Now that's something.Scenes(All at once.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: That really is something; that's really cool.ScenesJoey: Howdy partner!ScenesRoss: Maybe I should get another pair! Ooh, y'know, they-they had some with fringe all down the sides. (Chandler starts rubbing his temple again.) I'm gonna go kiss Ben goodnight. (He starts to head for Monica's bedroom.) I can't believe he thinks I'm a cowboy. (Pause.) I would make a good cowboy. (He struts into Monica's room.)ScenesMonica: Okay, now that everything's wrapped up here, I think I'm, I'm gonna go do my laundry.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, me too. Y'know if this shirt is dirty. (Smells it.) Yep.Scenes(They both exit.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I'm gonna go too. I'm gonna go to the airport. I figure if I hang around there long enough, someone's bound to leave one of those planes unattended.ScenesRachel: Good luck, honey!ScenesPhoebe: Bye! (She exits, leaving Rachel and Joey alone.)ScenesRachel: Hey, uh, Joey?ScenesJoey: Umm?ScenesRachel: Remember that big thing I was gonna tell you about?ScenesJoey: Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)ScenesRachel: I'm not gonna tell you, but if you found out on your own, that would be okay and then we could talk about it. Right?ScenesJoey: Well, then it wouldn't be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!ScenesRachel: (quietly) Yeah. Well. (Pause.) Hey uh Joe, would mind going over to Chandler's bedroom and get that book back that he borrowed from me?ScenesJoey: Now? You want me to go over there now?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Do you know something?ScenesRachel: Do you know something?ScenesJoey: I might know something.ScenesRachel: I might know something too.ScenesJoey: What's the thing you know?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I can't tell you until you tell me what you know.ScenesJoey: I can't tell you what I know.ScenesRachel: Well then I can't tell you what I know.ScenesJoey: Okay, fine.Scenes(Silence ensues.)ScenesJoey: You don't know!ScenesRachel: All right, how about I go over there and I will walk into Chandler's bedroom and I will see that thing that I think that I know is actually the thing that I think that I know! (Note: Kudos to Ms. Aniston on the delivery of that line. She said it very quickly and didn't screw up a word. Try it yourself, it ain't that easy.)ScenesJoey: (gasps) YOU KNOW!!!!ScenesRachel: AND YOU KNOW!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I know!!!!ScenesRachel: Chandler and Monica?!! Oh, this is unbelievable!! How long have you known?ScenesJoey: Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I've been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can't say anything about this to anybody, they're so weird about that! Listen… (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)ScenesJoey and Rachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! It's raining. I don't want to fly in the rain. So…Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.ScenesRachel: Ohhh, yeah, me too.Scenes(They both exit.)ScenesPhoebe: That's weird. (Pause.) I bet they're doing it.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Oh good, okay, I can't take it anymore. I can't take it anymore. So you win, okay? Here! (Hands him the 50 bucks he's about to owe him.) Pheebs? Flying a jet? Better make it a spaceship so that you can get back to your home planet! And Ross, phone call for you today, Tom Jones, he wants his pants back! And Hornswoggle? What are you dating a character from Fraggile Rock?! (He sits down and sighs in relief.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Chandler's Work LaughScenesWritten by: Alicia Sky VarinaitisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to pry more information about Chandler and Monica from Joey who's sitting on the couch and busy downing a pizza.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Come on Joey!!!ScenesJoey: Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it's not that big of a deal, so Monica and Chandler are doing it.ScenesRachel: I can't believe you would say that!ScenesJoey: Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.ScenesRachel: No! I mean come on! This is a huge deal! (She sits next to him on the couch.) Fine I want—I need more details, who-who initiated the first kiss?ScenesJoey: (thinks) I don't know.ScenesRachel: Is he romantic with her?ScenesJoey: I don't know.ScenesRachel: Are they in love?ScenesJoey: (thinks) I don't know.ScenesRachel: You don't know anything.ScenesJoey: Ohh, I know one thing!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: They did it right there on the couch.Scenes(He points to where she's sitting and she jumps up quickly.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Ross!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: (disinterested) Hey-yeah. (He hurries up to the counter.) Hey Gunther, can I have a scone please? (To the gang.) Wanna hear some good news? Someone I know is getting married! Yeah! And weddings are happy occasions! Oh, by-the-by it's my ex-wife Emily!ScenesAll: What? Oh!ScenesChandler: Sorry man.ScenesGunther: Here's your scone.ScenesRoss: Oh, thanks Gunther. (He takes it, hands the plate it's on to Rachel, sets it down on the table, and proceeds to pound it into oblivion while saying.) STUPID BRITISH SNACK FOOD!!!!!!!ScenesChandler: Did they teach you that in your anger management class?ScenesPhoebe: Hey, you know what might help you deal with it? Think of it this way, you and Emily are in the past and you can't be mad about the past. So are you still mad about the Louisiana Purchase?ScenesRachel: Pheebs, I don’t think anyone's mad about that.ScenesPhoebe: Exactly! Because it's in the past!ScenesJoey: (eyeing the flattened scone) Anybody gonna eat that?

rows.Scenes: Chandler's office, Monica and him are at a party his office is throwing.]
rows.Content: Monica: Look at us all dressed up for the big office party! By the way, what are we celebrating?ScenesChandler: Oh, we had a lot of liquor left over from the Christmas party.ScenesMonica: I think this is so cool because none of our friends are here and we can be a real couple. We don't have to hide.ScenesChandler: I know, I can do this. (He takes her hand.)ScenesMonica: Ooh, and I can do this. (She kisses him on the cheek.)Scenes(They both stand real close together.)ScenesBoth: We can't do that. (They separate.)Scenes(Chandler's boss (Doug) walks up.)ScenesDoug: Hey Bing! (Slaps him on his ass.) (Sees Monica) Wo-ho-ho, who's the pretty lady and what the hell is she doing with you?ScenesChandler: I asked myself that very question, sir. Uh, (Points to Monica) this is Monica. (Points to his boss.) This is my boss, Doug. Doug this is Monica.ScenesMonica: Hi, nice to meet you!ScenesDoug: Hi! And this is my wife Kara.ScenesKara: Nice to meet you Monica. Bing! (Slaps Chandler on his butt.)ScenesDoug: Say uh, Bing, did you hear about the new law firm we got working for us?ScenesChandler: No, sir.ScenesDoug: Yeah, Dewey, Cheatum, and Howe.Scenes(Chandler does a fake laugh.)ScenesDoug: Come on honey, let's go drink our body weight. (They walk off leaving Chandler and Monica alone.)ScenesMonica: What was that?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: That noise you just made?ScenesChandler: Oh, that was my work laugh.ScenesMonica: Really? Your work laugh?ScenesChandler: Oh, believe me, to survive this party, you're gonna have to come up with one too.ScenesMonica: All right, check me out.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(She walks up to where Doug is finishing another joke to another group.)ScenesDoug: …says $30 Father; same as in town.Scenes(Monica does a fake laugh. For the laughs, you'll have to see the episode. I can't describe them.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is buying a muffin as Chandler runs in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! Everybody at work loved you last night!ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: And! They like me more just because I was with ya! I think you repaired a lot of the damage from when they met Joey. And Doug wants us to play tennis with them. He's never even talked to me outside of work. Except for that time when we bumped into each other at that strip club. (She glares at him.) Strip church. Anyway, I'm gonna go try and find a racquet.ScenesMonica: Hey, I thought you already had one.ScenesChandler: Oh I used too, but then Joey thought it would be fun to go to Central Park and hit rocks at…bigger rocks. (He starts to leave and stops an entering Rachel.) Hey Rach, do you have a tennis racquet?ScenesRachel: Oh umm, y'know I lent it to Joey and I never actually got it back.ScenesChandler: Okay, good luck with that. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: (To Monica) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesRachel: What's up?!ScenesMonica: What are you doing here? I thought you had to do inventory all day.ScenesRachel: Well yeah, I do, but I decided to take a long lunch and spend some time with my friend Monica. Y'know I-I feel that we don't talk anymore. How are you? What is new with you?ScenesMonica: Uhh, not much. Uh, work's good.ScenesRachel: Oh y'know what, we don’t have to talk about work. We can talk about anything!ScenesMonica: Okay. Umm…ScenesRachel: Hey! Y'know what? Let's talk about relationships!ScenesMonica: Okay, what's going on with you?ScenesRachel: Nothing! You go!ScenesMonica: Well, I-I—there was this guy at the bank that I thought was cute umm, but I don't anymore.ScenesRachel: Wow that's uh, juicy. Umm, (checks watch) y'know what though Mon, I actually do have a lot of work to do so if-if—are you sure there's just not anything else?ScenesMonica: Yes, I'm sure! Rachel is there something that you want to talk me about?ScenesRachel: No! (Gets up to leave.) (Under her breath.) If there was I wouldn't tell you.

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Phoebe is settling a dispute between the chick and the duck.]
rows.Content: (The duck quacks.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, then what happened?Scenes(The duck flaps its wings frantically.)ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Ohh. Uh-huh. Uh-huh. (The chick clucks.) You'll get your turn!ScenesRoss: (entering from the bathroom) Hey Pheebs, what's going on?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing! (Picks up and sets the chick down on the floor.) (To the chick.) This is not over!ScenesRoss: No! No! No!ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: I was up all night writing this really nasty letter to Emily! It was perfect and now it's all covered in-in… (The duck quacks.) Actually, thanks!ScenesJoey: (entering from his room) All right! Everybody ready to go to the movies?ScenesRoss: Uh actually, I think I'm gonna skip it.ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I'm gonna stay and read my book. I just wanna be alone right now.ScenesJoey: Oh. Are you sure you don't want to come? Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, they get mail and stuff.ScenesRoss: That's okay, Joe.ScenesJoey: All right, let's go Pheebs.ScenesRoss: (licks the envelope and encounters a foreign substance on the glue.) Oh God!

rows.Scenes: A tennis court somewhere in the city of New York, it's the doubles match-up of a century Chandler and Monica versus Doug and Kara.]
rows.Content: Doug: Bing!Scenes(Hits the ball towards Chandler who returns it back to him. He then hits the ball at Monica who slams it and it bounces off Kara's leg.)ScenesKara: Oww!!ScenesMonica: Game!ScenesDoug: Well, I gotta tell ya Bing; that partner of yours is a real tiger. (To his wife.) Are you all right sweethart?ScenesKara: (out of breath and mouths) I'm not all right.ScenesDoug: We're, we're just gonna get a little sip of water.Scenes(They both walk off the court.)ScenesMonica: Am I on fire today or what?! Those birds are browned, basted, and ready to be carved!ScenesChandler: Okay, easy Martina. I think we should let them win the next game.ScenesMonica: I'm sorry, I don't understand what you just said.ScenesChandler: Let them win one.ScenesMonica: Are you crazy?! We own those two! I mean look at 'um, he can't breath and she's popping pills.ScenesChandler: You're not even giving them a chance!ScenesMonica: They have racquets don't they?!ScenesDoug: Uh Bing, I think we're gonna make this the last game.ScenesChandler: Oh yes, sir! Put me out of my misery. Are you sure you never played pro? (Does his work laugh.) (To Monica) Please let them win!ScenesMonica: I'll take it down to 95% but that's the best I can do.Scenes(She serves to Doug who returns it to Chandler. As it bounces over his head Chandler swings and misses.)ScenesChandler: Oopsey, missed it!ScenesMonica: I got it! (She hits a forehand smash that bounces right in between Doug and Kara and scores a point.)ScenesDoug: Nice shot.Scenes(Chandler glares at her and she shrugs her shoulders. Monica serves again; and Kara returns it.)ScenesMonica: I got it!!Scenes(Chandler cuts in front of her and hits the ball high and long.)ScenesChandler: Long! (Gives Monica the Work Laugh.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Chandler are returning from the game.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can't believe you let them win!ScenesChandler: Yeah, at least you hid your feelings well about it. (Removes a smashed racquet from his bag.)ScenesMonica: I was frustrated.ScenesChandler: It was my racquet.ScenesMonica: I was frustrated with you!ScenesChandler: If we hadn't lost the game they never would've invented us to dinner tomorrow night.ScenesMonica: Y'know what really bothers me? Is—it's how-how different you act around them! I mean y'know the throwing the tennis games, the fake laugh, the "I'll see you around, Bing!" "Not if I see you first, Doug!" (Mocks the fake laugh.) I gotta tell you, I don't like Work Chandler. Okay? The guy's a suck-up.ScenesChandler: Okay y'know what, because you said that, I'm not putting out tonight.

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, the next morning the girls are there with Joey.]
rows.Content: Monica: I'm telling you, something's wrong! My brother does not stay out all night.ScenesJoey: Maybe we should check the trash chute.ScenesRachel: Ross couldn't fit down the trash chute.ScenesJoey: That's right, he almost could. Which is exactly how I got stuck there.Scenes(Ross enters.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: There he is!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! (She goes to hug him, stops short, and hits him on the shoulder.) Where the hell have you been?!!ScenesRoss: Just, y'know out.ScenesRachel: Ohh, out, oh God, I don't know why we didn't think to check there!ScenesPhoebe: What were you doing?ScenesRoss: I uh, went to a bar. And then I just uh, just walked around for a while.ScenesRachel: You walked around all night in the city by yourself?ScenesJoey: (snaps his fingers) He hooked up! He hooked up with someone.ScenesRoss: Look, I don't have to answer your questions! Okay? I'm a big boy, I can do whatever I want!ScenesJoey: He hooked up!! Tell us about her!Scenes[Suddenly the door opens and Ross's mystery girl enters. I'll give you a hint to who it is: OH….MY….GAWD!! Uh-huh, it's Janice.]ScenesJanice: (entering) Ross you left you scarf in…(sees everyone.) Hey you guys. (Does the laugh.)Scenes(They all turn and with shocked looks on their faces stare at Ross. Ross is at a loss for words at this moment.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Janice: Uh-oh-okay. Uh-oh-okay. I know what you all are thinking. But Chandler is in Yemen! I'm a young woman! I have needs! I can't wait forever!ScenesRachel: Yeah! No that's what I was thinking.ScenesJanice: So I'm asking you please, take a moment before you judge me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, nobody's judging you. (They all turn and look at Ross.)ScenesJanice: Oh! Okay! (To Ross) You, Mister Right Place at the Right Time, call me! (Does her famous, or is that infamous, laugh and exits.)Scenes(They all turn and glare at Ross.)ScenesRoss: Okay, look, I-I know what you guys are going to say…ScenesPhoebe: You two will have very hairy children.ScenesRoss: Okay, I didn't know you would say that.ScenesRachel: Ross! Janice?!ScenesJoey: All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He's our friend. He obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.ScenesRoss: Look, I didn't lose my mind! Okay, Janice and I have a lot in common! We've-we've both been divorced. We-we both have kids.ScenesPhoebe: So are you actually gonna see her again?ScenesJoey: Phoebe! Don't put ideas in his head!ScenesRoss: I am gonna see her again.ScenesJoey: Damnit Phoebe!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is going through her purse as Rachel rushes in.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Okay, I have to tell you something that I have never admitted during our entire friendship! But, when we were in high school I made out with James Farrell even when I knew that you liked him! Wow, that feels so good to get off my chest! Okay, you go!ScenesMonica: My turn? What-what are you talking about?ScenesRachel: Ugh, Monica, I know about you and Chandler.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRachel: I overheard you guys on the phone the other day, and you said, "I'll just tell Rachel that I'm doing laundry for a couple of hours." And he said, "Laundry? Is that my new nickname?" And you said, "No! You know what your nickname is, Mr. Big.ScenesMonica: Well. Sounds like you're writing yourself a little play there Rach. Wow! Let me know how that one turns out.ScenesRachel: Well, I wouldn't know because I got so freaked out that I hung up the phone.ScenesMonica: Well, if you had kept listening, you-you would have heard me call him Mr. Big…(Thinks)…ot.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: Mr. Bigot. He tells the most racist jokes.ScenesRachel: All right. So you're telling me that there is nothing going on between you and Chandler.ScenesMonica: Me and Chandler?! (Does her fake laugh.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Phoebe and Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, put your 20 bucks down. First one to find the tasty treat wins. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm.ScenesJoey: All right. Let's get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that's over the duck and the laundry basket that's over the chicken.) And they're off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)ScenesPhoebe: Get your foot off my contestant! Judge!ScenesJoey: Judge rules, no violation.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Yeah!Scenes(Neither of them turns around from watching the chick and the duck look for the tasty treat.)ScenesRoss: Y'know what? It sounds so weird to say this but, I just had a great day with Janice!Scenes(They both turn around.)ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Are you serious?!ScenesRoss: Yeah! I opened up to her about all the terrible stuff that's been happening to me. I mean I talked for hours. (Joey has lost interest and is watching the race again.) It is amazing to have someone give you such-such focused attention.ScenesPhoebe: You don't need Janice for that, you've got us. We…ScenesJoey: And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!ScenesPhoebe: (turning from Ross.) No!! Hey-hey that's not a Nutter-Butter, that's just an old Wonton!ScenesJoey: Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, tough call.ScenesJoey: Yeah.

rows.Scenes: Doug's house, Chandler, Monica, and them are just finishing dinner.]
rows.Content: Doug: But seriously, I believe that we should all support President Clinton. And her husband Bill. (Chandler does the laugh.)ScenesKara: So how do you kids like your coffee?ScenesMonica: Oh, none for me. Thanks.ScenesChandler: Just a little bit of sugar.ScenesDoug: Well, maybe I'll bring it out and have Monica stick her finger in it. That oughta sweeten it up, huh? (Once again, with the laugh.)Scenes(Doug and Kara go get the coffee.)ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) How does that laugh not give you a headache?ScenesChandler: Oh, you get used to it.ScenesMonica: Y'know, I-I-I don't think that I can. So if you don't mind, maybe this will be it for me on the work things.ScenesChandler: So I laugh at my boss's jokes, what's the big deal?ScenesMonica: I'd rather hang out with a sniveling work weasel guy when I can be hanging out with my boyfriend who I actually respect.ScenesChandler: Oh. (Does a double take when he realizes what she just said.)ScenesDoug: (entering) Uh, I gotta apologize for Kara's coffee. Y'know, I feel sorry for it if it ever got in a fight, it's not strong enough to defend itself. (Chandler does not laugh.) Did you hear what I said Bing?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesDoug: The joke Bing. What's the matter with you?ScenesChandler: Well, I-I just didn't think it was funny sir.ScenesDoug: Excuse me?ScenesChandler: Well, I just…ScenesMonica: (interrupting) Honey, I just don't think that you understood the joke.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesMonica: Yeah! I mean it was really funny, I-I just don't think you got it. You see Kara's coffee is-is-is weak tasting, okay? But-but what Doug was-was imply that it was weak physically. You get it now honey?ScenesChandler: I think I do! (They all laugh.) Thank you, Monica.ScenesMonica: I thought you could use the help.ScenesChandler: Coffee in a fight! (Does the laugh again.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is going through the mail as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?ScenesRachel: Sure! Why?ScenesJoey: Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it's kinda hard to concentrate.ScenesRachel: What?! She just called and said that she was gonna be working late! She keeps lying to me! That's it! Y'know what? I'm just gonna go over there and confront them right now!Scenes[Cut to Chandler, Joey, and Ross's apartment, Rachel enters and sneaks up to Chandler's bedroom where she overhears Chandler and Monica talking.]ScenesChandler: (from his bedroom) All right, so you're telling me that I have to tell racist jokes now?!ScenesMonica: Sorry! I'm just—I'm not very good at this! I'm a terrible liar and I hate having to lie to Rachel!ScenesChandler: But we're not ready to tell yet!ScenesMonica: I know! It's just that…ever since high school Rachel was the one person I told everything too. Y'know? I miss that so much now. She's my best friend.Scenes(Rachel decides not to confront them and starts to walk out, knocking over a lamp in the process.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Joey?! Oh my God, Rachel!ScenesRachel: Hey! Hi!ScenesMonica: Wh-wh-what are you doing here? (She tries to pull her shirt down to cover the fact that she's wearing men's boxers.]ScenesRachel: Well, I was actually—I-I came over here to-to borrow this lamp. To umm, look at my books, y'know, see them a little better.ScenesMonica: Okay great!ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Great! Umm, well what-what I was doing in Chandler's room is that umm, I was cleaning it! In fact, he pays me to clean it!ScenesRachel: Oh! What a great way to earn some extra pocket money.ScenesMonica: Y'know when I said to you earlier that I was at work umm, I'm at my new work.ScenesRachel: That's good enough. Right? (Pause.) Okay, well umm, I'm gonna go look at my books!ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: I'll get back to my new job.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRachel: 'Kay. (Pause.) Congratulations on your new job. (She goes and hugs Monica and is almost in tears.)Scenes(After she exits, Chandler enters.)ScenesChandler: Man, she is really gullible.Scenes(Monica motions that it went right over Rachel's head.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Janice are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Here you go. (Serves them both some coffee.)ScenesRoss: Thanks!ScenesJanice: Actually, I should get going.ScenesRoss: Are you sure? Because I can stay out as late as you want. I told you how I'm on sabbatical from work, right?ScenesJanice: Yes! Yes! You did!ScenesRoss: Oh…ScenesJanice: What is wrong now?!ScenesRoss: This isn't what I ordered! Man! Can anything go right in my life?! First my marriage falls apart and then…ScenesJanice: I know! I know! And then you lose your apartment! And then you lose your job! And then your ex-wife gets married so fast! And now the coffee—ahh!! Ross, we need to talk.ScenesRoss: Okay. Sometimes I feel…ScenesJanice: No-no-no, no. I'm going to talk. I believe that the sun has set on our day in the sun.ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesJanice: (starting to cry) You're a very sweet person Ross, umm, unfortunately I don't think I can take another second of you whining!!ScenesRoss: Let-let me make sure I'm hearing this right, you're ending this with me because I'm too whiney? (Janice makes an agreeing sound.) So you're saying, I've become so whiney that I annoy you, Janice.ScenesJanice: Well yeah!!ScenesRoss: OH…MY…GOD!!ScenesJanice: Are you gonna be okay?ScenesRoss: I am now.ScenesJanice: Okay.Scenes(Joey enters.)ScenesJoey: Umm, hi.ScenesJanice: Oh hi! Well, I guess that's two out of three, Joey. (Laughs and exits.)Scenes(Joey looks at Ross with a horrified look on his face.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Chandler is reading a magazine as Ross hands him a beer.]
rows.Content: Ross: Dude, we got to talk.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesRoss: I just wanted to tell you something before you heard it from someone else and I hope this isn't too weird, but uh, I had uh, a thing with Janice. (He laughs, his real laugh this time.) What you're-you're not mad?ScenesChandler: Why would I be mad?ScenesRoss: Well, because y'know there are certain rules about this kind of stuff. You don't uh, you don't fool around with your uh, friend's ex-girlfriends or possible girlfriends or girls they're related to.ScenesChandler: (realizes what Ross just said and the implications to him) I am mad! But you know what I'm gonna do? I'm gonna forgive you! Because that's what friends do! They forgive their friends when they do everything you just said, all on the list there. Well, but I want you to remember that I forgave you.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesChandler: I also want you to remember that I let you live here rent free!ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesChandler: And, I want you to remember that I gave you twenty (counts his money) seven dollars. No strings attached. Now, if you can't remember that, I think we should write it down—let's write it down!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Joey's BagScenesTeleplay by: Seth KirklandScenesStory by: Michael CurtisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler's bedroom, he is giving Monica a massage.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can't believe we've never done this before! It's sooo good! So good for Monica!Scenes(Chandler picks up the timer being used and turns it to zero at which it chimes.)ScenesChandler: Oh! Look at that, time's up! My turn!ScenesMonica: That was a half an hour?ScenesChandler: It's your timer.Scenes(They change places.)ScenesMonica: Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the best massages!ScenesChandler: All right, then massage me up right nice!Scenes(She starts the massage, only she is doing extremely hard and Chandler is gasping in pain.)ScenesChandler: Ah! Ahh!! Ahh!!ScenesMonica: It's so good, isn't it?ScenesChandler: It's so good I don't know what I've done to deserve it!ScenesMonica: Say good-bye to sore muscles!ScenesChandler: Good-bye muscles!!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I'm telling you, she gives the worst massages ever!! Okay, it was like she was torturing me for information. And I wanted to give it up I just—I didn't know what it was!ScenesJoey: Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.ScenesChandler: Look, for the first time in my life I'm in a real relationship. Okay, I'm not gonna screw that up by y'know, telling the truth.ScenesRoss: (walking up with Rachel and carrying coffee) Hey.ScenesJoey: Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from the floor. It's one of those magician stovepipe hats.)ScenesRoss: Sorry.ScenesChandler: (examining the hat) And the bunny got away. (Turns and starts looking for the bunny as Joey puts the hat on.)ScenesRoss: (glaring at Joey) This would be the place where you explain the hat.ScenesJoey: Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff.ScenesChandler: And you're gonna make them all disappear.ScenesJoey: Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.Scenes(Chandler picks up a basket from the table and puts it on his head.)ScenesChandler: Done.ScenesRachel: Joey, if you wanna look good, why don't you just come down to the store? I'll help you out.ScenesJoey: Great! Thanks, Rach!ScenesRachel: Sure! (Pause) God, please take those off!ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(Both of them remove their hats as Phoebe enters.)ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, how's it going?ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the hospital.Scenes(All at once.)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: Is everything okay?ScenesJoey: Are you all right?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, no-no-no. I'm fine. I'm okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died.ScenesJoey: Pheebs! Sorry!ScenesPhoebe: It's okay, I mean she had a really incredible life. And it's not like I'm never gonna see her again, y'know she's gonna visit.ScenesRachel: Well maybe, maybe she's with us right now?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she's gonna come to the coffeehouse!ScenesMonica: (entering, in a hurry) Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having sex in a car right outside.ScenesRoss: Uhh, Pheebs' Grandmother just died.ScenesMonica: Ohh my God, I'm so sorry.ScenesPhoebe: It's okay. Actually y'know what, it's kinda cool. 'Cause it's like y'know, one life ends and another begins.ScenesMonica: (to the guys) Not the way they're doing it. What, what happened? How did she die?ScenesPhoebe: Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some yogurt and she just never came back up again.ScenesJoey: Pheebs, I'm so sorry.ScenesPhoebe: It was really sweet. The last thing she said to me was; "Okay dear, you go get the eggs and I'm gonna get the yogurt and we'll meet at the checkout counter." And y'know what? We will meet at the checkout counter.

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale's, Rachel is fixing Joey up with some new clothes.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay now Joey, y'know that since you're returning all of this stuff right after the audition you're gonna have to wear underwear?ScenesJoey: All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then.ScenesRachel: Okay, it's missing something. Ooh, I know! Umm, okay. (Goes and grabs a bag, that looks like a purse, and shows it to Joey.)ScenesJoey: Really? A purse?ScenesRachel: It's not a purse! It's a shoulder bag.ScenesJoey: It looks like a women's purse.ScenesRachel: No Joey, look. Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring catalog. Look. (Shows him.) See look, men, carrying the bag.ScenesJoey: See look, women, carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and looks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women's purse looks good on me, a man.ScenesRachel: Exactly! Unisex!ScenesJoey: Maybe you need sex. I had sex a couple days ago.ScenesRachel: No! No Joey! U-N-I-sex.ScenesJoey: Well, I ain't gonna say no to that.

rows.Scenes: Ursula's apartment, Phoebe is about to break the bad news to her sister. She knocks on the door.]
rows.Content: Ursula: Who is it?ScenesPhoebe: It's Phoebe.ScenesUrsula: Oh great! (Opens the door.) (Disappointed) Oh, you. Umm, what's up?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in?ScenesUrsula: Umm, yeah—no thanks.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well, umm Grandma died.ScenesUrsula: Wow! Didn't she die like five years ago?ScenesPhoebe: No, she just died today! Okay, umm, we're having a memorial service tomorrow.ScenesUrsula: Okay, I know that I went to that all ready.ScenesPhoebe: No you didn't!ScenesUrsula: Well, then who's been dead for five years?ScenesPhoebe: Well, lots of people! Look, are you coming to memorial service or not?ScenesUrsula: Umm, no. See I already thought she was dead so I kinda made my peace with it. Plus, I'm going to a concert tomorrow. So… I'd invite you, but umm, I only have two tickets left.ScenesPhoebe: Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert. (Starts to leave.)ScenesUrsula: Thanks! Enjoy your funeral.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are on the couch as Joey enters with his new bag.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!Scenes(As he walks past both Chandler and Ross notice the bag and stare at each other in shock.)ScenesChandler: Wow! You look just like your son Mrs. Tribbiani!ScenesJoey: What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!ScenesRoss: Your make-up!ScenesRachel: (entering) Joey, what are you doing with the bag? You're audition is not until tomorrow.ScenesJoey: Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts eating.)ScenesRachel: Joey, y'know you get any mustard on that bag, you can't return it.ScenesJoey: Why would I return it? I love this bag!ScenesRachel: All right, then you owe me $350.ScenesJoey: Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He's holding the fake credit cards that come with the bag.)ScenesRachel: (glaring at him) Joey…ScenesJoey: All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you.ScenesRoss: What's the part, Anti-man?ScenesRachel: Hey, don't listen to them. I think it's sexy.ScenesJoey: U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's Grandmother's memorial, Phoebe is at the door welcoming people.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Well hello, Mrs. Penella! Thank you so much for coming! Well, okay look, here's your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on.Scenes(The gang arrives.)ScenesRachel: Hi sweetie!ScenesRoss: Hey, how are you holding up?ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry.ScenesPhoebe: (notices his bag.) Hey, y'know what? My Grandma had the exact same bag!ScenesJoey: Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks!ScenesChandler: Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine.Scenes(Another man, an older man, enters, looking around and bumps into Chandler.)ScenesMan: Oops, I'm sorry. Excuse me. Is this the umm, the memorial?Scenes(The gang moves off as Phoebe greets the new guest.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, welcome.ScenesMan: Hello. Hello.ScenesPhoebe: Umm here's your 3-D glasses.ScenesMan: Oh, umm, all right.ScenesPhoebe: So how did you know Francis?ScenesMan: Well I actually, I-I really, I haven't seen her for years. But umm, well I-I was pretty tight with-with her and her daughter.ScenesPhoebe: Really?! What's your name?ScenesMan: Umm, Frank Buffay.Scenes(Needless to say, Phoebe is stunned into silence. And one audience member gasps.)ScenesFrank Sr.: (Seeing the look on her face) Y'know what? Strike that. My name uh, actually is-is Joe. Uh, Joe umm, Hill.ScenesPhoebe: You're Frank Buffay?ScenesFrank Sr.: Shh! (Whispers) No! Joe Hill!ScenesPhoebe: You just said…ScenesFrank Sr.: Y'know what, I gotta go. And thank you so much for coming. (Hands back his glasses and hurries out.)ScenesPhoebe: But…Scenes(Phoebe takes one step after him and stops.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: What?! What honey?ScenesRoss: What happened?ScenesPhoebe: That was my dad!ScenesChandler: Oh my God!Scenes(They all look down the hall he left from.)ScenesJoey: (approaches, wearing his glasses) Hey you guys, check it out. Check it out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It's like it's coming right at me. (Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey's arm, which causes his hand to slap him in his face.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Funeral Home, continued from earlier. Phoebe is returning after looking for her father.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, did you catch him?!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: Wh-what did he say?!ScenesPhoebe: He said, "Nice to meet you Glenda." (They stare at her, dumbfounded) Well, obviously I couldn't give him my real name?ScenesRachel: Why?! Why not?!ScenesPhoebe: Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here! What do you think? He's gonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned!ScenesJoey: What did you say to him?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I said, I told him y'know, that I was the executor person of Francis' will and that I needed to talk to him so I'm gonna meet him at the coffee house later.ScenesThe Pastor: Could everyone please take their seats?ScenesPhoebe: All right, well, I just can't think about that right now. I just wanna say good-bye to my Grandma.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: All right, let's go say good-bye.Scenes(They put on their glasses and try to find their way to their seats.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, after the funeral, everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering, with bag) Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?ScenesRachel: Ahhh, I think you look great! That bag is gonna get you that part.ScenesChandler: And a date with a man!ScenesJoey: Y'know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)ScenesPhoebe: All right, I'd better go too. I have to go talk to my dad.ScenesRachel: Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say? Are you gonna tell him who you are?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, no, not at first 'cause I-I don't want to freak him outScenesRoss: Well, but aren't you pissed at him?! I mean this guy abandoned you! I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger! (Getting worked up) I mean I-I-I'd walk in there and I'd be like, "Yo, dad! You and me outside right now!" (Calming down.) I kinda scared myself.ScenesMonica: Well, at least you scared someone.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know it's funny, you'd think I'd be angry. I mean, you'd think I'd wanna rip his tiny little head off. Fortunately, I'm past it.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you.ScenesPhoebe: All right.Scenes(She goes over and tries to give Phoebe a massage. Phoebe yelps in pain and jumps away from her.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Get off!! Ow!! Oh, stop it!! Why?! Why are you doing that to me?!ScenesMonica: What are you talking about?ScenesPhoebe: As a masseuse and a human, I'm begging you, never do that to anyone!ScenesMonica: (indignant) I give good massages! (Ross laughs.) I used to give them to Rachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch! (She starts giving Chandler a massage.)ScenesPhoebe: (seeing the look on Chandler's face) He-he does not like it! He hates it! He's in pain!ScenesMonica: No he's not!ScenesChandler: (wincing) Yes, he is!ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: I'm sorry but, ow-owww-owww!ScenesMonica: You've been lying to me? I can't believe you'd do that.ScenesRoss: Well, maybe he just didn't want to hurt your feelings.ScenesMonica: But the minute we start to lie to each other… (Pauses after she realizes what she's saying.) And by 'we' I mean society.

rows.Scenes: Joey's audition, he is with bag.]
rows.Content: The Casting Director: Any time you're ready, Joey.ScenesJoey: (reading from the script) Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a table and I'll buy you a drink.ScenesThe Casting Director: (stopping him) I'm sorry. Could you, could you try it without the purse?ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new here. Maybe we should—I'm sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a question.)ScenesThe Casting Director: Sure. What?ScenesJoey: Well, first it's not a purse.ScenesThe Casting Director: Okay, anytime.ScenesJoey: I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's bag!ScenesThe Casting Director: Okayyyy! Anddd, go!ScenesJoey: All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It's the latest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!ScenesThe Casting Director: Umm, do you sell these bags?ScenesJoey: Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.ScenesThe Casting Director: Okay! Thank you! That was great!ScenesJoey: Yeah but I didn’t read anything.ScenesThe Casting Director: I think we've seen enough!ScenesJoey: Okay! All right, I'll see ya. (As he's walking off stage.) (Patting the bag.) We got it! We got it!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is poking his head in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, is Rachel here?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: (coming all the way in) Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this afternoon and the whole massage thing. Y'know? I-I really like 'em.ScenesMonica: Oh, please, stop! Look, we're supposed to be honest with each other. I-I just wish you could tell me—just say, "I don't like your massages.ScenesChandler: (falling into that trap) I don't like your massages.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) See? It's no big deal.ScenesChandler: Okay, but now see you're crying!ScenesMonica: I'm not crying about that! I'm crying about something that happened at work.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: (bursting into tears) My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages.ScenesChandler: It's okay, you don't have to be the best at everything.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! You don't know me at all!ScenesChandler: Okay, you give the worst massages in the world.ScenesMonica: I'm crying here!!ScenesChandler: Okay, hear me out. Okay? You give the best bad massages. If anybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves, "Who's the best of that?" They'd have to go to you.ScenesMonica: Huh. So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad massage, well who would get that?ScenesChandler: Oh, it would be you! You! Monica! And you'd get all the votes!ScenesMonica: So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?ScenesChandler: Absolutely!ScenesMonica: Okay. I suck!ScenesChandler: Yeah! (They hug.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Frank Sr. is just arriving.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Umm, thank you for meeting with me.ScenesFrank Sr.: Thank you. All right.ScenesPhoebe: Come, sit. (He's hesitant.) Sit. (Still hesitating.) Sit! (He sits on the arm of the couch.) Umm, all righty, before we get started I just—I need you to state for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay.ScenesFrank Sr.: Oh yes. Yes, yes, I am, uh-hmm.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesFrank Sr.: So, what did Francis leave me?ScenesPhoebe: Huh?ScenesFrank Sr.: Well, that's why you wanted me to come, right?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yes. Yes. Yeah—no. She did. She left you umm, (looking in her purse) this lipstick.ScenesFrank Sr.: Oh. Huh. It's huh, well it's (opens it) oh it's—ew used. Umm, cool.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. I have just a few questions to ask so I'm going to get out my official forms. (She picks up a couple of crumpled receipts.) Okay, so, question 1) You and uh, you were married to Francis' daughter Lilly, is that correct?ScenesFrank Sr.: Yes, yes I was.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A. Happily, B. Medium, or C. In the total abandonment of her and her two children?ScenesFrank Sr.: It really says that?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. See? (Quickly shows him.)ScenesFrank Sr.: Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C.ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, okay, total abandonment. Okay, reasons for abandonment, A. Top secret government work, B. Amnesia, or C. Or you're just a selfish, irresponsible bad, bad man?ScenesFrank Sr.: Y'know, I don't think I want the lipstick that much. (Gets up to leave.) But umm… Oh, would you do me a favor? And umm, would you, would you give Lilly that, please? (Hands her a note.)ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesFrank Sr.: Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note? Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out. So, uh, I wrote her that note, would you give it to her please?ScenesPhoebe: But you-you-you came to see Lilly?ScenesFrank Sr.: Yeah, yeah. Why?ScenesPhoebe: Lilly's dead. (He looks up in shock.)ScenesFrank Sr.: She what?!ScenesPhoebe: She's dead.ScenesFrank Sr.: Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: Well, if she isn't then cremating her was a big mistake.ScenesFrank Sr.: I can't believe this. I just—I can't believe this. How-how—Oh my God. How long ago?ScenesPhoebe: 17 years ago.ScenesFrank Sr.: Oh! What about, what about the girls?ScenesPhoebe: Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho. And Phoebe, (pause) is on this couch.Scenes(Silence ensues.)ScenesPhoebe: Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you!ScenesFrank Sr.: Phoebe, I-I-I-umm, (Sits down next to her and brushes against her leg.) Oops. (He backs up.) I just, I-I-I-I don’t, I don’t know what to say. I just can't believe that you're my daughter, you're so pretty.ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Well, that's neither here nor there.ScenesFrank Sr.: So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very sorry that I left?ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what, it doesn’t matter what you say it's not gonna make a difference anyway, so you can just go.ScenesFrank Sr.: All right. Well, y'know in my defense I was a lousy father.ScenesPhoebe: That's a defense?ScenesFrank Sr.: Yes. Yes it is. I burned the formula and I put your diapers on backwards. I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more!ScenesPhoebe: You make up songs?ScenesFrank Sr.: Well no, just-just that one. But, it was stupid. Let's see, how did it, how did it go. Umm. (Singing.)ScenesSleepy girl, sleepy girl.ScenesWhy won't you go to sleep?ScenesSleepy girl, sleepy girl.ScenesYou're, you're, you're keeping me uppp! (Yeah, that's to the tune of Smelly Cat.)ScenesYeah.Scenes(Phoebe is trying not to smile. He moves closer and very shyly holds out his hand and turns his head, hoping for Phoebe to take his hand. She doesn't.)ScenesFrank Sr.: I just, I y'know, I'm not very good at this. So, umm… (Backs away.)ScenesPhoebe: Well, I am. (Moves over and takes his hand.)Scenes(She holds his hand for a little while then…)ScenesPhoebe: Not yet, no. (Drops his hand and moves back.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey returns from his audition and finds everyone but Phoebe there.]
rows.Content: Joey: (dejected) Hi.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey man, how did the audition go?ScenesJoey: Estelle said I didn't get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)ScenesRachel: What?! Why? Joey you were so ready for it!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me.ScenesRoss: What kind of problem?ScenesJoey: Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the bag!ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: Nooooo!ScenesJoey: Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!ScenesMonica: Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag.ScenesJoey: I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach? (She's avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!ScenesRachel: Honey wait, Joey, I’m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are with it… (Looks for help.)ScenesChandler: Oh, hey! (Ross nods in agreement as well.)ScenesRachel: …I just don't know if the world is ready for you and your bag.ScenesJoey: I can't believe I'm hearing this!ScenesRachel: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I'm not saying that you shouldn’t have a bag, I just—it's just there are other bags that are a little less umm, (Pause) controversial.ScenesChandler: Yeah umm, they're called wallets.ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One Where Everyone Finds OutScenesWritten by: Alexa JungeScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is eating some Chinese food.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (looking out the window) Oh hey, you guys, look! Ugly Naked Guy is putting stuff in boxes!Scenes(They all run and join her at the window.)ScenesRachel: I'd say from the looks of it; our naked buddy is moving.ScenesRoss: Ironically, most of the boxes seem to be labeled clothes.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I'm gonna miss that big old squishy butt.ScenesChandler: And we're done with the chicken fried rice.ScenesRoss: Hey! Hey! If he's moving, maybe I should try to get his place!ScenesAll: Good idea! Yes!ScenesRoss: It would be so cool to live across from you guys!ScenesJoey: Hey, yeah! Then we could do that telephone thing! Y'know, you have a can, we have a can and it's connected by a string!ScenesChandler: Or we can do the actual telephone thing.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ugly Naked Guy's apartment, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are checking out the place. Luckily, Ugly Naked Guy is nowhere to be seen.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh my God! I love this apartment! Isn't it perfect?! I can't believe I never realized how great it is!ScenesRachel: Well that is because your eye immediately goes to the big naked man.ScenesPhoebe: It's amazing! You better hurry up and fill out an application or I'm gonna beat you to it.ScenesRoss: (laughing) Ohh. (Phoebe takes a couple of steps to the door and Ross quickly hurries out.)ScenesRachel: Well, I never thought I'd say this, but I'm gonna go use Ugly Naked Guy's bathroom. (Does so.)ScenesPhoebe: (looking out the window) Oh, look! There's Monica and Chandler! (Starts yelling.) Hey! Hey, you guys! Hey! (Chandler and Monica start taking each other's clothes off.) Ohh!! Ohh! Ahh-ahhh!!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesPhoebe: (screaming) Ahhh!! Chandler and Monica!! Chandler and Monica!!ScenesRachel: Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: CHANDLER AND MONICA!!!!ScenesRachel: OH MY GOD!!!ScenesPhoebe: OH!! MY EYES!!! MY EYES!!!!ScenesRachel: Phoebe!! Phoebe!! It's okay!! It's okay!!ScenesPhoebe: NO! THEY'RE DOING IT!!!ScenesRachel: I KNOW!! I KNOW!! I KNOW!ScenesPhoebe: YOU KNOW?!!!ScenesRachel: Yes, I know! And Joey knows! But Ross doesn't know so you have to stop screaming!!ScenesRoss: (entering) What's going on?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Ohhh!!!ScenesRachel: (trying to divert his attention from the window by jumping up and down) HI!! Hi!ScenesRoss: What?! What?!ScenesRachel: Nothing! Oh God, we're just so excited that you want to get this apartment!ScenesRoss: Actually, it looks really good. (Turns towards the window and now Phoebe starts jumping to divert his attention.)ScenesPhoebe: (Screaming incoherently.) Get in here!!! (Motions to join her and Rachel.)Scenes(Ross starts jumping and screaming incoherently and hops over and joins in on the group hug.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there talking about Chandler and Monica.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: You mean whenever Monica and Chandler where like y'know doing laundry or going grocery shopping or—Oh! All that time Monica spent on the phone with sad Linda from camp!ScenesRachel: Uh-huh, doing it. Doing it. Phone doing it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oh, I can't believe it! I mean I think it's great! For him. She might be able to do better.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesRachel: Joey! Come here! Come here!ScenesJoey: What? What?ScenesRachel: Phoebe just found out about Monica and Chandler.ScenesJoey: You mean how they're friends and nothing more? (Glares at Rachel.)ScenesRachel: No. Joey, she knows! We were at Ugly Naked Guy's apartment and we saw them doing it through the window. (Joey gasps) Actually, we saw them doing it up against the window.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so now they know that you know and they don't know that Rachel knows?ScenesJoey: Yes, but y'know what? It doesn't matter who knows what. Now, enough of us know that we can just tell them that we know! Then all the lying and the secrets would finally be over!ScenesPhoebe: Or, we could not tell them we know and have a little fun of our own.ScenesRachel: Wh-what do you mean?ScenesPhoebe: Well y'know every time that they say that like they're doing laundry we'll just give them a bunch of laundry to do.ScenesRachel: Ohhh, I-I would enjoy that!ScenesJoey: No-no-no! No-no wait Rach, you know what would even be more fun? Telling them.ScenesRachel: Ehhh, no, I wanna do Phoebe's thing.ScenesJoey: I can't take any…ScenesPhoebe: No! You don't have to do anything! Just don't tell them that we know!ScenesJoey: Noo! I can't take any more secrets! (To Rachel) I've got your secrets. I've got their secrets. I got secrets of my own y'know!ScenesRachel: You don't have any secrets!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? Well, you don't know about Hugsy, my bedtime penguin pal. (Joey shies away.)ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) So umm, how-how are we gonna mess with them?ScenesJoey: Ugh.ScenesPhoebe: Well, you could use your position y'know as the roommate.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: And then. I would use y'know the strongest tool at my disposal. My sexuality.ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello children!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, watch, learn, and don't eat my cookie.Scenes(She gets up and goes over to Chandler who's ordering some coffee from Gunther.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh, wow that jacket looks great on you!ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: (feels his arm) Yeah the material feels so soft—hello Mr. Bicep! Have you been working out?ScenesChandler: Well, I try to y'know, squeeze things. (Phoebe giggles uncontrollably.) Are you okay?ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you really wanna know, I'm—Oh! I can't tell you this.ScenesChandler: Phoebe, it's me. You can tell me anything.ScenesPhoebe: Well actually you're the one person I can't tell this too. And the one person I want to the most.ScenesChandler: What's going on?ScenesPhoebe: I think it's just y'know that I haven't been with a guy in so long and how sometimes you're looking for something and you just don’t even see that it's right there in front of you sipping coffee—Oh no, have I said to much? Well it's just something to think about. I know I will.Scenes(She makes a show of bending over to get her coat and showing off her bum. She then walks out, leaving no one to eat her cookie.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler's bedroom, Chandler and Monica are there, of course. Like who else would it be, duh!]
rows.Content: Monica: You are so cute! How did you get to be so cute?ScenesChandler: Well, my Grandfather was Swedish and my Grandmother was actually a tiny little bunny.ScenesMonica: Okay, now you're even cuter!!ScenesChandler: Y'know that is a popular opinion today I must say.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: The weirdest thing happened at the coffee house, I think, I think Phoebe was hitting on me.ScenesMonica: What are you talking about?ScenesChandler: I'm telling you I think Phoebe thinks I'm foxy.ScenesMonica: That's not possible!ScenesChandler: Ow!ScenesMonica: I'm sorry it's just, Phoebe just always thought you were, you were charming in a, in a sexless kind of way.ScenesChandler: Oh, y'know I-I can't hear that enough.ScenesMonica: I'm sorry, I think that you just misunderstood her.ScenesChandler: No, I didn't misunderstand, okay? She was all over me! She touched my bicep for crying out loud!ScenesMonica: This bicep?ScenesChandler: Well it's not flexed right now!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Chandler are there. Monica is entering from her room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Mon, what are you doing now? Wanna come see a movie with us?ScenesMonica: Uhh, y'know actually I was gonna do some laundry.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesMonica: Hey Chandler, wanna do it with me?ScenesChandler: Sure, I'll do it with ya.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay great, hold on a sec! (She runs to her room and returns carrying a huge bag of laundry.) Oh, here you go! You don't mind do ya? That would really help me out a lot! Thanks!ScenesMonica: I mean I-I don't I think I have enough quarters.ScenesPhoebe: I have quarters! (She holds up a bag of quarters.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey Ross! Any word on the apartment yet?ScenesRoss: Well, I called over there and it turns out Ugly Naked Guy is subletting it himself and he's already had like a hundred applicants.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: No-no, I got the edge. I know it's not exactly ethical but I sent him a little bribe toScenestip the scales in my direction. Check it out, you can probably see it from the window. (They all head to the window.)ScenesMonica: Oh, is it that pinball machine with the big bow on it?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesChandler: That new mountain bike?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesMonica: Well what did you send?ScenesRoss: A basket of mini-muffins.ScenesPhoebe: But there's a whole table of mini-muffin baskets. Which one did you send?ScenesRoss: The small one.ScenesRachel: What?! You-you actually thought that basket was gonna get you the apartment?ScenesRoss: Well yeah! Someone sent us a basket at work once and people went crazy over those little muffins. It was the best day.ScenesChandler: Your work makes me sad.ScenesRoss: Oh man! I want that place so much!! I was so sure that was gonna work! There's twelve bucks I'll never see again! (Exits.)ScenesRachel: All right honey, we'd better go if we wanna catch that movie.ScenesMonica: Bye!ScenesAll: Bye!ScenesPhoebe: Bye Chandler! (She walks up to him.) (Quietly.) I miss you already. (She pinches his butt.)ScenesChandler: (after they've left) Okay, did you see that?! With the inappropriate and the pinching!!ScenesMonica: Actually, I did!ScenesChandler: Okay, so now do you believe that she's attracted to me?ScenesMonica: Ohhh, oh my God! Oh my God! She knows about us!ScenesChandler: Are you serious?ScenesMonica: Phoebe knows and she's just trying to freak us out! That's the only explanation for it!ScenesChandler: (a little hurt) Okay but what about y'know my pinchable butt and my bulging biceps—She knows!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Joey is snoozing with Hugsy, his bedtime penguin pal and Chandler and Monica come storming in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Joey!Scenes(Joey quickly tries to hide Hugsy by throwing it over his head.)ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesChandler: Phoebe knows about us!ScenesJoey: Well I didn't tell them!ScenesMonica: Them?! Who's them?ScenesJoey: Uhhh, Phoebe and Joey.ScenesMonica: Joey!ScenesJoey: And Rachel. I would've told you but they made me promise not to tell!ScenesChandler: Oh man!ScenesJoey: I'm sorry! But hey, it's over now, right? Because you can tell them that you know they know and I can go back to knowing absolutely nothing!ScenesMonica: Unless…ScenesJoey: No! Not unless! Look this must end now!ScenesMonica: Oh man, they think they are so slick messing with us! But see they don't know that we know that they know! So…ScenesChandler: Ahh yes, the messers become the messies!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is looking at Ugly Naked Guy's apartment through binoculars.]
rows.Content: Ross: Noooo.ScenesRachel: Oh Ross, honey you gotta stop torturing yourself!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, why don't you just find another apartment?ScenesRoss: Look I've already looked at like a thousand apartments this month and none of them even compares to that one!ScenesRachel: Y'know what you should do?ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesRachel: You should find out what his hobbies are and then use that to bond with him. Yeah! Like if I would strike up a conversation about say umm, sandwiches. Or uh, or my underwear.ScenesJoey: I'm listening.ScenesRachel: (To Ross) See?ScenesRoss: That is a great idea! And! I know Ugly Naked Guy because we've been watching him for like five years so that gives me back my edge! Oh, let's see now he had the trampoline.ScenesPhoebe: He broke that.ScenesRoss: Well, he had gravity boots.ScenesRachel: Yeah, he broke those too.ScenesJoey: So he likes to break stuff.ScenesRoss: Okay, I've got to go pick up Ben but I-I will figure something out. (He opens the door and stops.) Hey, didn't he used to have a cat?ScenesPhoebe: I wouldn't bring that up, it would probably just bum him out.ScenesJoey: Yeah, poor cat, never saw that big butt coming.ScenesRoss: Right. (Exits.)Scenes(The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)ScenesRachel: Hello! (Listens) Oh yeah! Hey! Hold on a second she's right here! (To Phoebe) It's Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: (in a sexy voice) Oh? (Takes the phone from Rachel.) Hello you.ScenesChandler: Hello Phoebe, I've been thinking about you all day. (He's holding the phone so that Monica can hear it as well.)ScenesPhoebe: Eh?ScenesChandler: Well you know that thing you said before, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't intrigued.ScenesPhoebe: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah, listen, Joey isn't gonna be here tonight so why don't you come over and I'll let you uh, feel my bicep. Or maybe more.ScenesPhoebe: I'll have to get back to you on that. Okay, bye! (Hangs up.) Oh my God! He wants me to come over and feel his bicep and more!ScenesRachel: Are you kidding?!ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesRachel: I can not believe he would do that to Mon—Whoa! (She stops suddenly and slowly turns to point at Joey. Joey is avoiding her eyes.) Joey, do they know that we know?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesRachel: Joey!ScenesJoey: They know you know.ScenesRachel: Ugh, I knew it! Oh I cannot believe those two!ScenesPhoebe: God, they thought they can mess with us! They're trying to mess with us?! They don't know that we know they know we know! (Joey just shakes his head.) Joey, you can't say anything!ScenesJoey: I couldn't even if I wanted too.

rows.Scenes: Outside Ugly Naked Guy's apartment, Ross is knocks on the door and Ugly Naked Guy answers it. He's ugly. He's naked. And he's holding a huge jumbo soda.]
rows.Content: Ross: Good evening, sir. My name is Ross Geller. I'm one of the people who applied for the apartment. And I-I realize that the competition is fierce but—I'm sorry. I, I can't help but notice you're naked and (He claps his hands.) I applaud you. Man, I wish I was naked. I mean, this-this looks so great. That is how God intended it.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica and Rachel and Phoebe are planning their respective strategies to break the other pairing. Joey is not amused.
rows.Content: Monica: (in the kitchen with Chandler) Look at them, they're-they're panicked!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, they're totally gonna back down!ScenesMonica: Oh yeah!Scenes[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel sitting on the couch.]ScenesPhoebe: All right. All right! If he wants a date? He's gonna get a date. All right, I'm gonna go in.ScenesRachel: All right. Be sexy.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) Please.Scenes(She saunters over to Chandler with a mean pair of 'Come hither' eyes and she glares at Monica.)ScenesPhoebe: So Chandler, I-I'd love to come by tonight.ScenesChandler: (initially worried, but gets over it) Really?ScenesPhoebe: Oh absolutely. Shall we say, around seven?ScenesChandler: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Good. I'm really looking forward to you and me having sexual intercourse.Scenes(As she walks away, Chandler mouths a scream to Monica. How motions and mouths, "It's okay, it's okay.")ScenesJoey: (looking out the window) Hey-hey, check it out! Check it out! Ugly Naked Guy has a naked friend!Scenes(They all run over to the window.)ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! (She gasps.) Oh my God! That is our friend! (Monica covers her face.) It's Naked Ross! (Monica turns and buries her face in Chandler's shoulder.)ScenesAll: Yeah, it is! Naked Ross!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting Phoebe ready for her date.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Show time!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Rachel, get me perfume!ScenesRachel: Okay! (She runs to get some.)ScenesPhoebe: And Joey, get me a bottle of wine and glasses? (He begrudgingly does so.)Scenes(In the meantime, Rachel has returned with the perfume and sprays a mist out in front of Phoebe who walks through the mist and does a little spin.)Scenes[Cut to Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Monica is getting Chandler ready for his half of the plan.]ScenesMonica: All right, it'll be great! You just make her think you wanna have sex with her! It'll totally freak her out!ScenesChandler: Okay, listen, how far am I gonna have to go with her?ScenesMonica: Relax, she-she's gonna give in way before you do!ScenesChandler: How do you know?!ScenesMonica: Because you're on my team! And my team always wins!ScenesChandler: At this?!ScenesMonica: Just go get some! (Kisses him.) Go! (She runs to hide in the bathroom.)Scenes[Cut to the hallway, Phoebe is outside getting some last minute instructions from Rachel.]ScenesRachel: (handing her the wine) Okay honey, now I'm gonna try to listen from right here!ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay? Whoa, wait! (She undoes one button on Phoebe's dress.)ScenesPhoebe: Good idea!ScenesRachel: Yeah, oh wait! (She goes for another one.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh now, don't give away the farm!Scenes(Phoebe knocks on the door with the wine and Chandler answers it. Rachel hides next to the door.)ScenesChandler: Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Chandler.ScenesChandler: Come on in.ScenesPhoebe: I was going too. (They go inside and he closes the door.) Umm, I brought some wine. Would you like some?ScenesChandler: Sure.Scenes(She makes a big show out of pulling out the cork and pours the wine.)ScenesPhoebe: So, here we are. Nervous?ScenesChandler: Me? No. You?ScenesPhoebe: No, I want this to happen.ScenesChandler: So do I.Scenes(They click their glasses and take a sip. That sip turns into a gulp, which quickly progresses into their mutual draining of their glasses at once.)ScenesChandler: I'm gonna put on some music.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe, maybe I'll dance for you. (She starts doing a rather suggestive and seductive dance that's silly at the same time.)ScenesChandler: You look good.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks! Y'know, that when you say things like that it makes me wanna rip that sweater vest right off!ScenesChandler: Well, why don't we move this into the bedroom?ScenesPhoebe: Really?ScenesChandler: Oh, do you not want to?ScenesPhoebe: No. No! It's just y'know first, I wanna take off all my clothes and have you rub lotion on me.ScenesChandler: (swallowing hard) Well that would be nice. I'll go get the lotion.Scenes[Cut to the bathroom, Chandler is entering.]ScenesChandler: Listen, this is totally getting out of hand! Okay? She wants me to put lotion on her!ScenesMonica: She's bluffing!ScenesChandler: Look, she's not backing down! She went like this! (He does a little mimic of her dance.)Scenes[Cut to the hallway where Phoebe is conferring with Rachel.]ScenesPhoebe: He's not backing down. He went to get lotion.ScenesJoey: (entering the hall) Oh man! Aren't you guys done yet?! I wanna sit in my chair!ScenesRachel: Joey look, just look at it this way, the sooner Phoebe breaks Chandler the sooner this is all over and out in the open.ScenesJoey: Ooh!ScenesRachel: Okay!ScenesJoey: I like that! (To Phoebe) Oh, okay! Show him your bra! He's afraid of bras! Can't work 'em! (He swiftly rips open the front of Phoebe's dress revealing her bra.)ScenesPhoebe: Joey! (Examining the dress.) Wow, you didn’t rip off any buttons.ScenesJoey: It's not my first time.Scenes[Cut to the bathroom.]ScenesMonica: You go back out there and you seduce her till she cracks!ScenesChandler: Okay, give me a second! (Pause) Did you clean up in here?ScenesMonica: Of course.Scenes[Cut back to the living room. Chandler slowly exits the bathroom and gets pushed from behind by Monica and sees Phoebe closing the apartment door.)ScenesChandler: Oh, you're-you're going?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, not without you, lover. (She slowly walks over to him and is showcasing her bra.) So, this is my bra.ScenesChandler: (swallowing hard) It's very, very nice. Well, come here. I'm very were gonna be having all the sex.ScenesPhoebe: You should be. I'm very bendy. (Pause) I'm gonna kiss you now.ScenesChandler: Not if I kiss you first.Scenes(They move closer to together and Phoebe hesitantly puts her hand on Chandler's hip. He puts his hand on her left hip but then decides to put his hand on her left hip. Phoebe then grabs his butt. Chandler goes for her breast, but stops and puts his hand on her shoulder.)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh.ScenesChandler: Well, I guess there's nothing left for us to do but-but kiss.ScenesPhoebe: Here it comes. Our first kiss.Scenes(They slowly and hesitantly move their lips together and kiss gently. Phoebe has her eyes wide open in shock and Chandler is squinting. He finally breaks the kiss after only a short while and pushes Phoebe away.)ScenesChandler: Okay! Okay! Okay! You win! You win!! I can't have sex with ya!ScenesPhoebe: And why not?!ScenesChandler: Because I'm in love with Monica!!ScenesPhoebe: You're-you're what?!Scenes(Monica comes out of the bathroom like a bolt, and Rachel and Joey both enter.)ScenesChandler: Love her! That's right, I…LOVE…HER!!! I love her!! (They walk together and hug.) I love you, Monica.ScenesMonica: I love you too Chandler. (They kiss.)ScenesPhoebe: I just—I thought you guys were doing it, I didn't know you were in love!ScenesJoey: Dude!ScenesChandler: And hats off to Phoebe. Quite a competitor. (Pause) And might I say your breasts are still showing.ScenesPhoebe: God! (She turns and buttons up.)ScenesJoey: All right! So that's it! It's over! Everybody knows!ScenesMonica: Well actually, Ross doesn't.ScenesChandler: Yes, and we'd appreciate it if no one told him yet.Scenes(Joey suddenly gets very angry.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross's new apartment, he is showing his boss, Dr. Ledbetter his new place and new outlook on life.]
rows.Content: Ross: A new place for a new Ross. I'm gonna have you and all the guys from work over once it's y'know, furnished.ScenesDr. Ledbetter: I must say it's nice to see you back on your feet.ScenesRoss: Well I am that. And that whole rage thing is definitely behind me.ScenesDr. Ledbetter: I wonder if its time for you to rejoin our team at the museum?ScenesRoss: Oh Donald that-that would be great. I am totally ready to come back to work. I—What? (He notices something through the window.) No! Wh… What are you doing?!! (Dr. Ledbetter is slowly backing away.) GET OFF MY SISTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The Girl Who Hits JoeyScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Ross is running up the stairs. Note: This show continues where the last one left off.]
rows.Content: Ross: Chandler!!! Chandler!!! (He opens the door to the apartment but is stopped by the chain; Chandler and Monica quickly stop making out and try to get dressed.) Chandler, I saw what you were doing through the window! Chandler, I saw what you were doing to my sister! Now get out here!ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Wow! Listen, we had a good run. What was it? Four? Five months? I mean, that's more than most people have in a lifetime! So, good-bye, take care, bye-bye then! (He kisses her and starts to climb out the balcony window.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?!ScenesChandler: Oh, I'm going on the lamb.ScenesMonica: Come on Chandler, come on, I can handle Ross. (They go to the door. Ross is trying to stick his hand through and undo the chain; Monica pushes his hand back.) (To Ross) Hold on! (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What's up bro?Scenes(Ross spots Chandler and starts chasing him around the kitchen table. Chandler runs and hides behind Monica.)ScenesRoss: What the hell are doing?!!ScenesRachel: (running from the guy's apartment with Joey in tow) Hey, what's-what's going on?!ScenesChandler: Well, I think, I think Ross knows about me and Monica.ScenesJoey: (panicking) Dude! He's right there!ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) I thought you were my best friend, this is my sister! My best friend and my sister! I-I cannot believe this!ScenesChandler: Look, we're not just messing around! I love her. Okay, I'm in love with her.ScenesMonica: I'm so sorry that you had to find out this way. I'm sorry, but it's true, I love him too.Scenes(There's a brief pause.)ScenesRoss: (happily) My best friend and my sister! I cannot believe this. (He hugs them both.) (To Joey and Rachel) You guys probably wanna get some hugs in too, huh? Big news!ScenesRachel: Awww, no, it's okay, we've actually known for a while.Scenes(There's another pause as Ross gets angry again.)ScenesRoss: What? What? What?! You guys knew? (Joey and Rachel backup against the door.) You all knew and you didn't tell me?!!ScenesRachel: Well, Ross, we were worried about you. We didn't know how you were going to react.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRoss: (happily again) You were worried about me? You didn't know how I was going to react? (He hugs them both.)ScenesJoey: Okay, all right, whew! What do you say we all clear out of here and let these two lovebirds get back down to business? (Ross turns and glares at him.) Hey-hey-hey, I-I-I'm just talking here, he-he's the one doing your sister.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, you know what I just realized? If you guys ever have kids…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Whoa-whoa-whoa! We're having kids?!ScenesJoey: (quickly) I call Godfather!ScenesRoss: You can't just call Godfather. Don't you think her brother should be Godfather?ScenesJoey: Sure, if you cared enough to call it first.ScenesMonica: Guys, you're a few steps ahead of us.ScenesChandler: Yeah, big zero gravity moon steps.ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, I just thought of the greatest wedding gift to get you.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I'll go in on that with you! I couldn't think of anything.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(A girl enters.)ScenesJoey: (to her) Oh, hey Katie! Everyone, this is Katie.ScenesKatie: Hi!ScenesAll: Hi!ScenesJoey: So, are you ready to go?ScenesKatie: Yeah, I just gotta run to the bathroom.ScenesJoey: Oh sure, right back there. (Points.)ScenesKatie: Hey, where are we going to lunch?ScenesJoey: I was thinking Chinese food.ScenesKatie: Ohh, I love Chinese! How did you know I love Chinese?! (She hits him repeatedly as she says that.)Scenes(She heads to the bathroom and Joey sits back down.)ScenesRachel: She is so cute! You could fit her right in your little pocket!ScenesJoey: I don't know. I mean I like her a lot, and she's really nice, but…ScenesMonica: But what?ScenesJoey: (shyly) She keeps punching me.Scenes(They all laugh.)ScenesMonica: In that cute, little, sweet way she just did?ScenesJoey: Hey, it's a lot harder than it looks! Okay? (Quietly) She-she-she's hurting me.ScenesMonica: I know what you need, you need a bodyguard. Hey Ross, what is Ben doing after preschool?ScenesChandler: Hey listen, come on, Joey is having a problem! A little girl is beating him up.ScenesRachel: Aww, Joey, come here. (She takes his hand.) Look honey, I know this must be really, really difficult for you and I--Oh, I'm sorry. Am I hurting you?

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, he's unpacking after moving in. There's a knock on the door and he answers it.]
rows.Content: Ross: (opens it to reveal Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! I brought you some house warming gifts.ScenesRoss: Aww.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Salt, so your life always has flavor.ScenesRoss: Huh.ScenesPhoebe: Bread, so you never go hungry.ScenesRoss: Ohh.ScenesPhoebe: And a scented candle for the bathroom, because well, y'know.ScenesRoss: Thanks. Thanks. And thanks again.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!Scenes(The door across the hall opens and a guy walks into Ross's apartment.)ScenesGuy: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesGuy: Welcome to the building. I'm uh, Steve Sarah; I'm president of the tenants committee.ScenesRoss: Oh hi! Ross Geller. And this is my friend Phoebe.ScenesSteve: Oh hi Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Mr. President.ScenesSteve: I came to talk to you about Howard.ScenesRoss: Howard?ScenesSteve: Yeah, he's the handy man. He's gonna be retiring next week and everyone who lives here is kicking in a 100 bucks as a thank you for all the hard work type of thing.ScenesRoss: Oh that's nice.ScenesSteve: Yeah. So, do you want to give a check? Or…ScenesRoss: Oh. Uhh…ScenesSteve: Oh look, you don't have to give it too me right now! You can slip it under my door. (Points to his apartment across the hall.)ScenesRoss: No-no, it's not that, it's just… I-I just moved in.ScenesSteve: Well, the guy's worked here for 25 years.ScenesRoss: Yes, but I've lived here for 25 minutes.ScenesSteve: Oh, okay, I get it. (Starts to leave.)ScenesRoss: No wait, look. Look! I'm sorry, it's just I've never even met Howard. I-I mean I don't know Howard.ScenesSteve: Howard's the handy man!ScenesRoss: Yes but too me he's just, man.ScenesSteve: Okay, fine, whatever. Welcome to the building. (Exits.)ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe) Ugh, can you believe that guy!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I really like his glasses.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is lamenting to Chandler and Rachel about his troubles in his new building.]
rows.Content: Ross: …so then President Steve told everyone that I was a cheapskate, and now the whole building hates me! A little kid spit on my knee! Y'know what I'm gonna do? I'm gonna throw a party. That's right. For everyone in the building, and I'm gonna sit them down and explain to them, I am not a bad guy. I am not a cheap guy! I'm just a guy who-who stands up for what he believes in. A man with principles.ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) Sounds like a fun party.ScenesRachel: Hmm. Look, Ross, if you want your neighbors to like you, why don't you just pay the hundred bucks? The party's gonna cost you way more than that.ScenesRoss: It doesn't matter! It's my principles! We're talking about my principles!ScenesRachel: Okay, I thought it was about your neighbors liking you.ScenesRoss: Oh, they'll like me. Once they come to my awesome PAR-TAY! Okay, I gotta run. I gotta go get some nametags. (Exits.)ScenesRachel: And that crazy party animal will be your brother-in-law.ScenesChandler: Very, very funny, but don't say things like that in front of Monica. I don't want you putting any ideas in her head.ScenesRachel: Umm, Chandler, you do realize that those ideas are probably already in Monica's head.ScenesChandler: Wh-wh-why?!ScenesRachel: Well, because she loves you and because you love her.ScenesChandler: Yeah, so, what's that supposed to mean?!ScenesRachel: Hey, Chandler, don't freak out! I'm telling you something you already know! Come on, she broke up with Richard because he didn't want to have babies. And she's a woman, and she's almost 30, and y'know it's Monica.ScenesChandler: I don't see it that way. Okay? Because, I see two Monicas, the one that was my friend, who lived across the hall, and wanted to have a lot of babies and then the new Monica, who I just started to date. Now, who's to say what she wants?! I’m right. I'm right. Am I right?ScenesRachel: No, you're right, you are absolutely right. I mean that makes, that makes everything different.ScenesChandler: Okay. It's not different at all, is it?ScenesRachel: Not unless different means the same.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is sitting on the couch with Katie.]
rows.Content: Katie: You were so funny with that waiter! You're such a nut! (She slaps her thighs, Joey jerks, and spills some of his coffee.)ScenesJoey: (sets the coffee down) Y'know, breadstick fangs are always funny.ScenesKatie: No, you make them funny. You're the funny one! (She punches him again and he retreats to the arm of the couch.)ScenesJoey: Uhh, look Katie, uh listen, we-we need to talk. Okay? Umm, look I like you. I-I really do, I like you a lot. Okay? But sometimes when you, when you playfully punch me like that it-it feels like someone's hitting me with a very tiny but very real bat.ScenesKatie: Aww, like I could hurt you. Are you making fun of my size? Don't make fun of me because of my size! (She punches him again and almost knocks him off the arm of the couch.)
