rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Monica are curled up on one of the chairs.]
rows.Content: Monica: Isn't this great?ScenesChandler: Hmm.ScenesMonica: Couldn't you just stay like this forever? (His eyes snap open.) Chandler! Couldn't you just stay here forever?ScenesChandler: Yeah, here, somewhere else, y'know where-where ever. (Gets up.)ScenesMonica: Are you okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I'm cool. Casual.ScenesMonica: What-what are you doing?ScenesChandler: I'm just hanging out. Y'know, having fun. Y'know with the girl that I'm seeing casually.ScenesMonica: Man, I knew it! I knew you were going to do this!!ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesMonica: Get all freaked out because everybody was talking and just joking around about marriage and stuff.ScenesChandler: Well, you do want all that stuff, right?ScenesMonica: Oh and you know what I want!ScenesChandler: Yes! You want babies! You have baby fever!ScenesMonica: I do not have baby fever!ScenesChandler: Oh please, you are obsessed with babies and-and marriage and everything that's related to babies and-and marriage! I've got an idea, why don't we turn down the heat on this pressure cooker?!ScenesMonica: Have you lost your mind? Chandler, this isn't about me! This is about you and all your weird relationship commitment crap!ScenesChandler: Nah-uh! I know you! Okay? I know the thoughts that you have in the head--in your head!ScenesMonica: You don't know everything. Did you know that I'm going out with Rachel tonight instead of you? Hmm? And did you know that the only baby around here is you?! And did you know that I can't even look at you right now?! (She storms out.)ScenesChandler: Well, I did not know that.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is getting advice from Ross and Joey.]
rows.Content: Chandler: It's gonna be okay, right? I mean she's not gonna leave me? This is, this is fixable.ScenesRoss and Joey: Oh yeah, yeah, sure. Absolutely.ScenesChandler: By me?ScenesRoss: Oh, no!ScenesJoey: No-no.ScenesRoss: Well, unless you make some kind of big gesture.ScenesJoey: Yeah, big!Scenes(Monica enters.)ScenesJoey: Uh-oh, shht! The Misses.ScenesMonica: Gunther, can I get a coffee (Looks at Chandler) to go?ScenesChandler: Monica. (Goes to talk to her.)ScenesMonica: I'm still not done not wanting to talk to you.ScenesChandler: Just tell me what I need to do to make things right.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: Well, that's what we do. Y'know, I-I mess up and then you tell me how to fix it and then I do and then y'know you think I'm all cute again.ScenesMonica: Really? I'm really tired of being your relationship tutor. You're gonna have to figure this one for yourself. All right? Y'know what? If you're too afraid to be in a real relationship, then don't be in one. (She walks out.)Scenes(Chandler turns to watch her go and then sees Ross and Joey both with huge grimaces on their faces.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, he's having his party, only he's the only guest. He gets up and puts on a nametag that says Ross, but doesn't quite like it. So he takes it off and puts on one that says Dr. Geller and he puts the Ross one underneath the Dr. Geller one. Then as he turns off the music, we hear the party for Howard raging in the apartment across the hall.]
rows.Content: Party Guests: (chanting) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (Ross goes to investigate the noise) Howard! Howard! Howard! (They're holding Howard above their heads.) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (He sees Phoebe chanting along with them.) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Yay!!ScenesRoss: Phoebe! (He grabs her arm to get her attention.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hi Ross!ScenesRoss: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I thought this was your party and it turns out it’s a party for Howard. He's just the sweetest little man! (A guest walks up to her.)ScenesGuest #1: See ya Phoebe! Oh and hey, thanks for chipping in!ScenesRoss: You chipped in?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, uh-huh, a 100 dollars.ScenesRoss: Phoebe! I can't believe you gave them money! I thought you agreed it was totally unreasonable that they asked me for that money!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but they didn't ask me! Y'know? This way I'm just y'know, the exotic, generous stranger. That's always fun to be.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but you're making me look bad!ScenesPhoebe: No I'm not. No! If anything I'm making you look better! They'll see you talking to me and that's--I'm a hit!ScenesSteve: (walking up) Oh hey, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesSteve: Oh hey, Ross. Umm, see, I was thinking maybe you two could switch apartments because Phoebe's more our kind of people. Something to think about. (Walks away.)Scenes(Ross turns and glares at Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay, my bad.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is getting some coffee as Joey enters. He's looking a little puffy, but that's probably from the large number of different color sweaters he's wearing.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi! Wow! You look, you look…big.ScenesJoey: Thanks! I've been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I'm wearing six sweaters?ScenesRachel: Uhhh, yeah. But it's not obvious why.ScenesJoey: Well look, I’m breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra padding. Y'know? I mean, if she hits me when she's happy, can you imagine how hard she's gonna hit me when I tell her I'm taking away the Joey love?ScenesKatie: (entering) Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey! Hiya!ScenesRachel: Hey! Hey, cute jacket!ScenesKatie: Oh, thanks! That's so sweet! (She punches Rachel like she punched Joey.)ScenesRachel: Oh! Ow! (Joey motions, "You see what I mean?!")ScenesKatie: Oh, ow! Did Joey tell you to say that? You guys, (Punches Joey) are too much! (Punches Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Whoa! (Laughs) Y'know what Katie? I gotta tell ya I-I-I-I think you are the one who is too much. (She punches Katie back.)ScenesKatie: Ohh, Joey has the nicest friends! (She punches Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, and the nicest girlfriend! (She retaliates.)ScenesKatie: You're so sweet! (Punches Rachel yet again.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, you're so sweet! (She kicks Katie in the shin.)ScenesKatie: Oww!!!! Joey, she just kicked me.ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesKatie: Well? Aren't you gonna do something?ScenesJoey: Uhh….ScenesKatie: You'd better do something, or I'm gonna walk out that door right now! Well? Are you gonna?ScenesJoey: Nah.Scenes(She looks at Rachel and storms out. After she's left Joey hugs Rachel in thanks.)

rows.Scenes: Howard's party, Phoebe is talking Ross up to two more partygoers. Ross isn't happy about it.]
rows.Content: Ross: (trying to get her attention) Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: (ignoring him and continuing her conversation) That's what I'm saying. (Laughs.)ScenesRoss: (tapping her on the shoulder) Phoebe? Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh. (Turns to him.)ScenesRoss: Look, this is a disaster! Can't I please just go?ScenesPhoebe: No! No! I'm talking you up to people. Just give it a little time, all right? Relax, get something to eat! Okay?Scenes(They go to the food table.)ScenesRoss: So uh, what did you tell them about me?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I was telling them about you and Emily. Y'know, try to get some sympathy.ScenesRoss: Ohh. (He cuts himself a piece of cake.)ScenesPhoebe: But somehow you came off as the bad guy.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I think I told it wrong. Y'know, we should talk about that because I don't totally understand what happened there.ScenesRoss: (trying a piece of cake) Ohh, this cake is really good!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, see? Things are looking up already!ScenesGuest #2: (sees the cake) Oh my God! Someone cut Howard's cake! (Ross tries dumping it into a nearby plant.) Who would do a think like that?Scenes(Steve goes over to look at Ross who's trying to look cool, but has some frosting on his lip.)ScenesSteve: 3-B!ScenesAll: Oh yeah, aww!ScenesSteve: Okay, you got your free food! You ruined everyone's fun! Don't you think it's time you went home?!ScenesGuest #3: Yeah, leave!ScenesAll: Yeah, get out! Now!ScenesSteve: Go back to 3-B, 3-B!ScenesPhoebe: All right, everyone calm down! Everyone calm down! I have something that I would like to say! Who here likes Ross? (Ross is the only one who raises his hand and Phoebe glares at him to put his hand back down.) Of course you don't like him! He-he didn't give you any money, he raised his own hand when I asked, "Who hear likes Ross," and he's wearing two nametags! (He takes one off.) I-I'll be honest with you guys, when I first met Ross I didn't like him at all! But then once I got to know him I saw that he's really sweet and caring and very generous. I mean, all I'm saying is don't judge Ross before you get to know him all right? I mean, I like all you guys now, but when I first meet you y'know Kurt, I thought, y'know abrasive drunk, umm Lola, mind numbingly stupid! And okay, you guys (She turns to an elderly gentleman and a 20 something woman, who're a couple.) (To the girl) Gold-digger, (To the old guy) cradle robbing perv! So, I think you all know what I mean.

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross and Phoebe have been banished to Ross's place.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Obviously I didn't think they were gonna start throwing things. I just thought if I kept insulting everyone, you would jump in and defend everyone and then you could look like the hero.ScenesRoss: Oh wow, yeah! See, I did not get that.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler comes running in. Everyone else is already there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Where's Monica?! Where is she? I need to talk to her! It's urgent! Is she here?ScenesMonica: (raising her hand) I'm Monica.ScenesChandler: I need to talk to you, it's urgent!ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay, I've been doing a lot of thinking about us, y'know a lot of uhh, us thinking. And uh, well I guess there's only one-one way to do this. (He slowly and awkwardly gets down on one knee.)ScenesMonica: Wait what-wh-wh-what are you doing?!ScenesChandler: (getting out a ring box) Monica…ScenesMonica: No-no, don't-don't-don't do it!ScenesChandler: Will you marry me?Scenes(Phoebe hides her eyes in shame. Rachel is starring at them wide-eyed and open-mouthed. Joey and Ross are stunned to temporary silence.)ScenesRoss: Oh-no. No. No.ScenesJoey: What a bad idea!ScenesRachel: Ohhhh, I cannot look at it! (She doesn't move.)ScenesMonica: Chandler, why are you doing this?ScenesChandler: I don't know. But I know I'm not afraid to do this.ScenesMonica: Chandler.ScenesChandler: I'm doing this because I'm sorry?ScenesMonica: Do you umm, you really think the best reason to get married is because you're sorry?ScenesChandler: No, the best reason to get married is pregnancy. Sorry is pretty much fourth y'know, behind being ready and actually wanting to get married. (Laughs.) Will you be my wife?ScenesMonica: (kneels with him) Chandler, umm, I want you to take just a minute and I want you to think about how ridiculous this sounds.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I'm kinda wishing everyone wasn't here right now.ScenesMonica: Honey! Do you know that none of that stuff came from me?! I mean I never said I wanted to have babies and get married right now!ScenesChandler: Yeah I know, but I was really confused and then I talked to these guys. (Turns to look at Ross and Joey.)ScenesMonica: Who? Two divorces and Joey?!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: She's right y'know.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but still, cheap shot!ScenesMonica: Y'know what? Y'know when I said that I want you to deal with this relationship stuff all on your own? Well, you're not ready for that.ScenesChandler: I didn't think I was!Scenes(They hug.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, what would have done if I said yes?ScenesChandler: Well I would've been happy because I would've be able to spend the rest of my life with the woman that I love. Or, you would've seen a Chandler shaped hole in that door. (Points at the door.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Ross, will you pass me that knife?ScenesRoss: No, I will not!ScenesJoey: Oh, it's okay. You don't have to be so mean about it.ScenesRoss: You're right, I'm sorry. Will you marry me?Scenes(They all laugh.)ScenesPhoebe: Aw, and I was gonna ask you to marry me because I forgot to say hello to you last week.ScenesRachel: Oh no wait Pheebs, I think for something like that you just ask them to move in with you. But I'm not sure, Chandler?ScenesChandler: Okay, how long is this going to go on.ScenesMonica: Well I think the length of teasing is directly related to how insane you were so, a long time.ScenesRoss: This is fun. Hey Rach, remember that whole "We were on a break thing?" Well, I'm sorry, will you marry me? (Laughs--whines as he sees that no one is laughing. They're just staring at him in shock.)ScenesChandler: That's not funny.ScenesJoey: That's not funny at all!Scenes(They all get up and leave.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With A CopScenesStory by: Alicia Sky VarinaitisScenesTeleplay by: Gigi McCreery & Perry ReinScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Monica and Chandler are sitting on one of the chairs doing a crossword puzzle.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesJoey: What are you guys doing up?ScenesChandler: Oh, we wanted to finish the crossword before we went to bed. Hey, do you know a six-letter word for red?ScenesJoey: (thinks) Dark red.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I think that's wrong, but there's a Connect the Dots in here for you later. (To Monica) Hey, how about maroon?ScenesMonica: (checks to see if it works) Yes, you are so smart! (Kisses him.)ScenesJoey: Aww, you guys are so cute!ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesJoey: All right, I'll see you in the morning.ScenesChandler and Monica: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Joey's bedroom, time lapse. He's asleep and dreaming. In his dream he's doing the crossword puzzle with…wait for it…Monica!]
rows.Content: Dream Monica: Y'know, I love doing crossword puzzles with you honey!ScenesDream Joey: Aww, me too. Now let's finish this and go to bed.ScenesDream Monica: Okay! There's only one left, three letter word, not dog but…ScenesDream Joey: Cat.ScenesDream Monica: Yes! You are so smart! (Kisses him.) I love you.ScenesDream Joey: I love you too.Scenes(They hug.)Scenes[Cut back to Joey in bed, he's smiling, enjoying the dream as he wakes up. Suddenly, he realized what he was dreaming about and bolts upright in bed.]ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there but Ross and Joey. Gunther hands them the bill, and Chandler gives some money to pay it.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (looking at the bill) Uhh, we still need a tip.ScenesPhoebe: All right. Hold on. (She starts digging in the chair.) I got it. Nickel! (Donates it.) How much more do we need?ScenesRachel: A couple of bucks.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, dime! (Donates that.) You guys should probably keep talking; this could take a while. (Finds something else.) Oh no, wait! Look it! Whoa! (Looks at it.) Oh my God, this is a police badge!ScenesMonica: Wow!ScenesChandler: Oh that's so cool! Why would a cop come in here though? They don't serve donuts. (No one laughs.) Y'know what actually, could you discover the badge again? I think I can come up with something better than that.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, I bet somebody's missing that badge.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I should probably take it back. Ooh, but you know what? While I'm at the police station, I could check their Ten Most Wanted lists because my friend Fritzy has been like number 11 forever, so this could be her year! (She crosses her fingers in hope.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey, you guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey Joey!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Hey. That uh, that my sweatshirt?ScenesMonica: Oh yes, it is. I'm sorry I borrowed it, I was cold. I hope its okay?ScenesJoey: Well uh, it's just that uh, y'know if-if you're gonna be wearing someone's sweatshirt shouldn't it be your boyfriends--and I’m not him.ScenesMonica: I'm sorry, I'll give it back to you.ScenesJoey: No-no! No! I mean it's gonna be all smelling like Monica!ScenesMonica: Are you saying I smell bad?ScenesJoey: No! No, you smell like a meadow. (Pause.) I'm sorry. (Runs to the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: What's with him?ScenesChandler: Oh, y'know what? The last time Joey went to a meadow, his mother was shot by a hunter.

rows.Scenes: A couch store, Ross is trying to decide on a new couch for his place. He has dragged Rachel along for the trip, and she's not too happy about it. Ross is sitting on it in different ways to see how it feels. He tries to just sit on it normally, and then he tries flopping on it. One thing about this couch, it's huge. It's like twice the size of a normal full size couch. Whoever designed this thing, needs help and fast.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (disgusted at Ross's antics) Ugh!ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Yeah, I still don't know. (To the salesman who is hovering nearby) I'm sorry I just wanna make sure that I bought the right couch. I need a couch that says, "Kids welcome here." But that also says, (In a sexy voice) "Come here to me!ScenesRachel: What?! You say that to kids?!!ScenesRoss: No! No! No! The "Come here to me" is y'know for the ladies.ScenesRachel: Ross, honey, it's a nice couch. It's not a magic couch.ScenesThe Salesman: You picked a great couch.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesThe Salesman: Yeah. Could you just sign right here please? (Hands him a clipboard.)ScenesRoss: Oh, sure. Whoa-whoa, what's this? The delivery charge is almost as much as the couch!ScenesRachel: Wait! No, that's ridiculous. Come on, he lives three blocks away!ScenesRoss: Yeah, y'know what? I'll take it myself, thank you! (He signs the form and hands it back to the salesman.) All right Rach, let's go! (He picks up one end of the couch.)ScenesRachel: Yeah! (She puts on her coat and turns around and sees Ross is expecting her to help.) (Laughing.) Are you kiddin'?ScenesRoss: Oh, come on it's only three blocks! And-and, it's not very heavy, try it! Come on! Come on!ScenesRachel: (Disgustedly she goes and tries to pick up the couch. Much to her amazement, she is successful.) Oh. Oh! I can do it!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesThe Salesman: You two are really gonna enjoy that couch.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, we're uh, yeah we're not together. (He starts backing out of the store.)ScenesThe Salesman: Ohh, okay. (Laughs.) Something didn't quite add up there. (Ross stops, walks back to talk to the salesman, and in the process pushes Rachel up against a wall.)ScenesRachel: Ross!ScenesRoss: What's that supposed to mean?ScenesRachel: Ross!ScenesThe Salesman: Well you, her, I mean, she's very…y'know. And you're like…y'know.ScenesRoss: Not that it's any of your business, but we did go out.ScenesThe Salesman: Really? You two?ScenesRoss: Yeah! Rach?ScenesRachel: Come on, I don't really want to be doing this right now. I am carrying a very heavy couch.ScenesRoss: Then tell him quickly.ScenesRachel: (To Ross) Fine! (To the salesman) We went out.ScenesRoss: Not only did we go out, we did it 298 times!ScenesRachel: Ross!! Oh my--ugh!! You kept count?! You are such a loser!ScenesRoss: A loser you did it with (To the salesman) 298 times!Scenes(Rachel pushes on the couch and pushes Ross out the door.)

rows.Scenes: Outside of Central Perk, Phoebe is exiting and sees a woman put out her cigarette on a tree.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh. Oh! Ma'am? Excuse me, ma'am?ScenesThe Smoking Woman: Yes?ScenesPhoebe: You can't put your cigarette out on a tree!ScenesThe Smoking Woman: Yeah I can, it worked real well.ScenesPhoebe: No but you shouldn't! Don't ever do that again.ScenesThe Smoking Woman: I won't! (Turns away) Until I have my next cigarette.ScenesPhoebe: Hold it! (Grabs the badge) N.Y.P.D! Freeze punk!ScenesThe Smoking Woman: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah that's right you are so busted. (To no one in particular.) Book 'em.ScenesThe Smoking Woman: Who are you talking too?ScenesPhoebe: Save it Red! Unless you wanna spend the night in the slammer, you apologize to the tree.ScenesThe Smoking Woman: I am not going to apologize to a tree!ScenesPhoebe: You apologize to the tree right now or I am calling for backup. (The woman calls her bluff.) (Screaming at no one in particular) Backup! Backup!!ScenesThe Smoking Woman: I-I'm sorry! Sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, cancel backup! Cancel backup!

rows.Scenes: Ross's building's lobby, he and Rachel are about to attempt to take the couch upstairs.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay. (Throws off the last cushion.)ScenesRachel: Ross, didn't you say that there was an elevator in here?ScenesRoss: Uhh, yes I did but there isn't. Okay, here we go.Scenes(They start the attempt. Ross is going backwards and reaches the first landing. This staircase has three steps then a landing, makes a 90-degree turn, and has more steps before another landing and another 90-degree turn.)ScenesRoss: Okay, go left. Left! Left! (The bottom of the couch is hitting the railing.)ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what? There is no more left, left!ScenesRoss: Oh okay, lift it straight up over your head! Straight up over your head! You can do it! You can do it! (She gets it lifted up and they make the first turn.) Okay. You got it?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Good-good-good.ScenesRachel: Oh-oh!Scenes(She can't stay at the end as the couch rounds the turn so she shifts to the back corner of the couch and is at a 90-degree angle to it.)ScenesRoss: Yeah, you got it right? You got it right? You got it?Scenes(She don't got it as the couch slips out of their grips and falls over the bottom railing.)ScenesRachel: Any chance you think the couch looks good there?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe is telling Chandler and Monica how she fought crime in her own way with the badge she found.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: …so this guy was all (Mumbles.) And I'm all, Buffay, Homicide. (Flashes the badge.) It was just so cool!ScenesMonica: (cooking something) Phoebe, you were supposed to take that back!ScenesPhoebe: I know but I'm having so much fun doing good deeds.ScenesChandler: Okay, but impersonating a police officer is a serious thing. You could get arrested.ScenesPhoebe: You could get arrested, right now! (Flashes the badge and they glare at her.) All right, yeah, I gotta take it back. I'm totally drunk with power. (She heads for the door just as Joey enters.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Joey) Hey.ScenesJoey: (To Phoebe) Hey! (Sees that Monica's there.) Oh.ScenesChandler: Hi, Joe.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I didn’t know you guys were going to be here.ScenesMonica: Hey Joey, sweetie, taste this. (Holds out a spoon for him.)ScenesJoey: (backing away) What?! Why?!ScenesMonica: What is going on with you?ScenesJoey: Nothing!ScenesChandler: Oh, come on! You've been acting strange all day!ScenesJoey: All right! There is something. I kinda had a dream, (pause) but I don't want to talk about it. (Starts for his room.)ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-what-what if Martin Luther King had said that? (Imitating what his famous speech would sound like.) I kinda have a dream! I don’t want to talk about it.ScenesJoey: Well, it involved Monica.ScenesChandler: You had a dream about a girl that I am seeing?! Oh, that is so cool! (To Monica) I can't tell you how many times I've dreamt about a girl that he was seeing. (Seeing Monica's stare.) (To Joey) Anyway we're talking about your dream. (To Monica) I love you. (To Joey) Your dream? (Leans in to listen closely.)ScenesJoey: Don't worry, there wasn't any sex in it or anything. I haven't dreamt about her like that since I found out about you two--ish.ScenesMonica: What was the dream about?ScenesJoey: Well, okay. You were my girlfriend and we were doing the crossword puzzle. Y'know like you guys were doing last night. So, that's it. I'm in love with Monica and I'll be moving out.ScenesMonica: Wait, Joey! Joey! That doesn’t mean that-that you're in love with me!ScenesJoey: It-it doesn’t?ScenesMonica: No!ScenesChandler: No, it can mean anything. Like uh, all of the sudden you're jealous because I've become the apartment stud.ScenesJoey: That kinda sounds like your dream dude.ScenesMonica: Or, it could mean that-that you saw Chandler and me together and we y'know were being close and stuff and then you just want to have that with someone too.ScenesJoey: In the dream I did enjoy the closeness.ScenesMonica: Um-hmm.ScenesChandler: Joey, look, are you attracted to Monica? Right here, right now, are you attracted to her?ScenesJoey: (looks at her) Not really.ScenesChandler: Well there you have it!ScenesMonica: Well sure! I'm just wearing sweats! (Looking at Chandler and slowly realizing what his point is.) But that's good that you're not in love with me, because you just want a girlfriend!ScenesJoey: No, I don't think it's just about just getting a girlfriend. Y'know? I mean, yeah, I can get a girlfriend! Yeah, we could sit in the chair and do crosswords, but y'know are we ever going to have y'know the closeness like-like you guys have?ScenesChandler: Well y'know, Monica and I were friends before we started dating. So maybe-maybe that's it?ScenesJoey: Friends first? That's interesting.ScenesMonica: You become friends after?ScenesJoey: No, never done that either.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey, umm, do you guys have that tape measure?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, it's actually in my bedroom.Scenes(Monica and Chandler both remember a special moment between them.)ScenesMonica: (laughing) That's right.Scenes(They realize the implication of their behavior, stop instantly and head for his bedroom. In the meanwhile, Joey is starring at Rachel in a seductive way.)ScenesRachel: (noticing him) What's up Joey?ScenesJoey: (in a sexy voice) How you doin'?Scenes(Rachel is stunned.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is walking up and notices a car that is parked half on the curb and right in front of the door, making it difficult for people to enter Central Perk.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Excuse me, is this your car?ScenesGuy: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Well I don't think it's very nice of you to park here, y'know you're blocking the entrance.ScenesGuy: Don't worry about it. It's not a problem.ScenesPhoebe: Well, it's a problem for me, which means it's a problem for you 'cause I'm a cop. (Shows the badge.)ScenesGuy: (he reaches into the car and slams his siren on the roof.) So am I!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, no. (Pause) Oh okay, so you're a cop which means you can park anywhere, 'cause I know that 'cause I'm a cop too. So, all right, keep up the good work. 10-4. (Tries to leave.)ScenesCop: (stopping her) Hey, wait a second! So wait, what precinct are you with?ScenesPhoebe: I-I'm with the umm, the 57th.ScenesCop: Oh, I know a guy in homicide up there.ScenesPhoebe: I'm in vice. Yeah, in fact I'm undercover right now. I'm a whore.ScenesCop: Who-who else is in vice up there?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, do you know, umm Sipowicz?ScenesCop: Sipowicz? No, I don't think so.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, big guy, kinda bald.ScenesCop: No, I don't know him.ScenesPhoebe: (starts to walk away, but stops) Don’t try to call him or anything, 'cause he's not there, he's out. His umm, his partner just died.ScenesCop: Wow umm, tell Sipowicz I'm real sorry for his loss.ScenesPhoebe: I-I sure will, take care. (Starts walking off.)ScenesCop: (following her) Hey by the way, I'm sure Sipowicz is gonna be all right. I heard that kid from Silver Spoons is really good. (Phoebe's stunned) And where did you find my badge?ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (She starts laughing. Then she throws the badge at him and runs away.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering. Rachel is there getting some tools to help Ross out.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey! Joey, would you mind giving me and Ross a hand moving his couch?ScenesJoey: Oh, I'd love too, but I got acting class. But y'know what? I guess I can blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.Scenes(He starts staring at her longingly.)ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesJoey: Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesJoey: Yeah that's not such a bad situation they got going over there. I'm thinking of getting me one of those.ScenesRachel: What's up Joe?ScenesJoey: Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great…ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoey: …is because they were friends first. Y'know? So I asked myself, "Who are my friends?" You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So…ScenesRachel: (laughing) What are you saying?ScenesJoey: I'm saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.ScenesRachel: Y'know honey, umm, as uh, as flattered as I am that uh, you saw me first, uhh, I just, I-I don't think we should be cranking anything up.ScenesJoey: I'll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)ScenesRachel: (laughs and pushes the chair back in) Yeah, well, y'know umm… No honey, listen I think it's a great idea to become friends with someone before you date them, but I think the way you do it is y'know you meet someone, become their friend, build a foundation, then you ask them out on a date. Don't hit on your existing friends!ScenesJoey: Won't-won't that take longer?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Yeah. Oh, but once you find it, ohh it's so worth the wait.ScenesJoey: Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) Man, I wish I saw Phoebe first!

rows.Scenes: The lobby of Ross's building, he's sitting on the couch at the bottom of the stairs, and he's practicing enticing women to join him on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: Come here to me. No-no, you come here to me.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey Ross! I brought reinforcements.ScenesRoss: Oh great! What, you brought Joey?ScenesRachel: Well, I brought the next best thing.ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Chandler?! You brought Chandler?! The next best thing would be Monica!ScenesChandler: Y'know, I would be offended, but Monica is freakishly strong, so…ScenesRoss: Look, I-I drew a sketch about how we're gonna do it. (Showing them) Okay Rach, (points to the sketch) that's you. That's the couch. (Points again.)ScenesRachel: Whoa-oh, what's-what's that? (Points.)ScenesRoss: Oh, that's me.ScenesRachel: Wow! You certainly think a lot of yourself.ScenesRoss: No! That's-that's my arm!ScenesChandler: (looking at the sketch) Oh, I see. I thought you just really, really liked your new couch.ScenesRoss: Y'know what? Just-just follow my lead.Scenes(Chandler and Ross head for opposite ends of the couch.)ScenesRachel: Okay!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesRoss: Come on, Chandler.Scenes(They pick up the couch and after throwing off the last pillow; Rachel helps out on Chandler's end.)ScenesRoss: All right. (They start up the stairs. Ross is first.) Okay, here we go!Scenes(Chandler has moved forward and is now underneath the couch as it heads up the first set of stairs.)ScenesRoss: All right, ready?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Turn.ScenesChandler: (straining) Okay.ScenesRoss: Turn! Turn!Scenes(As they turn the couch, Chandler gets sandwiched between the railing and the couch.)ScenesChandler: Okay, I don't think we can turn anymore!ScenesRachel: Ross, I don't, I just don't think it's going to fit.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah it will! Come on, up! Up-up-up! Up! Yes! Here we go! Pivot! (They start up the stairs again. Chandler is between the couch and the wall now.) Pivot! Piv-ot! Piv-et!! Piv-ett!!! Piv-et!ScenesChandler: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!!Scenes(They set the couch down.)ScenesRoss: Okay, I don't think it's going to pivot anymore.ScenesChandler and Rachel: You think?!ScenesRoss: All right, let's uh, let's bring it back down and-and try again.Scenes(As they start back down the couch drops a little bit and gets jammed. They try to free it to no avail.)ScenesChandler: Okay, yeah, I think it's really stuck now.ScenesRoss: I can't believe that didn't work!ScenesRachel: I know, me neither! I mean, you had a sketch!ScenesChandler: Oh, y'know, what did you mean when you said pivot?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is returning and finds Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey! How's it going? Did you make any new friends?ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)ScenesChandler: (stopping him) Hey, whoa-whoa! What's she like?ScenesJoey: Uhh, well, she's…really good in bed.ScenesMonica: Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Well look, hey, it's all your fault!ScenesRachel: What?! Why?!ScenesJoey: Well because you didn't give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As soon as I told her I wanted to y'know, build a foundation and be friends first. I suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her roommate!ScenesMonica: What about the closeness?ScenesJoey: Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering with a pizza and finds everyone but Ross there.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) All right! Hey, who wants pizza?!ScenesChandler: Ooh, I do! I do! I do!Scenes(They all walk over to get a slice.)ScenesJoey: (taking a bite) Oh, great! Can you believe I found it on the second floor?Scenes(They all throw their pieces back as there is a knock on the door.)ScenesMonica: Who is it?ScenesVoice: N.Y.P.D!!ScenesPhoebe and Joey: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: Uhh, just a minute officer!!Scenes(He throws his piece back in the box, runs into the living room, looks for a place to hide the pizza, finds one, slides the box under the couch, sits down on the table, and tries to quickly chew the food in his mouth.)ScenesCop: I'm looking for Phoebe Buffay!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, God, it's him! It's that cop! God, I can't believe it! He found me!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Phoebe, are you gonna go to jail?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, if I'm going down, I'm taking you (Points at all of them) with me. (They all look at her.) Harboring a fugitive? That's one to three years minimum. Good luck Chandler. (She opens the door to the cop from before.) Okay, you can arrest me. Fine. But you'll never make it stick and you know it!ScenesCop: Yeah, but I kinda don't have a choice, it's my job. I mean, you understand right?ScenesPhoebe: Yep! As long as you understand that I'm going to call my lawyer and once he puts you on the stand he'll make you look like a fool. A fool!ScenesCop: I don't like looking foolish. Y'know what? Maybe uh, I don't arrest you today. Maybe I came by and you weren't here.ScenesPhoebe: I would love it if I weren't here!ScenesCop: Okay, so since umm, you're not going to jail tonight I was wondering if you would like to go to dinner with me?ScenesPhoebe: Me?!ScenesCop: Yeah. Ever since you flashed my badge at me, I kinda can't stop thinking about you. You're the prettiest, fake undercover whore I've ever seen.ScenesChandler and Joey: Nice!ScenesPhoebe: Wow! I didn't see that coming! You're-you're asking me out!ScenesCop: Yeah. I mean, I coulda done it better, but these people keep staring at me.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, yeah, I'd like to go out with you officer…ScenesCop: Gary.ScenesPhoebe: Gary.ScenesGary: Okay, so it's a date.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! So--ooh, I gotta ask you though. How did you know where to find me?ScenesGary: Well you're fingerprints were all over my badge so I just ran it through the computer and this was listed as your last known address so I just checked it out.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, impressive.ScenesGary: Not as impressive as you. I gotta tell you, I looked at your record and you've done some pretty weird stuff.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, we'll talk at dinner.ScenesGary: Okay. (He starts to leave.) So I'll come by in a couple hours and pick you up?ScenesPhoebe: All right, I can't wait!ScenesGary: Okay. And don't worry, I'm not just gonna take you out for donuts.Scenes(Chandler busts out laughing and everyone just looks at him.)ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) He has a gun!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The couch store, Ross is talking to a saleswoman.]
rows.Content: Ross: I'd like to return this couch. I'm not satisfied with it.Scenes[The camera cuts to show the couch, which has been cut in half.]ScenesThe Saleswoman: You wanna return this couch? (Ross nods yes.) It's cut in half!ScenesRoss: That's what I'm telling you.ScenesThe Saleswoman: Did you cut this couch in half?ScenesRoss: This couch, is cut in half! I would like to exchange it for one that is not cut in half!ScenesThe Saleswoman: You're telling me this couch was delivered to you like this?!ScenesRoss: Look, I am a reasonable man. I will accept store credit.ScenesThe Saleswoman: I'll give you store credit in the amount of four dollars.ScenesRoss: (thinks) I take it.ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Rachel's Inadvertant KissScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Rachel enters, happily.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Good, you guys are all here!ScenesRoss: Hey! What's up?ScenesRachel: Well, I have a job interview at Ralph Lauren tomorrow!ScenesAll: Congratulations! Ohh, that's great!ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesJoey: Boy, that guy's underwear sucks!ScenesRachel: Wh-what?!ScenesJoey: I got this pair marked excess, I gotta tell ya, there was no room for excess anything in there.ScenesRachel: Anyway, I'm going to be the coordinator of the woman's collection, I'll work right under the director, it's the perfect, perfect job for me!ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Well, if you nail the interview, you'll get it!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: You wanna work on your interview skills?ScenesRachel: O-okay!ScenesPhoebe: Okay! All right, let's start with the handshake. Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi.Scenes(They shake hands.)ScenesPhoebe: Very good handshake, good wrist action.ScenesMonica: Let me try. (Gets up to join them.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (They shake hands and she pulls away suddenly) Oh my God! What did I ever do to you?! (Rubbing her hand.)ScenesMonica: Did I squeeze it too hard?ScenesPhoebe: Let's just say, I'm glad I'm not Chandler.Scenes(Chandler tries to comprehend that remark.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is standing at the window waving at Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.ScenesMonica: Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?ScenesJoey: Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.Scenes(We see Ross through the window and he acts like a swimmer that gets attacked by a shark, picture one of the many, many, many Jaws movies they made and you get the idea.)ScenesJoey: (waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross's building is flirting with me.ScenesMonica: Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor…ScenesMonica: (joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?ScenesJoey: Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's Building, Joey is trying to find the hot girl's apartment. So he's walking up the hallway counting doors. He comes to what he thinks is the right one and knocks on it. Ross opens the door, it's his apartment.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Joey! Great stuff huh?ScenesJoey: This is your place?ScenesRoss: Of course it is. Yeah, come on in. Ooh-ooh, go by the window you can pretend to be surfing. (He pretends he's surfing by the window.)ScenesJoey: But I counted, you're not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering again.]
rows.Content: Joey: Ugh!!ScenesMonica: What happened?ScenesJoey: I ended up at Ross's place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something. (Looks out the window.) Damn! She's not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his 'Watching TV' bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on his remote.)ScenesMonica: No Joey, I think he's just watchin' TV.Scenes(It's only when the camera cuts to Ross's apartment that we see that the TV is turned off and Ross is indeed doing a bit. He then tries to hide his smirk.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, later that day, Gary is kissing Phoebe good-bye.]
rows.Content: Gary's Radio: We've lost visual contact with the suspect.ScenesGary: Okay, now I've really have to go!ScenesPhoebe: But it's just so unfair that our date has to get cut short just 'cause some guy shot at a store clerk.ScenesGary: I know, but it's my job, sweethart!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, then maybe I can come too!ScenesGary's Radio: Suspect has just emerged naked from the sewer.ScenesPhoebe: All right, you go. (They kiss.)ScenesGary: Bye-bye.ScenesPhoebe: 'Kay, bye!Scenes(Gary closes the door behind him.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh God!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Oh I just miss him so much!ScenesMonica: Wow! For just a week you guys are really close, huh?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, it's weird. I can't help it though he's so sweet, he's like this little puppy dog, y'know? But like a really tough one that shots bad guys. Ohh, I just love beginning parts of relationships, y'know?! You just like can't keep your hands off each other.ScenesMonica: I know it is the best.ScenesPhoebe: So-so how long did that last for you and Chandler?ScenesMonica: What? It's still going on.ScenesPhoebe: Come on, seriously! When did it end?ScenesMonica: I-I am serious, I mean, we're, we're all over each other all the time.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, you know where you are better than I do. I was just curious.ScenesMonica: (Start annoying hyper-competitive mode now.) (Jumping up) What don't you just calm down Phoebe! All right?! Why don’t you just get all your facts before you run around telling everybody that you're the only hot couple!!ScenesPhoebe: (Under her breath) God, I woke the beast. Sorry. (To Monica) I was wrong obviously, I just—I misspoke. It's okay.ScenesMonica: Oh no, it is okay, I mean as long as you know that Chandler and I are also very hot and fiery, just as hot as you! I mean our flame, whew, is on fire!ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey Monica, here's your broom back.ScenesMonica: You are so cute. (She goes over and kisses him passionately.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next day, Chandler and Joey are there as Rachel returns from her interview.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh hey, how'd the interview go?ScenesRachel: Ugh, horrible! I did the stupidest, most embarrassing thing!ScenesJoey: Did you tell the guy you wanted to have sex with his wife and then fall right out of your chair?ScenesRachel: No!ScenesChandler: So what happened?ScenesRachel: Ugh, it was horrible! And-and the interview part went so well, y'know? I even made him laugh. He said something about a boat and I was like, "Well, yeah! If you've got enough life jackets!" (She starts laughing; Chandler and Joey are not amused.) Trust me, it was actually, it was very funny. Anyway, so we were saying good-bye and ugh!ScenesJoey: What happened?ScenesRachel: (We see a flashback as Rachel describes what happened.) All right, we were shaking hands and he kinda leaned toward me… Y'know maybe he was going to open the door, but I totally miss read him and I uhhh… (The flashback shows that she kissed him on the cheek.)ScenesJoey: You kissed him?!ScenesRachel: Well, I didn't know what else to do!ScenesChandler: Well you coulda tried, not kissing him.ScenesRachel: Thanks Chandler.ScenesMonica: (entering from the bathroom) Hey Rach, a guy from Ralph Lauren called, you got a second interview!ScenesRachel: I can't believe it! I got a second interview!ScenesMonica: Yes!ScenesJoey: I bet that kiss isn't looking like such a big mistake now, is it?ScenesRachel: What-what, wait a minute, you don't think that's why he wants me back?ScenesJoey: Yeah! (Chandler makes a noise) No?ScenesMonica: A kiss? What are you talking about?ScenesRachel: I accidentally kissed him in the interview, and now he wants me back y'know of course, 'cause "Let's bring the girl back who kisses everybody!ScenesChandler: Come on, Rach.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! What if he thinks I'm the kind of girl that-that would just sleep with him?ScenesMonica: He probably wants you back because you're right for the job.ScenesRachel: Maybe. I-I don't know—Oh God, how could I be so stupid?!ScenesJoey: Oh Rachel look, don't say that, I think you just need a hug from Joey. Come on. Come on. (She hugs him and Joey looks out the window.) She's back! Hot girl's back!ScenesRachel: Ohh, well I'm not totally back yet, but thank you.ScenesJoey: No, in Ross's building! (He throws Rachel onto the chair and heads to the window.) She's back! She's back! (Pantomimes) Okay, wait there, I'll be over in a second. (He counts where she is again.) Got it! (Runs out and does a little hot over a chair.)ScenesChandler: I gotta check out this hot girl! (He heads to the window but realizes something, stops, turns and points at Monica.) There she is! (He dances over to her and kisses her.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's building, Joey is knocking on a door again. It's again answered by Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: Damnit!! Did you move?!ScenesRoss: Yes. I lived with you guys for a while and then I found this place. (Joey just stares at him) I'm Ross.Scenes(Joey makes a frustrated face and noise and walks away. He knocks on the next door and it's answered by an old man.)ScenesThe Old Man: Yes?ScenesJoey: (Looking around) Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?ScenesThe Old Man: No. I'm all alone.ScenesJoey: Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or babysitter by any chance a hot girl?ScenesThe Little Girl: Daddy!!ScenesJoey: Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!

rows.Scenes: Rachel's job interview, she is waiting outside Mr. Zelner's (the interviewer) office banging her pen between her teeth.]
rows.Content: Mr. Zelner: Hi Rachel!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMr. Zelner: Come on in.Scenes(They go inside.)ScenesMr. Zelner: It's really nice to see you again.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesMr. Zelner: (Sees that she has some ink on her lip from her pen.) Oh Rachel, uhh… (He points to his lip to get her to notice the ink on hers.)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMr. Zelner: Just ah… (He points again.)ScenesRachel: Excuse me?ScenesMr. Zelner: Here let me… (He goes to wipe it off himself.)ScenesRachel: (stopping him) Wh-whoa! All right, okay-okay, I see, I see what's going on here! Now listen, look-look, I'm sorry if I gave you the wrong impression, but I am not some hussy who will just sleep around to get ahead! Now even though I (He tries to interrupt and tell her about the ink), hey-hey-hey, even though I kissed you, that does not give you the right to demand sex from me. I do not want, this job that bad. Good day, sir. (She storms out of his office.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning from her interview attempt.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Ugh, you will not believe what that sleaze-ball from Ralph Lauren did too me!Scenes(Joey, Monica, and Ross all point to their lips to get Rachel to once again notice the ink on her lip.)ScenesRachel: Okay-okay that-that's amazing. How did you know that?ScenesRoss: You got ink on your lip.ScenesRachel: Oh. (Realizes.) Ohhhhhhhhh….

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Gary and Chandler and Monica are all there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (To Gary) So what do you say, maybe sometime I hold your gun?ScenesGary: I don't know man, we're really not supposed to do that.ScenesChandler: Oh, what can happen? I mean, would you… (He gestures and spills some of his coffee.)ScenesGary: Yeah, I'm gonna say no.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, do you want to go see a movie after dinner tonight?ScenesPhoebe: Oh we can't, we already have plans.ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Well, same thing we did all day, hang out at Gary's apartment. He is so amazing, we never left the bedroom. But have fun at the movie.ScenesMonica: (That annoying competitiveness thing kicks in again, what the heck is that with her and why must the writers show it every flippin' episode?!) Oh, we're not seeing a movie!ScenesPhoebe: You're not? Then why did you ask us if we wanted to go?ScenesMonica: Oh umm, that's because I just wanted to y'know walk in on me and Chandler while we were, y'know, doing it all night. Will you excuse me for just a second?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Okay. (She gets up and walks over to Chandler.) Chandler? Can I see you for a second?ScenesChandler: Uh, yeah.ScenesMonica: Okay. (They walk away to get some privacy.) We have got to beat them! {Here we go yet again.}ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesMonica: 'Cause, Gary and Phoebe think they're a hotter couple than we are!ScenesChandler: Ohh, so?ScenesMonica: So! So we've got to go upstairs and have a lot of sex to prove them wrong!ScenesChandler: Monica, you have got to stop this competitive thing! Okay? It's crazy. {Finally! The voice of reason.} I mean, just impress Gary and Phoebe we have to go upstairs and have sex over and over and I'm saying no to this, why? Get your coat.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The lobby in Ross's building, we see a flyer that is on the bulletin board that reads, "Are you the Hot Girl who waved at me? If so, give me a call!" and it's signed, Joey 629-9*** (The last couple of numbers have been ripped off). Anyhoo, Ross is getting his mail.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to the woman checking her mail next to him) Hey!Scenes(A man walks up.)ScenesThe Man: (To Ross) Excuse me. (He puts up a flyer that has a sketch drawing of Joey and it reads, "Warning! Intruder! If you see this creep - call the cops!") You should check this out, tell the other tenants. Apparently he's running around looking for some kind of a hot girl.ScenesRoss: (to the woman checking her mail) Who isn't?Scenes(For the first time we see that the woman Ross is talking too is in fact the hot girl that Joey is looking for. She just kinda stares at him.)ScenesRoss: I don't, I don't think we've meet. I-I'm Ross.ScenesThe Hot Girl: I know. You're the guy who wouldn't chip in for the handyman.ScenesRoss: Nevermind! (Goes back to his mailbox.)ScenesThe Hot Girl: No, I-I actually thought it was unfair the way everyone reacted. I mean you had just moved in.ScenesRoss: I had just moved in. Thank you! Listen umm…ScenesThe Hot Girl: Jen.ScenesRoss: Jen, I know this may sound a little…(makes some kind of crazy noise) But uh, would you maybe wanna grab a cup of coffee sometime, or…ScenesJen: Sure! That would be nice.ScenesRoss: Umm?ScenesJen: Oh! My number is on there. (Hands him a business card.) Give me a call.ScenesRoss: I will give you a call.ScenesJen: I'll see you later. (Starts to walk away.)ScenesRoss: Okay!Scenes(After she's left, Ross gets really happy and starts kissing the card. Suddenly, she returns.)ScenesJen: I forgot my paper. (Ross quickly hides the card in his mouth.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, a post-coital Monica and Chandler are recovering on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: That was amazing!ScenesMonica: Phoebe and Gary are so gonna hear about this at dinner.ScenesChandler: That was amazing.ScenesMonica: We are the hottest! Huh? No one is hotter than we are! You're the best.ScenesChandler: No, you're the best.ScenesMonica: No, you're the best.ScenesChandler: No, you're the best.ScenesMonica: I am the best.Scenes(Just as they start to get up, Joey walks in.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What 'cha been doin'? (Has a silly grin.)ScenesMonica: (looking out the window) Hey Joey! Isn't that the girl that waved at you the other day?ScenesJoey: I don't know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.) Yeah, yeah, that's her. But y'know what? Doesn't matter, I'm never gonna get to meet her anyway.ScenesMonica: Why?ScenesJoey: Because it's impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of hot girl parallel universe, or something.ScenesMonica: What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!ScenesJoey: No. No. No. She lives on the third floor, eighth apartment from the left.ScenesMonica: No, those first two windows, (Points) that's the lobby. And y'know the other one over there, that's the stairway. You've been counting wrong.ScenesJoey: I did not know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can't believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.

rows.Scenes: Jen's apartment, Ross is picking her up for their date.]
rows.Content: Ross: So uhh, you ready?ScenesJen: Sure, I'll just get my coat. (There's a knock on the door.) Could you get that?ScenesRoss: Sure. (He opens the door to Joey. Needless to say, Joey's stunned.) Joey…ScenesJoey: Dahhhhh!! (Ross has a puzzled look on his face.) No! Noooo!! (Storms off.)

rows.Scenes: Mr. Zelner's office, Rachel has come back again to try and do that second interview.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ah, first, I-I would like to say thank you for agreeing to see me again.ScenesMr. Zelner: That's quite all right, but I feel obligated to tell you that this meeting is being videotaped.ScenesRachel: (looks around for the camera) Okay. Umm, well, first I would like to start by apologizing for kissing you and uh, for yelling at you.ScenesMr. Zelner: Fair enough.ScenesRachel: Now you're probably going to hire one of the people who did not ah, (She puts her hands on his desk blotter and he moves it. Rachel then doesn't know where to put her hands.) who did, who did not umm, yell at you and storm out, and I think that's a big mistake and here's why. I made a huge fool of myself and I came back, that shows courage. When I thought you wanted sex in exchange for this job, I said no. That shows integrity. And, I was not afraid to stand up for myself and that shows courage. (Suddenly realizes that she said courage twice.) Okay umm, now I know I already said courage, but y'know you gotta have courage. And umm, and finally when I thought you were making sexual advances in the workplace, I said no and I was not litigious. {By the way, litigious means to want to litigate and litigate is to make a lawsuit against.  So she didn't want to sue him.   Don't worry, I had to look it up too.} So there you go, you got, you got (counts them off with her fingers) courage, you got integrity, you got (Pause) courage again, and not litigious. Look Mr…ScenesMr. Zelner: Zelner.ScenesRachel: Zelner! Right! I knew that! I really, really want this job and I think, I think I would be really good at it.ScenesMr. Zelner: Y'know what? I may regret this but uh, I'm going to give you a shot.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh! You are?ScenesMr. Zelner: Um-hmm.ScenesRachel: Really? Oh thank you! Oh… Oh, would it be completely inappropriate to give you a hug?ScenesMr. Zelner: Yes!ScenesRachel: Okay, well then how about a handshake? (She goes to shake his hand but misses and touches his groin.) Oh God I'm sorry! Oh God, I'm sorry! I did not mean to touch that—I mean you there. There. Uhh, okay, so thank-thank you, I'm going to leave now thank you very much uh-huh, thank you so—Hey! I'll see you Monday! (Exits.)

rows.Scenes: A restaurant, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Gary are on a double date. Chandler is yawning.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: You tired Chandler?ScenesMonica: You better believe he's tired, after the day we had! If you know what I mean. You know what I mean?ScenesChandler: Honey, the tortilla chips know what you mean.ScenesGary: So uh Chandler, you like that badge I got you?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, it's so cool. (He opens his coat and has it pinned to the lining.) Now I gotta go, Officer Bing has gotta, 10-100. (Pause, softly) That's pee-pee. (Heads for the bathroom.)ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you have a, a twig in your hair.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, (laughs) umm, we kinda took a little detour on the way over here.ScenesGary: Yeah, we took a little stroll in the park and no one was around, so…ScenesMonica: You didn't!ScenesPhoebe: We did! We violated Section 12 Paragraph 7 of the criminal code!ScenesMonica: The park huh? A public place.ScenesGary: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: I hear ya. Excuse me for just a second! (Gets up and heads for the bathroom as that annoying Gotta-win-at-all-costs-super-competitive thing kicks in again.)Scenes[Cut to the Men's room. Chandler is practicing flashing his badge as Monica enters.]ScenesMonica: Hi Chandler.ScenesChandler: Monica! This is the Men's room! (Pause) Isn't it?ScenesMonica: Yes it is. You see I've always found the men's bathroom very sexual. Haven't you?ScenesChandler: No. And if I did, I don't think we'd be going out. Monica, this is getting ridiculous!ScenesMonica: Come on, we can't let them win!ScenesChandler: Ugh, we have already proved that we are hot! Okay? So why-why are you getting so obsessed about this thing?!ScenesMonica: Because Phoebe and Gary are in that-can't-keep-their-hands-off-each-other-doing-it-in-the-park phase!ScenesChandler: (gasps) So?ScenesMonica: I feel really sad that we're not…really there anymore.ScenesChandler: Oh wow! Is that what this all have been about?ScenesMonica: Wasn't it a lot more exciting when we were y'know all over each other all the time?ScenesChandler: Yeah that was great. That was really great! But to tell you the truth, I'm more excited about where we are right now.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! I've never been in a relationship that's lasted this long before. Y'know to get past the beginning and still be around each other all the time, I think that's pretty incredible. And the fact that this is happening all with you, yeah I think that's pretty exciting. (Kisses her.)ScenesMonica: That is so sweet. I know that I was acting a little crazy but umm, I feel the same way.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Yeah. (They hug.)ScenesChandler: Y'know what I just realized? You just freaked out about our relationship.ScenesMonica: Did not.ScenesChandler: Yes you did! Admit it! You freaked out!ScenesMonica: Okay, I freaked out a little.ScenesChandler: Little?! You freaked out big time! Okay? And I fixed it! We have switched places! I am the relationship and king and you are the crazy, irrational screw up! (Does a dance of joy.) (Monica glares at him.) And now we're back.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Looking through Ross's window, he's doing more pantomimes. The first one is he's walking a dog that has stopped, then suddenly tugs him forward.]
rows.Content: [Cut to the inside of Monica and Rachel's apartment, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.]ScenesRachel: (laughs) I cannot believe Ross is buying this!ScenesMonica: Thank God! I can't watch him anymore!ScenesChandler: (entering) You guys ready fore the movies?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Oh by the way, thank you for loaning us Pamela and Yasmine.Scenes(We see through the big window from the outside and see that Monica and Rachel have pictures of their faces pasted onto cardboard cutouts of Pamela Anderson and Yasmine Bleeth wearing their Baywatch swimsuits.)ScenesRoss: (from his apartment) Man! They cannot get enough! (Makes like he's a robot and waves at the cutouts.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One Where Rachel SmokesScenesWritten by: Michael CurtisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Joey is holding a deck of cards out to Chandler.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, pick a card.ScenesChandler: Okay. (He picks the 9 of Spades)ScenesJoey: All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?ScenesChandler: Oh yes.ScenesJoey: (holding up the Queen of Clubs) Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)ScenesChandler: (pause) Yes.Scenes(Joey laughs then realizes the trick didn't work when Chandler hands him his card back.)ScenesCarol: (entering with Ben and Ross) Hey guys!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesChandler: Hi there!ScenesBen: Hi!!ScenesCarol: Guess what? Ben is going to be in a TV commercial!ScenesPhoebe: What are you talking about?!ScenesRoss: (sets Ben down) Well, it's not for sure but umm, we met this guy in the park who thought Ben was really cute--y'know, which he is--so umm anyhoo, he uh, he gave us his card and told us to bring him down for this commercial he's auditioning.ScenesJoey: (reading the card) Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! (Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I've been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.ScenesRoss: I know, it's crazy! We were just pushing Ben on the swings…ScenesJoey: I'm always on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!ScenesChandler: That.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is eating breakfast, Ross is heading for the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering from her room) Okay, gotta go! Wish me luck!ScenesJoey: Luck!ScenesChandler: Hey Rach, now that you're working at Ralph Lauren, can you bring me back some of those polo shirts?ScenesRachel: Uh well, y'know what? I don't think if I feel comfortable stealing on my very first day…ScenesChandler: Unwilling to steal from work, interesting.ScenesMonica: Besides, if anybody's gonna get free stuff, it's gonna be me.ScenesRachel: Okay guys, way to wish me luck!ScenesAll: Good luck! Go get 'em! (Rachel exits.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, let's discuss Rachel's birthday. I say we throw a surprise party this weekend.ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn't like for another month.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah but if we throw her a party on her birthday, then it's not a surprise.ScenesMonica: I think it's a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just invite her close friends.ScenesJoey: Ross!! We're having a surprise party for Rachel!!ScenesRoss: (from the bathroom) Okay!!ScenesJoey: Done.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, great so do you want to do it together?ScenesMonica: I would love to do it together!Scenes(Joey starts to giggle.)ScenesJoey: They're gonna do it together.ScenesChandler: Dude! That's my girlfriend!ScenesJoey: What, so I gotta shut it down now?ScenesRoss: All right, I gotta take off. I'm picking up Ben then we're off to the big audition.ScenesMonica: It's gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben's dad.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Weirder than watching his two moms make out? (Monica nods in agreement.)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa dad? There's a dad in the commercial?ScenesRoss: Yeah the dad and Ben eat soup and pretend to enjoy it.ScenesJoey: Whoa, hey, maybe I'll go down there with ya and see if I can get an audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben's father than his godfather.ScenesRoss: You're not his godfather.ScenesJoey: What?! Are you kidding?!ScenesRoss: (Pause) Of course I am! (Joey is relieved) Okay, let's go godfather.ScenesJoey: All right!Scenes(As they walk out he motions to Chandler that he is still Ben's godfather.)

rows.Scenes: Ben's audition, Carol, Ross, and Ben along with about 10 more families are in a waiting room as Joey enters happily.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! I'm in, they're gonna let me audition!ScenesRoss: Really? That's great!ScenesJoey: I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her…ScenesCarol: (noticing a kid who has picked up a copy of Variety to read) Hey, that kid looks familiar.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, yeah! He's done tons of commercials. I've seen him in like Sugar Smacks, Playstation, and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad….ScenesRoss: Yeah well, he's not gonna get this one. Ben is way cuter than that kid. I mean look at him, look at you, (Starts to whine like a baby and Joey just glares at him.)ScenesJoey: That's great. Listen, wouldn't it be great though if I got to play Ben's dad?ScenesRoss: Joey, you look nothing like Ben.ScenesJoey: I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)ScenesCarol: Y'know, I don't really know you well enough for you to do that.

rows.Scenes: Rachel's new job, she's in her new boss's office (Kim's) and with the other assistant (Nancy). Together they're deciding what clothes to buy or something, who knows, let's all watch/read to find out.]
rows.Content: Kim: So it's down to these two, Nancy I know you like this one and I think I agree. Rachel, what do you think?ScenesRachel: Well umm, that one is pretty but uh, I just, I just love this fabric (On the other one.) Sorry.ScenesKim: Oh don't be sorry, that's part of your job here to give your opinions and then I take credit for them--I'm kidding.ScenesNancy: She is kidding, but don't ever disagree with her again. Okay, now I'm kidding!ScenesRachel: (laughing nervously) Oh, what a fun office.ScenesKim: I don't know which one, but I do know I need a cigarette. So what do you say we take a break, we go outside, and we'll figure this out when we come back?Scenes(They all get up to leave.)ScenesKim: (at the door) Rachel? Do you smoke?ScenesRachel: Oh no, my dad's a doctor and he would always tell me just horror stories…(stops and tries to change directions)…about ghosts and goblins who totally supported the princess's right to smoke.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is telling Chandler and Monica about her day.]
rows.Content: Rachel: …and then they came back from smoking and they had made all of the decisions without me!ScenesMonica: That doesn't seem fair.ScenesRachel: I know! It's like I'm being punished for not having this disgusting, poisoning habit!ScenesChandler: Yeah, it is the best.ScenesRachel: I mean what if this keeps happening? Y'know, they'll-they'll be outside smoking, making all the decisions and I'll just be up in my office breathing my stupid clean air, y'know? And then when the day comes when Kim wants to promote one of us, who do you think she's gonna pick? Me or Smokey Smokerson?ScenesMonica: Rachel, you can go down there, you don't have to smoke. Just say you wanna get some fresh air.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I can do that.ScenesChandler: Yeah, or you can do the easy thing and smoke.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey Rach, you wanna get some coffee?ScenesRachel: I would love to!ScenesPhoebe: Oh good!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I wanna go to babe.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good.Scenes(They all start out.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait, I change my mind! (She slams the door on them.) Okay, let's talk about the party! I have so many ideas! (Holds up a cocktail napkin.)ScenesMonica: Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, look at that.ScenesMonica: All right, that's a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus, umm y'know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music, here's an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I've highlighted the ones that would go really good with the food.ScenesPhoebe: What happened to the intimate dinner party?ScenesMonica: Oh, we're not doing that. Okay…ScenesPhoebe: So wow, it looks like you took care of everything. Thanks a lot, co-host.ScenesMonica: What?! I didn't take care of everything, there's-there's plenty of things for you to do!ScenesPhoebe: Like what?ScenesMonica: (Thinks) Cups.ScenesPhoebe: Cups? You're giving me cups?ScenesMonica: And ice!ScenesPhoebe: Cups and ice? Ooh, I get to be in charge of cups and ice? (Thinks of something) All right. Fine, okay, I will be in charge of cups and ice!ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant…ScenesPhoebe: I got it! Mine!ScenesRoss: (entering, downtrodden) Hi.ScenesMonica: Hey! How'd the audition go?!ScenesRoss: Not so good.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's (sadly) "Audition didn't go so well. (Happily) Yeah it did?ScenesRoss: (Pause) Yeah I am! Yeah, Ben got a second audition!ScenesJoey: (also downtrodden) Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn't get a callback.ScenesMonica: You got a callback too didn't you?ScenesJoey: (Happily) Yeah I did!

rows.Scenes: The smoker's balcony, Rachel is out to join Kim and Nancy.]
rows.Content: Kim: Hey Rachel, what are you doing out here?ScenesRachel: Oh well, it's kinda lonely up there, so I just thought I would come out here and get some fresh air.ScenesKim: Nancy and I were talking about the fall collection.ScenesRachel: Oh great!ScenesKim: So anyway we really… (Someone exhales and Rachel turns and coughs.) Honey, we're just smoking all over you.ScenesNancy: Oh, sorry!ScenesRachel: Oh that's okay.ScenesKim: No-no-no, we'll move you just stay right there. (They walk away.)ScenesNancy: So anyway I sent the designs over to Ralph and he's very excited about the line.ScenesKim: Oh that's great! You are the best!Scenes(Rachel gets fed up and heads over to another smoker.)ScenesRachel: Excuse me, can I, can I bum one of those? (He holds up his pack.) Y'know what, actually… (She takes the one he's smoking and heads over to where Nancy and Kim are standing and laughing.) Okay, okay, okay, what's so funny over here?ScenesNancy: I thought you didn't smoke.ScenesRachel: Oh, I thought you guys meant marijuana cigarettes, y'know? Y'know what I mean, like dubbies? And I actually, I thought to myself, "Wow, those guys are crazy!" But no, I actually smoke the regular ones all, all the time.ScenesKim: We get high.ScenesRachel: Oh, me too.ScenesKim: I'm kidding.ScenesRachel: (Laughs) Oh, me too.

rows.Scenes: Ben and Joey's (Isn't that an ice cream??) callback.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh God, this is so nerve wracking! How-how do you do this?ScenesJoey: Well, unfortunately, I don't get many callbacks so…ScenesCarol: Is it a good sign that they asked us to hang around after the audition?ScenesJoey: Who knows?ScenesThe Casting Director: (entering) Okay uh, we have narrowed it down to Raymond, Ben, Kyle, and Joey. The rest of you, thank you very much.ScenesRoss: Yes!! I knew it!! (To the people who didn't make it.) Bye-bye! So long! Later!ScenesJoey: Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben's dad!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesThe Casting Director: Actually, that can't happen. Yeah because you all have such different looks, we're putting you with Raymond and Kyle with Ben. So it'll be either you two (Points to Joey and Raymond) or you two. (Points to Kyle and Ben.) (Exits.)ScenesJoey: Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.ScenesRoss: Yeah, it is.ScenesKyle: Yeah. It's gonna be weird.ScenesRoss: No, we-we're gonna be like best friends, that's why it's gonna be weird.ScenesKyle: Oh, oh, I thought we were just talking.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are talking.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering, carrying two garbage bags) Hey!ScenesRoss and Chandler: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Is it okay if I leave this stuff here 'til Rachel's birthday party?ScenesChandler: Ah sure. What's in 'em?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, cups.ScenesChandler: Oh good, because uh we got Rachel 800 gallons of water.ScenesRoss: Seriously that's a lot of cups.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, that's 'cause Monica put me in charge of cups and ice, and Monica is gonna rue the day that she put me in charge of cups and ice.ScenesChandler: Y'know I rued the day once…didn't get a whole lot else done.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, time to bring up the rest of the cups. (She goes and opens the door to Joey.) Oh, hi Joey!ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Ross good, I'm uh glad you're here. I wanna talk to you about something.ScenesRoss: What's up?ScenesJoey: Well, I've been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y'know me going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can't lead to anything good. So, I think I'm just gonna step aside. I'm gonna tell them that I won't audition.ScenesRoss: Wow, uh, Joey that's-that's great. Thanks man.ScenesJoey: That's it? You're-you're gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career we're talking about here!ScenesRoss: Well, you just…ScenesJoey: I just said that so you wouldn't let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone should step aside it should be Ben!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesJoey: What? Chandler! Tell 'em!ScenesChandler: (shocked) Well I mean, let me get the door first. (Goes and opens the door.) Oh, hi! No one. (Exits.)ScenesRoss: Why should Ben step aside? It was his audition in the first place! You-you just tagged along! You're like the uh, tag-a-long dad.ScenesJoey: At least I care about his feelings!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesJoey: Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesn’t get it?ScenesRoss: And why wouldn't he get it?ScenesJoey: Oh, come on! Have you seen what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!ScenesRoss: Are you saying your kid eats soup better than my kid?ScenesJoey: You just give him a spoon baby!ScenesRoss: Oh yeah? I guess we'll just see!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!ScenesRoss: You're kid's name is Raymond!ScenesJoey: Yeah?! So's yours!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: (To Rachel) How did work go?ScenesRachel: Oh it was great! It was great! I went down there just like you said, y'know? And we talked business. Kim totally took my opinions.ScenesMonica: You stink!ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesMonica: No, I'm-I'm serious!ScenesRachel: Well-well that's 'cause I went down there and they were all smoking. This is actually the smell of success.ScenesChandler: Okay, there's something different though--Oh my God! You smoked!ScenesRachel: I did not!ScenesChandler: Yes you did! You look happy and sick; you smoked!ScenesRachel: All right, fine! But I had too! I had to do it for my career!ScenesChandler: I wish I had smoked for my career…ScenesMonica: That's so gross!ScenesRachel: No well, no it's not that bad, y'know? I mean yeah, my tongue feels a little fuzzy and these fingers sort of smell, I actually feel like I can throw up.ScenesChandler: Okay, but you gotta push past this because it is about to get so good!ScenesMonica: Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm not kidding. (She's not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)ScenesChandler: I think you smell great! (He sniffs her shoulder.)

rows.Scenes: The smoker's balcony, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are all puffing away on their cancer sticks.]
rows.Content: Kim: So, we're decided, no on plaid, yes on pink?ScenesNancy: Absolutely!ScenesRachel: I am so on board! (She throws away her recently lit cigarette.)ScenesKim: Rachel didn't you just light that?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I did, but y'know what? I am really, really trying to cut back, y'know? (Laughs) Good luck, Rach.ScenesNancy: I've actually been thinking about quitting lately.ScenesKim: Oh sure, every Sunday night I'm telling myself I'm quitting but every Monday morning it's like (Mimics chain smoking.)ScenesNancy: Tell me about it!ScenesRachel: Well then let's just quit! We'll just quit! Let's all quit!ScenesKim: It does sound appealing.ScenesNancy: Oh, I never could do it.ScenesRachel: Oh but you could. You can. Absolutely! We can help each other out! We can get--what are those--those patches! We could be like the Patch Sisters!ScenesKim: Oh y'know, we really should quit. Okay, let's quit!ScenesRachel: Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it! (She grabs their cigarettes and lighters and throws them in the trash.)ScenesKim: My late husband gave me that lighter. (Rachel laughs.) I'm not kidding.ScenesRachel: Okay then! (She starts rummaging through the trash to find Kim's lighter.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Ben's audition, Joey is rehearsing his lines, uh correction, Joey is rehearsing his line.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) Hmm soup! (Tries again, with a little caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!ScenesCarol: Joey, Ross is gonna be here any second, would you mind watching Ben for me while I use the ladies' room?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, no problem.ScenesCarol: Thanks. (Exits.)ScenesJoey: (goes over to Ben) Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. No stability. One day you're Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.ScenesRoss: (entering, angrily) Joey!ScenesJoey: (angrily) Ross!ScenesRoss: (angrily) Ben! (Pause.) (Happily.) I mean, Ben! Ben!ScenesThe Casting Director: (entering) Okay, Raymond, Joey you're up.Scenes(Raymond and Joey go in the office.)ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesThe Casting Director: Okay, uh well, let's try one. Whenever you guys are ready. (Some dude puts down a couple bowls of soup in front of them.)ScenesJoey: Uh-oh.ScenesThe Casting Director: Is there a problem?ScenesJoey: Well this is noodle soup and uh, I've been working with tomato. But that's okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.ScenesThe Casting Director: Y'know, that's-that's fine, but the line is, "Hmm, soup.ScenesJoey: Oh, what did I say?ScenesThe Casting Director: Hmm, noodle soup.ScenesJoey: How's that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!ScenesThe Casting Director: All right, let's try one.Scenes(Raymond and Joey both eat a spoonful and Joey turns to Raymond and says…)ScenesJoey: Hmm, noodle soup.ScenesThe Casting Director: Okay. Let's do it again.ScenesJoey: Okay.Scenes(They do it again.)ScenesJoey: Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!ScenesRaymond: COME ON!!!!ScenesThe Casting Director: Y'know what? We need to move on.ScenesJoey: No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful) Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are cheating and are caught by Rachel.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey! Hey-hey-hey!!ScenesKim: Uh-oh, busted!ScenesRachel: Come on you guys! What are doing?! I thought we were the patch sisters!ScenesKim: Yeah. That didn't work out.ScenesNancy: Rachel we tried to quit, but it was too hard!ScenesRachel: Well y'know if you, if you started smoking again you could've at least told me! Come on, give me one of those! What are we talking about?ScenesKim: No. No! You're doing great! Don’t you give up! That's why we didn't tell you and we're not gonna drag you down with us.ScenesRachel: Oh wait, no-no-no! Drag me down. Drag-drag me down.ScenesKim: Forget it Rachel! We're both so proud of how well you're doing. I'm not gonna let you blow it. In fact, if I catch you with a cigarette, you're fired. So go on, get out of here! Go on, I don't want you breathing this stuff! Go on!ScenesRachel: Okay. (Starts to walk away.)ScenesKim: (to Nancy) So, okay! So you'll come with me on the Paris trip.ScenesRachel: (hearing that) Oh man!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel's surprise party. The apartment is festooned with cups. There are cups everywhere! Cup centerpiece, cup garland, etc., etc]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (To Chandler) Check it out! Cup hat! (Points to her hat.) Cup banner! Cup chandelier! And the thing that started it all, the cup!
