(Holds up one.)ScenesChandler: Great job with the cups, Pheebs!ScenesMonica: (overhearing that) Why don't you just go out with her!Scenes(Chandler starts to follow her into the kitchen.)ScenesPhoebe: (following him) And did you notice the ice? (Gestures to 3 huge buckets of ice on the table.) Look! We have it all! We have crushed! Cubed! And dry! Watch! (Pours some water onto the dry ice, causing it to evaporate/smoke.) Ahhh! Mystical!ScenesChandler: Awesome!ScenesMonica: Chandler! Everyone--no one's eating my Tuscan finger food 'cause they're all filling up on Phoebe's snow cones!ScenesChandler: There are snow cones! (Monica glares at him.) Snow cones! Yuck!ScenesMonica: Y'know…go! Go! Right there! (Points)ScenesChandler: Thank you! Thank you! (Runs to the snow cone machine.)Scenes(Rachel enters.)ScenesPhoebe: (noticing her) Oh, look! Look! Look!ScenesAll: Surprise!!ScenesRachel: What?! What?! My birthday's not for another month!ScenesMonica: That's the surprise!ScenesRachel: Oh my God! You guys this is so great! I mean it's so unexpected! I mean Chandler's birthday is even before mine!Scenes(Everyone stops and looks at Chandler, who's nodding.)ScenesAll: Surprise!ScenesRachel: Wow! This is great! Look at all these cups! This is so weird.ScenesPhoebe: I was in charge of cups.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay, not so weird.Scenes[Cut to another part of the room, Ross is going to talk to Joey.]ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesRoss: Listen man, uh, I'm sorry the audition didn't go so well.ScenesJoey: Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)ScenesRoss: No really, I-I am! I feel bad!ScenesJoey: Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, "Hmm, noodle soup." (Nods his head in disgust.)ScenesRoss: Yeah y'know what? Maybe-maybe you didn't mess up your audition because you suck, maybe you messed up because you care more about uh, your godson.ScenesJoey: What you do mean?ScenesRoss: I think, sub-consciously…ScenesJoey: Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.ScenesRoss: (pause) I think on some level, you-you sabotaged your own audition so that Ben would get the part.ScenesJoey: Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah. Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor…ScenesRoss: No!ScenesJoey: No, it's just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was more important to see him succeed.ScenesRoss: There you go. Thank you!ScenesJoey: Thank you! So, did-did he get it?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesJoey: Eh, what are you gonna do?ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are out smoking as Chandler sticks his head out the door.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (to Kim and Nancy) Oh, hi! Excuse me, is uh Rachel Green here? I was supposed to meet her for lunch.ScenesKim: Oh, she doesn't come down here any more. You can find her up on ten.ScenesChandler: Okay, great.Scenes(Kim exhales and Chandler stares at it longingly.)ScenesKim: (to Nancy) So we talked about the (Chandler sneaks closer to her cigarette) whole presentation yesterday at lunch (Closer) and he wondered if one person would be enough (Closer) to get a take on the trip (Still closer) and I said, "Yeah, absolutely!" (She's interrupted by Chandler who has reached his goal and takes a drag from her cancer stick.)ScenesChandler: I'll catch you guys later. (Exits.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One Where Ross Can't FlirtScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is getting ready for a date with Monica as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: Wow! You look nice. What's the occasion?ScenesChandler: Monica and I are celebrating our ten-month anniversary, we've got reservations at Ja George.ScenesRoss: Wow! How'd you get in there?ScenesChandler: Made a few calls, pulled some strings, and they agreed to seat us at 11:30 if we both had the chicken and didn't get desert.Scenes(There's a knock on the door and Chandler answers it. It's the pizza delivery girl.)ScenesDelivery Girl: Hi Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hey Caitlin! Somebody got a haircut.ScenesCaitlin: Ugh, I hate it! I look like an 8-year-old boy.ScenesChandler: Yeah, if that was true, gym class would've been a lot more interesting.ScenesCaitlin: It's uh, 27 dollars even.ScenesChandler: Oh, okay. (Hands her the money.) Here you go.Scenes(The duck starts quacking.)ScenesCaitlin: Hey, where's the chicken?ScenesChandler: Oh, he's in the back. The duck pissed him off, said that eggs came first.ScenesCaitlin: (laughs) Great. I'll see you later!ScenesChandler: Okay, bye!Scenes(He closes the door and turns to see Ross glaring at him.)ScenesRoss: What the hell was that?!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesRoss: The flirting! Aren't you supposed to be going out with, I don't know hmm, let's say my sister?!ScenesChandler: I was not flirting.ScenesRoss: It was totally flirting. "Somebody got a haircut (Makes some whiney, nasally noises.)ScenesChandler: Okay first of all, the impression, uncanny. And second, that was not flirting, that was just casual conversation between two people. That is all.ScenesRoss: Yeah, right.ScenesChandler: You wanna see flirting? I'll show you flirting. (Starts to move towards Ross.)ScenesRoss: (backing away) I'm good.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I am so proud of Joey, I can't believe he's going to be on Law & Order!ScenesPhoebe: I know. But don't you think that it should be called Order and Law?ScenesRachel: No because first they arrest the guy and then they try him.ScenesPhoebe: Don't get me started on that.Scenes(Ross and Chandler enter with the pizzas.)ScenesChandler: I was not flirting.ScenesRoss: And on your anniversary, for shame!ScenesRachel: What's going on?ScenesRoss: Chandler was hitting on the hot delivery girl!ScenesChandler: I was not and oh God, shh!ScenesRoss: Well I'm sorry but you were! Okay? And besides if anyone should be hitting on her it's the guy who's single, the guy that who-who-who can do something about it.ScenesPhoebe: Sounds like somebody wants to be Mr. Pizza Delivery Girl.ScenesRoss: Well…ScenesChandler: Is that what this is about? You like Caitlin?Scenes(Ross looks at Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Ross! We broke up two years ago; you've been married since then. I think it's okay that we see other people.ScenesRoss: Well, I-I was watching her the other day at the pizza place.ScenesRachel: Hm-mmm.ScenesRoss: And she's just so sexy and funny and has the cutest little…ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what? We don't need her measurements.ScenesPhoebe: (looking through the pizzas) Okay pepperoni, pepperoni, pepperoni, okay Ross, I know she's pretty and you love her, but is she stupid?! She forgot my vegetarian!ScenesRoss: This is perfect! She'll have to come back here with your pizza, and when she does, I'll turn on the Charm-O-Ross. Oh I'm so glad you don't eat meat.ScenesPhoebe: See? Vegetarianism benefits everyone.ScenesJoey: (entering, with his grandmother) Hey everybody, look who's here! You remember my grandmother!ScenesRachel: Big night!ScenesPhoebe: This is so cool!ScenesChandler: So, Joey on Law & Order, you must be very proud!ScenesJoey: Chandler, she doesn't understand a word of English.ScenesChandler: I'm sorry, I thought you were Joey's other grandmother. (She just stares at him.) I've done it again.ScenesJoey: She's my biggest fan. Yeah, she's the only one in the family that's believed in me.Scenes(They both start speaking Italian to each other, and since I'm not Italian and don't understand one word, we'll move on to the English portion of the show. Not, that I'm English. Not that there's anything wrong with that, it's just that I'm not. Y'know I think I should shut-up now and move on. Anyhoo, she says something about Joey being fat I think based on this line.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so…ScenesMonica: (entering from the bathroom) Hey! Happy Anniversary!ScenesChandler: Happy Anniversary, 10 months! (They kiss.)ScenesMonica: So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in London…ScenesChandler: Uhh, Joey's grandmother is right there. (Points)ScenesMonica: Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn't?ScenesChandler: The one that doesn't.ScenesMonica: That was some hot love you gave me! I'm gonna go get ready.ScenesChandler: Hey, why don't you wear those earrings I gave you?ScenesMonica: That's a great idea! I was saving them for something special.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: (runs over to Phoebe) You have got to go home!ScenesPhoebe: But I like it here!ScenesMonica: You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay? Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well I think that they're in my purse. Why don't you go get dressed and I'll look for them.ScenesMonica: Great!ScenesPhoebe: Okay! (Walks over to Rachel) Rach, hi, I need those earrings you borrowed.ScenesRachel: Oh, umm, okay, yeah, I'll be, yeah I'll be right back. (Goes to her room.)Scenes(Phoebe then gets possessed 'cause she starts speaking in tongues. She speaks Italian to Joey's grandmother. She is quickly exorcised and returns to speaking in English. Of course, too most people English is a strange language as well. But none of them are probably reading this and if they were they wouldn't understand it. So why am I talking about them? I have absolutely no clue. Moving on…)ScenesJoey: Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?ScenesPhoebe: I guess so. (See, the brief possession didn't affect her at all, like we could really tell.)ScenesRachel: (She enters and hands Phoebe the earring) Here you go. Thank you!ScenesPhoebe: Wait, Rach! Where's the other one?ScenesRachel: Oh what, you-you want both of them?ScenesPhoebe: Rachel Karen Green, where's the other earring?!ScenesRachel: Okay, okay, okay, look, just don't freak out, but I kinda lost it. I know it's in the apartment, but I definitely lost it.ScenesPhoebe: Well, what am I going to tell Monica? She wants to wear them tonight!ScenesRachel: Tell her to wear her own earrings.ScenesPhoebe: These are her earrings.ScenesRachel: Nooo! Nooooo! You lent me Monica's earrings?! I'm not allowed to borrow her stuff!ScenesPhoebe: Why not?ScenesRachel: Because I lose her stuff!Scenes[Time Lapse, the gang is now watching Law & Order. By the way, the entire rest of the episode takes place in Monica and Rachel's apartment. Why are they called apartments when they're all stuck together? Something to think about.]ScenesJoey: Okay, see that blind guy right there? I'm gonna bash his head in later.Scenes(His grandmother asks him something.)ScenesJoey: Oh umm, my big scene is coming up. Big scene coming up.ScenesChandler: If you said, "Big lima bean, bubbling up." Would she understand the difference?ScenesMonica: (noticing Rachel crawling behind the couch) Rach? What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Oh boy, I just can't watch. It's too scary!ScenesMonica: It's a diaper commercial.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah well, you know me, babies, responsibilities, ahhh!!!Scenes(There's a knock on the door.)ScenesCaitlin: Pizza delivery!ScenesRoss: I'll get it! I will get that! (Runs over and opens the door.)ScenesCaitlin: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesCaitlin: One uh, vegetarian pizza. That's $12.15.ScenesRoss: Oh. Uh, by the way, if it makes you feel any better. I happen to like 8-year-old boys.ScenesCaitlin: What?!ScenesRoss: (I can't make it out.) The uh, your hair, before, your hair, you said you thought your looks like an 8-year-old's, and I'm just saying I like it. The hair.ScenesCaitlin: Oh. Thanks.ScenesRoss: You understand I don't actually like 8-year-old boys.ScenesCaitlin: Y'know, all I'm looking for is the money.ScenesChandler: Here you go. (Hands her the money.) Now stop bringing us pizzas you.ScenesCaitlin: I'm gonna try. (Walks away and Ross closes the door.)ScenesChandler: You're welcome.ScenesRoss: You couldn't let me have her, could ya?!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesRoss: This is a girl that I really like and had too swoop in there!ScenesMonica: What's goin' on?ScenesRoss: Chandler was totally flirting with the hot delivery girl!ScenesChandler: Thank you for that! (To Monica) I was not flirting.ScenesMonica: It's okay. I don't care. It's uh, it's fine.ScenesRoss: Really?!ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesMonica: It's no big deal, I do it all the time.ScenesChandler: (starts to laugh, but then gets serious) So umm, you-you flirt with guys all the time?ScenesMonica: Sure! It doesn't mean anything! Just like I know it doesn't mean anything with you!ScenesChandler: Okay, but there is a big difference. You are a lot hotter than I am.ScenesJoey: (walking past) True story! (Goes and sits down.)ScenesMonica: Chandler, this actually bothers you?ScenesChandler: Yes, it does bother me! And I think it would bother a lot of people. Rachel, when you were going out with Ross, did it bother you when he flirted with other women?ScenesRachel: Uhh, no, no, it bothered me when he slept with other women.ScenesRoss: And thank you, for that.ScenesRachel: But y'know, I never really had anything to worry about. Ross was never very good at the flirting thing.ScenesRoss: What? (Mumbles) What-what, what are talking about? It-it worked with you.ScenesRachel: Oh! Y'know what? You're right! We meet, you flirted and then bamn nine years later you had me!ScenesRoss: All right, all right. You-you-you know what I'm going to do? I am going to order another pizza and when Caitlin gets here, you-you--I will show how well I flirt. Yeah! I will, I will get her phone number! (To Chandler) And not the one on the menu!ScenesPhoebe: (entering from Rachel's bedroom) I found it!ScenesRachel: Ohh! Thank God! Where was it?ScenesPhoebe: On your dresser.ScenesRachel: Okay that is the one we already have!ScenesJoey: Okay, here's my big scene. My big scene's here! (They have two of the cops on the street, then they cut to where they're entering an apartment.) Oh my God.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesJoey: (smiling) Okay, everybody just keep smiling. It'll kill my grandmother if she finds out.ScenesChandler: (smiling) Well, what is it?ScenesJoey: (smiling) Oh, they cut me out of the show.ScenesRachel: (smiling) What?!ScenesRoss: (smiling) Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: (smiling) Maybe your scene's coming up?ScenesJoey: (smiling) Not likely.  'Cause you see that body bag right thereScenesRachel: (smiling) Yeah.ScenesJoey: (smiling) I'm in it.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, it's continued from before the commercial break.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (smiling) This is terrible, what are you going to do?ScenesJoey: (smiling) I don't know. This little, old lady lives for my career. When they dumped me off of Days of Our Lives she almost died.ScenesPhoebe: (not smiling) That's not good.ScenesJoey: (smiling) No, smile! Not that face, smile! Everybody smile! (They all smile.)ScenesRachel: (smiling) Joey, why don't you just tell her what happened? It's not your fault.ScenesChandler: (smiling) If we keep talking this way, aren't we gonna freak her out soon?ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: (Something in Italian to Joey.)ScenesJoey: Soon, soon, I'm gonna be on soon. There I am! (Points to the screen, of course it isn't him.)ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: (pointing at the screen) No! Sam Waterston!ScenesJoey: No-no-no, that-that's me, that's me.ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: No, it's Sam Waterston! Crimes and Misdemeanors, Capricorn One.ScenesChandler: Doesn't know, "Hello." But she knows Capricorn One.Scenes(Phoebe gets up.)ScenesMonica: (following her) Phoebe! I have to have those earrings, we're going to leave as soon as the show is over.ScenesPhoebe: But I already gave them back to you!ScenesMonica: No you didn't.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I already didn't give them back to you, that's what I said. (Walks away over to Rachel.) Where is that other earring?ScenesRachel: It's not here Pheebs, it's not here. Ohh, I went to Joey and Chandler's last night! Okay! (Goes to the door.)ScenesPhoebe: Make sure you check Chandler's jewelry box.ScenesRachel: Wait a minute. Chandler has a jewelry box?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, we have like ten minutes. Do you want me to get into that now?!Scenes(Rachel heads for Joey and Chandler's and Phoebe heads for the kitchen to find Ross.)ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe) Hey Pheebs! How's that uh, vegetarian pizza working out for ya? You and those vegetables have a real thing going on, huh?ScenesPhoebe: (she just looks at him) Why are you being weird?ScenesRoss: Do you like it?ScenesPhoebe: No, that would be, "Why are you being cute?ScenesRoss: Okay, I'm working on my flirting.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! I did not get that.Scenes[Cut to Chandler and Monica on the couch.]ScenesChandler: So uh Monica, do you, do you like the Law & Order?ScenesMonica: Yeah, it's good.ScenesChandler: See, I'm finding out all this stuff about you today, like you like the Law & Order and that you flirted with every guy in the Tri-State area!ScenesMonica: Chandler! (Joey and his grandmother shush them and wave them away, which they do.) Okay, let me get this straight, it's okay for you to flirt, but not for me.ScenesChandler: Oh, I'm so glad we cleared that up. Look, I'm sorry, some things are different for men and for women.ScenesMonica: Go on, teach me something about men and women.ScenesChandler: Okay, I've already taught you so much already, but whatever. See when you flirt with a guy you think, "I'm just flirting, no big deal." But the guy is thinking, "Finally! Somebody who wants to sleep with me!ScenesMonica: No way!ScenesChandler: It's true.ScenesMonica: Well that's pathetic!ScenesChandler: Again true.ScenesMonica: And this goes for all guys?ScenesChandler: All guys that are awake. Then we go to sleep and then all the guys from the other end of the world wake up and behave the exact same way.ScenesJoey: (To Ross in the kitchen) All right, it's another commercial; I still haven't told her!ScenesRoss: Joey! This is like the last commercial. You've got like (checks his watch) ten minutes left!ScenesJoey: I know, I know! What am I going to do? (Thinks) Ooh!ScenesMonica: No! You are not gonna run out and leave her here!ScenesJoey: (dejected) Yeah, all right. (Thinks of something.) Ooh! (He quickly runs out before anyone can stop him.)ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: Joey!ScenesChandler: Uh, Joey is gonna be right back. Right back! (Tries to pantomime it for her.) Meanwhile, let's-let's-let's talk about you. (Pause.) So, you're old and small.Scenes[Time lapse, Rachel is coming back from Chandler and Joey's.]ScenesRachel: (entering) (To Phoebe) (whispering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Did you find it?ScenesRachel: The earring? No. But look, I found my sunglasses under the couch! I've been looking for these since like last summer. (Puts 'em on.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, those are my sunglasses, you borrowed them from me.ScenesRachel: Okay, calm down, here they are. (Gives back the sunglasses.)ScenesMonica: (entering from her room) Phoebe! (Motions for the earrings. Phoebe gives her the one-minute sign.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) What are we going to do?!ScenesRachel: I don't know, I don't know.ScenesPhoebe: All right well, we're just gonna have to tell Monica, that's all.ScenesRachel: Oh gosh, she's going to kill me.ScenesPhoebe: I suppose I could tell her it's just all my fault.ScenesRachel: Ohh that'd be great!ScenesPhoebe: Mon, can I talk to you for a sec?ScenesMonica: Yeah, what is it?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I lost one of your earrings. I'm sorry! I am so, so sorry!ScenesMonica: (shocked) Wow! All right well, I mean, what can you do? If you lost it you lost it.ScenesPhoebe: I will replace it, I promise. I feel so terrible.ScenesMonica: All right, sweetie that's fine. You didn't do it on purpose.ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: Look at you! Come here! (They hug.) Feel better?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! You're the best!ScenesRachel: Okay, wait a minute. Wait a minute, I-I-I, I can't do this. Listen honey, this is, it's not Phoebe's fault. She lent me the earrings, and I lost it. I'm so sorry. Honey, I feel terrible too. (Holds out her arms for a hug.)ScenesMonica: (angrily) That is exactly why I do not lend you stuff!! (Rachel looks over at Phoebe in resignation.) Okay?! I mean, first it's my jewelry! And if it's not my jewelry, it's-it's my blue sweater! And if it's not my sweater, it's my sunglasses!ScenesRachel: Your sunglasses?!ScenesMonica: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, right! (Hands Monica back her sunglasses.)ScenesCaitlin: (from outside) Pizza!ScenesRoss: (running to the door) Oh, mine! Mine! Mine! (to everyone) Okay, here goes. Prepare yourselves for some Class A flirting.ScenesChandler: Okay, hold on. (Pauses as he readies himself.) Okay. (Walks away.)ScenesRachel: Honey, you have nothing to prove. And if you really like this girl, I don't flirting is the right thing to… (Ross interrupts and shushes her.)ScenesRoss: You'll see. Okay. (Readies himself.) Oh, what's-what's her name?ScenesAll: Caitlin!ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: Caitlin!ScenesRoss: (He opens the door while faking a laugh.) Hey! Oh, we-we can't keep eating like this. (Monica turns her head in shame.)ScenesCaitlin: It's uh, $12.50.ScenesRoss: Okay, (gets the money) so, do you make the pizzas in one of those uh, wood-burning ovens?ScenesCaitlin: No actually umm, I think that they're umm, gas.ScenesRoss: Gas? Wow! Intense.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) If this is the way all the Gellers flirt, we don't have a problem.ScenesRoss: (to Caitlin) Hey uh, y'know that smell gas has?ScenesCaitlin: (wanting more than anything to get the money and leave this horrible, horrible place) Yeah.ScenesRoss: They put that in.ScenesCaitlin: What?!ScenesRoss: The gas is odorless, but they add the smell so you know when there's a leak.ScenesCaitlin: (getting more desperate to leave) Well okay!ScenesRoss: A lot of other gas smells…ScenesChandler: Oh the humanity.ScenesRoss: Meth-methane smells…ScenesCaitlin: Y'know what umm, actually I, I really, I should go.ScenesRoss: Oh but I-I-I haven't paid you yet!ScenesCaitlin: Y'know what? That's okay, you guys have ordered so many that this one is on me! (Runs for her life.)Scenes(Ross closes the door slowly.)ScenesRoss: (To All) Was I talking to her about gas?ScenesChandler: More so than anything else.ScenesPhoebe: I-I-I found it interesting.ScenesRachel: I'm sorry.ScenesRoss: Look, no-no, hey, hey, don't worry about it! In nine years, she and I will be right there. (Goes and sits on the couch dejectedly.)ScenesRachel: Okay, well, I'm gonna clear out some of these boxes. (She grabs a couple of the old pizza boxes and exits.)ScenesPhoebe: (walking over to Ross) Ross?ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: What else do they add smell too?

rows.Scenes: The street outside the building, Rachel is running to catch up with Caitlin.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey! Hey! (Stops Caitlin) Hi! Hey-hey-hey, I'm Rachel! From upstairs? The ones with all the pizza?ScenesCaitlin: Oh, is there a problem?ScenesRachel: No. No. Every thing's--they're fine. Great pizza. But it's uh, actually umm my friend Ross. He uh, just gets really nervous when he's flirting.ScenesCaitlin: Oh my God! That was flirting?!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesCaitlin: Wow!ScenesRachel: I know, I know, but uh just, I'm telling you, once, once you get past that part, that where it-it just feels like you wanna die, he's-he's really a good person.ScenesCaitlin: The guy with the gas?!ScenesRachel: Yeah. I'm-I'm telling you he's really sweet and he's really funny and he's just ugh, got a good heart. And besides, I y'know, I think he really likes you.ScenesCaitlin: Really?!ScenesRachel: Well y'know, we have 7 people and like 10 pizzas, what do you think?ScenesCaitlin: I just, I thought Joey was there.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey's grandmother are still watching Law & Order.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Hey Ross? Umm, I just ran into Caitlin in the hallway and-and uh, you must be getting better at this flirting stuff than I thought.ScenesRoss: What do you mean?ScenesRachel: Well, I don't get it, but she wanted me to give you her phone number. (Hands him the slip of paper with the phone number on it.)ScenesRoss: And she just gave you this?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Rach, thanks but uh, I don't need you doing me any favors.ScenesRachel: I-I-I didn't! I didn't! She thought you were cute.ScenesRoss: Well that I can believe.ScenesRachel: Yay!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! Is the show still on?ScenesChandler: Almost over man.ScenesJoey: (says hi to his grandma) Look! Oh! (Pointing out the window.) Is that the Pope?! (Chandler and his grandma turn to look and Joey slips a tape into the VCR.)ScenesChandler: Why am I looking?ScenesJoey: Oh, here I am, here's my big scene!Scenes(Joey has made a little home movie that's his big scene. He braces himself against the door to his apartment and while holding a plastic gun and wearing the same sweater says…)ScenesJoey: (on the tape) All right back off! I gotta gun! I'm not afraid to use it!ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: Oh Joey!ScenesJoey: That's right!ScenesChandler: You couldn't have at least changed your shirt.ScenesJoey: (on the tape) Now, I wanna a suitcase filled with 100,000 dollars. (The duck quacks, to the duck) Choo! Choo! Choo! (To the imaginary cops) Filled with $100,000 in small bills, and if I don't get it…(the duck quacks louder) Choo!! And if I don't get it, (pause, picks up the duck) I'm gonna shoot this duck!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no!ScenesJoey: (on the tape) I'm comin' out! (He opens the door and hops out pointing the gun in all directions and then runs out of view.)ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe) And she's supposed to buy this?!ScenesGrandma Tribbiani: Joey, bravo! (Starts with that Italian stuff again.)Scenes(Suddenly, the tape cuts away from Joey's impromptu scene, to Chandler standing really, really close to the camera.)ScenesChandler: (singing) Ground control to Major Tom! Commencing countdown…engines…on!Scenes(Joey and Chandler both run to shut off the tape.)ScenesJoey: (to his grandmother) That's uh, scenes from next week's show. Next week's!ScenesPhoebe: I am definitely gonna watch that!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, another time lapse, Monica is seeking advice from Rachel and Phoebe about possible replacement earrings.]
rows.Content: Monica: What about these? These look the same?ScenesPhoebe: Definitely!ScenesMonica: Not as each other!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, then no.Scenes(Goes over to Chandler.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesChandler: You ready?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesChandler: You look amazing. I'm the luckiest man in the world.ScenesMonica: Ohh, you're about to get a little luckier.ScenesChandler: Let me see the earrings.ScenesMonica: Oh, honey, the earrings…ScenesChandler: (looking at them) They look great! Does your boyfriend have the best taste or what?ScenesMonica: My boyfriend really does have good taste!Scenes(He turns to get his coat and Monica gives Rachel and Phoebe two thumbs up as Chandler walks over to Ross.)ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Thanks for picking out the earrings man.ScenesRoss: Hm-mmm.ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The Ride AlongScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan & Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Joey, and Monica are sitting on the couch as Ross is up getting some coffee.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, guys, listen, don't forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross's mind off of it.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, good idea.Scenes(Ross returns.)ScenesChandler: Hey man, what's up?ScenesRoss: (sits down at the table) Oh, eh, just thinking about Emily getting married tomorrow. (Joey panics.)ScenesJoey: Ooh, Ross, look! Look! (Points behind Ross.)ScenesRoss: (turning and looking) What? Where?ScenesJoey: Right over there! Right there! Look-look-look!ScenesRoss: What am I looking at?ScenesJoey: (to the rest of the gang) Somebody help me out here!ScenesPhoebe: (entering, with Gary) Hey!ScenesGary: Hello!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesGary: How are you?ScenesPhoebe: Monica, I'm sorry I didn't come by last night. I was out with Gary; he let me ride around with him in his cop car. We saw and prevented crimes.ScenesJoey: You got to go on a ride along?!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!ScenesJoey: I want to go on a ride along!ScenesRoss: Me too!ScenesGary: Okay!ScenesChandler: Yeah, yeah! Me too!ScenesGary: Really?! You?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesGary: Well, it's kinda dangerous.ScenesChandler: Well, I like danger.ScenesGary: Okay, you guys free tonight?ScenesJoey and Ross: Yeah!!ScenesChandler: Tonight? You-you didn't say it was going to be at nighttime.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is kneeling at the coffee table and has a bunch of pictures laid out in front of her as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! Oh, I'm so glad you're home, I thought tonight we could finally organize these photos!ScenesRachel: Ohh, thank God! Finally!ScenesMonica: Okay, I've broken them down into categories. Okay, we have uh, we got holidays, birthdays, candids, y'know… And then what I've done is I've cross-referenced them by subject. Right? So if you're looking up, oh let's say birthdays and dogs, you get Photo 152. See? (Hands her the photo.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, it's me and La Poo! Wow! I miss that dog.ScenesMonica: You can also find him under umm, dog and dead.ScenesRachel: Great! Thanks!ScenesMonica: All right, hand me that other box of photos; that's the very last one.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(She picks up the box and the bottom falls out, spilling all of the pictures onto Monica's neat little piles.)ScenesRachel: Oops. Sorry! Well, good thing you number all of them, huh?ScenesMonica: I hadn't! Photo 152 was a prototype.ScenesRachel: Ohhhh. Honey, honey, honey, it's okay, it's okay honey. I'm gonna fix you a drink, huh? Maybe a margarita?ScenesRoss: Ross has the blender! Ugh, everything's just falling apart!ScenesRachel: No honey, it's okay! Listen, I'll got to Ross's and get the blender, you get all the margarita stuff ready.ScenesMonica: All right, he's keys are in the drawer. Y'know what? I also need some cash.ScenesRachel: Okay, you want me to stop at the ATM?ScenesMonica: Nah, while you're at Ross's if you see any lying around…ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: What?! I-I-I don't, I don't do that!Scenes(Rachel slowly leaves the apartment.)

rows.Scenes: Gary's cop car, Ross is in the front seat with Gary of course. Chandler is in the back seat.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Gary) That was so cool man, the way you leaned on that guy.ScenesChandler: It is starting to get dark out there.ScenesRoss: (to Gary) He told you everything! I mean you totally cracked him!ScenesGary: Yeah well, being that he was the victim, they're usually pretty talkative.ScenesChandler: (laughing) Okay. (Deadpan) But it is officially nighttime.Scenes(Gary reaches up to grab that little light that cops have for unmarked cop cars.)ScenesRoss: Oh hey, Gary, want me to grab the berry for ya?ScenesGary: It's called the cherry.ScenesRoss: It's the—Chandler!!Scenes(Chandler starts laughing at his joke.)ScenesJoey: (returning from a deli) Okay, I got it! This place makes the best sandwich in the world!ScenesGary: Hey Joe does it have meatballs on it?ScenesJoey: Oh-ho, yeah!ScenesGary: Does it have melted cheese and marinara sauce?ScenesJoey: Yep!ScenesGary: Yeah, you can't eat that in my car.ScenesJoey: (dejected) Yeah okay. (To Chandler) Even though my tax dollars paid for this car.ScenesChandler: Your tax dollars?ScenesJoey: Yeah, okay.Scenes[Time lapse, they're still on the ride along and Joey is just sniffing his sandwich.]ScenesChandler: (leans in and takes a sniff of Joey's sandwich) Wow! That sandwich really does smell good.ScenesJoey: Did I say you could smell it?!ScenesChandler: I can't smell your sandwich?ScenesJoey: Half the taste is in the smell! You-you're sucking up all the tastiness!ScenesChandler: Okay, I'll give them back. (Exhales strongly through his nose and Joey just glares at him.) Look! What is so great about that sandwich?ScenesJoey: Okay, imagine the best sex you've ever had.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: Are you thinking about Monica?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Yeah, what's that like?

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Rachel is just entering. She takes off her coat and heads for the kitchen. As she does, she knocks something off of a bookcase next to the kitchen door with her coat and it breaks.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh please don't be from a real dinosaur! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! (She picks up the 2 pieces and looks at the stand.) Made in Mexico! Yes!! Ugh, who would buy this?! (Looks for a place to hide it and finds a wall sconce and drops the pieces into it and heads into the kitchen as the phone rings.)ScenesMonica: (on the answering machine) Rach! It's me! Pick up!Scenes(Rachel runs over and answers the phone with the blender in hand.)ScenesRachel: Hey! What's up?!ScenesMonica: I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt, some margarita mix, and tequila.ScenesRachel: So all we have is ice?ScenesMonica: See if he has ice.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(She hangs up the phone and starts to head back to the kitchen and notices some money lying out, stops, reaches down to pick it up, the phone rings causing her to drop it, she quickly puts it back, and heads for the kitchen.)ScenesEmily: (on answering machine) Hello Ross? It's Emily. (Rachel runs back into the room with the tequila.) I know this is out of the blue but uh, I'm getting married tomorrow. Well, maybe I am. I keep thinking about you and I'm wondering if-if we made a mistake giving up so fast. Are you thinking about me? Of course you're not, but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.ScenesRachel: Oh. Oh! (Takes a slug of tequila.)

rows.Scenes: The ride along.]
rows.Content: Ross: So where are we going next?ScenesGary: This witness won't return my calls so we're gonna see if we can surprise him coming home.ScenesChandler: Sur-surprise him? We're not, we're not gonna make anybody mad are we?ScenesJoey: Come on man! (To Gary) Listen so uh, are you gonna squeeze the perps shoes a little bit before he lawyers up?ScenesGary: It's a witness not a perp. And no one talks like that!ScenesRoss: Yeah, no one talks like that!ScenesJoey: Oh what? Like your Mr. Cop!ScenesRoss: Hey, I'm more cop than you two!ScenesChandler: How do you figure that?ScenesRoss: Hello! I'm in the front seat, okay? I'm Gary's partner!ScenesChandler: Y'know, when you say partner it doesn't sound cop. It, it sounds gay.ScenesRoss: Umm, jealous! (He drops the cherry and it turns on.)ScenesGary: Hey, do you mind? We're under cover here.ScenesRoss: Yeah, no problem. (Tries to turn it off.)ScenesGary: Ross!ScenesRoss: Sorry! Sorry! Oh, (He sticks it under his shirt) there! (It's just there flashing through his shirt) Hey Gary, who am I? Phone home!Scenes(Gary just glares at him.)Scenes[Time lapse, Ross has been demoted to the back seat with Joey and Chandler. He's not too happy about it.]ScenesChandler: Look at Officer Ross riding back here with the visitors.ScenesJoey: Yeah, what's up with that Serpico?

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Rachel is playing Emily's message to Monica.]
rows.Content: Emily: (on answering machine) Are you thinking about me? Of course you're not, but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.ScenesMonica: (does Rachel's) Nooo!ScenesRachel: (does Monica's) I know!ScenesMonica: Well thank God you were here! I mean, we have to erase that!ScenesRachel: What?! We can't do that!ScenesMonica: We have too! I mean what if Ross's hears that and then calls her back and then they get back together? Is that what you want? Ross back with that controlling, neurotic, crazy Emily? The Emily that wouldn't let him see you?ScenesRachel: Noo! Oh no! No! God no! He should not get back together with her. I know that! You know that! Even Ross knows that! But that still doesn’t give us the right to erase his message!ScenesMonica: I'm his sister, okay? I love him! I don't want to see him get hurt! Come on! Doesn’t that give me the right to control him—help him?ScenesRachel: I don't think he's the one who needs help.Scenes(They both sit down.)ScenesMonica: No, look, she's obviously unstable, okay? I mean she's thinking about running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she's putting him in! What's he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine, all right, but that's y'know, it's different! Although it did involve a lot of the same people.ScenesRachel: Ugh!ScenesMonica: Y'know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she's trying to play on him.ScenesRachel: Okay, you are crazy! I'm sorry, but she sounded generally upset! I mean, listen! (She hits a button on the machine.)ScenesAnswering Machine: Your messages have been erased.ScenesRachel: Noooooooo!

rows.Scenes: The ride along, they're all waiting outside of the witness's house and still in the car in the same places as before.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, y'know, we-we're safe right? I mean nothing bad can go down!ScenesGary: No. But that reminds me, (handing back a clipboard) sign this.ScenesRoss: What is it?ScenesGary: Oh it's nothing, it just says that you can't sue the city if you scrap your knee or y'know, get your head blown off.ScenesChandler: (deadpan) Oh, hurry up. I want to sign that.ScenesGary: Okay, here he comes. What is he doing? What the hell is he doing?!ScenesRoss: What? What? What? What is it?ScenesJoey: Is everything okay?ScenesChandler: What's going on?ScenesGary: Okay, he sees us. Now don't move. Don't look at him.Scenes(They all turn and look away. Suddenly a loud bang sounds out and in slow motion Joey slowly throws his body over Ross. Gary is shocked at what he sees while Chandler is obviously hurt.)ScenesGary: Hey, it's okay. It was just a car backfire. (Joey slowly moves off of Ross.) Hey, look at that! You tried to save your buddy. You see that? You see what he did?ScenesJoey: (To Ross) You okay man?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. Thank Joey!ScenesChandler: Uh, HELLO!!ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Monica has all the supplies she needs and is getting ready to leave.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right, I guess we should go.ScenesRachel: No, wait. Wait.ScenesMonica: Oh yeah right! (She grabs the money and shoves into her pocket.)ScenesRachel: No, Monica! Monica! We have to fix this!ScenesMonica: There's nothing we can do. You erased the message!ScenesRachel: Yeah well unless we tell him.ScenesMonica: Well, if you're gonna be totally rational about this, I can't argue with you! All right? Fine, if you wanna tell him, tell him. I just don't want to be a part of it.Scenes(The phone rings.)ScenesRachel: Oh, maybe that's Emily calling back to leave the exact same message.ScenesRoss: (on the machine) Hey Ross! It's you! I just want you to remember this feeling. You are lucky to be alive! So live everyday to the fullest. Love yourself, okay? Okay. Oh, and also get stamps. Bye! (He hangs up.)ScenesMonica: Wow! Play that message for Emily and this whole problem goes away!ScenesRachel: Right?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the guys are returning from the ride along to find Phoebe already there.]
rows.Content: Gary: Hey, anybody want to meet a hero?ScenesPhoebe: (excited) John Glenn is here?!ScenesGary: No, Joey!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, we had the most incredible night! Okay, so, we're in the car…ScenesGary: Wait! Hold on! (He goes over to Phoebe and gives her a kiss.) (To Phoebe) Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesGary: (To Ross) Okay, go ahead.ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, so we're in the car. Right? And bang! A shot was fired. And Joey with no regard for his own safety throws himself on me!ScenesPhoebe: My God, Joey!ScenesChandler: (pouting) It was a car backfire!ScenesRoss: Yeah, but-but he didn't know that!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I didn't know that.ScenesRoss: And it could've just as easily have been a bullet.ScenesGary: Hey Joe, you ever think about joining the force? We could use a guy like you.ScenesChandler: Who jumps at loud noises!ScenesRoss: Wow! I could've died tonight.ScenesChandler: Yeah! If the car that backfired had run over you! Y'know what, I think I'll go home before Ross starts rambling about his newfound respect for life. (He gets up and starts for the door.)ScenesRoss: I do have a newfound respect for life.ScenesChandler: (returning) Oh my God! (Storms out.)ScenesGary: (To Phoebe) So you wanna get some dinner?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Sure! Yep! (Gets up) Oh, y'know what? If I heard a shot right now, I'd throw my body on you.ScenesGary: Oh yeah? Well maybe you and I should take a walk through a bad neighborhood.ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesGary: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Bye!ScenesRoss and Joey: Bye!Scenes(They leave as Ross stares in awe at Joey.)ScenesJoey: Cut it out Ross! I hate to have to save your life and kick your ass in the same day!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is pacing as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Dude! How come you took off?ScenesChandler: Oh, I just went for a walk, around the living room. Whatever…ScenesJoey: Is something wrong?ScenesChandler: No. No I'm just tired. Y'know, from-from the walk.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesChandler: You dove in front of Ross! Ross!ScenesJoey: That's what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!ScenesChandler: I do not hate Ross!ScenesJoey: Of course you do! I saved him! You're mad at me! It all adds up! You want Ross out of the picture.ScenesChandler: What picture?ScenesJoey: I don't know, but I don't like what I'm hearing!ScenesChandler: Look I'm very glad that you saved Ross from the car backfire, but y'know, it could've been a bullet and you y'know, you didn't try to save me!ScenesJoey: Ohh, you're upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No! I…knew…you could take care of yourself. Y'know, I mean Ross, he need help. He's not street like us!ScenesChandler: When it comes down to it, you would risk your life for Ross before you would for me. That's the bottom line.ScenesJoey: Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn't trying to save Ross. Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich.ScenesChandler: From a bullet!ScenesJoey: I know it doesn't make much sense…ScenesChandler: Much sense?!ScenesJoey: Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!ScenesChandler: So you risked your life, for a sandwich!ScenesJoey: I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!ScenesChandler: So you didn't uh, choose Ross before me.ScenesJoey: No! I would never do that! You-you're like my brother!ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesJoey: Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich and holds it out for Chandler) here.ScenesChandler: Thanks. (He grabs the sandwich.)ScenesJoey: No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it's not a hot dog!Scenes(Chandler takes a bite.)ScenesJoey: How good is that?ScenesChandler: (with his mouthful) Oh-oi-ho, yeah!ScenesJoey: See?ScenesChandler: Hm-hmm. (Goes to take another bite.)ScenesJoey: Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!ScenesChandler: I thought you were showing me how much you mean to me.ScenesJoey: Yeah. With a bite! (Takes back the sandwich.) Gee-e-e-eez!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Rachel is trying to repair the thing she broke earlier, but gets interrupted by hearing Ross at the door. She panics and throws the thing into the kitchen. And runs to the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey! Hi!ScenesRoss: Rach, what uh, what are you doing here?ScenesRachel: Hey! Y'know what? You are in our apartment all the time! Okay? This is, this is just a drop in the bucket mister!ScenesRoss: Y'know, it-it doesn't matter. The important thing is that you're here. You're my friend, and you're here. Oh! (He goes over and hugs her.)ScenesRachel: Okay, just a little scared. What's going on Ross?ScenesRoss: The most amazing thing happened tonight. I thought my number was up. I had an actual near death experience!ScenesRachel: What?! What? What happened?!ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, we were on the ride along with Gary, right?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: And somebody took a shot at me!ScenesRachel: (gasps) Really?!ScenesRoss: No, a car backfired, but (Rachel suddenly calms down) I thought somebody was taking a shot at me. And Rach, I…I survived! And I was filled with this-this great respect for life. Y'know? I-I want to experience every moment. I want to seize every opportunity. I-I am seeing everything so-so clearly now.ScenesRachel: Because a car backfired?ScenesRoss: (stares at her briefly) Okay, why are you here?ScenesRachel: Well, I-I-I don't know how this fits into your whole "seizing" thing but um, Emily called you today.ScenesRoss: You talked to her?ScenesRachel: No, she left a message. (He starts for the machine.) (Stopping him.) But it-it kinda got erased. There's just (Pause) something wrong with your machine.ScenesRoss: Well, okay, what-what did she say?ScenesRachel: Well, uh something about having second thoughts about the wedding and did you guys make a mistake breaking up and uh, she wants you to call her.ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: Now, that-that was a good thing that I told you, right?ScenesRoss: Huh? Yeah! Yes, of course!ScenesRachel: Okay. Thank you! Thank you! Because—I'm sorry, all right. Because y'know what? She didn't want me—not important. The point is, I was right. Your decision. Okay? I was right. (She starts for the door.) (Stops) Your decision.ScenesRoss: Right. I guess, I guess I should call Emily.ScenesRachel: Okay, no, that's not the right decision. That's not, that's not right, no Ross-Ross, come on! I mean, that woman made you miserable! Okay, Ross, do you really want to get back into that?ScenesRoss: Okay, look, yesterday I would've even considered calling her back, but my ex-wife calls on the same day I have a near death experience. I mean, that-that has got to mean something!ScenesRachel: Ugh, Ross! That was not a near death experience! That was barely an experience!ScenesRoss: You weren't there! Okay, maybe this is something that I-I'm supposed to seize! Y'know?ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what? Maybe, this is not about seizing stuff. Maybe this is about escaping stuff.ScenesRoss: Huh.ScenesRachel: I mean, look-look today you escaped (Pause) (Not believing it) death, y'know? And maybe this is a chance for you to escape getting back together with Emily?ScenesRoss: That does make sense. Because I do wanna seize some opportunity, but I-I really don't wanna see or talk to her.ScenesRachel: Well, there you go!ScenesRoss: Yeah. Maybe today is just, close call day.ScenesRachel: (laughing) Close call day.ScenesRoss: Hey, thanks Rach. (They hug.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, honey no problem. Okay. (Gets up.)ScenesRoss: Oh wait-wait-wait! The message is blinking. Maybe you didn't erase it.ScenesRachel: Oh?Scenes(Ross hits the playback button.)ScenesRoss: (on machine) "Hey Ross, it's you!" (Hits the stop button) Oh yeah, no that's-that's an old message, nobody needs to hear that.ScenesRachel: No. (She heads for the door again.)ScenesRoss: (looking at the coffee table where his money was) Hey umm, was-was Monica here?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I want my money back.ScenesRachel: (going out the door) Yeah, uh you-you probably need that for stamps, right?Scenes(Ross is stunned.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Pheebs, has Gary ever been shot at for real?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Once. Yeah, a little. He kinda did it to himself. It's not really a good story.ScenesRoss: I wonder how I would react under fire, y'know? And not backfire but-but heavy fire, like I was in a war or something.ScenesMonica: Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a fantastic military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you guys.ScenesChandler: Before or after you were shot by your own troops?ScenesRoss: I know where Joey would be. He would be down in the foxhole protecting all of us.ScenesChandler: Yes, if the foxhole was lined with sandwiches.ScenesJoey: Yeah, hero sandwiches. (Points at Ross who points back.)ScenesPhoebe: Well you all know that I'm a pacifist so I'm not interested in war in any way. (Gets up) But y'know what? When the revolution comes, I will have to destroy you all. (Starts to leave.) (To Joey) Not you Joey.Scenes(Joey gets all happy with himself, while the rest of the gang is less than enthused.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The BallScenesTeleplay by: Greg MalinsScenesStory by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gary, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Gary: (To Phoebe) Would you like some more coffee, baby-doll?ScenesPhoebe: I'm fine, thanks.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Yeah, see, I can't pull of baby-doll can I?ScenesMonica: No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get some tea.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(Monica leaves and Chandler moves to talk to Phoebe.)ScenesChandler: Hiya doin' pumpkin?ScenesPhoebe: Nope. (Chandler nods in agreement.)Scenes[Cut to Gary and Monica at the counter.]ScenesMonica: So it looks like it's going really well for you two, huh?ScenesGary: I know, really well. In fact, I'm gonna ask Phoebe to move in with me.ScenesMonica: (shocked) Oh my God!ScenesGary: What do you, what do you think?ScenesMonica: I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?ScenesGary: Tonight, but don't say anything. Okay?ScenesMonica: I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I'm so excited! {And I just can't hide it! I'm about to lose control and I think I like it! Sorry, just couldn't resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do not get her flowers. Okay? Because y'know, she cries when they die, and there's the whole funeral…ScenesGary: (To Phoebe) I'll see you after work sweetie. (Kisses her.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Bye!Scenes(Gary exits and Monica rejoins them.)ScenesPhoebe: So, what movie should we see?ScenesMonica: (sitting down) Gary's gonna ask you to move in with him!!ScenesPhoebe: What?! Really?!ScenesMonica: He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I couldn't hold it in any longer!ScenesPhoebe: I can't believe this!ScenesChandler: (terrified) Right, because it's fast. Because, it's so fast. It's fast!ScenesMonica: Relax! It's Phoebe! Not you!ScenesChandler: Oh! Good for you Pheebs, way to go! (Breathes a sigh of relief)ScenesPhoebe: No, but it is fast. Isn't it?ScenesMonica: Ohhhh!ScenesPhoebe: No, I like him a lot but I don't think I'm ready for this!ScenesChandler: So, what are you gonna do?ScenesPhoebe: I don't know. I'll just handle it—I'll ask you to talk to him!ScenesChandler: Me?! Why me?ScenesPhoebe: Because you are so afraid of commitment! You talk to him, make him scared like you! Make him a…man!ScenesChandler: I'll try, but I'm not sure what good it would do, y'know? Because I'm a lot less afraid of commitment than I used to be.ScenesMonica: That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her tea.)ScenesChandler: (To Phoebe, behind Monica's back) Still terrified, I'll take care of it. No problem. (When Monica turns back he smiles and kisses her, when she turns away he nods that he'll do it to Phoebe.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are playing catch with a little foam globe.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Ross, is uh, is Staten Island really an island?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh, that's why they call it Staten Island.ScenesJoey: Ohhh. I thought it was like Long Island.ScenesRoss: (he catches the ball and pauses, staring at Joey in disbelief) Also an island.Scenes(The game resumes.)ScenesJoey: Hey, what time is it?ScenesRoss: (looks at his watch) 2:17.ScenesJoey: Wow! You realize that we've been throwing this ball, without dropping it, for like an hour?ScenesRoss: Are you serious?!ScenesJoey: Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn't want to say anything 'cause I didn't want to jinx it.ScenesRoss: Wow! We are pretty good at this! Hey! We totally forgot about lunch!ScenesJoey: Oh, I-I, I think that's the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey, you guys…ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Is Monica here?ScenesJoey and Ross: No.ScenesRachel: All right listen umm, I just bought something I'm not sure she's gonna like it, and it's gonna seem a little crazy, but this is something that I wanted since I was a little girl.ScenesRoss: You bought Shawn Cassidy!ScenesRachel: Noo! I wish! Okay, you ready?ScenesJoey and Ross: Yeah!ScenesRachel: Okay! (She goes and gets her surprise and when she returns with it, Ross stares in shock.) Check it out!Scenes(Joey turns and looks at quite possibly one of the ugliest pets that you can possibly buy on the planet. Rachel has bought herself a hairless cat. Yep, a hairless cat! Joey and Ross start to get sick.)ScenesRoss: What-what is it?!ScenesJoey: What the hell is that?!!ScenesRachel: It's a, it's a cat!ScenesJoey: That, is not a cat! {I have to agree with Joey on this one.}ScenesRachel: Yes it is!ScenesRoss: Why is it inside out?!ScenesRachel: Excuse me! But this is a purebred, show-quality Sphinx cat!ScenesRoss: How much did you pay for that?ScenesRachel: Well, it was a little extravagant, but I a pretty good deal.ScenesRoss: Yeah? How much?ScenesRachel: A thousand bucks.ScenesRoss: ON A CAT??!!!!ScenesJoey: It's not a cat!ScenesRachel: All right listen ball boys! My grandmother had one of these when I was a little girl and it was the sweetest thing! I mean it was so cute, it would sit in my lap and purr all day long, and I would drag a shoestring on the ground and he would chase it!ScenesRoss: Free cats do that too, y'know. {Which reminds me, if I might get a little political here, support your local animal shelter. Pet shops are not the place to buy dogs and cats from, you get a much better deal from the shelter, plus they probably won't die on you in a week and a half. If you want a leash, go to the pet shop. If you want the dog for that leash, go to the shelter and save it's life. Now back to regularly scheduled programming.}ScenesJoey: It's not a cat!ScenesRachel: Ugh! Look you guys, I'm really excited about this! Okay? I don't care what you think! I'm gonna go set up a little litter box for Mrs. Whiskerson. (They both glare at her.) Well, what am I gonna call her? Fluffy?!Scenes(Rachel goes into the bathroom as the guys continue throwing the ball.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) Hey, you wanna get something to eat or uh, do you wanna see how long we can throw this ball back and forth? Huh?ScenesJoey: Uhh, the ball thing.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Hey Ross, wouldn't it be great if we could go two straight hours without dropping it?!ScenesRoss: Uhh, yeah it would! Let's do it!ScenesJoey: Okay!Scenes(They throw the ball back and forth once.)ScenesJoey: (catches the ball) Uh-oh.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: I have to pee. And Rachel's in the bathroom!Scenes[Cut to Chandler and Joey's, Ross is seen throwing the ball into the bathroom, presumably where Joey is currently using the facilities.]ScenesJoey: Man, I didn't think we were gonna make it!ScenesRoss: I know! (Looks at the ball in his hands.) Don't switch hands, okay?

rows.Scenes: the 5th Precinct, Gary's precinct, Chandler has come to talk to him about commitment. And as he's walking through the door he notices a couple of "Ladies of the night" sitting there. (If you know what I mean.)]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey ladies! What are you in here for? (Laughs at his joke.)ScenesGary: Hey Chandler, what are you doing here?ScenesChandler: Gary, I'm here to report a crime.ScenesGary: Yeah?ScenesChandler: It is a crime that you and I don't spend more time together.ScenesGary: (laughs, then suddenly serious) What's up?ScenesChandler: Well, I heard that you thinking about asking Phoebe to move in with you and I thought maybe, we should have a talk. Man to uh, me.ScenesGary: Sure. Okay.ScenesChandler: Uh, are you crazy? Are you insane? If you live with Phoebe, you two are gonna be y'know, live-living together!ScenesGary: Yeah, I-I considered that. I just know it would make me happy.ScenesChandler: You mean scared.ScenesGary: No, I mean happy.ScenesChandler: Scared? Happy?ScenesGary: Chandler, what-what are you doing?ScenesChandler: I am trying to open your eyes, my man! Don't you see, if you lived with Phoebe she's always gonna be there. You're gonna get home, she's there. You go to bed, she's there. You wake up and oh yes, she's there!ScenesGary: I know! I can't wait!ScenesChandler: Were you're parents happy, or something?ScenesGary: Listen Chandler, the way I see it is that I was lucky enough to find someone that I really love. I just—I wanna be around her as much as I can.ScenesChandler: Wow, y'know when you say it, it doesn't sound so scary.ScenesGary: So you know what I'm talking about, right?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I think I do! Y'know what? You move in with her! You move in with her right now! Maybe I should in with Monica!ScenesGary: No, it's too soon for you guys.ScenesChandler: (pause) Yeah, you're right about that.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are still playing catch.]
rows.Content: Ross: …now when they found the remains of the Mesozoic Mastodon they discovered what appeared to be the remains of a Paleozoic Amphibian in its jaws! How did it get there?!Scenes{Y'know, sometimes I think the script writers throw in a line like that to try to trip me up. But it won't work. I'll always have the last laugh! <manical_laugh.wav> Okay, so maybe I'm a little deluded, it's probably just my spellchecker. But, I must admit I did get Mesozoic and Paleozoic on the first attempt. Yay me! Anyhoo…}ScenesJoey: Maybe this should be more of a quiet game.Scenes{Oh, all right!  Geez, I can't have any fun!}ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesMonica: Joey, I left my watch on the counter last night. (Goes to the counter) It was right here, where is it?ScenesJoey: I don't know.ScenesMonica: All right, come on, I'm-I'm late for work!ScenesRoss: How do you know? You don't have a watch.ScenesMonica: Guys, could you please just stop throwing the ball for one minute and just help me find it!ScenesJoey: Oh, I don't know…. Yeah, can't do it.Scenes(He throws it back to Ross, but it's intercepted by Monica and the guys both scream in horror.)ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRoss: Monica, whatever you do, do not drop that ball!ScenesJoey: Yeah, we haven't dropped it in… (Looks to Ross.)ScenesRoss: 2 hours, 27 minutes.ScenesMonica: Really?!Scenes[Time lapse, Monica has joined in and is calling to get out of work.]ScenesMonica: (on phone, faking she's sick) I-I'm not gonna be able to make it into work today, I don't feel very good. (Joey makes a high throw and Monica has to catch it way over her head.) (Not sounding sick) Yes!! (Realizes what she just did.) (Sounding sick again) Wow! Uh, for a second there I thought I was really better, but I'm not. (Hangs up and keeps throwing the ball.)Scenes(Rachel enters.)ScenesRoss: Hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: Check it out! Almost 3 hours without droppin' it!ScenesRachel: Oh, wow! Congratulations, that's quite a waste of time.ScenesMonica: Rach?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesMonica: You have scratches all over you, what happened? (Rachel's arms are covered with scratches.)ScenesRachel: Well, it's my cat.ScenesMonica: (shocked) What?!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, I got a cat.ScenesMonica: I don't want a cat!ScenesJoey: Oh, don't worry, it's not a cat.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: You guys this cat is nothing like my grandmother's cat. I mean, it's not sweet, it's not cute, I even dragged that little string on the ground, and it just flipped out and scratched the hell out of me. And I swear, I know this sounds crazy, but every time this cat hisses at me I know it's saying, "Rachel!ScenesRoss: Doesn't sound as crazy as paying a thousand dollars for a cat.ScenesMonica: (To Rachel) What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me 300!!ScenesRachel: Well, I was gonna let you play with it.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is drinking coffee as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, did you talk to Gary about the moving in thing?ScenesChandler: Yes I did, and I think you should do it.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesChandler: He's a great guy, y'know? And he loves you a lot, you are a very lucky lady.ScenesPhoebe: You are useless! Freaking out about commitment is the one thing you can do! The one thing! And you can't even do that right! God!ScenesChandler: I’m sorry. (Pause) If you ask me, I'd move in with him.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh!! God! (Gary enters and she sees him) Ooh! (To Chandler) Get out of here, good for nothing.ScenesGary: Hey Chandler.ScenesChandler: Hey Gar!ScenesGary: (To Phoebe) Hi sweetie. (Kisses her.) Hi, can I talk to you for a second?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Okay. (They move to the couch.)ScenesGary: You look very pretty today.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks! Okay. (They sit down.)ScenesGary: Here's the thing.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesGary: Y'know I really want to move this relationship forward.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm.ScenesGary: Because if you're not moving forward, y'know you're just moving backwards.ScenesPhoebe: No that's not true. If you're not moving forward, you're just staying still. And staying still is good. Watch this. (She stays still for a brief second.)ScenesGary: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesGary: I want you to move in with me.ScenesPhoebe: That is so sweet. But don't you think it's a little too soon? I mean there's so much we don't know about each other.ScenesGary: (disappointed) Oh. Oh-oh-okay, I get it.ScenesPhoebe: I just—I don't want us to jump into something we're not ready for.ScenesGary: (disappointed more) Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: I really don't want to mess up what we have. I'm just—I'm worried it's gonna be a big mistake.ScenesGary: (on the verge of tears) Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Which is why my answer is yes!ScenesGary: (suddenly happy) Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh! (They hug.) I'm so…happy. (She's not happy.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, and Monica are still playing catch, with Chandler looking on. Joey throws the ball to Monica who catches it and whips it at Ross.]
rows.Content: Ross: (catching the ball) Monica! Stop throwing it so hard! We're on the same team!ScenesChandler: Four hours? You guys have been doing this for four hours?ScenesJoey: That's right baby.ScenesChandler: All right, let me in. (He jumps off of the counter to join in the game.)ScenesMonica: (jumping in front of him) No-no! Don't do it! Don't!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: He's a dropper!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, that's right!ScenesChandler: I'm not a dropper!ScenesRoss: It's really a uh-uh three person game, y'know?ScenesChandler: It's throwing and catching!ScenesRoss: All right. (He gently tosses the ball to Chandler who catches it.)ScenesChandler: Oh! Oh! That's so hard. (Starts to juggle the ball, but loses control and almost drops it and hands it to Monica.)Scenes(Rachel enters with the "cat" and the chick and the duck start to get riled up.)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa you guys, it's not a cat!ScenesMonica: Oh my—Oh good God!ScenesRachel: (she's wearing an oven mitt to protect her hand) I give up you guys, I don't know what I'm going to do with this thing!ScenesRoss: Baking it didn't help, huh?ScenesMonica: So, why don't you just take it back to where you got it?ScenesRachel: I tried! They won't take her back.ScenesChandler: Maybe that's because she's a minion of the anti-Christ.ScenesMonica: Rach, why won't they take it back?ScenesRachel: Well, they said would but they would only give me store credit. I mean, what am I going to do, get a thousand regular cats?ScenesMonica: Look, if you want you can keep it at our place until you find out what to do with it.ScenesRachel: No Mon that's not the point. I'm out a thousand dollars, I'm all scratched up, and I'm stuck with this stupid cat that looks like a hand! (Storms out.)Scenes(Monica sneezes.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, the cat's made my eyes water! Don't-don't throw it to me! My vision's been compromised!! (Quickly grabs a tissue to wipe her eyes.) Oh God! Okay. Okay. It's okay. Man, that was close.ScenesChandler: Yeah, you almost overreacted to something.ScenesPhoebe and Gary: (entering) Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesGary: We have great news!ScenesPhoebe: We're moving in together! Isn't it great! Yay!ScenesAll: Congratulations! Congrats!ScenesPhoebe: I know, I'm so excited!ScenesGary: So am I!ScenesPhoebe: Well, you're not more excited than I am! No way! I'm the most excited!ScenesGary: Okay, I'll see you at the station later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, yeah, I'll see you later! Don't forget about the moving in!ScenesGary: All right.Scenes(Phoebe closes the door behind him.)ScenesMonica: So you're moving in with him. What happened?ScenesPhoebe: I couldn't tell him no. He got so sad. Maybe it'll be all right. I do really like him a lot and probably do it eventually anyway and plus, think of all the money I'll save on stamps.ScenesMonica: Why, do you write him a lot?ScenesPhoebe: No, I just heard when people live together, they split the cost of stamps. Don't they?ScenesAll: Yeah! That's right. Yeah-yeah! Yeah!Scenes(Rachel enters with the cat, wearing the oven mitt, and startles Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'm sorry, the oven mitts really freaked me out.

rows.Scenes: Gary's precinct, Phoebe is entering.]
rows.Content: Gary: Hey, honey! Okay, so did you find any apartments? Anything in Brooklyn Heights?ScenesPhoebe: No, nothing.ScenesGary: Oh really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesGary: Nothing at all?ScenesPhoebe: No, as soon as something opens up we'll move right in. Unless it doesn't have a pool, I need a pool. (Turns away from him.)ScenesGary: Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!Scenes(He takes her into one of those typical interrogation rooms you see on TV and in the movies. Which is really appropriate here, since this is a TV show. What are the odds of that?)ScenesGary: Take a seat. You okay? You feeling all right? (Closes the door and takes off his coat.)ScenesPhoebe: (sits down) Yeah, I feel great. 'Cause we're moving in together.ScenesGary: So you uh, you checked the paper for listings in Brooklyn Heights, right? You-you checked the Post?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, uh-huh, there was nothing. (Pause) Can I get some water?ScenesGary: In a minute. You-you checked today's Post?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, yeah! Today's.ScenesGary: 'Cause uh, this is today's Post (produces one from the other chair) and uh, these are the listings I found. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, two bedroom. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, one bedroom. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, (points) Brooklyn Heights, (points) Brooklyn Heights!ScenesPhoebe: (looks at the paper) Are these for rent! I thought people were just bragging!ScenesGary: Let me tell you what I think might be going on. (Phoebe looks down in shame.) No-no-no, don't look at the table. Look at me. (Points to his eyes and she does so) Okay, I think somebody asked someone to move in with them. And I think someone said, "Yes" but now she's having doubts because things are moving to fast for someone. Does that sound at all possible to you?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Yes! Fine! I am someone! You want me to say it? I have doubts! (Pause) I'm sorry! (Puts her head down.)ScenesGary: Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesGary: Phoebe, it's okay that you feel this way. I mean it is soon. And there's a lot of things we don't know about each other, and I just figure that everything I really like. And the things I don't know, I get to learn about at someplace with both our names on the mailbox.ScenesPhoebe: That's so sweet.ScenesGary: Sweethart, but none of that matters if it's too soon for you. It's fine! We don't have to move in together. I just—I want you to be happyScenesPhoebe: Living with you would make me happy.ScenesGary: Phoebe, you don't have to say that.ScenesPhoebe: No, I really wanna live with you! I wanna move in with you!ScenesGary: Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Definitely! Yes! Let's live in an apartment that we both live in! (Hugs him.)ScenesGary: Oh that's great!ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait, one sec. One sec. (Goes to the mirror) Hey you! Behind the glass! Who are you looking at! I've always wanted to say that when I was in one of these rooms, (sees the look on his face) which was never!

rows.Scenes: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel is trying to sell the cat.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Show cat! Quality show cat! Show cat! (A woman approaches.)ScenesWoman No. 1: (looks into the box) Oh my God! What's wrong with your baby?!ScenesRachel: It's not a baby! It's a cat!ScenesWoman No. 1: Eew! It's creepy looking!ScenesRachel: Oh no! No! It's actually—it's very sweet. It's very sweet. Look! (Goes to pet it and it hisses at her.) Yeah, do you want it?ScenesWoman No. 1: (laughs) No, I hate cats.ScenesRachel: Well, so then what are you doing to me? Okay? Just get out of here! All right? Move on!Scenes(Another woman approaches.)ScenesWoman No. 2: Wow! What an unusual cat!ScenesRachel: Yes! Thank you! Exactly! You want it?ScenesWoman No. 2: Maybe. I was thinking about getting a cat, I was just going to go to the shelter (Good for her) but… Okay, why not?ScenesRachel: Oh, terrific! That'll be $2,000.ScenesWoman No. 2: What?!ScenesRachel: Okay, a thousand.ScenesWoman No. 2: I thought you wanted to adopt your cat.ScenesRachel: Well, I do, but you're just gonna have to actually look at this as more of an investment than a cat.ScenesWoman No. 2: Okay, yeah, I just wanted a cat. (Starts to leave.)ScenesRachel: (makes some unintelligible sound to stop her from leaving) Obviously you know how to haggle, so I'm not gonna try and take you on. Okay? So $800 and I don't call the cops because you're robbing me blind! Blind! (Covers her eyes) Just take cat, leave the money, and run away! Run away! (Uncovers her eyes and sees that the woman has fled) Damnit! (To the cat) Cat, can't you at least smile or something?! (The cat hisses at her again, it sounds like Rachel) Okay, did anybody just hear that? Anybody?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, Monica, and now Chandler are still playing catch. The guys are exhausted and sitting around the room. Monica is still standing all pumped up and being hyper-competitive yet again. {Okay! We get it! She's competitive!! Must we see all the time?!}]
rows.Content: Ross: I'm starving!ScenesMonica: Come on guys! Suck it up! We're closing in on ten hours! It's gut-check time!ScenesJoey: I don't know who made you the boss? All right? We (Ross and him) invented this game!ScenesMonica: Please! I made this game what it is.ScenesChandler: Not fun anymore?ScenesRoss: I'm still hungry!ScenesMonica: All right, there's some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand right? Are you with me?ScenesRoss: I am!ScenesMonica: All right! Let's go! (Runs to the door.) Let's go Team Monica! (The guys all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.Scenes[Cut to her apartment where Rachel is sitting at the table.]ScenesMonica: Rachel! What is your cat doing in one of my bowls!ScenesRachel: It's not! I'm defrosting a chicken. (Pause) Oh, I uh sold Mrs. Whiskerson.ScenesRoss: Oh, thank God!ScenesJoey: Did you get your money back?ScenesRachel: Yeah, 15 hundred dollars.ScenesMonica: Wow! You made a profit!ScenesGunther: (entering with the cat) I just came for the red-velvet pillow.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, there you go. (Hands over the pillow.)ScenesGunther: Thanks Rachel. And-and don't forget you-you can come visit her anytime you want.ScenesRachel: Oh good, great! I'll-I'll keep that in mind. (Turns and walks away.)ScenesGunther: (To Ross) Hey! So what is this? Some kind of snake or something?

rows.Scenes: Gary and Phoebe's apartment, it's morning and they're both waking up in bed.]
rows.Content: Gary: I really like waking up with you.ScenesPhoebe: I like waking up with you too. (Looks out the window) Oh! It's such a beautiful morning. (Some birds are singing outside the window) Oh, I can stay here all day.ScenesGary: That would be great!ScenesPhoebe: We could have breakfast in bed…ScenesGary: Wait, just a second.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (He grabs his gun and shoots the bird.) Oh! Oh no.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Hyper-competitive Monica, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are still playing catch. Monica is finally tiring while the rest of them are totally exhausted and virtually asleep.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right! Come on Monica! Look alive! Come on, look alive!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh good, you're all up.ScenesRachel: Phoebe! It's 6 o'clock in the morning! Why aren't you at Gary's?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, that's over.ScenesAll: What?!ScenesChandler: Come on! Gary's such a great guy! Whatever the problem is, you can work it out!ScenesPhoebe: He shot a bird!ScenesChandler: Oh that is over!ScenesAll: That's terrible! I'm sorry!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, are you okay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Yeah, I'll be alright.ScenesJoey: Oh hey, here Pheebs. (He throws her the ball.)ScenesPhoebe: (catches it) Nah, I don't feel like playing. (She sets the ball down on the table and everyone gasps.)ScenesMonica: It's okay. It's okay. Just pretend that it didn't happen! Okay? No one needs to know! I mean, Phoebe's not an official ballplayer! I mean, only official ballplayers can drop the ball!ScenesAll: All right. Okay. I'm starving! (They all get up, thus officially ending the game.)ScenesRachel: Phoebe, honey, wanna get some breakfast?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Okay! Okay, let's race! First one there wins! Ha-ha! (Runs out the door and everyone watches her leave.)Scenes(Pause)ScenesChandler: You guys wanna eat here?ScenesAll: Yeah! As long as we're here!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Man that was great! Huh? Can you believe how long we threw that ball around?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it is amazing it lasted that long.ScenesRoss: I know. My arm is killing me.ScenesRachel: No, I meant with the dropper over here. (Points at Chandler.)ScenesChandler: Y'know, how did I get this reputation as a dropper? Okay? I'm anything but a dropper. (We see various scenes of him dropping a football, a mug of coffee, the phone, an apple, a Frisbee, a record, and the final scene has a ball bouncing off of his chest. I'm not going to describe them, you'll have to see them.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Joey's Big BreakScenesTeleplay by: Wil CalhounScenesStory by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe are there reading. Rachel is sitting on the couch flanked by Ross and Monica. She suddenly stops reading and starts blinking her left eye as if it's bothering her. The problem is that Joey is on her left and thinks she's winking at him and winks back. Ross is watching this and isn't quite sure of what to make of it.]
rows.Content: Ross: What's going on?ScenesRachel: Well, my eye is a little itchy.Scenes(Ross turns to look at Joey.)ScenesJoey: Uhhh, mine too! Yeah.ScenesMonica: (To Rachel) Wow! It's really red! You should go see my eye doctor.ScenesRachel: Richard? I'm not gonna go see your ex-boyfriend!ScenesChandler: Oh, Richard. That's all I ever hear, Richard, Richard, Richard!ScenesMonica: Since we've been going out, I think I've mentioned his name twice!ScenesChandler: Okay, so Richard, Richard!ScenesMonica: It's not Richard! Okay? It's this new guy and he's really good.ScenesRachel: Well, I'm sorry I'm not going to an eye doctor!ScenesRoss: Oh God, here we go!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesRoss: Anytime anything comes close to touching her eye or anyone else's she like freaks out. Watch! Watch! (He takes his finger and moves it towards his eye.)ScenesRachel: (flinches) Ross! Come on! That's all right! Fine--Okay, I have a weird thing about my eye. Can we not talk about it please?ScenesAll: All right, fine.ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, remember that great song, Me, Myself, and I? (And on the "I" part she mimics poking her eye.)ScenesRachel: (flinches again) Monica! Come on!ScenesRoss: Hey, does anybody want to get some lunch? All those in favor say I? (Pokes his eye)ScenesRachel: (freaks) Ross! Stop it! Come on!ScenesChandler: How much did I love The King and I? (Oh, you get the point by now.)ScenesRachel: Chandler!ScenesJoey: Me too! Me too! Me too! (Yeah, he does the same thing.)ScenesRachel: Just stop it! Come on!Scenes(Joey howls in pain and holds his eye.)ScenesChandler: You okay there man?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I got too excited!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right, I gotta go. I'm taking Ben to the park.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, give him a kiss for me!ScenesRoss: All right, bye!ScenesMonica: Bye!ScenesPhoebe: Bye!ScenesRoss: Later! (Exits.)ScenesPhoebe: (after he's gone) I am so sorry you got caught in the middle of that. I didn't mean to be so out there. I am furious with him!ScenesChandler: Wow umm, calm down.ScenesPhoebe: I'm trying, but man that guy can push my buttons!ScenesMonica: Why are so mad at him?ScenesPhoebe: Look, I don't wanna talk about it. Okay?ScenesMonica: Well, it just seems that…ScenesPhoebe: You wanna be on my list too? Keep talking! Has anyone seem my list by the way?ScenesChandler: Uh, no Pheebs. What's it look like?ScenesPhoebe: Uh, it's a piece of paper and it says, "Ross" on it.ScenesJoey: (entering, depressed) Hey. I just got off the phone with Estelle and guess what. (Pause, then very excitedly) I GOT THE LEAD IN A MOVIE!!!!!!ScenesChandler: You got the lead in a movie? That's amazing! What's the movie about?!ScenesJoey: It's called Shutter Speed, it's really cool! Yeah, umm, I meet this girl in the subway and we fall in love in like a day, right? And then, she disappears… But I find out where she lives and when I get there this like old lady answers the door and I say, "Where's Betsy?" Right? And she says, "Betsy's been dead for 10 years.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh-oh, chilling!ScenesJoey: And the best part is, we're filming in the desert outside Vegas! (To Chandler) And you know what that means buddy!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know that means buddy!ScenesJoey: Road trip! Yeah, we can rent a car! I just have to be there by Tuesday!ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait, my grandmother's dead.ScenesChandler: Well, uh, we can talk about that too Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: No! No, her cab! She probably won't be using it; you can drive it to Las Vegas.ScenesJoey: All right! Thanks Pheebs!ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa-whoa, what are we going to do about my job?ScenesJoey: Oh umm, not go.ScenesChandler: All right, great, road trip baby! (To Monica) This okay with you?ScenesMonica: Chandler! You don't have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.ScenesChandler: Thank you.ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, come on! We're gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!ScenesRachel: (entering from her bedroom) All right! Let's get this over with! Ugh! (She walks by the table and notices that no one is looking and accidentally on purpose knocks over the open cereal box.) Ohhh! No! Look what I did!
