(She starts walking through the mess. {Also, notice the continuity error in this scene. Note the position of the box and dispersal pattern of the cereal before and after the camera cut.}) Oh, I mean, look at this mess! I mean, we're probably gonna have to clean this up! Y'know? We're gonna have to reschedule!ScenesMonica: No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All right, let's go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is reading a map as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh hey Joey! What's up?ScenesJoey: I can't decide which route to take to Vegas. Hey, you've traveled a lot right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I've been around.ScenesJoey: Okay, so-so which route should I take the northern route or the southern route?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, if you take the northern route there's a man in Illinois with a beard of bees. {Okay, I must protest this, I've lived in Illinois all my life and know of no man with a beard of bees! Wisconsin, on the other hand, might be a different story.}ScenesJoey: Great! Problem solved!ScenesPhoebe: But on the southern route there's a chicken that plays tic-tac-toe.ScenesJoey: Well, back to square one.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I know a way that you can decide! All right, I'm going to ask you a series of questions and you answer as quickly as you can.ScenesJoey: (quickly) Yes!ScenesPhoebe: Good, but wait. Okay, all right, here we go. Now I want you to relax. Take a deep breath. Clear your mind. (Quickly) Which do you like better peanut butter or egg whites?ScenesJoey: Peanut butter!ScenesPhoebe: Which would you rather be a fireman or a swimmer?ScenesJoey: A swimmer!ScenesPhoebe: Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?ScenesJoey: Monica. Oh… huh, I always thought it would be Rachel.ScenesPhoebe: No thinking! No thinking! Tie or ascot?ScenesJoey: Ascot!ScenesPhoebe: North route or south route?ScenesJoey: North route!ScenesPhoebe: Bamn! There you go! Huh?ScenesJoey: Wow! That was incredible! Beard of bees, here I come!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this guy again. (She ignores him.)ScenesJoey: Hey man, what's up?ScenesRoss: Uhh, not much. You guys want to see a movie tonight?ScenesJoey: Sure, what do you want to see?ScenesRoss: I don't know, umm…ScenesJoey: Oh, I know how we can decide. Phoebe, show him your game!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, no thank you. (She gets up and moves to the couch. They were at a table previously.)ScenesRoss: What's with her?ScenesJoey: I don't know. But hey, I know we can decide. Okay, I'm gonna ask you questions and you answer real quick. Okay?ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJoey: What do you like better action or comedy?ScenesRoss: Action.ScenesJoey: Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?Scenes(Ross pauses and looks at him, Joey motions for him to hurry up.)ScenesRoss: Dude, you are sick.ScenesJoey: Oh, I'm sorry. I forgot you had that whole Rachel thing.

rows.Scenes: Monica's eye doctor's office, Monica and Rachel are waiting in an exam room and looking at this big white thing used to check eyes. I have no idea what it is, and if an ophthalmologist happens to know what that is, let me know.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God! What does that thing do?ScenesMonica: (looks at it more closely) Oh that's an eye removal machine.ScenesRachel: All right, I'm outta here!ScenesMonica: I'm kidding! I'm kidding!Scenes(Rachel heads for the door but is intercepted by the doctor.)ScenesThe Doctor: Hi Rachel!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesThe Doctor: I'm Dr. Miller. Monica told me you were a little nervous, but don't worry everything's gonna be just fine.ScenesRachel: So were done then!ScenesDr. Miller: Almost! But first, we gotta start.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesDr. Miller: This is a glaucoma test.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesDr. Miller: Sit down.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesDr. Miller: But your chin here. (She does so.) Now, you'll feel a small puff of air in each eye.ScenesRachel: (jerks back from the tester) What?!ScenesMonica: A small puff of air, now come on!ScenesDr. Miller: Here we go.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesDr. Miller: 1…2…3! (Rachel jerks back on 3.)ScenesRachel: I'm sorry. All right, I'll just stay in here this time. (Puts her head back.) Okay.ScenesDr. Miller: Ready?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesDr. Miller: 1…2… (She flinches on 2 this time.)ScenesMonica: Y'know what, I'm gonna hold her head.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesDr. Miller: That's okay.ScenesMonica: Okay. (Monica backs off.)ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay!ScenesDr. Miller: 1…2! (She flinches again.) (Gives up.) Y'know what? You're young; you probably don't have glaucoma.ScenesRachel: (really excited) Great!! It was very, very nice to meet you sir--Ow! Hey! What are you doing?! Are you crazy! (He took out that thing they use to look at people's retinas and looked at Rachel's when she was shaking his hand causing her to flinch and scream at him.)ScenesDr. Miller: Okay. You've got a small, minor infection in that left eye. I want you to take these drops three times a day and you'll be as good as new.ScenesRachel: Yeah, no, I don't-I don't put things in my eye.ScenesDr. Miller: Okay then, I guess we'll see you back here in three months.ScenesRachel: Great!ScenesDr. Miller: And I'll fit you for a glass eye.ScenesRachel: Okay, just give me the damn drops! (Grabs them and storms out.)ScenesMonica: Dr. Miller? (She covers her right eye and reads from the chart) P E C F D.ScenesDr. Miller: Very good Monica! You know where they are.ScenesMonica: I sure do! (She runs over to a drawer, opens it, and grabs a lollipop.) (To Rachel) And you don't get one!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica, and Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Y'know, I-I gotta tell ya, those eye drops are a miracle. My eye is a 100% better.ScenesMonica: They're still in my coat.ScenesRachel: Damn!ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! You ready to go?ScenesChandler: Yeah, listen, how cold is it going to be there? Do I need a coat or will all these sweater vests be enough? (Holds up 3 of them in different colors.)Scenes(Monica stares at him.)ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: I love you.Scenes{There's another continuity error here. Before Monica says I love you, Chandler's holding the vests so that you couldn't see the collar, you could see all three, and they were folding nicely. After she says the line and the camera cuts back to Chandler, you can only see two out of the three, you can see the collar of the top one, and it looks like it was folded sloppily, unlike before. Hey, you notice things while spending this much time on this!}ScenesJoey: Man, I wish Ross was coming with us! Y'know? I'm gonna miss him!ScenesPhoebe: Thanks a lot! I just got that jerk out of my mind!ScenesChandler: Hey, so where are we staying? Is the movie putting us up in a big hotel suite?ScenesJoey: Uh no, not really. It's an independent film y'know? So we don't have a real big budget. I figured I'd just stay in your room.ScenesChandler: I see, but once you get your first paycheck you'll be springing a big hotel suite, right? I mean, lead in a movie, they must be paying you a lot?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah! For every dollar Shutter Speed makes, one penny of it goes right in Joey's pocket.ScenesChandler: So you don't get paid unless the movie makes money?ScenesJoey: Did you not hear the plot of the movie? "She's been dead for ten years." I'm gonna be a millionaire!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: I just wanna say good-bye to you guys and to see if you guys will place a little bet for me, huh? Twenty bucks on black 15.ScenesJoey: You got it!ScenesRoss: All right!Scenes(Joey nods to Chandler, no way!)ScenesChandler: All right, bye-bye now!ScenesPhoebe: Bye!ScenesRachel: Bye you guys!ScenesJoey: Bye-bye!ScenesMonica: I wanna say good-bye at the car!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesJoey: Anybody want to say good-bye to me at the car?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, I'll say good-bye to you at the car if you don't mind the puss.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: See ya! (Walks out.)ScenesRachel: Well, wait a minute! The puss is good! It means it's healing! (Runs after him.)ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, what 'cha reading? (Phoebe ignores him) Pheebs? (Turns away) Hello? (He sits down next to her and she moves over a bit.) Phoebe? (He moves closer and she keeps moving away.) Phoe-Phoebe! (They end up hanging over the arm rest.) Come on! (He grabs the magazine away from her.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't see you there.ScenesRoss: Phoebe, are you, are you mad at me, or something? 'Cause if are please, tell me what it is I did!ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you don't know I can't help you.ScenesRoss: Well, I don't know.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I can't help you.ScenesRoss: Well, whatever it is I'm-I'm very, very sorry. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Apology accepted.ScenesRoss: Okay. So we're, we're good?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: All right. (Gets up.) I'll uh, I'll see you later, okay?ScenesPhoebe: (quietly) Bye, fat ass.ScenesRoss: ALL RIGHT!! Phoebe now come on! Will you please tell me what it is I did that mad you so mad at me!ScenesPhoebe: I don't know! I don't remember!ScenesRoss: Well if you can't remember, can't we just forget about this?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, I am mad at you. I know that much. But, I am sorry about the fat ass thing. You actually have a very sweet little hiney.Scenes(Ross isn't sure what to do with that comment.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's cab, Joey and Chandler are headed across the George Washington bridge on their way to Las Vegas. Joey is driving.]
rows.Content: Joey: Man, I'm getting pretty tired. You're might have to take over soon.ScenesChandler: We've been driving for a half-hour, and you haven't looked at the road once.ScenesJoey: Don't worry, it's out there! (Just then a horn honks and Joey quickly looks at the road.) I think I just need lunch.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: You wanna eat? (Pulls out the twenty) My treat!ScenesChandler: Isn't that Ross's money?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Okay. Ross's treat! Where do you wanna eat?ScenesChandler: I don't know.ScenesJoey: Ooh, hey, I know how we can decide! All right, uh, I'm gonna ask you a bunch of questions and then you have to answer real fast. Okay? So uh, clear your mind Clear it right out! Clear it out! Clear!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesJoey: Okay, uhh, would you rather be too wet or too dry?ScenesChandler: Too dry.ScenesJoey: Do you believe in ghosts, yes or no?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesJoey: Is this movie gonna be my big break?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesJoey: (shocked) What?!ScenesChandler: Yes.ScenesJoey: Dude you said, "No!ScenesChandler: I also said, "Yes!ScenesJoey: You don't think this is going to be a big break for me?ScenesChandler: No! (Realizes) Ahhh!!!ScenesJoey: I don't believe this!ScenesChandler: Look Joe, I just, I just don't want to get your hopes up real high.ScenesJoey: What are you talking about?! I'm the lead in a movie!ScenesChandler: They're not even paying ya! This doesn't even sound like a real movie!ScenesJoey: Y'know what? I don't need this! Okay? I don't know why you're dumping all over my big break.ScenesChandler: Joe, I don't think this is going to be your big break.ScenesJoey: Is that why you're on this trip, huh? Make me feel like a loser? 'Cause if it is, I'll tell ya, I-I-I'd rather be alone.ScenesChandler: Oh, you don't want me on the trip?ScenesJoey: Not if you're gonna be like this!ScenesChandler: All right, I'll tell ya what, the next time you ask me a question like that I'll lie.ScenesJoey: Yeah! I don't want you on the trip!ScenesChandler: All right, fine! Fine! Why don't you pull over? I'll get out right now!ScenesJoey: Fine! (He slams on the brakes, stopping the car on the bridge to the sound of numerous car horns.) Get out!ScenesChandler: You're not actually supposed to stop on the bridge.ScenesJoey: Get out!!ScenesChandler: All right!! (Gets out and Joey speeds away.) Wait! Wait, there's no sidewalk! Yeah, I'm gonna die here.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there. Ross is trying to figure out why Phoebe's mad at him.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, are you mad at me because my hair gel smells?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesRoss: Are you angry at me because I said your handwriting is childlike?ScenesPhoebe: No that made me feel precious.ScenesMonica: Oh, I know! Umm, is it because he's always correcting people's grammar? Whom! Whom! Sometimes it's who!ScenesRoss: Yeah? Sometimes it's… (Does the fist thing.)ScenesRachel: Oh, did you beat him at a board game? He turns into such a baby when he starts to lose.ScenesRoss: Okay, I'm the baby. (Points at his eye.)ScenesRachel: Eh! Stop it!ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Chandler! What are you doing here?ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Joey kicked me out of the car on the George Washington bridge!ScenesAll: Why?!ScenesChandler: I don't know! He went crazy! Y'know, we were playing that game where you-you ask a question and you answer it really fast.ScenesPhoebe: That game should not be played without my supervision.ScenesChandler: Well, I don't know what mad him so mad, y'know? All I said was that uh, I didn't think this wasn't gonna be his big break, that this movie wasn't going to do anything for him, and that uh, y'know it didn't sound like a real movie--Okay, he should've pushed me off of the bridge.ScenesPhoebe: What's in the bag?ScenesChandler: Oh, I figured you guys would all be mad at me. So I got you some gifts that I found on the side of the road. (Looks into the bag.) Who wants the teddy bear with one leg?ScenesPhoebe: I do!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to apply her eye drops while Monica looks on.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay. (She tilts her head back and squeezes the eyedropper. The only problem is, it's not over her eye.)ScenesMonica: Not even close.ScenesRachel: Okay, then y'know what? Help me! I need help! I can't do this!ScenesMonica: Okay! All right! Let's do it!ScenesRachel: All right!ScenesMonica: Sit down. (They sit down on the couch.)ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesMonica: Put your head back.ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesMonica: All right.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: Now, open your eyes.ScenesRachel: Okay, they are. (No they're not.)ScenesMonica: How many fingers am I holding up? (She's not holding any up.)ScenesRachel: (thinks) Four.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, I was thinking four.ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesMonica: Yes! All right, y'know what? Why don't we start with a practice run? Okay?ScenesRachel: Okay!ScenesMonica: No drops!ScenesRachel: Great!ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: On three, 1…2…3! (Rachel turns her head on three to avoid the drops.) Now my pillow's all wet! (She was trying to fool Rachel and squeezed the eyedropper.)ScenesRachel: Well, well, you said it was practice!ScenesMonica: Then why did you move?!ScenesRachel: Because I knew you were lying!ScenesMonica: All right, come here! (She gets up and drags Rachel off of the couch by her legs.)ScenesRachel: (as she's being dragged) What are you? Monica!! Stop it!! Oh my God! Stop it! (Monica drags her totally onto the floor and on her back.)ScenesMonica: I am going… I'm going--Turn it over! (Rachel rolled onto her stomach and Monica rolls her back.) I'm… I am going to get these drops in your eyes. (She is holding Rachel down with both hands and has the eyedropper in her mouth.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! You really are freakishly strong!Scenes(Monica starts biting on the eyedropper, spraying the fluid all over. But Rachel keeps turning her head back and forth and Monica keeps missing.)ScenesRachel: Monica! Stop it!ScenesMonica: (spitting out the eyedropper) Damn! It's empty!ScenesRachel: Wow, y'know if Joey and Chandler walked in right now, we could make a fortune! (Monica is straddling Rachel and holding her arms down. In a rather risqu� pose, at least for primetime TV.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, time lapse, Phoebe and Monica are playing cards as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ooh that is definitely Chandler, Joey, or Ross. (Thinks) Or-or Rachel!ScenesMonica: (answers the phone) Hello? (Listens.) (To Phoebe) It's Joey. (Phoebe's proud of herself.) (To Joey) I'm so glad you called! Chandler told me what happened. Y'know he's really upset about it.ScenesJoey: (on a pay phone holding a box) Not as upset as he's gonna be when he finds out what I did with his sweater vests!ScenesMonica: What did you do to his sweater vests?ScenesJoey: Let's just say there's a well-dressed pack of dogs in Ohio. Hey Monica listen is-is Phoebe there? I gotta ask her something about the car.ScenesMonica: Yeah, she's here. Hold on a second. (She hands the phone to Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, dude!ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs! Listen, this wooden box keeps sliding out from under the seat. What-what is it?ScenesPhoebe: Oh that's my grandma. (Joey holds the box away from him.) And thanks Joey she's having a really great time. (Joey is happy now.)ScenesChandler: (who has just entered) Is that Joey? Is that Joey? Let me talk to him! I wanna talk to him!ScenesPhoebe: Okay Joey? Chandler's here, he was wondering… (We hear the dial tone as Joey hangs up.) Okay, I guess he ran out of change.ScenesChandler: Y'know, he won't even talk to me. How am I going to apologize to him if he won't even talk to me?ScenesMonica: Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las Vegas he'll know that you're sorry.ScenesChandler: That's a good idea. I wonder where I could (Pause) get a basket of porn…ScenesPhoebe: No, don't-don't say I'm sorry with porn!ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what you should send him? A cartoon of cigarettes. 'Cause that why he could trade it for protection. No. That's prison.ScenesRoss: (entering) Okay Pheebs, I know how we're going to figure this out. Okay, clear your mind and answer the first thing that comes into your head. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm.ScenesRoss: What do you like better flora or fauna?ScenesPhoebe: Fauna.ScenesRoss: Who would you rather be Simon or Garfunkle?ScenesPhoebe: Garfunkle.ScenesRoss: Why are you mad at me?ScenesPhoebe: You said I was boring--Ohh!ScenesRoss: When did I say you were boring?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, I remember now! We were playing chess!ScenesRoss: Phoebe! You and I have never played chess!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, come on! Yes, remember that time on the frozen lake? We were playing chess, you said I was boring, and then you took off your energy mask and you were Cameron Diaz! (Realizes) Okay, there's a chance this may have been a dream.

rows.Scenes: The desert outside of Las Vegas, Joey is arriving and we hear the song, Name. Y'know, (singing) I've been through the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to be out of the rain. In the desert, you can't remember your name, 'cause there ain't no one for to give you no pain. La…la…la-la-la, la, la, la, la-la-la. You get the idea. Anyhoo, he pulls up and stops. As he gets out of the car, he spills a huge pill of fast food containers out of the foot well.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey-hey! Stanley! Hey-hey! You're leading man is here! Let's get to work.ScenesStanley: Umm, slight change of plans. We've shut down.ScenesJoey: Wh-what?! Why?!ScenesStanley: It's a money thing, we don't have any.ScenesJoey: (laughs) You're kidding right?ScenesStanley: No.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesStanley: It-it's probably just temporary. We're hoping to get some more money soon, so if could just uh, hang out.ScenesJoey: Uh, hang out?! How long?ScenesStanley: I don't know. A week? Maybe two? The money will turn up! People will always wanna invest in movies! Hey, you're not rich are ya?ScenesJoey: No!ScenesStanley: Eh, worth a shot. (Gets into his car.) Look Joey, let me know where you're staying, okay? (The car peels away.)Scenes(I think one of the grips walk up to Joey, mainly because there's a credit for The Grip. What the heck is a grip anyway?!)ScenesThe Grip: Hey pal, are you Joey Tribbiani?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesThe Grip: These got left for ya. (He hands him a bunch of helium balloons.)ScenesJoey: Thanks. (The grip walks away.) (Reading the card.) Congratulations on your big break.Scenes(The rest of the crew start to drive away leaving Joey sad, alone, and holding his congratulatory balloons as the song comes up again. La-la-la. See, I've been through the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to be out of the rain! In the desert you can't remember your name, 'cause there ain't no one for to give you no pain. La-la-la, la, la, la…)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the phone is ringing.]
rows.Content: Monica: (answering it) Hello?ScenesJoey: (on phone from Vegas) Hey Monica, it's Joey!ScenesMonica: Hey Joey! Aww, you remembered even though you're a big star!ScenesJoey: Aw, come on! It'll be years before I forget you!ScenesMonica: Joey, what's it like on a movie set, huh? Do you have a dressing room? Do you have a chair with your name on it?ScenesJoey: Uh, well yeah-yeah, I've got all of that going on. Yeah, listen uh, I want you to make sure you tell Chandler that he couldn't have been more wrong! Uh-oh! I gotta go Monica, my uh, my sushi's here!Scenes[Cut to Joey hanging up the phone in Vegas. He's wearing a Roman gladiator's uniform and goes over to join a family to pose for a picture. You see, he's apparently taken a job at Caesar's Palace.]ScenesJoey: (to the family) Sorry about that. Thanks for waitin'.ScenesThe Husband: Okay!ScenesJoey: Everybody smile! (The picture is taken) Okay, thanks a lot! Enjoy your stay at Caesar's! We hope it's toga-rrific! (The family leaves.) Kill me. Kill me now.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, The gang is surrounding Rachel at key positions.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Rach, can you pass me the TV Guide?ScenesRachel: Yep!Scenes(As she moves to get it, Monica yells…)ScenesMonica: Go!!Scenes(Phoebe jumps to the floor as Ross tackles Rachel off of the couch. Chandler helps push Rachel onto the floor by jumping over the back of the couch. Phoebe grabs Rachel's head to hold it still and opens Rachel's eye as Monica jumps onto Chandler's back to administer the torture--I mean medicine.)ScenesRachel: What?!! Stop it! Stop it! Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Okay! Okay! Okay! (She succeeds in getting the eye drops in and everyone climbs off of Rachel.) We'll see you in about 3 to 4 hours.ScenesRachel: Oh! (She's trying to recover while still on the floor.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One In VegasScenesPart I Written by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesPart II Written by: Greg Malins & Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is sitting in the living room and Phoebe is standing in the kitchen as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Pheebs? Could you get that? Please?ScenesPhoebe: Why? Just 'cause you're too lazy to get up off your touchie?ScenesRachel: No! No! It's just that all the people in the entire world that I want to talk to are right here.ScenesPhoebe: (smiles) Okay! (Goes to answer the phone.)ScenesRachel: (under her breath) Sucker!ScenesPhoebe: (answering the phone) Hello? (Listens) Hey Joey!Scenes[Cut to Las Vegas, Joey is on the phone and wearing his gladiator costume.]ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs! Listen, uh can you do me a favor? I forgot the pin number to my ATM card can, can you get it for me?ScenesPhoebe: Sure! Where is it?ScenesJoey: Uh, I scratched it on the ATM machine down on the corner.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! So you're 5639?!ScenesJoey: That's it! Thanks Pheebs!Scenes[Cut to Monica and Rachel's]ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (to Joey) Ooh, do you want to talk to Chandler?ScenesChandler: (To Phoebe) Is that Joey?! (She nods yes) Let me talk to him!Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: No! (She nods no to Chandler) Because he didn't believe in my movie! Which is a big mistake because it is real! Real!ScenesA Casino Boss: Hey! Tribbiani! Get back to work! Break time's over!Scenes[Cut to Phoebe]ScenesPhoebe: Who was that?ScenesJoey: Uhh, my stunt double. Yeah, and y'know, he's getting a little too familiar for my tastes.ScenesChandler: (To Phoebe) Y'know what? I have been trying to apologize to him all week! If he's not gonna let me do it on the phone, I'm gonna go down there and do it in person.Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: Uhh Pheebs, I heard that. Can you put him on?Scenes[Cut to Phoebe]ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! (She hands the phone to Chandler.)ScenesChandler: (To Joey) Hey!Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: Don't come out here!Scenes[Cut to Chandler]ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, I've supported you one hundred percent and I want to prove that to you in person!Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: I got that! I forgive ya! Don't come out here!Scenes[Cut to Chandler]ScenesChandler: Forgive me? You haven't been taking my calls in a week!Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: Well, I'm totally over it Chandler. Friends forever! Don't come out here!ScenesA Tourist: (To Joey) Would you mind doing a picture with us?Scenes[Cut to Chandler]ScenesChandler: Uh, what was that?Scenes[Cut to Joey]ScenesJoey: Uh, Entertainment Tonight. [Cut to Chandler] Yeah, okay so, good talking to ya and don't come out here. All right. (Hangs up the phone and poses for that picture.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Monica! I'm sorry I'm late! (Starts looking around for her) Monica? (Goes into Monica's bedroom.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Phoebe? (Phoebe comes back into the living room) Oh, Phoebe, I'm so sorry. Have you been here long?ScenesPhoebe: (saddened) It's okay. What the hell took you so long?ScenesMonica: Okay, you can not tell Chandler. Okay? That I ran into Richard.ScenesPhoebe: Which Richard?ScenesMonica: The Richard.ScenesPhoebe: Richard Simmons?! Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Noo! My ex-boyfriend Richard! Y'know the tall guy, moustache?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Okay, that actually makes more sense. So how was it?ScenesMonica: It was, it was really nice. We started talking and I-I ended up having lunch with him.ScenesPhoebe: That is so weird! I had a dream that you'd have lunch with Richard.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesPhoebe: But again, Simmons. Go on.ScenesMonica: The strange part was, he was really nice, umm and he looks great, but I didn't feel anything at all!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! So now why can't we tell Chandler?ScenesMonica: Because it would totally freak him out and tomorrow's our anniversary. I just don't want anything to spoil that.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I can't believe you guys lasted a whole year!ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! I owe Rachel 20 bucks!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: On a totally different bet.ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: It's almost our anniversary!ScenesChandler: I know. Can you believe it? One year ago today I was just your annoying friend Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: Awww! Now you're just my annoying friend Chandler.ScenesChandler: Huh.ScenesMonica: I got you a present!ScenesChandler: Oh, but it's not 'til tomorrow!ScenesMonica: I know, but you have to open it today! (Hands it too him.)ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(He starts taking his time opening it. Finally Monica snaps.)ScenesMonica: (grabbing the gift from him and opening it) Okay! There you go! It's two tickets to Vegas!ScenesChandler: Wow!ScenesMonica: For this weekend! Oh gosh, it would be perfect, we get to see Joey plus we get to start our anniversary celebration on the plane. We can call it out plane-aversary.ScenesChandler: Do we have to?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Okay this is great, but Joey said he didn't want any of us out there.ScenesMonica: Oh, he just doesn't want us to go through any trouble. Think of how excited he'll be when we go out and surprise him! Plus we get to have our own, ani-Vegas-ary! A-Nevadaversary!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I think we should see other people.ScenesMonica: But we can go, right?ScenesChandler: Yes.ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesChandler: It's a great idea. (They kiss)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I'm gonna go too!ScenesChandler: Y'know Pheebs, it's kinda our (His and Monica's) anniversary.ScenesPhoebe: Oh please, you are not gonna ditch again like you did with London.ScenesMonica: Ditch you? Phoebe, you were pregnant with the triplets!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, great story! I'm going!ScenesRachel: (entering with Ross) Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey, you guys, listen, this weekend we're all gonna go to Las Vegas to surprise Joey! Including me!! You wanna go?!ScenesRachel: Well, I guess I could take a couple days off work.ScenesPhoebe: Of course you can take a couple days off work because this trip includes me!ScenesRachel: Oh no, wait a minute, wait, I've got a presentation tomorrow. I can't miss that.ScenesRoss: Oh, but I've got tickets to the Van Gogh exhibit! I've been waiting like a year for this.ScenesChandler: (coughing) Art lover!ScenesRoss: What'd you say?ScenesChandler: I said art lover.ScenesRoss: Is that supposed to be an insult?ScenesChandler: I don't know, I'm very tired.ScenesRoss: So Rach, maybe you and I could fly out together Saturday.ScenesRachel: That sounds great.ScenesRoss: Yeah? All right I'll call the airlines. (Picks up the phone and does so)ScenesRachel: Okay. Yeah, that would be nice actually, to have the apartment to myself for a night.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, so you can walk around naked.ScenesRachel: No! So I can be by myself. Y'know? Have a little alone time.ScenesPhoebe: Naked alone time.ScenesRachel: No! Phoebe just because I'm alone doesn’t mean I wanna walk around naked. I mean, you live alone, you don't walk around naked.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh! Why do you think it takes me so long to answer the door?

rows.Scenes: An airplane cabin, Phoebe has the aisle seat, Chandler the window, and Monica's stuck in that horrible middle seat.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So, so far is this trip to Vegas better or worse than the trip to London?ScenesChandler: So it's pretty much the same Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, what about after I give you these candies? (Hands them each one from her purse.)ScenesChandler: Yeah, I guess it's a little better now.ScenesPhoebe: Ah-ha! Okay, (takes out a notepad) Las Vegas 1, London 0! I'll be right back. (Gets up and heads aft.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Happy plane-aversary.ScenesMonica: Aww! I love you!ScenesChandler: Can I give you a present now?ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesChandler: Okay! (He grabs his carryon and starts rummaging through it.) Oh man! Don’t tell me I did this!ScenesMonica: I love the "I forgot the present" fake out!ScenesChandler: How do you feel about the, "I really did forgot the present, please forgive me" not fake out?ScenesMonica: Oh that's okay. Don’t worry about it, you can give it to me when we get back.ScenesChandler: Ohh that's the worse thing that can happen on an anniversary ever!ScenesPhoebe: (sitting down) Oh good! All right, so you decided to tell him about the Richard thing.ScenesChandler: What-what Richard thing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no. [The patented version.]ScenesChandler: What Richard thing?ScenesPhoebe: (To Monica under her breath) Simmons! Go with Simmons!ScenesMonica: Okay, I umm, I ran into Richard yesterday and he asked me if I wanted to go for a bite and I did. The only reason I didn't tell you is because I knew you'd get mad and I didn't want to spoil our anniversary.ScenesChandler: (talking out of the side of his mouth) I'm not mad.ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! Yeah, so you-you bumped into Richard! You grabbed a bite! It's no big deal. (He still ain't happy.)ScenesMonica: Great!Scenes(Pause.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, London 1…

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is coming out of the bathroom after a shower wearing only her bath robe, walks into the kitchen, and opens the fridge. As she bends over to grab a bottle of wine, her robe falls open (Damn this network primetime programming, we didn't see anything!) and she quickly closes it again. But then realizes she didn't have to do that. So she closes the fridge and stands next to the table, thinks about it for a little while and…]
rows.Content: Rachel: (takes off her robe) Oh! Look what happened! {Don't get your hopes up guys, we only get to see her from the back or from the neck up. Its times like these I wish that the networks would broadcast some nudity other than Denis Franz's butt.} (In her head.) Huh, check me out! I'm in my kitchen…naked! I'm picking up an orange. (Does so) I'm naked! (Goes into the living room) Lighting the candles, naked, and carefully. (She backs anything that might have a point like a candle on her body away.)Scenes[Cut to Ross's apartment, he's sitting by his window looking at an art book. As he's turning the page, he glances up and notices something.]ScenesRoss: (in his head) Oh my God! That's Rachel naked! I can't look at that! I am looking at this. (Looks back at his book.) Okay, vivid colors, expressive brush strokes—Unless she wants me to be looking at that. She knows I'm home. She knows I can see her. What kind of game is she playing? I think maybe someone's lonely tonight. Oh-ho, Dr. Geller! Stop it! You're being silly! Or, am I?Scenes[Cut back to Monica and Rachel's apartment, Rachel is singing along with a song and dancing while facing the big picture window. Y'know, I think I'd pay real good money to be on the other side of that window!]ScenesRachel: (singing) Love to love ya baby! Ow! Love to love ya baby! Ow! (There's a knock on the door, she turns off the music, puts on her robe, and goes to answer the door.) Love to love ya, baby! (There's another knock.) Darnit! (Looks through the peephole and turns on the lights.) Ugh. (She opens the door to Ross who's leaning against the door jam.)ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the scene is continued from where we left off before the break.]
rows.Content: Ross: May I come in?ScenesRachel: Uh, yeah, if you want too.ScenesRoss: Do you want me too?ScenesRachel: Yeah, sure?ScenesRoss: So do I. (Slowly walks in.) Okay Rach, before anything happens (He takes off his coat) I just want to lay down a couple of ground rules. (Turns back to face her.) This is just about tonight. I don't to go through with this if it's going to raise the question of "Us." (Rachel's confused) Okay? I just want this to be (Kicks off his left shoe) about what it is! (Kicks off the other one.)ScenesRachel: And um, what-what is that Ross?ScenesRoss: The physical act of love. (Hisses at her.)ScenesRachel: (laughs) What?! Are you crazy?ScenesRoss: Oh so-so you weren't trying to entice me just now with your-your nakedness?ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh God, you saw me?! Oh!ScenesRoss: You weren't trying to entice me with your nakedness.ScenesRachel: Noo!! No! You thought, you actually thought I wanted to have sex with you?!ScenesRoss: No! No! (Grabs his coat) No! (Grabs a shoe.) No-no-no-no. (Grabs the other one and heads for the door.)ScenesRachel: Ohh wow! I’m sorry, but Ross you kicked off your shoes!ScenesRoss: Can we, can we just forget this ever happened?ScenesRachel: Yes of course, absolutely! You're right. I'm sorry.ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesRoss: All right I guess I'm, gonna go pack. (Starts to leave)ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh wait! One more thing umm, do-do we still need to uh settle the question of "us?Scenes(Ross storms off embarrassed.)

rows.Scenes: Las Vegas, we have the typical glamour shots of Vegas, the Strip, slot machines, a couple other gaming tables all set to the tune of you guessed it, Money. Anyhoo, we finally get through that and watch Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe enter Caesar's Palace carrying their luggage.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey you guys wait! Guys! (Catches up to them.) This place is so much better than London! Okay? This lady dressed like Cleopatra gave me a coupon, 99 cent steak and lobster dinner. Huh!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you don't eat animals.ScenesPhoebe: For 99 cents, I'd eat you. (Sees the casino) Okay, I can totally settle down here. It's got everything I could ever want, including Joey! Look! (Points to Joey in his gladiator suit posing for a picture with two old ladies.) Oh! Look! Hi!ScenesChandler: Oh my God.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Joey! (They all head over to him, he spots them coming and panics.) Hey! Hey!! Wow! (She hugs him.)ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesChandler: Love your condoms my man.ScenesJoey: What-what are you guys doing here? I thought I told you not to come.ScenesPhoebe: Why are you dressed as a gladiator?ScenesJoey: Uhh, because I'm shooting a scene right now. Yeah, I uh, I play a gladiator. Uh, y'know what? Hold-hold on a second. (To no one in particular) Can we cut? Yeah, my-my friends are here, I'm gonna take a little break.ScenesMonica: Who are you talking too?ScenesJoey: They uh director. Uhh, her. (Points to an old woman standing behind him. Who glares at him and walks off.) All right, all right, it's not a gladiator movie. I work here.ScenesChandler: Why?! What happened?!ScenesJoey: Well, the movie got shutdown because they ran out of money, so I'm working here 'til it starts up again, if it ever does.ScenesMonica: I'm so sorry.ScenesJoey: Look, I'm sorry I didn't tell ya. (To Chandler) I'm sorry man.ScenesChandler: No-no, that's okay, apparently there's a new policy where we don't have to share everything with everybody.ScenesMonica: I knew you were not okay with that.ScenesPhoebe: So you're a gladiator! Wow!ScenesJoey: Yeah, what-what's going on?ScenesPhoebe: Monica had lunch with Richard.ScenesJoey: Dawson?!ScenesPhoebe: Noo! But that would've been so cool!ScenesChandler: No! Her boyfriend Richard!ScenesMonica: It meant nothing! Okay? After all this time, how can you not trust me?ScenesChandler: When you go lunching with hunky moustache men and don't tell me about it!ScenesMonica: You're right. I'm sorry. I should've told you.ScenesChandler: Thanks. (They hug.)ScenesJoey: Aww, there we go.ScenesPhoebe: I love Vegas!ScenesMonica: I promise you, next time I will absolutely tell you.ScenesChandler: (pushing her away from another hug) Next time?ScenesJoey: Ooh, so close.ScenesChandler: There's not gonna be a next time! You can not ever see him again!ScenesMonica: I can not see him? I mean, you can't tell me what to do!ScenesChandler: That's so funny, because I think I just did!ScenesMonica: Oh y'know what? If you're gonna be acting like this all night, I really, I don't even want to be around you.ScenesChandler: Fine with me!ScenesMonica: Fine! Happy Anniversary!ScenesJoey: Whoa! Whoa! Guys! Please! Come on! Come on! This is obviously just a big misunderstanding.ScenesMonica: No it is not!ScenesChandler: What are you talking…ScenesJoey: Hey-hey don't look at me! I just work here! (Walks away.)

rows.Scenes: An aircraft cabin, Ross and Rachel are on their way to Vegas.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (taking off her sweater) Okay umm, Ross? I'm-I'm really warm, so I'm going to be taking off my sweater. Now, I'm just letting you know that this is not an invitation to the physical act of love.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) Yep! That's hilarious!ScenesRachel: I'm sorry. I'm done. I'm done.ScenesRoss: Y'know, last night was embarrassing for you too.ScenesRachel: No, not really. I mean you've seen me naked hundreds of times.ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. But it was a first for the rest of my building.ScenesRachel: Okay. All right, that's true! But y'know I just don't embarrass that easily.ScenesRoss: What?! You totally get embarrassed!ScenesRachel: No, I don't! Ross, I think I'm just a more secure person than you are.ScenesRoss: Is that so?ScenesRachel: Yeah.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRoss: (loudly so that everyone can hear) Hey lady! I don't care how much you want it! Okay?! I am not gonna to have sex with you in the bathroom! (Rachel sinks lower on her chair trying to hide.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler's hotel room, he's sitting there with Joey who's talking about his helmet and running his hand through that feathery thing at the top.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, y'know in Roman times this was more than just a hat.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure! Sure! They would uh, they would scrub the floors with it! They would use it to get the mud off their shoe. And sometimes underneath the horse would get dirty so they would stick it right…ScenesChandler: (interrupting in the nick of time) Joey, I uh! I can't believe this is how I'm spending my anniversary.ScenesJoey: All right well, I'll take you someplace nice then. Look! A guy tipped me a hundred bucks today.ScenesChandler: Whoa!ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, he was playing blackjack for like an hour and he won $5,000. Can you believe that? $5,000!ScenesChandler: Y'know, if I won $5,000 I'd join a gym, y'know build up my upper body and hit Richard from behind with a stick! (Mimics it.)ScenesJoey: Wait a minute! Why don't I do what that guy did? I'll take this $100 and turn it into $5,000! And then I'll turn that into enough money to get my movie going again!ScenesChandler: Good luck!ScenesJoey: Chandler! I don't need luck. I have thought this through!ScenesChandler: I see.Scenes(Joey exits as Chandler shakes his head.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The casino bar, Phoebe and Monica are sitting at the bar, while Wayne Newton's signature song Danke Schoen is playing in the background.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to the bartender) Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks.ScenesMonica: I can't believe this! This is like the worst night ever!ScenesPhoebe: Y'know Monica you had a minor setback in your relationship with Chandler. Big deal! It's only Chandler. (Monica turns and stares at her.) I am so sorry.ScenesMonica: This is crazy! I mean, it's such a stupid argument. I don't even wanna see Richard again.ScenesPhoebe: So go fix it! Go find Chandler! He's probably up in your room! Tell him that you're sorry and that you love him.ScenesMonica: Y'know what? You're right Phoebe. You're right. Thank you! (Gets up to find Chandler.)ScenesPhoebe: Sure! (When Monica gets close to the door.) (Yelling) Yeah! Las Vegas, number one!Scenes[Cut to the casino, Monica is walking through it past the craps table when she notices a chip on the floor. She picks it up and heads to the table.]ScenesMonica: Anybody lose this? (Holds up the chip and the woman next to her shakes her head no.)ScenesThe Croupier: Comin' out. Place your bet. (Monica does so.) Dice are out. (The woman next to Monica rolls the dice.) Double or nothin'! Pay the front line! (Monica won and doubled the chip.)ScenesMonica: Hmm.

rows.Scenes: An airplane cabin, Ross and Rachel are both reading as a guy stops by their row.]
rows.Content: Guy: (To Rachel) So uh, I'm on my way back to the bathroom. (Ross giggles.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, all right. All right! Just keep walkin'! All right?Scenes(Ross keeps giggling and Rachel decides upon revenge. She gets up and kisses the rather large man in the seat in front of Ross on the back of his head. The guy turns around angrily.)ScenesRachel: Ross! What are you… I'm sorry sir. I just, I think he just really likes you.Scenes[Time lapse, Ross is drinking something and decides to get Rachel again.]ScenesRoss: (to the guy in the window seat next to him) Hey! Y'know that teacher who had a baby with her student? (He points at Rachel.)Scenes[Time lapse, Rachel pushes the flight attendant call button, takes Ross's drink, and spills it into his lap.]ScenesRoss: What the? What…ScenesRachel: (to the flight attendant who appears in record time. It was only seconds after Rachel pushed the call button was she there. Once again, more proof that TV isn't real, IRL she would've been waiting for the rest of the flight and by then Ross's pants would be dry.) Hi!ScenesThe Flight Attendant: Miss? May I help you?ScenesRachel: Yes, I'm sorry. Do you have any extra pants? Umm, my friend seems to have had a little accident.

rows.Scenes: Caesar's Palace Casino, Joey is approaching one of the blackjack tables on his quest to make enough money for his movie.]
rows.Content: Joey: (to the dealer) Can I change a hundred? (He hands him his chip.)ScenesBlackjack Dealer: Changing one hundred! (Gives him the change.) Good luck sir.ScenesJoey: (betting all 100) Let's ride.ScenesBlackjack Dealer: (Deals the cards) 13.ScenesJoey: Hit me! (He does so.) Ohh man! (Joey busts and loses all the money, but when the dealer starts to collect the cards Joey notices something.) Wait! (He holds his hand next to the dealer's hand.)Scenes[Cut to Chandler's room, Joey is relaying to Chandler his amazing discovery.]ScenesJoey: Chandler! You are not gonna believe this! I have found my identical hand twin!ScenesChandler: (totally confused) What?ScenesJoey: My identical hand twin!ScenesChandler: What's an identical hand twin?ScenesJoey: What's it sound like? It's a guy with my identical hands! It was incredible! Chandler, the dealer's hands were exactly like me! It-it was like looking at my hands in a mirror!ScenesChandler: Are you sure you weren't (pause) looking at your hands in a mirror?ScenesJoey: Don’t you see what this means?! I can forget about that stupid movie. I'm gonna be a millionaire!ScenesChandler: (totally confused) How?ScenesJoey: Look, I don't have it all worked out yet, but it's gotta mean big money! Come on! Identical hands!ScenesChandler: Again I must go back to, how?ScenesJoey: This is Vegas man! People will pay to see freaky stuff! Okay, how much would you pay to see this hand (Holds up his left hand) twice? Huh?ScenesChandler: (Pause) Y'know, I-I can't really put a price on that Joe.ScenesJoey: Hey, are you unsupporting me again?ScenesChandler: No! No! I support you 100%! I just didn't, I didn't get it right away. Y'know now I'm caught up! Identical hand twins! It's a million-dollar idea!Scenes(Joey starts to leave to embark on his genius moneymaking scheme, but is freaked out slightly when as he goes to open the door, there's a mysterious knock. He calms himself down and opens the door to reveal Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Pheebs!!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesJoey: I found my identical hand twin!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you are so lucky! (To Chandler) Hey! So, where's Monica? Did you guys make up?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesPhoebe: But she just came up here!ScenesChandler: That was Joey!ScenesPhoebe: I wonder where she is. That is so weird.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, she's probably talking to Richard.ScenesPhoebe: Would you stop that! Do you wanna know the first thing she said when she came back from her lunch with Richard? She didn't feel anything for him. She loves you!ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yes! Now, she feels terrible! She really wants to make up! You gotta find her.ScenesChandler: Okay. (He gets up and goes to find her.)ScenesPhoebe: Good. (After he leaves, she puts on Joey's gladiator helmet and checks herself out in the mirror) I should really start wearing hats!

rows.Scenes: Caesar's Palace Casino, Chandler is looking for Monica while Tom Jones's signature song is playing in the background (Getting the theme yet? Tom Jones, Wayne Newton, casinos… They're in Vegas people! Catch up!) It's Not Unusual, y'know, "It's not unusual to be loved by anyone! It's not unusual to have fun with anyone!   But when I see you hanging about with anyone, it's not unusual to see me cry!   I wanna die." Well, while that's playing he spots Monica playing craps and in victory hug the guy next to her. Chandler turns and walks out.]

That same plane cabin, Ross is working on a crossword puzzle and Rachel is asleep against his shoulder. She shifts a little bit and Ross suddenly gets an idea. An evil idea when he looks at his pen. Then we have a little time lapse, the plane has landed and everyone is disembarking. The flight attendant is saying bye-bye to everyone.]
rows.Content: The Flight Attendant: (to another passenger) Welcome to Las Vegas.Scenes(Rachel approaches and we see the fruits of Ross's evil plan. He has drawn a moustache and beard on Rachel. The flight attendant just ignores it.)ScenesThe Flight Attendant: (To Rachel) Thank you! (Not sure of herself) Enjoy your flight?ScenesRachel: Yes, I did. Thank you very much, it was excellent. (Disembarks)ScenesThe Flight Attendant: (To Ross) Hope you had a nice flight.ScenesRoss: Ohh, it was the best!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The casino, Ross and Rachel are entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: I think the check in is that way. (Points)ScenesRachel: Ahh.Scenes(A young boy sees Rachel, points, and starts laughing.)ScenesRachel: Hello! (She makes a face and the kid laughs harder. Finally, his parents drag him off.) Ohh, kids love me.ScenesPhoebe: (sees Ross and Rachel) Hey!ScenesRoss: Phoebe! (They hug.)ScenesPhoebe: You guys are here! Yay!ScenesRachel: Hi! (Hugs Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: (sees Rachel's face) What? Did you go to a costume party? Let me guess umm Pancho Vila? (Points at Rachel) and you're Bob Saget. (An old lady has sat down at the slot machine Phoebe was just at.)ScenesRachel: Pancho Vila?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! (Motions to her face, indicating all of Rachel's "make-up.")ScenesRachel: What are you talking about Pheebs? (Takes out her compact) I don't… (She gasps when she looks in the mirror and sees her face.) (To Ross) Oh my God, you drew on me?!ScenesRoss: Hey, you wet my pants!ScenesPhoebe: Whoa, what kind of party was this?ScenesRachel: Ross, I have been walking around like this since the plane! I can—you have so crossed a line. (Heads for the bathroom)ScenesRoss: Rach! Wait! The men's room is that way. (Points in the other direction. Rachel hits him with her purse and heads for the ladies room.)Scenes(The old lady at Phoebe's machine wins. Phoebe turns around in shock.)ScenesPhoebe: Ugh!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: That's like the third time that lady's won on a machine I was playing.ScenesRoss: Oooohhh, I'll bet she's one of those people.ScenesPhoebe: M-M-Mole people?ScenesRoss: What? No-no, a lurker.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. What's a lurker?ScenesRoss: Okay when you're playing a machine and it hasn't paid out, a lurker waits for you to give up and then…ScenesPhoebe: Kills you?ScenesRoss: No. They swoop in and steal your jackpot.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh!ScenesRoss: Uh-hmm.ScenesPhoebe: How do you know about this?ScenesRoss: My nana used to do it. That's how she paid for all my dance—karate lessons.ScenesPhoebe: Dance karate?ScenesRoss: Yes, it's a deadly but beautiful sport. (Does a karate chop, then does a little dance-type sway.)ScenesRachel: (returning with her purse covering her face) All right, it won't come off!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: It won't come off!ScenesRoss: Oh my God! Rach-Rach, are-are-are you sure?ScenesRachel: No, actually I took it off then I drew it back on.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey-hey-hey you made it!ScenesRoss: Joey!!ScenesJoey: All right! Hey-hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!!ScenesJoey: Who's your friend? He's hot! (Ross laughs and Rachel smacks him with her purse.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) Thanks man.ScenesRachel: Hi. (She hugs Joey.)ScenesRoss: Hey listen I uh, talked to Chandler, sorry about the movie.ScenesJoey: No, don't be sorry. I don't need it anymore. I found my identical hand twin!ScenesRoss: Your what?ScenesJoey: My identical hand twin! The person whose hands are exactly like mine! This thing is a gold mine!ScenesRoss: What?! That's not gonna make you any money!ScenesJoey: Okay. Well, if that's how you feel about it, fine! None of you get to live with me in my great big hand-shaped mansion! Except uh, you Pheebs. You can live in the thumb.

rows.Scenes: The craps table, Monica is on a big roll.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right baby, come on! (Rolls the dice) Yes! Yes! I am on fire!ScenesChandler: (walking by with his luggage) See you later Mon.ScenesMonica: Wait Chandler, what are you doing?!ScenesChandler: What does it look like? I'm going home.ScenesMonica: What? Wait! Why? (He turns and heads for the door and she chases after him.) Chandler! Chandler! Wait! I’m sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don't want me to see Richard again, I won't! He means nothing to me!ScenesChandler: Come on! I was there! (He's propped up with his hand on a statute of a naked guy. He winces and pulls his hand away.) I know he's the love of your life.ScenesMonica: Not any more.ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesMonica: Really! (They hug and kiss) All right? Let's forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. (She picks up his suitcase.) Okay, this is empty.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I wanted to make a dramatic scene, but I hate packing.

rows.Scenes: A blackjack table, it's the same one Joey's hand twin was working at, only he's not there anymore and has been replaced by a beautiful woman.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Uhh, hey. Where's the other guy?ScenesThe Woman Dealer: Which guy?ScenesJoey: He's kinda tall, dark hair, hand looks exactly like this. (Holds up his hand.) See?ScenesThe Woman Dealer: I don't know about the hands, but the guy that was here before me just went to the bathroom.ScenesJoey: Okay! (Walks away, then turns back.) How you doin'?ScenesThe Woman Dealer: Very busy.ScenesJoey: Right! Okay. (Heads for the bathroom.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's hotel room, Rachel is still trying to get the ink off and Ross is on the phone to the company. Wait a minute, why exactly are they sharing a hotel room? Didn't they like break-up or something? Did I miss a memo? Or maybe, it's just foreshadowing things to come. Who knows? Maybe the answer's at the bottom of the page. Then again, maybe it isn't and it's just one of those things TV writers just don't explain. Anyhoo…]
rows.Content: Ross: (on the phone) Yes, hello. I have a question. Umm, I used your pen to draw on my friend's face. (Listens) A beard and a moustache. (Listens and laughs) Thank you. (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) No, she didn't think so. (Listens) I know it's like (turns and sees Rachel staring at him and quickly changes the subject) anyway, umm well make-up didn't cover it and we've tried everything to get it off and nothing's worked. What-what do we do? (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Oh! Okay. (Listens) Okay, thank you! (Rachel gets excited at his tone.) (Hangs up the phone) Yeah, it's not coming off.ScenesRachel: What?! What else did he say?ScenesRoss: Umm, he said he thought I was funny. So…(Rachel stares at him.) Okay, look-look umm, let's just go downstairs, we'll have some fun, and you will forget all about it.ScenesRachel: Ross, no! There is no way I am leaving this room looking like this!ScenesRoss: Oh, come on! Rach, it's-it's not that bad.ScenesRachel: Ross, I am a human doodle!!ScenesRoss: Look, just because some idiot drew on your face doesn't mean you shouldn't have any fun! Okay? And besides, hey-hey-hey no one is even gonna look at you. Okay? This is Vegas! Hello! There are tons of other freaks here! (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) There are tons…of…freaks here. No other. No. Come on! No one will notice, I swear!Scenes(They both exit.)Scenes[Time lapse, they're both entering.]ScenesRoss: Okay, there was some staring and pointing.ScenesRachel: Okay, I need a, I need a drink! (Makes a beeline for the mini-bar.)ScenesRoss: Oh, hey y'know, they-they really overcharge you for that stuff. (Rachel glares at him.) But who cares?! Because it's all on me! (Rachel reaches into the fridge and pulls out two handfuls of those mini booze bottles.) (Watching her.) That is, one big drink!ScenesRachel: (she's finished reliving the fridge of its entire alcohol content.) Macadamia nut?ScenesRoss: (looking at the price list) Umm… Wow! That's-that's some pricey nut!ScenesRachel: Hm-mmm! (Opens the container)ScenesRoss: Really like those Macadamia nuts, huh?ScenesRachel: Nope! (She puts one in her mouth and spits it out, then does it again in another direction.)

rows.Scenes: The casino, Phoebe is playing on a slot machine. Suddenly the lurker sticks her head around the aisle of slot machines.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (seeing her) Get out of here you lurker! (She doesn't move) Go on! Get! (She throws a quarter at her.)ScenesChandler: (arm-in-arm with Monica) Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! You made up!ScenesMonica: Yeah, I couldn't be mad at him for too long.ScenesChandler: Yeah, she couldn't live without the Chan Love. (They start kissing.)ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, get a room.ScenesMonica: We have one.ScenesPhoebe: I know. Use it.

rows.Scenes: The Men's room, Joey is entering and sees his hand twin washing his hands.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh-oh-oh, yeah! (He grabs some towels and takes them to him.) That's right, you take good care of those babies!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Excuse me?ScenesJoey: It's me, Joey!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Do I know you?ScenesJoey: (holds up his hand) Joey!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Oh-ho, yeah. Yeah, the hand guy.ScenesJoey: Okay, so what are we going to do about this hand twin thing?!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Nothing?ScenesJoey: Look, you and I have been given a gift. Okay? We have to do something with it. Like-like, hand modeling! Huh? Or-or magic! And you know NASA's gonna wanna talk to us!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: (tries to leave) I have to get back to…ScenesJoey: (stopping him) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-whoa! We could have our own show! Y'know we could clap our hands together people will love it! Huh? And-and-and I wrote a song for us! (Singing, to the tune of This Land is Your Land) This hand is your hand! This hand is my hand! Oh wait, that's your hand! No wait, it's my hand!ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: That's okay. (Walks out.)ScenesJoey: (following him) But you haven't even heard the chorus!

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's room, Ross is drinking a beer while Rachel is examining herself in the mirror.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God, I'm starting to look like my great aunt, Muriel.ScenesRoss: (gets up) All right. Y'know what? We don’t have to go downstairs! We can bring Vegas up to us! (He grabs a deck of cards and pulls up a chair.) All right, come on, come on, we'll play some blackjack. Here we go. (Deals the cards.) 13.ScenesRachel: Hit me!ScenesRoss: (does so) Oohh, 23. (Rachel looks at him.) Which is what we play to at this casino! You win 10 dollars! (Holds out a ten.)ScenesRachel: I bet 20.ScenesRoss: You're right! (Gives her the twenty she won.)

rows.Scenes: The Craps Table, Monica is still on her roll, only this time Chandler's with her and she has a huge crowd of people around.]
rows.Content: Monica: (shaking the dice) A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! (Rolls the dice.) Yes!ScenesChandler: Yes! I've-I've never seen a roll like this in my life!ScenesMonica: That's right baby! Okay, what do I want now?ScenesChandler: Okay, ah umm, ah, a 8. Ah, a 6?ScenesMonica: Pick a number! That is your only job!ScenesChandler: 8. 8!ScenesMonica: Thank you!ScenesChandler: If you get this one, we buy everybody here a steak dinner!ScenesAll: Yay!!ScenesThe Croupier: 8!ScenesMonica: Yes!ScenesAll: Yay!!ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) We're not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?ScenesChandler: Noo!ScenesMonica: Okay, good! Okay, what do I want now?ScenesChandler: Ahh, ooh, try a hard 8.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Two fours.ScenesMonica: Okay. (Rolls the dice)ScenesThe Croupier: 8!:ScenesA Drunken Gambler: (To Chandler) Don't you let her go! You're a lucky guy!ScenesChandler: Thank you, Mister Drunken Gambler! Okay, you get this and uh, we get the biggest suite in the place! (Everyone cheers) Wait-wait-wait-wait! We (motions to Monica and him.) get the biggest suite in the place.ScenesMonica: All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on! (Rolls the dice.)ScenesChandler: (sees the roll) Yes!! I love you! I can't even remember what we were fighting about!ScenesMonica: Oh, that's because I had lunch with Rich—Me neither! Okay, what do I want now?ScenesChandler: Another hard 8.ScenesMonica: Hard 8?! We should call it easy 8!ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, I tell you what. You roll another hard eight; (pause) and we get married here tonight.ScenesDrunken Gambler: Go! Come on! Roll!ScenesAll: Roll-roll!!ScenesMonica: Shut up!! It just got interesting!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Craps table, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: What did you just say?ScenesChandler: You roll another hard eight and we get married here tonight.ScenesMonica: Are you serious?!ScenesChandler: Yes! I love you! I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.ScenesMonica: I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.ScenesChandler: Okay, so if an eight comes up, we take it as a sign and we do it! {Whoa! Where have I heard that before? Matthew Perry talking about signs in Las Vegas. I guess it must've been some movie I saw.} What do you say?ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesChandler: Okay! Come on! Let's go! All right!Scenes(She rolls the dice, but one bounces out of the table.)ScenesChandler: (spots one) Okay! That's a four! And where-where's the other one?ScenesDrunken Gambler: It went under the table.ScenesMonica: Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!ScenesChandler: All right!Scenes(He searches to his right; she searches to her left. They're both on their hands and knees when they spot the die. It's propped up against the table leg, and it's not lying flat. Both the four and the five are showing.)ScenesChandler: Here it is! Here it is!ScenesMonica: That could be a four or a five. It's your call.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesChandler: It's a four.ScenesMonica: I think so too.Scenes(Cue up the music as they move in and kiss. This time I think it's Perry Como, but I'm not sure. It's Everybody loves somebody, sometime! Everybody falls in love somehow! Something in your kiss, just told me, my sometime, is now!)

rows.Scenes: The slot machines, Phoebe is still feeding quarters into the one-armed bandit as the lurker peeks over the top of the machines.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh well, lost again. (She gets up and slowly moves away. The lurker scurries in and takes her spot, only this time Phoebe set a trap for her and catches her in the act.) That's it! You and me, outside!ScenesThe Lurker: I don't want to see you lose a chunk of that pretty blond hair!Scenes(They start smacking each other's cups, but Phoebe notices a security guard approaching.)ScenesPhoebe: Be cool! (They both pretend to have a nice conversation as the guard walks by, but after he leaves they both start fighting again.) Okay lady, your lurking days are over!ScenesThe Lurker: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, from now on everyone you lurk, I'm gonna lurk first! You move on to someone else, I'm gonna be one step ahead of you, every single time! And then I'll be on your ass every hour of every day 'til Monday, because that's when I go home. When do you leave?ScenesThe Lurker: Also Monday.ScenesPhoebe: What time? Maybe we can share a cab!

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel's room, they've pretty much consumed the entire mini-bar. Needless to say, they're feeling no pain and are still playing blackjack.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (She slows down with each one.)ScenesRoss: (runs out of cards) We need more cards.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and also we need more umm, drinks. Hold on a second. (Gets up but stumbles a little bit.) Whup, okay. (She makes it to the phone and picks it up, without dialing.) Hello! Vegas? Yeah, we would like some more alcohol, and y'know what else? We would like some more beers. Hello? Ohh, I forgot to dial!Scenes(They both start laughing. There's a knock on the door.)ScenesRoss: That must be our alcohol and beers! (Gets up to answer it.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Ohh, it's Joey! I love Joey! (Hugs him.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, I love Joey! Joey lives with a duck! (Goes and hugs Joey.)ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: Look-look-look you guys, I need some help! Okay? Someone is going to have to convince my hand twin to cooperate!ScenesRoss: I'll do it. Hey, whatever you need me to do, I'm your man. (He starts to sit down on the bed. There's one problem though, he's about two feet to the left of it. Needless to say, he misses and falls on his butt.) (Looking up at Joey.) Whoa-oh-whoa! Are you, are you okay?ScenesJoey: Yeah! I'm fine! Thanks! (He starts to leave, but gets an idea and stops.) Hey Rach, how you doin'?ScenesRachel: I'm doin' good, baby. How you doin'?ScenesJoey: Ross, don't let her drink anymore! (Exits)ScenesRoss: Ohh, here's that Macadamia nut!ScenesRachel: Ohhh!!ScenesRoss: (he puts it in his mouth) Nope! Something else. (Throws it back under the bed.)ScenesRachel: Oops! All right, so what do you want to do now?ScenesRoss: I wanna get out of the room! Y'know, I…I really miss downstairs.ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what? There's only one way I'm leaving this hotel room.Scenes[Cut to the casino, a very drunk and doodled on Rachel is walking arm in arm with an equally drunk and doodled on Ross are walking through the casino and greeting people on their way through. Ross has some whiskers and his nose colored in, along with his name on his forehead.]ScenesRoss: Well hello! I'm Ross!ScenesRachel: Good luck to ya!ScenesRoss: Excuse me sir, you've got a little something right here. (He points to the corner of his mouth and they both laugh.)Scenes(They've made their way to the statue of the naked man that Chandler was leaning against earlier.)ScenesRachel: Wow!ScenesRoss: (bowing) Hello!ScenesRachel: (bowing) Hello!ScenesRoss and Rachel: (bowing) Hello!Scenes(They both continue on and Ross meows like a cat.)

rows.Scenes: The slot machines, we see some guy not having any luck. Both Phoebe and the Lurker are lurking him and each stick their heads around the corner at different times This is all set to that Pink Panther song. Finally the guy gives up and walks past the lurker's position, thus giving her the advantage. She scurries in and quickly drops a coin in the slot before Phoebe gets there. Phoebe arrives slightly later and pulls the arm just after the lurker deposits the coin and wins.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I won! I won! I finally won!ScenesThe Lurker: I won! That was my quarter!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! Here! Take a hike toots! (Gives back her quarter.)Scenes(The security guard approaches.)ScenesThe Lurker: (to the guard) Excuse me, sir! This lady played my quarter, this is my money. (Motions to the jackpot.)ScenesThe Security Guard: (To Phoebe) Is that true miss?ScenesPhoebe: (quietly) Sells drugs to kids.ScenesThe Security Guard: What?!ScenesPhoebe: She sells drugs to kids. (The guard looks at the lurker.)ScenesThe Lurker: It was my quarter!ScenesThe Security Guard: (To Phoebe) Was it her quarter?ScenesPhoebe: How about we talk about this over dinner?ScenesThe Security Guard: Okay lady, you're out of here.ScenesPhoebe: No! No, you can't arrest me! No!! I won't go back! I won't go back to that hell hole!!ScenesThe Security Guard: I'm just taking you outside!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay. (Walks out.)

rows.Scenes: The Gift Shop, Monica and Chandler are entering.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, come on, I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.ScenesChandler: Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay! (Picks up a blue sweater.) Okay, here's something, here's something blue and new.ScenesMonica: You're so efficient. I love you!ScenesChandler: Let's go! (Starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: No-no-no! We need something old!ScenesChandler: Ohh, great, I have condom in my wallet I've had since I was twelve.ScenesMonica: That'll work!ScenesChandler: I don't think so.ScenesMonica: Okay, now we just need something borrowed!ScenesChandler: (looks around) Here just…take this. (Hands her the sweater.)ScenesMonica: That's stealing!ScenesChandler: No, we'll-we'll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.Scenes(She does so and it makes her look pregnant.)ScenesMonica: Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)ScenesChandler: Okay, one thing at a time. (They run out to get married.)

rows.Scenes: A blackjack table, Joey is moving in to try and get his hand twin (who's dealing) to join him in his evil plot to rule the world! "Join me, and together we'll rule the universe as father and son!" (Sorry, I had a little Star Wars creep in there—Ooh, I have a big spoiler for The Phantom Menace, Yoda lives at the end! Ha-ha, spoiled it! Now you don't have to see it!)]
rows.Content: Joey: (sitting down) Ahhh! (Slides his hands across the table.)ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Are you gonna play?ScenesJoey: No-no, I don't really have any money. Not yet, anyway… (Shakes his hands.)ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: You can't sit here if you're not gonna play.ScenesJoey: (throws down a small wad of money, and as his hand twin starts to unfold it, Joey once again brings attention to their special gift to the world. {Y'know, looking at it now, they really don't have that similar of hands. Joey's are bigger.}) Ooh-ho-ho! (The dealer stares at him and he stops.)ScenesPhoebe: (entering and sitting down at the table.) Hello. My name is Regina Phalange. I'm a businesswoman in town on business. Would you like to see my card? (Looks down) Ooh, what did I do with my file-a-facts? I must've left it in conference room B.ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: (To Joey) 14.ScenesJoey: Hit me! (He does so.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! May I just say that you two gentlemen have the exact same hands! They're identical! Now, I've never seen anything like that in the business world.ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Stop it!ScenesJoey: Uhh, Ms. Phalange, may I ask you a question as an impartial person at-at this table?ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Please stop it!ScenesJoey: Wouldn't you pay good money to see these identical hands showcased in some type of a uh, entertainment venue?ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: (To Joey) If you leave now, I will chop off my hand and give it too you!Scenes(The security guard from before approaches and Phoebe tries to turn her back on him.)ScenesThe Security Guard: (To Phoebe) Didn't I just throw you out of here?ScenesPhoebe: No, you threw out Phoebe. I'm Ms. Regina Phalange. Phalange!ScenesThe Security Guard: Come on, lady! (Starts to escort her out.)ScenesJoey's Hand Twin: Please, please take him too. (Motions to Joey.)ScenesJoey: Me?! Oh come on, man! You can't do this! Come on! (Being dragged out by the guard) I'm your hand twin!!

rows.Scenes: A Little White Chapel, Chandler and Monica are entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hello! One marriage please!ScenesMonica: Yep, we wanna get married!ScenesThe Attendant: Well, there's a service in progress. Have a seat.ScenesChandler and Monica: All right.Scenes(They both sit down.)ScenesChandler: (singing) Dum! Dum-dum-dum! Dum! Dum! Dum! Dum-dum-dum!ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesChandler: Oh, that's The Wedding March. Does, does that freak you out?ScenesMonica: No, only because that's the graduation song.Scenes(The real Wedding March begins playing from behind the closed doors of the chapel.)ScenesChandler: Okay! (Stands up) This is it! (Claps his hands) We're gonna get married!ScenesMonica: Are you sure you wanna do this?Scenes(Suddenly the doors burst open, and ROSS AND RACHEL COME OUT ARM-IN-ARM!!!!! And Rachel's carrying a bouquet!!! THEY GOT MARRIED!!!!)ScenesRoss: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross! (Throws some rice.)ScenesRachel: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel! (Throws some more rice.)Scenes(They storm out into the street.)ScenesRachel: Wait! (Gets her bearings) Okay!Scenes(She goes one way; he goes the other. The camera pans back to Chandler and Monica, and needless to say, they're standing there dumbstruck as The King's (Elvis Presley to the yougin's) Viva, Las Vegas begins to play. Sing along with me now, "Viva! Las Vegas! Vivaaaaaa! Vivaaaaa! Las Vegassssss!!" Fade to Black.)ScenesEnding CreditsScenes[That's all folks, no teaser; just the big cliffhanger for season 6. Yes, there will be a season 6, and it'll start again in September. Have a good summer everyone!]Scenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One After Ross Says RachelScenesWritten by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Wedding, continued from last season, the Minister is about to marry Ross and Emily.]
rows.Content: Minister: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. (Time lapse) Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross...ScenesRoss: I Ross...ScenesMinister: Take thee, Emily...ScenesRoss: Take thee, Rachel...(All his friends have looks of shock on their faces. He realizes what he said. Quickly he says.) Emily. (A slight chuckle.) Emily.ScenesMinister: (Looking and feeling awkward. he looks towards Emily.) Uhh...Shall I go on?ScenesRachel: (To the woman sitting in front of her) He-he said Rachel, right? Do you think I should go up there?ScenesEmily: Yes, yes, do go on.ScenesMinister: I think we’d better start again. Ross, repeat after me. I, Ross…ScenesRoss: I, Ross…ScenesMinister: Take thee, EM-I-LY…ScenesRoss: Take thee, (Glares at the Minister) Emily. (Chuckles) Like there’d be anybody else. (Emily is glaring at him.)ScenesMinister: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.ScenesRoss: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, until death parts us. Really, I do. Emily. (Points at her.)ScenesMinister: May I have the rings? (He is given the rings) Emily, place this ring on Ross’s finger as a symbol of your bond everlasting. (She jams the ring onto his finger) Ross, place this ring in Emily’s hand as a symbol of the love that encircles you forever.ScenesRoss: Happy too.ScenesMinister: Ross and Emily have made their declarations and it gives me great pleasure to declare them husband and wife.ScenesRoss: Yay!ScenesMinister: You may kiss the bride.Scenes(He goes to kiss her, but she isn’t very receptive of the kiss. She keeps avoiding him, until Ross finally gets to kiss her on her cheek.)ScenesMrs. Geller: (To Mr. Geller) This is worse than when he married the lesbian.Scenes(The band starts to play, and the recessional starts. Ross tries to take Emily’s hand, but she snatches it away from him.)ScenesEmily: Just keep smiling.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJoey: Well, that went well. Yeah.ScenesChandler: It could’ve been worse, he could’ve shot her.Scenes(Ross and Emily make it to the lobby.)ScenesRoss: (laughs) That uh, that was pretty funny. Wasn’t it?Scenes(Emily gives him a forearm shot across the stomach.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The Wedding reception, Ross and Emily are in the bathroom and Emily is yelling at him. Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are standing outside the doorway.]
rows.Content: Emily: (Yelling from inside the bathroom) You’ve spoiled everything! It’s like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!ScenesJoey: (To the gang) Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?ScenesRoss: (exiting the bathroom) That-that-that’s all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I’ll be right out here. (She slams the door in his face, to the gang) She’s just fixing her makeup.ScenesEmily: I hate you!!ScenesRoss: And, I love you!! (He walks into the living room)ScenesMr. Geller: Boy, bad time to say the wrong name, huh Ross?ScenesRoss: That’s true, thanks dad. (To All) People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!! (He starts to dance but stops when no one else joins him.)Scenes(Mrs. Waltham’s phone rings and she answers it.)ScenesMrs. Waltham: Yes, Waltham interiors.ScenesPhoebe: (On the phone, in New York) Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller’s personal physician, Dr. Philange.ScenesMrs. Waltham: Who?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I’ve discovered that Ross forgot to take his brain medicine, uh, now without it, uh, in the brain of Ross, uh women’s names are interchangeable, through-through no fault of his own.ScenesMrs. Waltham: Oh my God, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: No, not Phoebe, Dr. Philange. Oh no! You have it too!Scenes(Mrs. Waltham hangs up on her.)ScenesPhoebe: Hello?Scenes(Cut to Chandler and Monica at the buffet table.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Oh wow, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way but, I know we had plans to meet up tonight and, ugh, I’m just kinda worried about what it might do to our friendship.ScenesMonica: I know. How could we have let this happen?ScenesChandler: Seven times!ScenesMonica: Ugh! Well, y’know, we were away…ScenesChandler: In a foreign, romantic country…ScenesMonica: I blame London.ScenesChandler: Bad London! (Takes a spoon and smacks the turkey.)ScenesMonica: So look umm, while we’re st-still in London, I mean, we can keep doing it right?ScenesChandler: Well, I don’t see that we have a choice. But, when we’re back home, we don’t do it.ScenesMonica: Only here.ScenesChandler: Y’know, I saw a wine cellar downstairs…ScenesMonica: I’ll meet you there in two minutes.ScenesChandler: Okay!Scenes(He throws down his plate and runs to the wine cellar, Monica is about to follow him but is intercepted by Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Mon, honey, I gotta ask you something.ScenesMonica: (impatiently) Now?ScenesRachel: Ross said my name up there, I mean, come on, I just can’t pretend that didn’t happen can I?ScenesMonica: Oh, I-I don’t know.ScenesRachel: Monica, what should I do?ScenesMonica: Just uh, do the right thing. (Uses some breath spray)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box! (Tries to leave, but is stopped by Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Whoa, wait, listen, I think I’m just gonna talk to Ross about what he think it meant.ScenesMonica: Wait. Rachel, no, he’s married. Married! If you don’t realize that, I can’t help you.ScenesRachel: Okay, you’re right. You’re right. You can’t help me.Scenes(Cut to Mr. and Mrs. Geller.)ScenesMrs. Geller: Jack, is it all our fault? Were we bad parents?ScenesMr. Waltham: (walking by) Yes.ScenesMr. Geller: Oh yeah, well who serves steak when there’s no place to sit, I mean how are you supposed to eat this?ScenesJoey: Hey, what’s up? (He has solved the problem of eating the steak, he’s eating it with his hands.)Scenes(Cut to Monica and Chandler, Monica is running up to him.)ScenesMonica: Where were you? We were supposed to meet in the wine cellar?ScenesChandler: Forget it, that’s off.ScenesMonica: Why?!ScenesMr. Waltham: (drunkenly) The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes…Scenes(Joey walks up to them.)ScenesMonica: Joey, what are you doing? You promised Phoebe you wouldn’t eat meat until she has the babies!ScenesJoey: Well, I figured we’re in another country, so it doesn’t count.ScenesMonica: That’s true.ScenesChandler: The man’s got a point.Scenes(Cut to Rachel and Ross.)ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi. Sorry, things aren’t working out so well.ScenesRoss: Oh no! It could be better, but it’s gonna be okay, right?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! Of course, I mean, she’s gonna get over this, y’know? I mean, so you said my name! Y’know you just said it ‘cause you saw me there, if you’d have seen a circus freak, you would’ve said, "I take thee circus freak." Y’know, it didn’t mean anything, it’s just a mistake. It didn’t mean anything. Right?ScenesRoss: No! No! Of course it didn’t mean anything! I mean, uh well, I can understand why Emily would think it meant something, y’know, because-because it was you…ScenesRachel: Right…ScenesRoss: But it absolutely didn’t. (Yelling towards the bathroom) It didn’t!! It didn’t!!ScenesJoey: (approaching) Ross, hey, the band’s ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so…ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) Oh! Oh-oh, the band’s ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says—I don’t care about the stupid band!!ScenesJoey: You spit on me man!
