(They go into Monica's room.)ScenesRachel: (going through the mail) Oh look! A letter from my mom.ScenesRoss: So, Rach, y'know-y'know how Emily's coming right?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! I know.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom, Chandler is trying to listen through the door.]ScenesPhoebe: (To Chandler) Can you hear anything?ScenesChandler: Oh yes, somebody just said, "Can you hear anything?Scenes(Joey is bent over at the waist and is looking for something under Monica's bed.)ScenesMonica: Hey, Joey's ass! What are you doing?ScenesJoey: (holding a box) Well, remember when they got in that big fight and broke up and we were all stuck in her with no food or anything? Well, when Ross said Rachel at the wedding, I figured it was gonna happen again, so I hid this in here.ScenesMonica: Ooh, candy bars, crossword puzzles…ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, Madlibs, mine! (Grabs it.)ScenesChandler: Condoms?ScenesJoey: You don't know how long we're gonna be in here! We may have to repopulate the Earth.ScenesChandler: And condoms are the way to do that?Scenes[Cut to the living room.]ScenesRoss: Anyway it-it kinda-it all boils down to this, the last time I talked to Emily…ScenesRachel: (interrupting) Oh my God! My dog died!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Le Poo, our dog!ScenesRoss: Le Poo's still alive?!ScenesRachel: Oh God, it says he was hit by an ice cream truck and dragged for nine-(turns over the note)-teen blocks. Oh. (They all come out from Monica's bedroom) Oh my God.ScenesMonica: Sweetie, we heard you crying. Please don't cry.ScenesRachel: It's Le Poo.ScenesPhoebe: I know it's le poo right now, but it'll get better.

rows.Scenes: Atlantic City, New Jersey, Chandler and Monica are about to start their weekend of sex, sex, nothing but sex.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (jumping on the bed) I can't believe it! We're here!ScenesMonica: Ooh, chocolates on the pillows! I love that!ScenesChandler: Oh, you should live with Joey, Roll-os everywhere.ScenesMonica: Come here. (He does, and they kiss.) Okay, be right back.Scenes(Goes to the bathroom and Chandler turns on the TV and finds a high-speed police chase.)ScenesChandler: Oh yes! Monica, get in here! There's a high-speed car chase on!Scenes(Monica returns, carrying a glass.)ScenesMonica: We're switching rooms.ScenesChandler: (looks at what she's holding and shies away) Oh dear God, they gave us glasses!ScenesMonica: No, they gave us glasses with lipstick on them! I mean, if they didn't change the glasses, who knows what else they didn't change. (He glares at her.) Come on sweetie, I just want this weekend to be perfect, I mean we can change rooms, can't we?ScenesChandler: Okay, but let's do it now though, because Chopper 5 just lost it's feed! (He grabs their bags and sprints out.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is trying to tell Rachel about Emily's ultimatum again.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, so uh, y'know how there's something I wanted to talk to you about?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! (Turns to face him.)ScenesRoss: Well, y'know how I'm trying to work things out with Emily. Well, there's this one thing… Okay, (Rachel has her back turned to the camera, and Ross isn't looking at her.) here goes. I made a promise that-(they cut to the other camera and Ross notices something coming out of Rachel's nose)-Oh hey!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: You're nose is bleeding!ScenesRachel: Oh God. (He hands her some tissues.) No! Oh not again! (Wiping her nose.) This-this happened when my grandfather died. It's ugh! Sorry. (She puts her head back.) Oh, okay, so I'm sorry, what-what were you-what did you want to tell me?ScenesRoss: Umm… (Rachel blows her nose.)ScenesRachel: Sorry. Sorry.ScenesRoss: Okay, I uh, I can't see you anymore.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know. It's ridiculous! I can't see you either.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's weekend, a hotel clerk is showing them their new room.]
rows.Content: Hotel Clerk: I think you'll find this room more to your liking.ScenesChandler: Okay, great. (He grabs the remote and turns on the TV to the chase.)ScenesHotel Clerk: (watching the chase) They say he's only got half a tank left.ScenesChandler: Half a tank? We still got a lot of high-speed chasing to do!ScenesMonica: We're switching rooms again.ScenesChandler: What? Why?ScenesMonica: This is a garden view room, and we paid for an ocean view room.ScenesHotel Clerk: Our last ocean view room was unacceptable to you.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Excuse me, umm, can I talk to you over here for just a second?ScenesChandler: Uh-huh. (He doesn't take his eyes off the TV.)ScenesMonica: Chandler!ScenesChandler: (turning to face her) Yeah.ScenesMonica: Look, these clowns are trying to take us for a ride and I'm not gonna let 'em! And we're not a couple of suckers!ScenesChandler: I hear ya, Mugsy! But look, all these rooms are fine okay? Can you just pick one so I can watch-(realizes)-have a perfect, magical weekend together with you.Scenes[Time lapse, Monica and Chandler have changed rooms yet again.]ScenesMonica: Okay, this one I like!ScenesChandler: (watching TV, in fact, ER is on.) Nothing! It's over! Dammit! This is regularly scheduled programming!ScenesMonica: Can we turn the TV off? Okay? Do we really want to spend the entire weekend like this?ScenesChandler: Oh, I'm sorry, am I getting in the way of all the room switching fun?ScenesMonica: Hey, don't blame me for wigging tonight!ScenesChandler: Oh, who should I blame? The nice bell man who had to drag out luggage to 10 different rooms?ScenesMonica: I don't know, how about the idiot who thought he could drive from Albany to Canada on a half a tank of gas!ScenesChandler: Do not speak ill of the dead.ScenesMonica: We're supposed to uh, be spending a romantic weekend together, it-it, what is the matter with you?ScenesChandler: I just want to watch a little television. What is the big deal? Geez, relax mom.ScenesMonica: What did you say?ScenesChandler: I said, "Geez, relax Monnnnn.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading a magazine and has two tissues stuck up her nose in an attempt to stop the bleeding and as she hears Ross enter, she quickly hides her face behind the magazine and removes the tissues.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey. Rachel, I-I-I've been wanting to tell you something for a while now and I really, I just have to get it out.ScenesRachel: Okay, what's up?ScenesRoss: Okay, y'know how you told me I should do whatever it takes to fix my marriage?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I told you to give Emily whatever she wants.ScenesRoss: And while that was good advice, you should know that what-what she wants…ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesRoss: …is for me not to see you anymore.ScenesRachel: That's crazy! You can't do that! What are you going to tell her? (Pause) (Realizes) Oh God. Ohh, you already agreed to this, haven't you?ScenesRoss: It's awful I know, I mean, I feel terrible but I have to do this if I want my marriage to work. And I do, I have to make this marriage work. I have too. But the good thing is we can still see each other until she gets here.ScenesRachel: Ohh! Lucky me! Oh my God! That is good news, Ross! I think that's the best news I've heard since Le Poo died!ScenesRoss: You have no idea what a nightmare this has been. This is so hard.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, really? Is it Ross? Yeah? Okay, well let me make this a just a little bit easier for you.ScenesRoss: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Storming out!ScenesRoss: Rachel, this is your apartment.ScenesRachel: Yeah, well that's how mad I am!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is returning from his disastrous weekend. He throws his bag down and sits down on one of the leather chairs, but he sits on something and picks it up and throws it away.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Damn Rollos!ScenesJoey: Hey, you're back!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: How was your conference?ScenesChandler: It was terrible. I fought with (Pause) my colleagues y'know, the entire time. Are you kidding with this? (Throws away another Rollo)ScenesJoey: Oh, so your weekend was a total bust?ScenesChandler: Uh, no, I got to see Donald Trump waiting for an elevator.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey, you're back too!ScenesMonica: Yeah. Umm, Chandler can I talk to you outside for a second?ScenesJoey: Hey, how was your chef thing?ScenesMonica: Oh, it was awful. (To Chandler) I guess some people just don't appreciate really good food.ScenesChandler: Well, maybe it was the kind of food that tasted good at first but then made everybody vomit and have diarrhea.ScenesMonica: Chandler! (Motions for him to come outside.)ScenesChandler: Monica. (Follows her out.)Scenes[In the hall.]ScenesMonica: Okay, I'd like to know how much the room was because I'd like to pay my half.ScenesChandler: Okay, fine, $300.ScenesMonica: 300 dollars?!ScenesChandler: Yeah, just think of it as $25 per room!ScenesMonica: Urghh!!ScenesJoey: (sticking his head out the door) What are you guys woofing about?ScenesMonica: Chandler stole a twenty from my purse!ScenesJoey: Nooooo!!! Y'know what? Now that I think about it, I constantly find myself without twenties and you always have lots!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is drinking some Alka-Seltzer. The rest of the gang, minus Rachel is there as well.]
rows.Content: Ross: You should've seen the look on her face. I don't want Rachel to hate me! I don't know what to do.ScenesJoey: You want my advice?ScenesRoss: Yes! Please!ScenesJoey: You're not gonna like it.ScenesRoss: That's okay.ScenesJoey: You got married to fast.ScenesRoss: That's not advice!ScenesJoey: I told ya.ScenesRoss: I'm going to the bathroom. (Gets up and exits.)ScenesJoey: Man, if anyone asked me to give up any of you, I couldn't do it.ScenesChandler and Phoebe: Yeah, me either.ScenesMonica: Maybe I could do it.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi!ScenesJoey: Hi, Rach.ScenesChandler: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesRachel: Look, I know you guys heard about the whole thing with me and Ross but y'know, I've been obsessing about it all day and I'd just love not to talk about it. All right?ScenesJoey: I-I-I don't know if this falls under this category, but uh, Ross is right back there. (Points over his shoulder.)ScenesRachel: That's not Ross!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! Not that guy! He does look like him though.ScenesChandler: Okay, Ross is in the bathroom.ScenesRachel: Oh my God, its happening. It's already started. I'm Kip.ScenesJoey: Hey, you're not Kip!ScenesRachel: (To Joey) Do you even know who Kip is?ScenesJoey: Who cares? You're Rachel! (To Chandler) Who's Kip?ScenesChandler: Kip, my old roommate, y'know we all used to hang out together.ScenesJoey: Oh, that poor bastard.ScenesRachel: See? Yeah, you told me the story. He and Monica dated when they broke up they couldn't even be in the same room together and you all promised that you would stay his friend and what happened? He got phased out!ScenesMonica: You're not gonna be phased out!ScenesRachel: Well, of course I am! It's not gonna happen to Ross! He's your brother. (To Chandler) He's your old college roommate. Ugh, it was just a matter of time before someone had to leave the group. I just always assumed Phoebe would be the one to go.ScenesPhoebe: Ehh!!ScenesRachel: Honey, come on! You live far away! You're not related. You lift right out.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey, Mr. Bing. That uh, hotel you stayed at called. Said someone left an eyelash curler in your room.ScenesChandler: Yes that was mine.ScenesJoey: 'Cause I figured you'd hooked up with some girl and she'd left it there.ScenesChandler: Yes that would have made more sense.ScenesJoey: Y'know, I-I don't even feel like I know you anymore man! All right, look, I'm just gonna ask you this one time. And whatever you say, I'll believe ya. (Pause.) Were you, or were you not on a gay cruise?!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on couch and Rachel is getting some coffee. Phoebe keeps turning her head from to keep from looking at Rachel.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Phoebe? (She turns her head further away.) I'm sorry about the whole lifting out thing. (Moves over next to her.) You gotta come with me!ScenesPhoebe: Come where?ScenesRachel: Wherever I go. Come on you and me, we'll-we'll start a new group, we're the best ones.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but try and get Joey too.ScenesRoss: (entering) Pheebs, you mind if I speak to Rachel alone for a sec?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, sure! (She gets up to leave.) Bye Ross! (Whispering behind his back.) Forever.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi. What are you doing here? Isn't this against the rules?ScenesRoss: I talked to Monica, look, I'm the one who made the choice. I'm the one who's making things change, so I should be the one to y'know, step back.ScenesRachel: Oh, Ross…ScenesRoss: No, no, it's okay. Really. They're plenty of people who just see their sisters at Thanksgiving and just see their college roommates at reunions and just see Joey at Burger King. So is, is that better?ScenesRachel: No, it's not better. I still don't get to see you.ScenesRoss: Well, what-what would you do? Rach, if you were me, what-what would you do?ScenesRachel: Well, for starters I would've said the right name at my wedding!ScenesRoss: I can't believe this is happening.ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesRoss: I am so sorry.ScenesRachel: I know that too.ScenesJoey: (entering) (He clears his throat to get their attention.) Hey, Rach? Sorry to interrupt but umm, Phoebe wanted me to talk to you about a trip or something.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is doing a crossword puzzle.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesChandler: I just came over to drop off…nothing. So that weekend kinda sucked, huh?ScenesMonica: Yeah, it did.ScenesChandler: So, I guess this is over.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Well, y'know, you and me, it had to end sometime.ScenesMonica: Why, exactly?ScenesChandler: Because of the weekend, we had a fight.ScenesMonica: Chandler that's crazy! If you give up every time you'd have a fight with someone you'd never be with anyone longer than—Ohhh! (They both realize something there.)ScenesChandler: So, this isn't over?ScenesMonica: (laughs) You are so cute! No. No, it was a fight. You deal with it and move on! It's nothing to freak out about.ScenesChandler: Really? Okay. Great!ScenesMonica: Ohh, welcome to an adult relationship! (She goes to kiss him.)ScenesChandler: (stops her) We're in a relationship?ScenesMonica: I'm afraid so.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(They kiss.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh hey, Monica, I heard you saw Donald Trump at your convention.ScenesMonica: Yeah, I saw him waiting for an elevator.Scenes(Joey thinks that sounds familiar, but dismisses the thought.)ScenesMonica: Hey, Rach, can I borrow your eyelash curler, I think I lost mine.ScenesRachel: Yeah, it's in there. (Points to the bathroom.)Scenes(Joey puts two and two together.)ScenesJoey: (shocked) Oh! Ohh! Oh!!ScenesChandler: Joey, can I talk to you for a second? (He grabs him and starts to drag Joey into Monica's room.)ScenesJoey: Oohh!! Ohh! Oh-oh-oh! Oh-oh!!Scenes(Chandler pushes him through the door and Monica closes it behind them.)Scenes[Cut to Monica's room, Chandler tackles Joey onto her bed and tries to cover his mouth.]ScenesJoey: Ohhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes. (Lets him up.)ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) You?! (To Monica) And-and you?!ScenesMonica: Yes, but you cannot tell anyone! No one knows!ScenesJoey: How?! When?!ScenesChandler: It happened in London.ScenesJoey: IN LONDON!!!ScenesChandler: The reason we didn't tell anyone was because we didn't want to make a big deal out of it.ScenesJoey: But it is a big deal!! I have to tell someone!Scenes(They both grab him and stop him.)ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no-no! You can't!ScenesMonica: Please? Please?! We just don't want to deal with telling everyone, okay? Just promise you won't tell.Scenes(Joey thinks it over.)ScenesJoey: All right! Man, this is unbelievable! I mean, it's great, but…ScenesMonica: I know, it's great!Scenes(She goes over and kisses Chandler.)ScenesJoey: Aww, I don't want to see that!Scenes[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel.]ScenesPhoebe: We're so stupid! Do you know what's going on in there? They're trying to take Joey!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, minus Ross are playing Madlibs. Phoebe is reading hers.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: The most popular Phoebe in tennis is called the overhand Phoebe. And if you win, you must slap your opponent on the Phoebe and say, "Hi, Phoebe!ScenesMonica: Oh that's cute! We really all enjoyed it. But y'know, it doesn't count.ScenesPhoebe: Count for what?ScenesMonica: Count in our heads as-as good Madlibs.Scenes(They putting their notepads down and get up to leave.)ScenesJoey: I guess I'm done.ScenesChandler: Fun's over!ScenesMonica: Wait-wait, guys! If-if we follow the rules, it's still fun and it means something!ScenesRachel: Uh-huh!ScenesJoey: I think I'm gonna take-off.ScenesMonica: Guys, rules are good! Rules help control the fun! (They all leave and close the door on Monica.) Ohhh! (Throws her notepad down in disgust.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The YetiScenesWritten by: Alexa JungeScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Monica and Chandler are making out on one of the chairs.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! None of that, not while you're living under my roof!ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesJoey: Look, just because I know about you two, doesn't mean I like looking at it.ScenesChandler: Aren't you supposed to be at an audition for another hour?ScenesJoey: Well, I'm sorry if I'm not a middle-aged black woman! (Starts for his room.) And I'm also sorry if sometimes I go to the wrong audition! Okay, look, if I have to pretend I don't know about you two, then you two are gonna have to pretend there's nothing to know about.ScenesChandler and Monica: Okay.ScenesMonica: Sorry.ScenesChandler: Sorry.Scenes(They wait for Joey to go into his room and close the door and then start making out again.)ScenesJoey: (from the bedroom) I can hear that!ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Rachel's at work.Scenes(They both go to her apartment.)Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: I can still hear you!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, and Monica are there as Phoebe enters carrying a large box.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hello!ScenesMonica: Hey, what's that?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, my mom sent me a family heirloom that once belonged to my grandmother. Can you believe it?! A year ago I didn't even have a family, and now I have heirlooms for crying out loud.Scenes(She puts her leg up on the chair and removes this huge knife from her boot to open the box with. The guys are shocked at the knife's existence.)ScenesPhoebe: Eeeee-(She opens the box and removes its contents and sees that it's a fur coat.)-ohh!! God! (She throws it at Joey.)ScenesJoey: Argh-argh!! (Catches the coat.) Ooh, soft. Is this mink?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Why would my mother send me a fur? Doesn't she know me but at all! Plus, I have a perfectly fine coat that no innocent animal suffered to make!ScenesChandler: Yeah, just some 9-year-old Filipino kids who worked their fingers bloody for 12 cents an hour. (Phoebe stares at him wide-eyed. Chandler sees her reaction.) That didn't happen, I made that up!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesGunther: Oh, Ross? Ross! You can't put up flyers in here.ScenesRoss: How come? Everybody else does.ScenesGunther: You can't.ScenesMonica: What is that?ScenesRoss: Oh, umm, I'm just getting rid of a couple of things.ScenesMonica: (looking at the flyer) This is all of your things.ScenesRoss: Yes, yes it is! No, but it's good it's—Emily thinks we should get all new stuff. Stuff that's just ours, together. Y'know brand new.ScenesMonica: So basically, this is a getting-rid-of-everything-Rachel-ever-used sale.ScenesRoss: Touched. Used. Sat on. Sleep on.ScenesGunther: I'll take it all.ScenesJoey: Hey, Ross, you're okay with that?ScenesRoss: Look, if I can just do what Emily wants and get her to New York, I'm sure everything will be fine.ScenesChandler: Okay, but don't you think this is a little extreme?ScenesRoss: After what I did? Can you blame her?ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! You got off easy! When my friend Silvie's husband said someone else's name in bed, she cursed him and turned his thingy green.Scenes(Ross suddenly gets up and heads for the bathroom.)ScenesJoey: (after Ross is gone) What is he doing? What, Emily, thinks Ross's furniture has got Rachel coodies?ScenesMonica: Now calm down Joey.ScenesJoey: No! Everything's gettin' all messed up, y'know? Emily won't let Ross see Rachel, we're not gonna stop seeing Rachel, hence Ross stops seeing us!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I hate this. Everything's changing.ScenesChandler: Yeah I know, we're losing Ross, Joey said hence…ScenesMonica: Look, I'm not happy about this either, but y'know if-if Ross says he's happy then we're just gonna have to keep our feelings about Emily to ourselves. Are you cool with that?ScenesJoey: No! But y'know, I'm an actor, I'll act cool.

rows.Scenes: The Storage Room in the basement of Monica and Rachel's building, Monica and Rachel are looking for something.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh, whoa God! Storage rooms give me the creeps! Monica, come on please hurry up honey! Please?ScenesMonica: Rachel, if you want the little round waffles, you gotta have to wait until I find the little waffle iron.ScenesRachel: I want the little round waffles.ScenesMonica: All right. (Looking through a box.) Op, here it is! Right underneath the can of-of bug bomb. I wonder if the best place to put something that cooks food is underneath the can of poison?Scenes(The single light flickers and goes out. Leaving the room in total darkness.)ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what? I'll-I'll have toast!Scenes(She starts to run out but is stopped by a figure looming out of the darkness carrying a pick axe.)ScenesRachel: Arghhhh!!!!!!Scenes(They both start screaming at the top of their lungs.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Fog him! Fog him!Scenes(Rachel grabs the bug bomb, activates it, throws it at the figure, and they both run out through the fog.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I don't know what I'm gonna do about this coat.ScenesJoey: I'll take it!ScenesPhoebe: That might work! (She gives him the coat.)ScenesJoey: Ooh-ooh-ooh, yeah! (He drapes it around his shoulders.) Enh? All right, what do you think?ScenesChandler: You're on in 5 Ms. Minnelli.ScenesRoss: (on the phone) No-no-no, it's just a bit sudden. (Listens) No, it's great. Okay? I'm totally on board. I love you too, all righty. Bye. (Hangs up.)ScenesJoey: What's the matter Ross?ScenesRoss: Nothing. Oh, actually, great news! I just got off the phone with Emily and it looks like I'm moving to a new apartment. Woo-hoo!ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesRoss: Well, her thought is, and I agree, fresh new furniture, why not a fresh new apartment? Her cousin has this great place to sublet, it's got a view of the river on one side and Columbia on the other.ScenesJoey: That's way uptown! That's like three trains away! (Phoebe pinches him.) Which is great! I love to ride that rail!ScenesChandler: So you're really okay with this?ScenesRoss: Yes! Yes! I mean it's-it's kinda far from work, but uh, y'know, I'll get so much done on the commute. I-I've been given the gift of time!ScenesChandler: Now that's so funny, because last Christmas I got the gift of space. We should get them together and make a continuum.Scenes(Ross exits.)ScenesJoey: Now he's movin'? Man, what is Emily doing to him? (Phoebe pinches him again.) Ow!! He's not even here!!!Scenes(Monica and Rachel enter breathless.)ScenesRachel: You guys! You guys!ScenesMonica: We were, we were just in the storage area and we saw this really creepy man!ScenesRachel: It was like this crazy-eyed, hairy beast man! He was like a, like a bigfoot or a yeti or something!ScenesMonica: And he came at us with an axe, so Rachel had to use a bug bomb on him!ScenesRachel: (proud of herself) Yeah, I-I-I just pulled the tab and I just fogged his yeti ass!ScenesJoey: Uhh, like dark hair, bushy beard?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Yeah, you fogged Danny.ScenesRachel: Please! We did not fog Danny! Who's Danny?ScenesJoey: Dan just moved in downstairs. Yeah, he just got back from like this four-month trek in the Andes. Nice fella.ScenesMonica: Oh he's nice. He's nice! Y'know, you always stick up for the people we fog!

rows.Scenes: Their Building, Monica and Rachel are going to apologize to Danny. Rachel knocks on his door, which he opens and he has this really bushy beard and long hair. Picture Paul Bunyan.]
rows.Content: Danny: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Hi! You might not remember us, but we are the girls that fogged you.ScenesMonica: We're-we're really sorry we fogged you.ScenesDanny: Okay.Scenes(He closes the door. Rachel's not happy with that and knocks again. He opens the door.)ScenesRachel: Hi! Just so you know, we-we didn't mean to fog you, we thought you were like a yeti or something.ScenesDanny: Okay.Scenes(He closes the door again. Once again, Rachel knocks (harder this time) and he answers it.)ScenesDanny: Yesss?ScenesRachel: Hi! Sorry to bother you, but I don't think we can accept your acceptance of our apology, it just doesn't really seem like you mean it.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesDanny: O-kay!Scenes(He closes the door before Rachel can say anything.)ScenesMonica: Wow! That guy is so rude!ScenesRachel: Really! What is with that guy? I mean you'd forgive me if I fogged you.ScenesMonica: Well you did a little bit.ScenesRachel: Oh my God, honey, I'm so sorry!ScenesMonica: I totally forgive you!ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesMonica: Yes!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is making a drink as Phoebe enters with the fur coat.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: So listen, you know my friend Chris who owns the crematorium?ScenesMonica: Crematorium Chris? Sure!ScenesPhoebe: He says, that he would cremate my fur coat for free if I umm, y'know, bring in the next person I know who dies.Scenes(Rachel enters from the bathroom and sees the coat.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Oh my God, look at these pelts!ScenesMonica: Don't get too attached, she's having it cremated.ScenesRachel: What? Uhh, Phoebe, honey, honey, I know you're quirky and I get a big kick out of it, we all do actually, but if you destroy a coat like this that is like a crime against nature! Not nature, fashion!ScenesPhoebe: This is fashion?! (Grabs the coat from Rachel.) Okay, so to you, death is fashion?! That's really funny. (She puts the coat on and starts to model it.) Here's Phoebe umm, sporting uh, y'know, cutting edge hairy carcass from y'know, the steal traps of wintry Russia. I mean, you really thing this looks good? (Sees herself in the mirror.) 'Cause I do.

rows.Scenes: Ross's Apartment, the gang is helping Ross move out by carrying boxes. Chandler has picked a particularly large and apparently heavy box, because he takes a running start at it and still can't budge it.]
rows.Content: Ross: (on phone) I know I miss you too. I can't wait to see you. I love you. Bye. (Hangs up.)ScenesChandler: Okay, what is in here? Rocks?ScenesRoss: No-no, this is my collection of fossil samples.ScenesChandler: So, rocks.Scenes(He picks up a smaller box and carries it to the moving van as Joey returns.)ScenesRoss: I'm really gonna miss this apartment. Y'know, Ben-Ben took his first steps right over there. (Points.)ScenesJoey: Ohh. Hey, remember when I ran into this thing (The shutters that close off the kitchen.) and it kinda knocked me out a little?ScenesRoss: I loved this place! To tell you the truth, I wish I didn't have to move.ScenesJoey: Uhh, are you saying that you're not entirely happy about this?ScenesRoss: Well, I mean if uh, if Emily gave me a choice…ScenesJoey: You do have a choice!! Ross, why are you listening to her?! Are you, are you crazy?!ScenesRoss: Why?ScenesJoey: It's not right what Emily wants you to do! She is totally-(The gang enters behind Joey and Phoebe pinches him again.)-Owww!! Stop pinching me! Look, now you guys said I only had to keep my mouth shut as long as Ross was happy, right? Well he just told me that he's not entirely happy.ScenesRoss: What's going on?ScenesJoey: We all hate Emily!ScenesPhoebe: Nooo!!ScenesMonica: No, Ross, we do not hate Emily. We-we just, we just think that you're having to sacrifice a whole lot to make her happy.ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Look, we just think that maybe she's being a little unreasonable.ScenesJoey: Yes! Yes! Unreasonable!ScenesRoss: Unreasonable? How about we have this conversation when one of you guys gets married! You have no idea what it takes to make a marriage work! All right, it's about compromise! Do you always like it? No! Do you do it? Yes! Because it's not all laughing, happy, candy in the sky, drinking coffee at Central Perk all the time! It's real life, okay? It's what grown-ups do! (He storms out.)ScenesPhoebe: I think he's right. You guys hang out at the coffeehouse way too much.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, and Chandler are recovering from Ross's rebuke.]
rows.Content: Monica: God, I feel so guilty about Ross.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I know.ScenesJoey: I kinda feel like it's my fault.Scenes(Monica and Chandler turn and stare at him.)ScenesChandler: Kind of? If you just kept this to yourself none of this would've happened.ScenesJoey: Well, I'm keeping so many things to myself these days, something was bound to slip out! (He glares at Chandler.)ScenesChandler: Well, I think it's very brave what you said.Scenes(Monica pats Joey on the shoulder.)ScenesPhoebe: All right, I can't sit here anymore. I have to walk places. (She puts on her fur coat.)ScenesChandler: Pheebs, what are you doing with the coat? How about the whole animal rights thing?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I've been reading up and for your information, minks are not very nice. Okay, I admit it! I love this coat! Okay, I—it's the best thing I've ever had wrapped around me, including Phil Huntley! (She starts to leave but stops and says to Monica.) Remember Phil Huntley? He was fine!

rows.Scenes: Their building's lobby, Danny is checking his mailbox as Rachel enters carrying shopping bags and goes to her mailbox. Danny has shaved his beard and cut his hair, Rachel doesn't recognize him.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesDanny: So you like the short hair better.ScenesRachel: What? Yeti—I mean Danny?ScenesDanny: I had to cut my hair to get rid of the uh, fogger smell.ScenesRachel: Oh. Listen, I'm so sorry. I would, I would've never fogged you if y'know if you hadn't looked so…. Y'know.ScenesDanny: Absolutely. Some people are just into appearances.ScenesRachel: (shocked) What?ScenesDanny: That's cool. Cool. (Starts to leave.)ScenesRachel: What? Hey! No-no-no! This not cool! You don't even know me!ScenesDanny: Come on, you got the shopping bags and the Sack's catalog.ScenesRachel: So from that you think you've got me all figured out? Well, you don't! Y'know I-I could have toys for underprivileged kids in here!ScenesDanny: Do you?ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, if-if kids like to play with Capri pants.ScenesDanny: Okay. (Heads for his apartment.)ScenesRachel: And stop saying that! I hate that!ScenesDanny: Okay!Scenes(Rachel decides not to give up that easily and follows him to his apartment and bangs on the door, which he opens.)ScenesRachel: Fine! I judged you. I made a snap judgement. But you did it too! And you are worse because you are sticking to your stupid snap judgement! You can't even open up your mind for a second to see if you're wrong! What does that say about you?ScenesDanny: The pizza-place across the street any good?ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesDanny: I'm hungry. Wanna get some pizza? You can keep yelling if there's more.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay.ScenesDanny: Stop saying that. I hate that.

rows.Scenes: Ross's now empty apartment, he is spackling some holes shut as the gang comes to apologize.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Uh, Ross?ScenesPhoebe: Are you still mad at us?ScenesRoss: Yep.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good! Because we have an "I'm sorry" song.ScenesRoss: Y'know what? I'm really not in the mood.ScenesJoey: Look, Ross, I feel really bad. I mean, you're going through all this stuff and I just acted like a jerk.ScenesChandler: Yeah, we are so sorry.ScenesPhoebe: (To Chandler) You're kinda stepping on the song. (She gets ready to play but is stopped by…)ScenesJoey: Look, we were way out of line, we totally support you.ScenesMonica: Whatever you decide, whatever you do.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, now you're just taking lines right out of the song!ScenesRoss: Look, this is hard enough! I really need you guys right now.ScenesPhoebe: Yes! Exactly! And that's why…Scenes(She starts to play her song, but is stopped by Monica.)ScenesMonica: Why don't you come over tonight? And I'll make you favorite dinner.ScenesRoss: Okay. Thanks you guys. Pheebs are you wearing fur?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, let's get some perspective people; it's not like I'm wearing a seeing-eye dog coat!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, minus Rachel, are getting ready for dinner.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, y'know Ross, I think I kinda understand why I kinda lost it today.ScenesRoss: You do, huh?ScenesJoey: Yeah you see umm, well, I'm an actor. Right? So I gotta keep my emotions right at the surface y'know? See what I'm saying? I gotta lot of balls in the air. (Makes like he's juggling.) Y'know what I mean? It's tough! Guys like me, y'know, you wander around, you're alone…ScenesRoss: What are you talking about?ScenesJoey: (thinks) I'm not sure.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey, look at you! Where have you been?ScenesRachel: Oh, I went to have pizza. With Danny.ScenesMonica: How did that happen?ScenesRachel: That yeti is one smooth talker.ScenesMonica: I hope you're not full, 'cause dinner's almost ready.ScenesRachel: Yeah, y'know I-I think I'm just gonna hang out in my room.ScenesAll: No! Why?ScenesRachel: Come on you guys! Listen, if Emily knew I was here having dinner you with you she would flip out and you know it. It's okay, I really… I don't mind.ScenesRoss: Wait! Wait! Wait! Y'know what? Just stay. Please? It uh… It would really mean a lot to me if you stayed.ScenesRachel: Ross, I…ScenesJoey: RACHEL PLEASE!!! JUST HAVE DINNER WITH US!!!ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay. Joey, it's okay. Settle down.ScenesJoey: All right, I-I'm sorry. I'm sorry. You see Rach I'm an actor…Scenes[Time lapse, dinner is now finished and Ross is looking out the window.]ScenesRoss: Hey! Hey, look! Ugly Naked Guy's back!Scenes(They all run over to the window.)ScenesRachel: I haven't seen him in so long!ScenesPhoebe: Oh God, I really missed that fat bastard!Scenes(Pause.)ScenesMonica: Wow, this is so weird. I just realized this might be the last time we'll all be hanging out together.ScenesJoey: It's almost as if he knew.Scenes(The phone rings.)ScenesMonica: I'll get it. (On phone.) Hello. (Listens.) Hi Emily! (Listens.) Yeah, uh you-you tracked him down. Hold on one second. (She hands the phone to Ross.)ScenesRoss: Hey! (Listens.) Yeah-yeah, we're just having dinner. (Listens.) Uh, yeah, sure uh hold on. (To the gang.) She wants to say hi. (To Emily) Hold on.Scenes(Ross puts her on speakerphone.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi Emily!ScenesChandler: Hi!ScenesEmily: Hello everyone. So who am I saying hello too?ScenesJoey: Well uh, I don't know about who's here, but I can tell you for damn sure who's not here and that's Rachel!!ScenesEmily: (laughs) Well, I should hope not. Ross knows better than that by now.Scenes(Rachel waves her hands in disgust and starts to head for her room.)ScenesRoss: Y'know what? Uh, Rachel is here! (Rachel stops.)ScenesEmily: She's there?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, there-there she is!ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah, she's here.ScenesEmily: Ross, take me off speakerphone.Scenes(He does so.)ScenesRoss: (on phone) Hi.ScenesEmily: How can you do this too me?! I thought I'd made my feelings about Rachel perfectly clear!ScenesRoss: (going onto the patio) Look Emily, I'm just having dinner with my friends, okay?ScenesEmily: You obviously can't keep away from her.ScenesRoss: Emily that's ridiculous. Look, I'm-I'm moving for you, I'm cutting friends out of my life for you. Please, just get on the plane and come to New York. Okay, you'll see you're the only person I want to be with.ScenesEmily: I'll feel better when I'm there, and I can know where you are all the time.ScenesRoss: Well, you can't know where I am all the time. Look, this marriage is never gonna work if you don't trust me.ScenesEmily: You're right.ScenesRoss: So, can you trust me?Scenes(Pause.)ScenesEmily: No.Scenes(Ross lowers his head.)Scenes[Cut to the inside of the apartment.]ScenesJoey: I think it's going okay. Looks like he's smiling.ScenesMonica: How can you tell? You can only see the back of his head!ScenesJoey: You can totally tell! Here look, watch me. (He stands up and turns his back to them so that he is facing the window.) Smile! Frown. Smile! Frown. (The camera cuts to Ross outside hanging up the phone.) Smile! (Ross turns around and sees Joey alternately smiling and frowning and just stares at him for a second and heads back inside.)ScenesRoss: Well, I guess that's it.ScenesAll: Why, what happened?ScenesJoey: What happened? What happened?ScenesRoss: My marriage is over.ScenesAll: What?!ScenesMonica: Oh, sweetie. Oh, look at you. You're shivering.ScenesPhoebe: Here. (She wraps her coat around his shoulders.)ScenesRachel: Ross, honey, is there anything we can do?ScenesRoss: Yeah. You can help me get my furniture back from Gunther.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: A curbside newsstand, Phoebe is whistling and walking up to it wearing her fur coat. She stops and starts to look through a magazine and notices a squirrel on a nearby tree chirping at her.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the squirrel) Okay, stop tormenting me! This mink! Okay, they're mean! And they hate squirrels! And y'know, okay, most of these probably wanted to be coats! (The squirrel stares at her.) All right, fine, now I get it. (To the clerk.) Here. (She hands him her coat.) You take it. (To the squirrel.) Are you happy now? I'm cold!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One Where Ross Moves InScenesWritten by: Perry Rein & Gigi McCreeryScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are there. Joey is looking at a National Geographic and giggling.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Are you looking at naked tribe's women?ScenesJoey: No, look. (Shows him the magazine.)ScenesChandler: That's a pig.ScenesJoey: I know, I know, but look at the knobs on her.Scenes(Ross enters and his hair is a mess.)ScenesChandler: Hey! (Joey quickly hides the magazine under the couch.)ScenesRoss: Emily's cousin kicked me out!ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesRoss: Well, when you're subletting an apartment from your wife's cousin and then you get a divorce, sometimes the cousin suddenly wants his apartment back.ScenesChandler: How can he do that? Didn't you sign a lease?ScenesRoss: Who needs a lease when it's family!ScenesJoey: Hey, you can stay with us! We'll take care of ya!ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah! Absolutely! Anything you need man! But you have to promise me the second you are feeling better so that we can make fun of your hair!ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: You got it.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRoss: Thanks you guys, I really appreciate this. All right, I'm gonna get packing again. Man, I've been moving around so much I'm beginning to feel like a nomad.Scenes(Joey starts giggling.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: He thought you said gonad.Scenes(Joey busts out laughing.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica's restaurant, she is getting inspected by the health department, Phoebe is watching.]
rows.Content: Health Inspector: Wow, Monica, if every restaurant is as clean as yours, I'd have a tough time making a living.ScenesMonica: Oh, Larry.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, do health inspectors work on commission?ScenesLarry: No, bribes.Scenes(Phoebe laughs.)ScenesPhoebe: It's okay to laugh right?ScenesLarry: Yeah, I was just kidding.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (She laughs harder.)ScenesLarry: I'll check the kitchen floors.ScenesMonica: Okay, knock yourself out, Larry.Scenes(He goes into the kitchen.)ScenesPhoebe: Yum-my!ScenesMonica: Larry?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah! I'd let him check out my kitchen floors.ScenesLarry: (entering) A 98. I deducted 2 points because you are not wearing your chef's hat, and that is a Section 5 violation.ScenesMonica: Uh, look, Larry honey, umm, I wrote the book on Section 5 and I know that you don't have to wear your hat unless you're in the kitchen.ScenesLarry: And where is your hat?ScenesMonica: It's in the kitchen, I'll go get it.Scenes(She heads for the kitchen door and just after she goes through the door…)ScenesLarry: Ahh that's the 2 points.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, you should really read that book you wrote. (To Larry) Wow! You saw the hat in the kitchen and knew that she'd have to go in there hatless to get it. You can have your own health inspector detective show!ScenesLarry: Oh, I don't know about that.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but then I can be you sidekick Vunda.ScenesLarry: Maybe uh, Vunda could give me her number and I can ask her to dinner sometime.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, she would love that! Y'know, 'cause you know all the clean places to eat.ScenesLarry: I-I'll call ya.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(Larry goes to leave but heads the wrong way and makes a quick sidestep to go out the right door.)ScenesPhoebe: He's so funny! (She imitates what he just did.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Monica and Rachel.]
rows.Content: Monica: Thanks.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (To Monica) Mon?ScenesMonica: Hmm?ScenesRachel: How's Ross doing? Y'know since all the Emily stuff.ScenesMonica: He's not great umm, but he's dealing with it. Oh wait a minute, you're not gonna try…ScenesRachel: Oh, honey, please, no, I can't get started with all that Ross stuff again. I mean, he's gonna screwed up for a looong time. And besides y'know, I don't, I don't go for guys right after they get divorced.ScenesMonica: Right, you only go for them 5 minutes before they get married.Scenes(Danny enters.)ScenesDanny: (To Gunther) Two pounds of Moca Java please.ScenesMonica: (To Monica) Danny. Are you guys ever gonna go out again?ScenesRachel: I don't know! He hasn't called me since that one time when we went out. I see him in the hallway, we flirt, I'm all ha-ha-ha-ha, and nothing.ScenesDanny: (To them) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi Danny! (Notices his box of liquor he's carrying.) Wow! Thirsty huh?ScenesDanny: Uh, actually, actually, I'm having a party at my place on Saturday, it's sort of a house warming kind of thing.ScenesMonica: Ohh, fun!ScenesRachel: Ohh, great!ScenesDanny: Yeah, I'm really looking forward to it.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesDanny: Okay, see ya. (Heads out.)ScenesMonica: Well, I guess we won't be warming his house.ScenesRachel: (laughs) Okay. All right, I see what he's doing! He's not asking me out, because he wants me to ask him out.ScenesMonica: And you're not gonna do that.ScenesRachel: That's right! 'Cause that would give him the control! So now he's all ooh, coming up with this whole I've got a party thing y'know, trying to get me to hint around for an invitation. Blew up in his face, didn't it?ScenesMonica: So-so there is no party.ScenesRachel: No, there's a party. There's a party. But the power, that is still up for grabs. You follow me?ScenesMonica: I think so. Se, he-he's not inviting you to his party because he likes you.ScenesRachel: Exactly.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, they're entering to find boxes strewn about the apartment.]
rows.Content: Joey: Ross?ScenesRoss: (entering from the bathroom) Hey roomies!ScenesChandler: Love what you've done with the place.ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah I know, I know, it's a lot of boxes, but again I really appreciate you guys letting me stay here.ScenesJoey: Not a problem. And listen, hey! Since you're gonna be here for a while, why don't—I was thinking we uh, put your name on the answering machine.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah!ScenesRoss: Oh, I uh, hope you don't mind, I kinda uh, jazzed it up a little. Check this out. (He plays the greeting, and We Will Rock You starts to play and Ross's voice comes over it.) We will, we will, call you back!ScenesJoey: Hey, all right!ScenesRoss: Pretty cool, huh?Scenes(They both laugh as Ross heads back to the bathroom.)ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) You're fake laughing too, right?ScenesChandler: Oh, the tears are real.

rows.Scenes: A restaurant, Phoebe and Larry are having dinner.]
rows.Content: Larry: You look beautiful this evening.ScenesPhoebe: (smiles) Show me the badge again.Scenes(He looks around and flashes her his badge and she laughs.)ScenesPhoebe: Shiny.ScenesLarry: Oh, will you mind if I wash up? Because I came straight from work and who knows where these babies (Holds up his hands) have been.ScenesPhoebe: (laughing) You are just nonstop!Scenes(He goes to the bathroom and Phoebe puts some pepper and salt on her food. With the salt she takes a bit and throws it over her left shoulder as she faces us.)ScenesLarry: (coming back) We're outta here!ScenesPhoebe: Why?!ScenesLarry: Just walking past the kitchen I saw 10 violations! I'm shutting this place down!ScenesPhoebe: (awed) You have the power to do that?ScenesLarry: This does. (Shows her his badge.)ScenesPhoebe: (excited) Shut it down.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is entering. As he closes the door, Joey pokes his head up from a box enclosure built using the 2 chairs.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesChandler: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: Nothing.ScenesChandler: You built a fort didn't ya?ScenesJoey: (smiles) Kinda.ScenesChandler: (notices something) Oh my God, the air purifier! Ross's air purifier! All I heard through 4 years of college was (makes a humming noise.)ScenesJoey: Dude, you should've gone out once and a while.ScenesChandler: I hate this thing!ScenesJoey: Come on, Chandler, Ross is our friend. He needs us right now, so why don't you be a grown up and come and watch some TV in the fort!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is opening the door.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, hi Danny.ScenesDanny: Hey guys, I just uh, wanted to invite you to the party tomorrow night.ScenesMonica: Oh, thanks! We'll try to stop by.ScenesRachel: Uh, actually, I think I'm gonna be busy.ScenesMonica: You are?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Remember I got that uh, gala.ScenesDanny: Yeah, what's the gala for?ScenesRachel: It's a uh, regatta gala.ScenesDanny: Really! You-you sail?ScenesRachel: No-no, but I support it.ScenesDanny: Okay, (To Monica) hope I see you tomorrow night.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesDanny: Take care. (Leaves.)ScenesRachel: Okay. (Closes the door.) Walked right into that one didn't he?ScenesMonica: What one? You wanted him to invite you to the party and he did it!ScenesRachel: Yeah, but he waited until the last minute! So if I said yes, he would know I had nothing better to do than wait around for an invitation to his stupid party. I said, "No!" Which puts me right back in the driver seat.ScenesMonica: Great. So the ball is in his court?ScenesRachel: Ball? There is no ball.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's and Ross's, Ross is working on his computer and Joey is making a lot of noise.]
rows.Content: Ross: (glaring at him) Joey, please! (Motions to his computer.)ScenesJoey: Sorry.Scenes(Joey starts playing with a toy alligator and has it attack him.)ScenesJoey: Ahhhhhhhhhh…Scenes(Notices Ross looking at him and stops. Ross gives him his 'quiet down' maneuver. Okay, this may take a while to explain, so center this on you screen and place your hands about a foot apart with your fingers together and pointing straight up. Now take you fingers and point them at the other hand and making a 90-degree angle with each of your hands and the first knuckle counting up from the wrist. Now take your right hand, no your other right (that was for the dyslexics), and lower it a couple of inches, so that the fingers are pointing at your wrist. Now take your arms and keeping the elbows bent and your hands in front of you spread out your arms, kinda like making a bird's wing. Now hunch your shoulders over and move you hands up and down as if you are trying to tell some one to turn it down. That's Ross 'quiet down' maneuver. Well, there is an accompanying face, but I don't want to try and describe it as well.)ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello children!ScenesJoey: Hey! Wanna play some foosball? Please?ScenesChandler: Okay. (Starts to head for where the foosball table usually is.)ScenesJoey: No-no, no! We have to move the table into my room, yeah! 'Cause of all the boxes. Come on!Scenes(They go into his bedroom.)ScenesJoey: All right, I have one question. What is the deal with this? (Imitates Ross's 'quiet down' maneuver, but does move his hands up and down he just flaps his hands as if he's waving good-bye.)ScenesChandler: Bye-bye little puppet Joey hand?ScenesJoey: No, the quiet down thing!ScenesChandler: You mean this. (Does the maneuver perfectly.)ScenesJoey: Um-hmm! Look, I-I-I don't know how much more of this I can take! Did you know he taped over my Baywatch tape with some show about bugs! My God! What if that had been porn?ScenesChandler: (gasps) All right look, y'know, this maybe tough but come on, this is Ross! I survived college with him!ScenesJoey: All right, I guess I can hold out a little longer. Let's have a game.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(They start playing.)ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no!ScenesJoey: YES!!ScenesRoss: (entering) Uh fellas, (Does the maneuver and gives them a double thumbs up, which Chandler returns as he closes the door.)ScenesChandler: Okay, so he's out of here.ScenesJoey: Um-hmm.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesJoey: You guys got anything to eat? I just went down to Johnos for some chicken and it was closed!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I took Larry there to eat but it was all violated. So we shut it down!ScenesJoey: Pheebs, if this guy keeps closing down all of our favorite places, where are we gonna eat?!ScenesMonica: I don't know, clean places?ScenesJoey: Umm, yum!Scenes(There's a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: (looking through the peephole) It's Danny.ScenesRachel: Don't let him in! I'm supposed to be at a regatta gala.ScenesMonica: (to Danny) We'll be right there! (To Rachel) Can't you just say it starts later?ScenesRachel: What? What kind of a regatta gala starts at night?!ScenesMonica: The fake kind!Scenes(She opens the door and Rachel hides behind it.)ScenesDanny: Hey, hi, I need a ladle. You got a ladle?ScenesMonica: We have a ladle. (Gives him one.)ScenesDanny: Thanks, see you at the party.ScenesMonica: Okay, great!Scenes(He leaves and she closes the door.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, guys, you know what Larry would say? He would say, "See you ladle." (Laughs.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are there. Chandler and Joey are looking through the paper.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well, I-I-I'm done with this. You want anything Ross? Sports? International? Apartment listings?ScenesRoss: I'll take sports.ScenesJoey: Mine! (He grabs it.)ScenesRoss: All right. Uhh, international.ScenesJoey: Oh that's mine too! (Grabs it and Ross looks at him.) I'm Italian!ScenesRoss: Well, I guess I can check out those apartment listings, even though there's never anything in here.ScenesChandler: Not even on page 7?ScenesRoss: (looks) Oh yeah! You're—hey, you're right! Here's an affordable place, (reading ad) two bedroom, close to work, ooh, it's available in five weeks!ScenesChandler: What about that circled one?ScenesRoss: Oh, I-I don't know, it's kind of expensive for a studio.ScenesJoey: But it's available now! Isn't it?ScenesChandler: Yes, it is.ScenesJoey: Hey, let's go look at it! (They both jump up.)ScenesRoss: Okay, let's go.ScenesJoey: Okay!ScenesChandler: There we go!ScenesRoss: Oh-oh-ooh, hey guys, I was wondering if you guys would uh, maybe chip in on some new air filters for the air purifier? I mean after all, we all are using it.ScenesChandler: Let's go quicker.ScenesJoey: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: The apartment in the listing, the guys are checking it out. There's one problem though, it's roughly the size of this computer screen. As they enter Joey lets out a whistle.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh my God! (Looking around, which doesn't take him long.)ScenesChandler: Yeah, well look at this kitchen, slash bathroom. Well that's great! Y'know so you can cook while in the tub.ScenesJoey: Somebody was using his head. Hey, let's check out the rest of the place.Scenes(They don't move, just look all around them.)ScenesRoss: I think this is it. I don't know, maybe we should keep looking.ScenesJoey: But hey, Ross, this place is available now!ScenesChandler: Yeah, you don't want to be stuck with us for the next five weeks.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(He looks at them.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) So, you-you think I should go ahead and take this place?ScenesJoey: Oh, it's perfect!ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) How about you?ScenesChandler: It's a kitchen slash bathroom.ScenesRoss: All right, I see what you guys are saying. I'll uh, I'll go downstairs and fill out an application.Scenes(He exits.)ScenesChandler: We are bad people.ScenesJoey: He knew we were trying to get rid of him. He knew! (Pause.) You think we could get a bathtub in our kitchen?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there waiting for Larry.]
rows.Content: Larry: (entering) Hey, ready for dinner?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, absolutely!ScenesLarry: Great! How about you wanted to go the Italian place down on Bleaker Street right?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I love that place! (Thinks about it.) So, no.ScenesLarry: How about Mama Lisettie's?ScenesPhoebe: Enh. Sure!ScenesLarry: (notices something) I wonder how long that milk (on the counter) has been setting out.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, no-no, this place is totally healthy! That—this milk is mine. I bought this today, 'cause I was thirsty for milk, y'know. (She takes a swig of it, but has to turn away from him as she makes a face to show that it has gone bad.) Okay, let's go!Scenes(Just as they're about to leave, Gunther comes out of the back carrying two garbage bags. Larry sees this and stops him.)ScenesLarry: Hey, buddy! (Flashes his badge.) Are you familiar with Section 11-B of the Health Code that requires all refuse material out the back exit?ScenesGunther: But then I'd have to go all the way around the dry cleaner place.ScenesLarry: Oh, so you're saying you'd choose convenience over health?!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, stop! Larry, okay, can't you just be Larry and not Larry the health inspector guy? Y'know I mean it was really exciting at first but now it's like, okay, so where are we gonna eat ever?ScenesLarry: Well, I suppose I could give him a warning.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you. (To Gunther, who's standing there frozen) Okay, go! Go! Go! (He runs off.) (To Larry) Now, if after dinner you still really need to bust someone, I know a hot dog vendor who picks his nose.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are lamenting about how they kicked Ross out.]
rows.Content: Joey: Maybe, maybe we did a good thing, helping Ross get back on his feet!ScenesChandler: Yes that was a nice place!ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Not a lot of closet space, but he can just hang his stuff out the window in a bag!ScenesJoey: Yeah!Scenes(Pause.)ScenesChandler: What are we gonna do?ScenesJoey: I don't know. Maybe pizza?ScenesChandler: About Ross!ScenesJoey: Oh! Oh!Scenes(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)ScenesJoey: Hello! (Listens.) Oh yeah! (To Chandler) It's the apartment manager; Ross put us down as references. (To the apartment manager.) Ross is the greatest guy you'll ever meet! Yeah, he's very reliable.ScenesChandler: (grabbing the phone) Of course he has this big huge dog! That uh, barks into the night. (Listens.) Well, who doesn't love dogs? (Thinks.) Ah, he's a tap dancer! (Listens.) Yes, some would say that is a lost art. (Thinks.) He's a pimp! (Listens.) There you go! Yes, he's a pimp. He's a big, tap dancing pimp! (Pause.) Hello?Scenes(The apartment manager hung up on him and he hangs up the phone and throws in on the chair. Joey motions, "What the hell was that?" Chandler makes a face to say, "Think about it." Joey tries to divide 136 by 13; he's confused. Suddenly, light dawns on yonder dunder head. He gets it.)ScenesChandler: Ohhhhh!Scenes(Joey motions, "Now, that's thinking!")

rows.Scenes: Downstairs at Danny's party, Monica and Rachel are coming down the stairs and Rachel has on a coat to make it look as if she's just getting back. But just as they reach the landing they see Danny out in the hall talking to a guest, Rachel then quickly pulls Monica back up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Shoot, shoot, this is never gonna work! He's right there!ScenesMonica: Just go over and say hi.ScenesRachel: No, I have to go downstairs and come back up as if I'm coming home from the regatta gala. Okay? So just go distract him. But don't be sexy.Scenes(Monica obeys.)ScenesMonica: Hey, Danny!ScenesDanny: Hey! What's going on?ScenesMonica: (turns his back to the stairs) Oh, it's a great party! Great food. Y'know, most parties it's all chips and salsa, chips and salsa. (As she's saying this Rachel tries to head downstairs but is blocked by people coming upstairs. She quickly retreats back up the stairs.) (Sees that she has to keep him distracted longer.) So umm, what's this? (Points to his plate.)ScenesDanny: Salad.ScenesMonica: Ooooh! (Rachel now succeeds in getting downstairs.) And-and-and what-what's this? (Points again.)ScenesDanny: Bread. Aren't you a chef?Scenes(Rachel returns.)ScenesMonica: (upon seeing Rachel she points) Oh.ScenesDanny: Hey! Rachel!ScenesRachel: Hey! Oh right, tonight was your party.ScenesDanny: Oh wow, you look great! Glad you could make it.ScenesRachel: Oh well, y'know, the gala had to end sometime.ScenesDanny: Don't go anywhere, I'll be right back. (He heads off.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, sure. (To Monica) All right, whose court is the ball in now?ScenesMonica: I thought there wasn't a ball?ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! He's glad that I came, he doesn't want me to go anywhere, balls flying all over the place!ScenesDanny: (returning, with a friend) Rachel, this is my friend Tom. (To Tom) This is the girl I told you about.ScenesRachel: Oh, go on! You telling people about me?ScenesDanny: You two could really hit it off! I'm gonna go mingle. (Leaves.)ScenesTom: So you work at Bloomingdale's, huh? My mom calls it Bloomies.ScenesRachel: (laughs) Yeah, okay, at ease solider!ScenesTom: I'm sorry?ScenesRachel: No, it's all right, you can just drop the act Tommy. I know what's going on here. Your Danny's wingman right? You guys are best buds. Frat bros!ScenesTom: I'm gonna go talk to uh, a friend.ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah, you go talk to your friend. You tell him, "Nice try.Scenes(He walks off.)ScenesRachel: Man! He just keeps lobbing them up and I just keep knocking them right out of the park!ScenesMonica: I think I need a drink.ScenesRachel: Yeah!Scenes(They go get a drink.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross still has boxes all over the place. Joey is wearing a football helmet, and Chandler is spinning him around in one of the chairs and counting.]
rows.Content: Chandler: 98. 99. 100. Okay, go!ScenesJoey: (getting up) Dude, I'm telling ya! I'm fine! (He tries to take a step and falls flat on his face.)Scenes(He tries to get up again and starts falling backwards and Chandler catches him.)ScenesChandler: Here we go! Here we go!Scenes(Ross enters.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey. So I uh, I didn't get that apartment. Some problem with my application.ScenesJoey: You're kidding!ScenesChandler: You're kidding, no!ScenesRoss: Yeah. But, the good news is that Phoebe said that I could stay at her place for a while. So…ScenesJoey: But you can't stay with Phoebe, Ross! We're-we're roomies!ScenesRoss: Look, you guys don't need me here taking up your space.ScenesJoey: Well, we got plenty of space! There-there's still some over there (Points to where the window is but sees that there isn't any space there and points towards his door.) by-by that speaker. Please, just stay!ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Are you guys sure about this?ScenesJoey: Definitely!ScenesChandler: Yes! Ross, you have to stay!ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesChandler: All right, buddy!ScenesRoss: So I'm a pimp huh? It's okay! Look, I know that sometimes I can be a pain in the ass, but you just have to talk to me. Tell me if something is bothering you. Okay? And for my part I will do everything I can to keep my annoying habits just (Does the 'quiet down' maneuver).Scenes(Chandler and Joey smile, but when Ross turns away look at each other with looks of horror.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's and Ross's, Chandler is entering and when he closes the door Joey pops his head out of the fort like before, but this time he's wearing a cowboy hat.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well, I see you've had a very productive day. Don't you think the cowboy hat is a little much?ScenesRoss: (popping up behind Joey wearing an Indian headdress) Come on, it's fun!ScenesChandler: All right! (He joins them in the fort and comes up putting on a bonnet.) Isn't this a woman's hat?ScenesJoey: Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!Scenes(Chandler does so.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The Thanksgiving FlashbacksScenesWritten by: Greg MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone has just finished Thanksgiving dinner and are groaning over their fullness.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh Monica that was the best Thanksgiving dinner ever! I think you killed us.ScenesRoss: I couldn't possibly eat another bite.ScenesJoey: I need something sweet.ScenesPhoebe: Does anyone wanna watch TV?ScenesAll: Yeah, sure.Scenes(She starts pushing the power button on the remote, but it's not facing the TV so it doesn't work.)ScenesPhoebe: Monica your remote doesn't work.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you have to lift it and point.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Aw, forget it.ScenesRachel: Yeah, you know what we should all do? We should play that game where everyone says one thing that they're thankful for.ScenesJoey: Ooh-ooh, I! I am thankful for this beautiful fall we've been having.ScenesMonica: That's very nice.ScenesChandler: That's sweet, Joey.ScenesJoey: Yeah, the other day I was at the bus-stop and this lovely fall breeze came in out of nowhere and blew this chick's skirt right up. Oh! Which reminds me, I'm also thankful for thongs. (Note: Actually, I think every guy is thankful for thongs. That and spandex. J )ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier. Joey is talking about the wonder that is the thong.]
rows.Content: Joey: I mean, it's not so much an underpant as it is a feat of engineering. I mean, it's amazing how much they can do with so little material! And the way they play with your mind! Is it there? Is it not there?ScenesChandler: Are you aware that you're still talking?ScenesMonica: Is anyone thankful for anything else besides a thong?ScenesRoss: Huh, I don't know what to pick. Am I more thankful for my divorce or my eviction? Hmm.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! See, and I didn't think you'd be able to come up with anything.ScenesRoss: I'm sorry. It's just that this is the worse Thanksgiving ever.ScenesChandler: No-no-no! I am the king of bad Thanksgivings. You can't just swoop in here with your bad marriage and take that away from me.ScenesRachel: Oh, you're not gonna tell the whole story about how your parents got divorced again are you?ScenesRoss: Oh God, no.ScenesJoey: Oh, come on! I wanna hear it! It wouldn't be Thanksgiving without Chandler bumming us out!ScenesChandler: It's a tradition, like the parade. If the parade decided it was gay, moved out, and abandoned its entire family.Scenes(And with that, we start a series of flashbacks to Thanksgiving's of years gone by.)ScenesThanksgiving 1978

rows.Scenes: The Bing household, Mr. and Mrs. Bing and Young Chandler are eating Thanksgiving dinner as a housekeeper serves them.]
rows.Content: Mrs. Bing: Now Chandler dear, just because your father and I are getting a divorce it doesn't mean we don't love you. It just means he would rather sleep with the house-boy than me.ScenesThe Housekeeper: More turkey Mr. Chandler? (And he makes eyes at him.)ScenesPresent Day

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Ross: You're right. Yours is worse. You are the king of bad Thanksgivings.ScenesPhoebe: I don't know about that. I've got one that's worse.ScenesChandler: Really? Worse than, "More turkey Mr. Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, did the little rich boy have a problem with the butler? Yes, mine's worse!ScenesThanksgiving 1862

rows.Scenes: A Union battlefield hospital, Phoebe, in a past life, is tending to a wounded Union soldier. (By the way, for historical perspective, 1862 was the second year of the American Civil War.)]
rows.Content: Past Life Phoebe: More bandages! More bandages! Please, can I get some more bandages in here! This man is dying—(She is cut off by an exploding shell just outside the tent. When the smoke clears, she's missing an arm and the blood is pumping out like you'd see in a horror movie. And upon seeing her condition, she says…) Oh no.ScenesPresent Day

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Ross: In this life, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this life! Oh okay no, Chandler's is worse.ScenesJoey: Man, it must be so cool remembering stuff like that! I don't have any past life memories.ScenesPhoebe: Of course you don't sweetie. You're brand new.ScenesRachel: I know Monica's worst Thanksgiving.ScenesMonica: Oh, let's not tell this story.ScenesAll: Oh, come on!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, I know! I know! It's the one where Joey got Monica's turkey stuck on his head!ScenesRachel: What?! Joey got a turkey stuck on his head?!ScenesJoey: Hey, it's not like it sounds.ScenesChandler: It's exactly like it sounds.ScenesThanksgiving 1992

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Phoebe is entering.]
rows.Content: Joey: (muffled) Hello?ScenesPhoebe: (surprised) Hello?ScenesJoey: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Joey? What's going on?ScenesJoey: Look. (He walks out of the bathroom with his head stuck in a huge turkey.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: I know! It's stuck!!!ScenesPhoebe: (walks him to the kitchen) Easy. Step. How did it get on?ScenesJoey: I put it on to scare Chandler!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Monica's gonna totally freak out!ScenesJoey: Well then help me get it off! Plus, it smells really bad in here.ScenesPhoebe: Well, of course it smells really bad. You have your head up a dead animal.Scenes(They hear Monica trying to unlock the door. So Phoebe quickly pushes his head down onto the table to make it look like the turkey is just sitting on a platter and not stuck on Joey's head.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey, did you get the turkey basted—Oh my God! Oh my God! (She sees someone is stuck in the turkey.) Who is that?ScenesJoey: It's Joey.ScenesMonica: What-what are you doing? Is this supposed to be funny?ScenesPhoebe: No, it's not supposed to be funny, it's supposed to be scary.ScenesMonica: Well, get it off now!ScenesJoey: I can't! It-it's stuck!ScenesMonica: Well, I don't care! That-that turkey has to feed 20 people at my parent's house and they're not gonna eat it off your head!ScenesPhoebe: All right, hold on! Okay, let's just all think.Scenes(They all start thinking. Joey starts rubbing his chin, of course his chin is currently inside the turkey so he ends up rubbing the turkey. And I didn't do that joke one bit of justice. It's one of those you have to see it to get it jokes.)ScenesMonica: Okay, I got it. Phoebe? All right, you pull. I'm gonna spread the legs as wide as I can. (Joey starts giggling.) Joey? Now is not the time!ScenesJoey: Sorry! Sorry.Scenes(They get into position to pull the turkey off.)ScenesMonica: Okay, count to three. 1. 2. 3!Scenes(They both pull but Joey slips out and starts to fall backwards just as Chandler enters, scaring him.)ScenesChandler: Arghhhhhh!! (Joey turns around to taunt him, but Chandler is in the doorway and Joey is facing the kitchen.)ScenesJoey: (pointing) It worked! I scared ya, I knew it! Ha-ha!ScenesChandler: I'm over here big guy.ScenesJoey: (turning all the way around, and still not facing Chandler) Yeah, you are! (Starts dancing.) I scared you!ScenesPresent Day

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (laughing) You did look like an idiot.ScenesJoey: Hey, I wasn't the only one who looked like an idiot. All right? Remember when Ross tried to say, "Butternut squash?" And it came out, "Squatternut buash?ScenesRoss: Yeah that's the same.ScenesMonica: That's it. That's my worse Thanksgiving.ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait! That can't be the one Rachel's talking about. She didn't even know that happened. So which one was it?ScenesAll: Which one?ScenesMonica: Umm, I-I really don't want to tell this story.ScenesChandler: Oh, come on Monica, reliving past pain and getting depressed is what Thanksgiving is all about. Y'know, for me anyway. And of course, the Indians.ScenesMonica: Look umm, of all people, you do not want me to tell this story!ScenesThanksgiving 1987

rows.Scenes: The Geller household, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are getting ready for Thanksgiving dinner. The doorbell rings.]
rows.Content: Mrs. Geller: Monica! I think Rachel's here!ScenesMonica: I'll get it! (She runs in, and she's her old fat self like The One With The Prom Video. Not only that, she's out of breath after running a short distance. She goes over and opens the door to reveal Rachel with her old nose.) Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Not for me. Chip and I broke up!ScenesFat Monica: Oh, why? Why? What happened?ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Well, you know that my parents are out of town and Chip was going to come over…ScenesFat Monica: Yeah, yeah, and you were going him y'know, your flower.ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Okay, Monica, can you just call it sex?! It really creeps me out when you call it that! Okay, and by the way, while we're at it, a guy's thing is not called his tenderness. Believe me! (Walks into the living room and greets Monica's parents.) Hi!ScenesMr. Geller: Hi Rachel!ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesMrs. Geller: You too sweethart!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!Scenes(He brought home Chandler for Thanksgiving. Chandler is sporting the very popular Flock of Seagulls haircut. Yeah, it's another you have to see it to believe it kinda thing.)ScenesMr. Geller: Oh my!ScenesRoss: Uh, everyone, this is Chandler! My roommate and lead singer of our band!ScenesFat Monica: Ross! (Wanting to be introduced.)ScenesRoss: Oh, this is Monica.ScenesFat Monica: Hi, I'm Ross's little sister.ScenesChandler: (seeing her) Okay.ScenesMrs. Geller: I'm so glad you could come Chandler, we've got plenty of food so I hope you're hungry.ScenesRoss: Oh, mom. Mom. Chandler hates Thanksgiving and doesn't eat any Thanksgiving food.ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh, well, I'm so glad you brought him here then.ScenesFat Monica: Umm, Chandler, if you want I can make you some macaroni and cheese for dinner.ScenesChandler: Well, as long as the pilgrims didn't eat it, I'm in.Scenes(As she is drinking, Monica laughs and Chandler's joke and Diet Coke comes out of her nose.)ScenesFat Monica: dammit! (Runs off.)Scenes(Ross points out Rachel to Chandler and goes over to talk to her. Rachel is checking out her nose in her compact mirror.)ScenesRoss: So uh, Rach? Does it, does it feel weird around here now? Y'know since I've been away at college.ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Oh! No, not really.ScenesRoss: Well, that's cool. So did… (She walks away from him and he shuts up.)Scenes(Rachel wanders into the kitchen where Monica is making Chandler's dinner.)ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Ugh! I cannot believe Chip dumped me for that slut Nancy Branson. I am never going out with him again. I don't care how much he begs!ScenesFat Monica: I think his begging days are over now that he's going out with Nancy Branson.ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Y'know what? I've just had it with high school boys! They are just silly. (Ross is overhearing this.) Silly, stupid boys! I'm going to start dating men!ScenesRoss: Umm, I'm sorry Judy, I couldn't find that bowl that you and Jack were looking for.ScenesFat Monica: Call them mom and dad you loser!ScenesRoss: (in a high pitched voice) Monica!Scenes[Time lapse, dinner has finished and Chandler is sitting on the couch eating some pie. Monica sits down beside him, and he gets pushed up a little by the wave she makes in the couch.]ScenesFat Monica: Hey Chandler! Did you like the macaroni and cheese?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, it was great. You should be a chef.ScenesFat Monica: Okay!Scenes(He gets up and walks away as Rachel come running over all excited.)ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Guess what?! All that stuff about Nancy Branson being a slut was all a rumor so Chip dumped her and he wants to come over to my house tonight!ScenesFat Monica: Oh that's so great!ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: I know!ScenesFat Monica: Oh gosh, listen if you and Chip do it tonight, promise me you'll tell me everything.ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: Oh totally, totally. Y'know it's not that big of deal, we already kinda did it once y'know.ScenesFat Monica: I know, but y'know, this time you're gonna definitely know whether or not you did it!ScenesBig Nosed Rachel: I know, I know. And oh, and this time Chip promised that-that this time it will last at least for an entire song!Scenes[Cut to the kitchen, Ross and Chandler are doing the dishes.]ScenesRoss: So I’m thinking about asking Rachel out tonight. Y'know maybe play her that song we wrote last week.ScenesChandler: Emotional Knapsack?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Right on! Oh! Uh, but, don’t take to long okay? 'Cause uh, we're gonna test out our fake ID's tonight, right Clifford Alverez.ScenesRoss: Listen, Roland Chang, if things go well, I’m gonna be out with her all night.ScenesChandler: Dude, don't do that too me!Scenes(Monica enters behind them.)ScenesRoss: All right, it's cool you can stay here. My parents won't mind.Scenes(Monica suddenly gets very happy.)ScenesChandler: No, it's not that, I just don't want to be stuck here all night with your fat sister.ScenesRoss: Hey!Scenes(Upon hearing this, Monica starts to break down and storms out. Only to be stopped by her parents.)ScenesMrs. Geller: (holding two pies) Monica, why don't you finish off these pies? I don't have any more room left in the fridge.ScenesFat Monica: No. No, thank you!ScenesMr. Geller: Well Judy, you did it! She's finally full!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, back to the present day.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I called you fat?! I don't even remember that!ScenesMonica: Well, I do.ScenesChandler: I am so sorry. I really am. I was an idiot back then. I rushed the stage at a Wham concert for crying out loud!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I can't believe you called her fat.ScenesRoss: I can't believe you let George Michael slap you.ScenesChandler: I am really sorry. That is so terrible. I am so, so sorry.ScenesRachel: Actually, y'know that's not the Thanksgiving I was talking about.ScenesMonica: Yes, it was!ScenesRachel: No, it wasn't. It was actually the…ScenesMonica: (interrupting her) Okay, now Thanksgiving's over, let's get ready for Christmas. Who wants to go get a Christmas tree?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, no, I have the cutest Christmas story!ScenesChandler: We wanna hear Monica's Thanksgiving story!ScenesPhoebe: Fine, all right, mine had a dwarf that got broke in half, but y'know whatever.ScenesThanksgiving 1988

rows.Scenes: The Geller household kitchen, Mrs. Geller is cooking and Rachel, post nose job, is helping her.]
rows.Content: Mrs. Geller: So Rachel, your mom tells me you changed your major again.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, I had too. There was never any parking by the Psychology building.ScenesMr. Geller: (entering) Hi Rachel.ScenesRachel: Oh hi!ScenesMr. Geller: Wow, love your new nose!ScenesMrs. Geller: Jack.ScenesMr. Geller: What? Dr. Wilson's an artist! He removed my mole cluster. Wanna see? (He starts to show her as the doorbell rings.)ScenesMrs. Geller: I'll get it.ScenesRachel: No, God! Please, let me! (Runs out.)Scenes(She opens the door to reveal Chandler and Ross. Unfortunately, they seem to have their holidays mixed up. They think it's Halloween and they're going as Crockett and Tubbs from that legendary TV show of the late 80's, Miami Vice. God, we looked silly back then!)ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey. (To his parents) Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesMr. Geller: (To Chandler) God, your hair sure is different!ScenesChandler: Yeah, we were just talking about that. I can't believe how stupid we used to look. (They both quickly push their sleeves over their elbows.)ScenesRoss: So uh, where's Monica?ScenesMrs. Geller: She's upstairs. Monica! Come down! Everyone's here! Ross, Rachel, and the boy who hates Thanksgiving.Scenes(Monica enters, but she forgot something. Oh, about 150 pounds. In other words, she lost weight, big time!)ScenesMonica: Hi, Chandler.ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: What-what's the matter? Is there, is there something on my dress? (She turns around making sure he gets a good look.)ScenesChandler: You just, you look so different! Terrific! That dress! That body!ScenesRoss: Dude!ScenesChandler: Sorry!ScenesMrs. Geller: Yes, yes Monica is thin. It's wonderful. But what we really want to hear about is Ross's new girlfriend.ScenesRoss: Oh mom! Okay, umm, her name is Carol. And she's really pretty. And smart. And uh, she's-she's on the lacrosse team and the golf team. Can you believe it? She plays for both teams!ScenesMonica: So Chandler, I guess I'll see you at dinner.Scenes(She heads for the kitchen and Chandler watches her leave and admires the view.)ScenesMr. Geller: Dude!ScenesChandler: Sorry.Scenes(In the kitchen.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Oh-ho, my God! That was so awesome! You totally got him back for calling you fat! He was just drooling all over you. That must've felt so great!ScenesMonica: Well it didn't!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: Yeah, I mean yeah, I look great. Yeah, I feel great and yeah, my heart is not in trouble anymore! Blah, blah, blah! Y'know I still don't feel like I got him back, y'know? I just want to humiliate him. I wanna, I want him to be like naked and then I'm going to point at him and laugh!ScenesRachel: Okay, that we may be able to do.ScenesMonica: How?ScenesRachel: Well guys tend to get naked before they're gonna have sex.ScenesMonica: What?! I mean, I didn't work this hard and-and-and lose all this weight so that I can give my flower to someone like him!ScenesRachel: Okay, first of all, if you keep calling it that, no one's gonna ever take it. Then, second of all you're not actually gonna have sex with him!
