You're just gonna make him think that you are.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesMonica: And when he's naked I can throw him out in the front yard and lock the door and all the neighbors will just humiliate him!ScenesRachel: Then, you will definitely get him back!ScenesMonica: Okay, so how do I make him think I wanna have sex with him?ScenesRachel: Okay, oh, here's what you do. Just act like everything around you turns you on.ScenesMonica: What do you mean?ScenesRachel: Well, like anything can be sexy. Like umm, oh-oh, like this dishtowel! (She grabs it and starts rubbing it on her cheek.) Ooh, ooh, this feels sooo good against my cheek! And-and if I feel a little hot, I can just dab myself with it. Or I can bring it down to my side and bring it through my fingers while I talk to him.ScenesMonica: (excited) I can do that!ScenesRachel: Yeah? Okay! Good, good, because he's coming. He's coming. (To Chandler) Hey, what's up? (She leaves and closes the door behind her.)ScenesChandler: Monica, I was wondering if you can make me some of that righteous mac and cheese like last year.ScenesMonica: Umm, I'd love too! (She goes over and picks up the box and decides to follow Rachel's advice and holds the box up to her cheek.) Ooh, I love macaroni and cheese. I love-I love the way this box feels against my cheek.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Boy, I love carrots! Oh! (She picks up a bunch of them and holds them between her fingers.) Sometimes I like to put them between my fingers like this and-and hold them down here while I talk to you. (She is rubbing her hip with the carrots.) Umm, and-and-and y'know if I get really hot umm, I-I like to pick up this knife (She picks up a knife without putting the box down. She's holding the box between her cheek and shoulder) and-and umm, I-I put the cold steal against umm, (Pause) my body. (She doesn't have any exposed skin within reach of the knife, so while holding the carrots in one hand and the box between her face and shoulder, she rubs the knife on her stomach.)ScenesChandler: Are you all right?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, of course. I'm fine it's just that—(She drops the box and in a reflex action tries to catch it with her arm, the knife slips out and slowly flips through the air and comes point first down into Chandler's shoe.)

rows.Scenes: The hospital, Chandler has been rushed to the emergency room.]
rows.Content: The Doctor: What do we got here?ScenesThe Paramedic: Twenty year old has got a severed toe on his right foot.Scenes(They go through the doors into the trauma room, opening them by ramming the gurney through them, only Chandler's foot is hanging off the end and he screams in pain.)ScenesRoss: Can you please not do that feet first? You know where his injury is! Severed toe, you just said it!ScenesThe Doctor: It says here that the knife went right through your shoe.ScenesMr. Geller: Of course it did. They're made of wicker.ScenesThe Doctor: Did you bring the toe?ScenesMonica: Oh yes! I have it right here, on ice! (She takes a bag of ice out of her purse and hands it to the doctor.)ScenesThe Doctor: (opening it) Don't worry son, we'll just attach it and—(Stops suddenly.)ScenesMonica: What?! What is it?ScenesThe Doctor: You brought a carrot.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesThe Doctor: This isn't your toe, this is a small, very cold piece of carrot.ScenesRachel: You brought a carrot?!ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh my God! There's a toe in my kitchen.ScenesMonica: God, I'm sorry! I'll go back and get it!ScenesThe Doctor: It's too late, all we can do now is sow up the wound.ScenesChandler: Without my toe?! I need my toe!ScenesMonica: Wait, no-no-no, I can go really fast! Dad, give me the keys to your Porsche!ScenesMr. Geller: Oh, I'm not falling for that one!ScenesPresent Day

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is reacting to the story.]
rows.Content: Chandler: That's why I lost my toe?! Because I called you fat?!ScenesMonica: I didn't mean to cut it off. It was an accident.ScenesChandler: That's why for an entire year people called me Sir Limps-A-Lot?!ScenesMonica: I'm sorry! It wasn't your whole toe!ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, I miss the tip! It's the best part. It has the nail. (He storms out.)ScenesMonica: Chandler! (Follows him out.)ScenesRoss: (To Joey) Sir Limps-A-Lot, I came up with that.ScenesJoey: You're a dork.Scenes[Cut to the hallway, Chandler is standing in front of his door.]ScenesChandler: I can't believe this.ScenesMonica: Chandler, I said I was sorry.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, sorry doesn’t bring back the little piggy that cried all the way home! I hate this stupid day! And everything about it! I'll see you later.ScenesMonica: Oh wait, Chandler, come here is there anything I can do? Anything?ScenesChandler: Yeah, just leave me alone for a while. (He goes into his apartment.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Chandler is sitting on one of the chairs and the duck is running around him and quacking.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh-oh, I'm a duck! I go, "Quack, quack!" I’m happy all the time!Scenes(There's a knock on the door and Chandler gets up to answer it. He opens the door to reveal Monica with a turkey over her head.)ScenesChandler: Nice try.ScenesMonica: Wait, wait, wait! (She puts a Shriner's hat on the turkey.)ScenesChandler: Look, Monica…ScenesMonica: Look! (She puts a big, yellow pair of sunglasses on the bird.)ScenesChandler: This is not going to work.ScenesMonica: I bet this will work! (She starts dancing and Chandler cracks up.)ScenesChandler: You are so great! I love you!Scenes(Monica stops suddenly and turns around slowly.)ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Nothing! I said, I said "You're so great" and then I just, I just stopped talking!ScenesMonica: You said you loved me! I can't believe this!ScenesChandler: No I didn't!ScenesMonica: Yes, you did!ScenesChandler: No I didn't!ScenesMonica: You love me!ScenesChandler: No I don't! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!Scenes(Joey walks in and sees Monica. He freaks out and runs back into the hallway, screaming.)ScenesEnding CreditsScenesThanksgiving 1915

rows.Scenes: The Western front during World War I, Phoebe, in yet another past life, is once again a nurse tending to yet another dying soldier. But this time she's doing it with a French accent.]
rows.Content: French Phoebe:  Gauze! Gauze! I need to get some gauze in here! Can I please get some gauze in here! (A shell explodes outside next to the tent and when the smoke clears, Phoebe still has her arm.) Whew! (Her arm falls off and starts pumping out blood.) This is getting ridiculous uh!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Ross's SandwichScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the entire gang is there, eating breakfast. Phoebe is on the couch, fidgeting.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: What am I sitting on?ScenesChandler: Top of the world? Dock of the bay? (He tries to think of another but can't) I'm out.ScenesPhoebe: (taking something out of the couch) Ew-eww!! Undies!Scenes(She throws them into the kitchen and Rachel picks them up with the handle of a large spoon. Chandler and Monica have horrified looks on their faces.)ScenesRachel: All right! Who's are they? Who's are they?ScenesRoss: Well, they're not mine!ScenesChandler: Well, they're Joey's! They gotta be Joey's!Scenes(Rachel turns and stares at him.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, they're mine.ScenesChandler: See? They're Joey's! J-J-J-J-J-Joey's!ScenesRoss: Why are they here?ScenesJoey: I don't know uhh… (Pause as he thinks about it.) Well, I'm Joey. Yeah, I'm disgusting, I take my underwear off in other people's homes.ScenesRachel: Well, get 'em out of here! What's wrong with you?ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesRachel: (waving them in his face) Take 'em! (Joey makes a noise and jumps out of the way.) Joey, you can touch them! They're your underwear.ScenesJoey: (reluctantly taking them) Chandler? A word.Scenes(Follows Joey into their apartment and shrugs on his way out.)Scenes[Cut to the guy's apartment.]ScenesJoey: That's it! I'm tired of covering for you two! This has got to stop! (Realizes he still has the underwear in his hand.) Ahh! (Throws them towards Chandler's room.) And tighty-whiteys! What are you, 8?ScenesMonica: (entering) Thank you Joey, thank you so much!ScenesJoey: Oh hey, no, you're not welcome. Okay, look, I hate this! You guys keep embarrassing me! (To Monica) Yesterday, Rachel found your razor in our bathroom and I didn't know what to say, so I said it was mine and-and that I was playing a woman in a play. And one thing led to another and (He puts his leg on the chair and pulls up his pants leg to reveal that he now has shaved legs.)ScenesMonica: (inspecting his leg) Wow! And around the ankles, y'know that is a tough spot.ScenesJoey: Yeah, it was! All right, listen, I can't…ScenesChandler: (interrupting him) All this lying has been hard on us too.ScenesJoey: Oh-oh, yeah-yeah, I bet all the sex makes it easier!ScenesChandler: Well, yeah actually.ScenesMonica: We'll try to be more careful okay? It's just that, we don't want everyone to know because this is going really well, and maybe the reason it's going really well is because it's a secret.ScenesChandler: I know it sounds really weird, but we're just so bad at relationships.ScenesMonica: We are! Help us!ScenesChandler: Help!ScenesJoey: All right! But, (To Monica) you do it with me once.ScenesMonica: Joey!ScenesJoey: Didn't think so.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there as Phoebe enters with her nose stuck in a book.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, Phoebe!ScenesChandler: Hi, Pheebs!ScenesRachel: Hey, Pheebs!ScenesJoey: Hey, Pheebs!ScenesRachel: What are you reading?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Wethering Heights. I'm taking a literature class at the New School and I have to finish it for the first session tomorrow.ScenesChandler: I didn't know you were taking a class. That is so cool.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Well, I really liked that Lamaze class I took! Y'know and this time I thought I'd go for something, y'know a little more intellectual, with a less painful final exam.ScenesRachel: Honey that sounds like fun.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Ooh, you should come with me! Oh yeah, then I'd have someone to sit with!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Okay—ooh, but are you going to have time to read it?ScenesRachel: Oh, I read that in high school.ScenesPhoebe: This is going to be so much fun! Okay-shhh, I have to finish.ScenesRoss: (entering, depressed) Hi.ScenesJoey: What's wrong buddy?ScenesRoss: Someone at work ate my sandwich!ScenesChandler: Well, what did the police say?ScenesRoss: My Thanksgiving leftover sandwich. I can't believe someone ate it!ScenesChandler: Ross, it's just a sandwich!ScenesRoss: Just a sandwich? Look, I am 30 years old, I'm about to be divorced twice and I just got evicted! That sandwich was the only good thing going on in my life! Someone ate the only good thing going on in my life!ScenesMonica: Okay, look, I-I have enough stuff for one more sandwich, I mean I was going to eat it myself, but (motions that he can have it.)ScenesRoss: (quietly) That-that would be incredible. Thank you so much. I-I still can't believe someone ate it!! I mean, look, I left a note and everything.Scenes(Shows the note to Chandler who reads it aloud.)ScenesChandler: (reading) Knock-knock. Who's there? Ross Geller's lunch. Ross Geller's lunch, who? Ross Geller's lunch, please don't take me. Okay?ScenesJoey: I'm surprised you didn't go home wearing your lunch.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, look you wanna hold onto your food? You gotta scare people off. I learned that living on the street.ScenesRoss: Really?! So what would you say Pheebs? Stuff like uh, "Keep your mitts off my grub?ScenesChandler: Say Ross, when you picture Phoebe living on the street, is she surrounded by the entire cast of Annie?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, this will keep them away from your stuff. (Writes him a note and the gang reads it.)ScenesAll: Whoa! Ohh!!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you are a bad ass!ScenesPhoebe: Someday I'll, tell you about the time I stabbed the cop.ScenesMonica: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Well, he stabbed me first!!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's class, the class has already started and Rachel walks in late.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (To Phoebe) Sorry I'm late, but I left late.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRachel: So Pheebs, what is the book about?ScenesPhoebe: I thought you said you read it in high school.ScenesRachel: Well yeah, but then I remembered I started it and there was this pep rally and I was, I was on top of the pyramid but anyway—umm, what is this book about?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, umm, it's this tragic love story between Cathy and Heathcliff and umm, it takes place on like these really creepy mores in England. Which I think represents the wildness of Heathcliff's character. I totally get symbolism.ScenesThe Teacher: How would you characterize the theme of this book, uh let's see here (looks at his attendance sheet), Rachel Green?ScenesRachel: Umm, well I would have to say that it's a, it's tragic love story.ScenesThe Teacher: Well, that's sort of a given, but yes. Anyone else?ScenesRachel: Oh-oh-oh, symbolism! And uh, the-the uh, wildness of the mores, which I think is-is mirrored in the wildness of Heathcliff's character.ScenesThe Teacher: Excellent! What Rachel has shrewdly observed here…ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) You completely stole my answer!ScenesRachel: Well, honey that was pretty obvious.ScenesPhoebe: Well how would you know?! You didn't even read it!ScenesThe Teacher: What do you think? You in the blue shirt.ScenesPhoebe: I think that uh, yours is a question with many answers.ScenesThe Teacher: Would ya care to venture one?ScenesPhoebe: Would you care to venture one?ScenesThe Teacher: Are you just repeating what I'm saying?ScenesPhoebe: Are you just repeating what I'm saying?ScenesThe Teacher: All right, let's move on.ScenesPhoebe: Okay then.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel return from the class.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Yeah but why didn't you just say that you didn't read the book?!ScenesRachel: Be-because I didn't want him to think I was stupid! I mean, that was really embarrassing what happened to you!ScenesRoss: (entering) Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Phoebe! You're note, amazing! Not only did no one touch my sandwich, but people at work are actually afraid of me. Yeah, a guy called me mental! Mental Geller, yeah, I always wanted a cool nickname like that.ScenesMonica: Yeah, the best you got in high school was Wet Pants Geller.ScenesRoss: That was the water fountain! Okay?! Anyway, people are writing reports for me, uh pushing back deadlines to meet my schedule, I'm telling you, you get tough with people you can get anything you want. (Joey walks by with a cup of coffee.) Hey Tribbiani, give me that coffee! Now!Scenes(Joey casually pushes Ross over the back of the couch and sits down proud of himself.)

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Joey is returning from a date with Cynthia.]
rows.Content: Cynthia: God, this was really fun! I've been wondering if you were going to ask me out.ScenesJoey: So you uh, still wondering?ScenesCynthia: No, we just went out.ScenesJoey: You're smart. I like that.Scenes(He goes to open the door to his apartment, but finds it locked. As he's getting out his keys, Chandler and Monica quickly jump up from making out in the living room and run to Chandler's bedroom. The apartment has about 20 candles burning all over the place. Joey opens the door and ushers Cynthia in.)ScenesCynthia: Oh, candles! (Notices something.) What is that? A blanket? A video camera? Oh my God! (As she storms out, Rachel returns and overhears the conversation.)ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no-no, wait-wait-wait!!ScenesCynthia: I can't believe you thought that you were going to video tape us having sex on the first date! (She storms away and Rachel enters to confront Joey.)ScenesJoey: Hiya.ScenesRachel: Joey, is what she just said umm—Oh my God. (Looks around the room.) You were actually gonna… (Chandler picks this moment to return to the living room.) (Rachel stares in shock.)ScenesChandler: What is going on here?ScenesRachel: And with Chandler in the next room. What are you, what are you sick?Scenes(Chandler silently pleads with Joey to cover for them.)ScenesJoey: I'm Joey. I mean, I'm disgusting. I make low-budget adult films. (Points at Chandler, angrily.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's; continued from earlier. Joey is closing the door after Rachel leaves and is about to confront Chandler and Monica.]
rows.Content: Joey: You guys promised you'd be more careful! I mean, come on! The good Joey name is being dragged through the mud here!ScenesMonica: We're so sorry.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, I'm telling everyone about you! That's the only way to explain the underwear and the video camera that doesn't make me look like a pig!ScenesChandler: No-no, wait! There's got to be a better explanation. You can tell them you had to make an adult film for your (Thinks) adult film class.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I like that. But no-no, how does that explain why Rachel found my underwear at your place?ScenesChandler: Oh—I don't know.ScenesJoey: Well, get ready to come out of the non-gay closet!ScenesMonica: Okay, just wait, please. I promise we'll come up with something. Just give us a little more time.ScenesJoey: All right. Hey, but it better make me look really, really good. (Starts for his room.) Oh, and another thing, the video camera? Nice!!

rows.Scenes: The Museum of Prehistoric History (Ross's work); Ross is in the break room eating lunch as his boss, Dr. Leedbetter walks in.]
rows.Content: Dr. Leedbetter: Umm, Ross. May I have a word with you?ScenesRoss: Yeah, of course, Donald.ScenesDr. Leedbetter: We've been getting reports of some very angry behavior on your part.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesDr. Leedbetter: Threatening letters, refusal to meet deadlines, apparently people now call you mental.ScenesRoss: (Proudly) Yeah.ScenesDr. Leedbetter: We want you to speak to a psychiatrist.ScenesRoss: Oh no, you-you don't understand. Ugh, this is so silly. Umm, this is all because of a sandwich.ScenesDr. Leedbetter: (laughs) A sandwich?ScenesRoss: Yeah. You see my-my sister makes these amazing turkey sandwiches. Her secret is, she puts a, an extra slice of gravy soaked bread in the middle; I call it the Moist Maker. Anyway, I-I put my sandwich in the fridge over here…ScenesDr. Leedbetter: (laughs) Oh, you know what?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: I-I'm sorry. I, I-I-I believe I ate that.ScenesRoss: You ate my sandwich?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: It was a simple mistake. It could happen to anyone.ScenesRoss: (getting upset) Oh-oh really? Did you confuse it with your own turkey sandwich with a Moist Maker?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: No.ScenesRoss: Do you perhaps seeing a note on top of it?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: There may have been a-a joke or a limerick of some kind.ScenesRoss: (getting angry) That said it was my sandwich?!ScenesDr. Leedbetter: Now-now calm down. Come look in my office, some of it my still be in the trash.ScenesRoss: (jumping to his feet in anger) What?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: Well, it was quite large. I-I-I-I-I had to throw most of it away.ScenesRoss: You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!Scenes[Cut to an outside shot of the museum.]ScenesRoss: (losing control, we hear him shout outside) MY SANDWICH?!!!Scenes[Cut to a shot of a park.]ScenesRoss: MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross's scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's class; Rachel walks in, on time this time.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesRachel: (sitting down) So umm, what's this book about?ScenesPhoebe: You didn't read this one either?!ScenesRachel: Well, I was gonna, but I accidentally read something else.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: Vogue! Hey, so tell me about this Jane Eyre woman.ScenesPhoebe: No! You should've read it yourself!ScenesRachel: Come on Phoebe! Don’t be such a goodie-goodie!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! Okay, all right, so Jane Eyre, first of all, you'd think she's a woman, but she's not. She's a cyborg.ScenesRachel: A cyborg?! Isn't that like a robot?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, this book was light years ahead of its time.ScenesThe Teacher: (entering) Sorry I'm late. Let's get started. So, what did everybody think about Jane Eyre?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Rachel and I were just discussing it and she had some very interesting insights.ScenesThe Teacher: Well, go ahead Rachel.ScenesRachel: Uh, thank you Phoebe. Umm, well, what struck me most when reading Jane Eyre was uh, how the book was so ahead of its time.ScenesThe Teacher: If you're talking about feminism, I think you're right.ScenesRachel: Yeah, well, feminism yes, but also the robots.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is on the couch as Monica joins him.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey. Okay, so umm, since that video camera thing didn't work out uh, I thought that I would give you just a little preview. (Hands him a Polaroid.)ScenesChandler: (gasps) You're naked in this picture!ScenesMonica: I know.Scenes(Ross walks in, eating cotton candy. Monica nudges Chandler who hides the picture in his magazine. Ross sits down on the chair, he seems kinda out of it.)ScenesChandler: Ross?ScenesRoss: (in a stupor) Hey Chandler. (Sees Monica.) Monica!ScenesMonica: Ross, are you okay?ScenesRoss: I'm fine! I saw a psychiatrist at work today.ScenesMonica: Why?!ScenesRoss: On account of my rage.ScenesChandler: Which I may say, right now, is out of control.ScenesRoss: He gave me a pill for it.ScenesMonica: A pill?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. Well, when the psychiatrist told me I had to take a leave of absence because I yelled at my boss I started to get worked up again, so he offered me a tranquilizer. And I thought was a good idea so, I took it.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, they're making you take time off work?ScenesChandler: And you're okay with that?ScenesRoss: I don't know. It's going to be weird not having a job for a while, but I, I definitely don't care about my sandwich.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are returning from class.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering, angrily) Ugh, that was so embarrassing! I can't believe you let me go on and on like that!ScenesPhoebe: (smiling) I'm sorry. It was just so funny when you started comparing Jane Eyre to Robocop.ScenesRachel: That was not funny!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I snapped! Okay? You weren't taking the class seriously.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, come on! What is the big deal? I thought this was going to be something we could do together! Y'know, I thought it would be fun!ScenesPhoebe: Well, yeah! Fun is good, but y'know I also wanted to learn. Y'know, people are always talking about what they learned in high school and I never went to high school.ScenesRachel: Ohh. Oh, so you really wanted to learn. Yeah, y'know, Pheebs I just wanted to have fun. Ohh, you know who you should go with?

rows.Scenes: The Class; Monica has taken Rachel's spot.]
rows.Content: Monica: (yelling and waving her hand in the air) I know! I know! I know!ScenesThe Teacher: Monica, you asked the question.Scenes(She sits back defeated, and Phoebe groans with disgust.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's; Joey returns carrying a bucket of chicken, and starts going through the mail. While doing this, Monica's picture falls out. He bends over to pick it up and gasps. While he's staring at the picture, Rachel decides to come over and sees him looking at the picture.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (sees the picture) Oh my God! That's Monica!!ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no! No-no-no-no-no-no-no!ScenesRachel: You get away from me!! You sick, sick, sick, sick-o!!ScenesRoss: (entering, with the rest of the gang) What's going on?ScenesRachel: Joey has got a secret peephole!ScenesChandler: (Sees the picture) Oh no! No! No! No! (Monica gasps as well.)ScenesRachel: Yes! He has a naked picture of Monica! He takes naked pictures of us! And then he eats chicken and looks at them!Scenes(Ross stares in shock at him as he angrily puts down the chicken and takes off his coat.)ScenesRachel: Look! (Shows Ross the picture.)ScenesRoss: (covering his eyes) Dude! That's my sister! (She shows the rest of the gang.)ScenesMonica: (grabbing the picture) Give me that!ScenesPhoebe: All right, wait! Just wait. Everybody just calm down. Okay? Let's give our friend Joey a chance to explain why he's such a big pervert!ScenesJoey: No! I am not a pervert! Okay? It's just… I just… Kinda…ScenesChandler: All right, look! Look. I think I can explain this.Scenes(He walks over and stands behind Joey.)ScenesJoey: Thank you!ScenesChandler: Joey's a sex addict.ScenesJoey: What?!! (He turns around and stares at Chandler who's silently pleading with Joey to go along with it.) No I'm not!!ScenesMonica: It's okay! It's good! It's good. It's a disease!ScenesJoey: No! No! I am not a sex addict!ScenesMonica: Yes you are! That's the only way to explain all this stuff!ScenesJoey: No it isn't! No, it's not. Because you can also explain it with the truth!ScenesRachel: Well, what is the truth?ScenesRoss: Yeah, what's going on?ScenesPhoebe: What's going on?ScenesJoey: (thinking) I slept with Monica.ScenesChandler: Well let's….let's see what everybody thinks of that?ScenesMonica: Oh no!ScenesRoss: You slept with my sister?ScenesJoey: Uh yes, but it was, we just did it once uh, in London.ScenesRoss: This is not good for my rage. (Takes another pill.)ScenesRachel: Monica, is this true?ScenesJoey: Of course it's true! How else would you explain all the weird stuff that's been going on?ScenesMonica: Yes it's true.ScenesRachel: Okay, but if it only happened that one time, how come we found your underwear in our apartment the other day?ScenesJoey: Ahh—oy! That was the underwear I was wearing that night in London. Right Monica?ScenesMonica: I guess I wanted to keep it (Pause) as a souvenir.ScenesRoss: My God Monica!!ScenesChandler: Are you sure Joe? Are you sure you're not just a sex addict?ScenesJoey: No! If anyone's a sex addict here, it's Monica! Yeah. Yeah. She has been trying to get me back in the sack ever since London!ScenesPhoebe: So that's why she gave you a naked picture of herself.ScenesJoey: That makes sense!ScenesRachel: And the video camera?ScenesJoey: Uhh, Monica?ScenesMonica: I guess I set up the video camera to try and entice Joey.ScenesJoey: But sadly I could not be enticed.ScenesRoss: Unbelievable! I mean you really kept Joey's underwear?! Why? Why would you do that?!ScenesMonica: I'm Monica. I'm disgusting. I stalk guys and keep their underpants.ScenesJoey: Well, I think we've all learned something about who's disgusting and who's not. Eh? All right, now, I'm going to get back to my bucket. I'm only eating the skin, so the chicken's up for grabs. (Offers it to everyone.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's class; the class has ended and Phoebe is talking to one of her classmates.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I really thought you making a good point. I mean y'know, until you got cut off.ScenesA Female Student: Yeah, what's up with that girl Monica?ScenesPhoebe: I don't know! I didn't come with her!ScenesMonica: (entering, happily) All right everybody! Everybody guess what? I just convinced Paul to give us a test next week!ScenesAll: A test?!!ScenesMonica: Come on! Tests make us all better learners! Oh yeah! (Running out) We should have essay questions!!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With The Inappropriate SisterScenesWritten By: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesWith Help From: Aaron Miller

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's apartment, Ross is cleaning out the fridge. Joey walks from his room. He looks like he just woke up.]
rows.Content: Joey: What are you doing?ScenesRoss: I...reorganized the fridge. See, bottom shelf: meats and dairy. (There’s nothing on the shelf.) Middle shelf: fruits and vegetables. (There’s one lone tomato.) And top shelf: expired products. (The shelf is jammed packed.)ScenesJoey: Why are you doing this?ScenesRoss: Because I am bored...Out of my mind. I’ve already been to the bank, post office, and the dry cleaners.ScenesJoey: Dude, you just described seven days worth of stuff. You’ve got to spread it out a little, you know. Haven’t you ever been unemployed?ScenesRoss: Hey, I am not unemployed. I’m on sabbatical!ScenesJoey: Hey, don’t get religious on me, ok. (Ross looks a little confused.) A guy in your position needs to be a little better at relaxing. You know. Why do you think we have the comfortable chairs? Huh...come here…sit down. (Ross sits down.) Ready? (Joey flips the foot rest up.) Ahh!! (He reclines the chair fully.) Ohh, yeah!! Huh?!ScenesRoss: So what, we just sit?ScenesJoey: Ohh, no, no. We’re not going to just sit. (Joey sits down and hits the speed dial button on the phone.) Shhh. (It begins to ring.)ScenesChandler: (Answering the phone at work) Hello, Chandler Bing.ScenesJoey: (In a high pitched female voice) Hello Mr. Bing...I love you.ScenesChandler: (Angrily) Alright, whoever this is, stop calling me! (Ross and Joey laugh silently.) It’s been six months! It’s not funny!ScenesJoey: But, I love you.ScenesChandler: Leave me alone! For the love of God, leave me alone!!! (Joey hangs up.)ScenesJoey: And that’s Wednesday. (He reclines in his chair.) Ohh.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey, Monica, and Rachel are there. Phoebe walks in ringing a bell.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey you guys, guess what?ScenesChandler: The British are coming?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you and your ways. (She shakes the bell at him and sits down.) Since it’s Christmastime. I’m going to be one of those people collection donations.ScenesAll: Ohh.ScenesPhoebe: (Excitedly) Yeah, I already have my bell and later on...I get my bucket.ScenesChandler: Ohh.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah, I’m going to be out there spreading joy to the people. I mean, last year, I spread a little joy but not really enough. So this year, I’m going to do the whole city.ScenesMonica: You know, I knew a girl in high school who did that. She was very popular. (Chandler laughs.)ScenesJoey: So Pheebs, where are you doing all, your bell ringing?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, they gave me a great spot. Right by Macys. Yeah, they hardly ever give such a good spot to a rookie, but I’m the only one who can sing "Merry Christmas" in 25 languages. (She smirks.) I lied.ScenesRachel: Oh my god. Ok you guys, there’s Danny. Watch. Just watch this. (He walks past the couch to the counter.) See?! Still pretending he’s not interested. Ohh, he’s coming over. Just pretend like we don’t know him. We’ve forgotten who he is.ScenesDanny: Hey guys.ScenesAll: Hey Danny.ScenesMonica: Danny? You know Rachel? She’s nice. She’s not bad to look at, right?ScenesRachel: Thanks, Mon.ScenesDanny: Well, of course.ScenesMonica: Do you want to go out on a date with her?ScenesRachel: Monica!!!ScenesDanny: (Looking at Monica) Absolutely! Is Friday okay?ScenesMonica: Friday’s perfect...She can’t wait.ScenesDanny: (To Monica) On the date, I will be able to talk to her directly? (To Rachel) See ya Friday. (He walks out.)ScenesRachel: (Somewhat angrily) Okay. What the hell was that? You know what? Don’t answer me. (Giggling) I have a date with Danny.

rows.Scenes: Estelle's (Joey's Agent) Office, Joey is there.]
rows.Content: Joey: How could I not get the part? The play was about a 29-year-old Italian actor from Queens.ScenesEstelle: Well, Telia Shire suddenly became available.ScenesJoey: She’s a woman!ScenesEstelle: What can I say? She nailed it.ScenesJoey: (Very discouraged) Okay, is there anything else?ScenesEstelle: Well, you’re just going to say no again but...gay porn.

rows.Scenes: In front of Macys, Phoebe is collecting donations and ringing her bell.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Happy Holidays. Feliz Navidad. Allo, and Merry Christmas. (A man put some change in her bucket.) Ohh thank you sir. Here's some joy. (She waves her hand up and down as if she is spreading joy.)ScenesMonica: (Walking in from off screen.) Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: I just wanted to see how it's going.ScenesPhoebe: Well, it's going okay.ScenesMonica: (Taking out her wallet.) Well good, here let me help you out.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thanks!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Wow!Scenes(Monica puts some change in Phoebe's bucket.)ScenesPhoebe: Is that a new Swede jacket? It looks really expensive.ScenesMonica: Yeah. I guess. (She puts more money in the bucket.)ScenesPhoebe: Just get your nails done?ScenesMonica: Yes Phoebe, but this is all I have. Okay? (She pours out the rest of her change purse into the bucket.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay! Thanks! Happy Holidays, here's your joy. (She waves her arm and spreads her joy.)Scenes(A man walks up and puts a dollar bill in.)ScenesPhoebe: Thank you! And Happy Holidays.Scenes(The man starts to take some change out.)ScenesPhoebe: Wait, you can't take the money out.ScenesThe Man: I'm making change. I need change for the bus.ScenesPhoebe: But, can't you leave the dollar? This money is for the poor.ScenesThe Man: I'm poor! I gotta take the bus!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Seasons Greetings and everything, but still…ScenesThe Man: Bite me, blondie! (The man storms off.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'm going to give him something else besides joy, just… (She scowls at him.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Joey is telling Ross how he didn't get the part.]
rows.Content: Joey: That part was perfect for me! I can't believe I didn't get it!ScenesRoss: I'm sorry, man. Hey, y'know what you should do? You should make something happen for yourself. Y'know, like-like write a play. Write a movie! Huh? I mean, what about those Good Will Hunting guys?ScenesJoey: Come on Ross be realistic, y'know? If I did write something, what are the chances I could get those guys to star in it?Scenes(Ross just stares at him until he figures it out.)ScenesJoey: Wait a second, I could star in it!ScenesRoss: Or that.ScenesJoey: I can't write! Y'know I mean I-I-I'm an actor, I don't have the discipline that takes, y'know? I can't do it.ScenesRoss: I'll help you. Yeah, I'll make up a schedule and make sure you stick to it. And plus, it'll give me something to do.ScenesJoey: Really? You'd-you'd do that for me?!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Thanks!ScenesRoss: (grabbing a notepad and sitting down) All right, we'll start off slow. The only thing you have to do tonight is come up with the name of your main character.ScenesJoey: Done!ScenesRoss: And it can't be Joey.ScenesJoey: It's not.ScenesRoss: Or Joseph.ScenesJoey: (disappointed) Oh.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning. Monica enters from her room wearing nothing but a robe.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, what's up?ScenesRachel: I just saw Danny getting on the subway with a girl and he had his arm around her.ScenesMonica: Oh, honey, I'm sorry.ScenesRachel: Well, you should be, this is all your fault! You meddled in our relationship!!ScenesMonica: You had no relationship!!ScenesRachel: No, but I was doing my thing and everything was going according to the plan!ScenesMonica: Oh God, stop with the plan! So what, so what you saw him with a girl? Who cares?! That doesn't mean anything! Now look, you're going to go out on a date with Danny and you're going to be so charming he's gonna forget all about that stupid subway girl.ScenesRachel: She was kinda stupid. You're right. All right, I'm just gonna go on the date. I'm gonna go on the date. That is the new plan.Scenes(Rachel goes into her room and closes the door. Which allows Monica to let Chandler out of her room.)ScenesMonica: Come on, hurry!Scenes(Chandler runs out the door and closes it behind him. After a short pause the door opens and Chandler comes rushing back through, grabs Monica, kisses her good-bye, and heads back out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Joey is trying to write his movie, Chandler is playing a game on the counter by trying to flip a ping pong ball with a spoon into a nearby bowl.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, how do you spell suspicious?ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesJoey: Because I think this character is going to be suspicious about stuff.Scenes(Chandler makes it into the bowl.)ScenesChandler: Yes! Chandler Bing, 7! Chandler Bing, 0.ScenesJoey: You're driving me crazy with that!ScenesChandler: Okay, I'll stop.ScenesJoey: Don’t stop! Move the bowl further away! Ross could make that shot!Scenes(Chandler slides the bowl to the far end of the counter. He tries again, but he hits the spoon to hard and the ball goes flying away.)ScenesJoey: Well, you suck! But at least you suck at a man's game now.ScenesChandler: You wanna play?ScenesJoey: Chandler, I can't be playing games, Ross is gonna be home soon. And I have to write five whole pages if I'm gonna stick to his schedule.ScenesChandler: Well, so, play for the next 30 minutes and then write until he gets home.ScenesJoey: (jumping up) All right! But uh, listen, what do you say we crank it up a notch?ScenesChandler: I'm intrigued.ScenesJoey: All right, all we need is a little lighter fluid.ScenesChandler: Okay, but be careful okay, because I wanna get our security deposit back.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I think we said good-bye to that when we invented hammer darts.ScenesChandler: Do you even remember which part of the wall is not spackle?ScenesJoey: Uh yeah, right here. (He punches his fist through the wall next to the door.)

rows.Scenes: In front of Macys, Phoebe is still ringing her bell. A guy puts some change into the bucket.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Thank you, Happy Holidays.Scenes(Another woman walks up and throws something into the bucket.)ScenesPhoebe: Now, that's trash. Young lady, you can't… (The lady ignores her and walks off.) Hey! Stop that young lady, she donated trash!Scenes(Another guy walks by and throws his light cigarette butt in the bucket.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!! (The bucket starts smoking.) The charity's on fire! Help! (Yet another guy walks by carrying a cup, which Phoebe grabs.) Oh good! Thank you, I need that. (She throws onto the smoldering fire. Suddenly the bucket erupts in flames.) Whoa! What is that?! (She sniffs the cup.) (To the guy.) It's nine o'clock in the morning!

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Ross is reading what Joey wrote.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right. (Reading.) A room. A man enters, he looks suspicious. (Stops reading a flips the page to find the next one is blank.) That's it? (Joey shrugs.) Joey, you're supposed to have five pages done by now! Including an exciting incident! (Flipping through the rest of the pad.) And what is, and what is all this?! (Reading.) The official rulebook of Fireball.ScenesJoey: Yeah, that's the uh, game we were playing.ScenesChandler: (entering from his room carrying a fire extinguisher and wearing oven mitts) Oh yeah, it's great! See you take a tennis ball, a bowl, and some lighter fluid—Op! Op! (He puts out a small fire which has re-ignited in his room.)ScenesRoss: This is helping your career?! Huh? I thought you wanted to be an actor not the creator of crazy lawsuit game!ScenesJoey: You're right, you're right, I'll get back to work.ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) And shame on you! You should know better, Joey needs to work. (To Joey) Now come on!ScenesJoey: Hey!Scenes(He tries to fire a burnt tennis ball into the bowl Chandler is standing by, but Ross grabs the ball away from him.)ScenesRoss: No! Ah-ah-ah-ah-ah! You can have this back when the five pages are done! (After Joey walks past, Ross throws the ball down in pain.) Ahh! (Chandler shows him the burn spots on his oven mitts.)

rows.Scenes: Outside Danny's apartment, Danny and Rachel are returning from their date.]
rows.Content: Danny: I had a really nice time tonight.ScenesRachel: So did I. I'm really glad Monica asked us out.Scenes(He kisses her.)ScenesDanny: I'd love to ask you in, but uh, my sister's visiting and I think she's asleep on the couch.ScenesRachel: You're sister? You're sister's asleep on the couch? (Danny nods, "Yes.") Ohhh! I saw her with you on the subway and now she's asleep on the couch!ScenesDanny's Sister: (opening the door) Oh, I thought I heard you.ScenesDanny: Oh hey, great, you're up. Rachel, this is my sister Krista. Krista, this is Rachel.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesKrista: Nice to meet you. I wish you'd told me we were having company, I'd fix myself up!ScenesDanny: Like it would help.ScenesKrista: You are so bad! (Hits him softly.)ScenesDanny: You are! (Hits her back.)ScenesKrista: You are! (Hits him softly.)ScenesDanny: You are! (Hits her back.)ScenesKrista: You are! (Hits him softly.)ScenesDanny: You are! (Hits her back.)ScenesKrista: You are! (Hits him harder this time.)ScenesDanny: You are so dead! I'm gonna get you.Scenes(He starts chasing her around Rachel a couple of times before she runs into the living room and he tackles her on the couch where he starts tickling her.)ScenesRachel: (not sure what to do) Uh, it was very nice meeting you. (They continue to ignore her.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is complaining to Ross and Monica about the bucket.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Nobody! Nobody respects the bucket! You wouldn't believe what people put in here! Look! (Hands it to Monica.) Okay, does this look like a garbage can to you?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesPhoebe: Does it look like an ashtray?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesPhoebe: Does it look like a urinal?ScenesMonica: Eww!! (Throws the bucket down.)ScenesRoss: So Pheebs, are you gonna go back out there or what?ScenesPhoebe: Well, yeah! But I'm not gonna take anymore crap. Okay? No more Mrs. Nice Bucket!ScenesMonica: Yeah, good for you. Y'know you're tough, you lived on the streets.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I'm gonna go back to being Street Phoebe. Yeah! Oh but, y'know what? I can't go totally back because Street Phoebe really wouldn't be friends with you guys. Sorry. (Leaves.)ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, umm, can I ask you guys something?ScenesMonica and Ross: Sure.ScenesRachel: Uh, I don't have any brothers so I don't know, but uh, did you guys wrestle?ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, yeah.ScenesMonica: All the time. In fact, I was undefeated.ScenesRoss: Uh, you weighted 200 pounds.ScenesMonica: Still, I was quick as a cat.ScenesRachel: Well, I met Danny's sister yesterday, and uh that was actually the girl on the subway.ScenesMonica: Oh, you're kidding.ScenesRachel: Yeah, they were very y'know…wrestley. But, I guess that's normal?ScenesMonica: (laughing with Ross) We don't, we don't wrestle now.ScenesRoss: Yeah, not since I got too strong for you.ScenesMonica: Too strong for me?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: You wanna go right now? 'Cause I'll take you right now, buddy! You wanna go?ScenesRoss: Oh fine.ScenesMonica: Ready? (They grab a hold of each other's necks.) Wrestle! (They start wrestling.)ScenesRachel: Okay, y'know what uh, actually, that's great. That helps a lot. Thanks. (She leaves them to wrestle.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Ross is cleaning the foosball table, Joey is working on his script.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering from his bedroom) Guys, come on! Let's go! The puck drops in 20 minutes! Come on, Joe!ScenesRoss: Joey's not going.ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) I didn't finish my five pages.ScenesChandler: Well, why can't you do them tomorrow?ScenesRoss: Because tomorrow he's redoing yesterday's pages.ScenesJoey: Yesterday's pages did not reflect my best work.ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Why don't you cut him a little slack? Okay? Maybe if he relaxes a little bit, he'll get some work done.ScenesRoss: I think he's been relaxing enough, thanks to you and Fireball.ScenesJoey: Dude, if you think Fireball's relaxing, you've obviously have never played.ScenesChandler: The only reason you're doing this to Joey is because you're bored. Okay, it's not his fault that you're unemployed.ScenesRoss: I am not unemployed. I'm on sabbatical!ScenesJoey: Come on look guys, don't fight.ScenesRoss: And the reason I'm doing this is because I am Joey's friend. And if you were a good friend, you'd be doing the same thing.ScenesChandler: Oh, so being a good friend means acting like a total jerk?ScenesRoss: If it does? Then you're an amazing friend of mine.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey guys, hey! How about we settle this over a friendly game of Fireball? Huh? I'll go unhook the smoke detectors!ScenesRoss: How about we settle this right now! (He rips up the tickets.) There! Now, no one's going to the game. Ha-ha-ha!ScenesChandler: I paid for those tickets!ScenesRoss: No you didn't. You said you would, but you never did!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! (Makes an unintelligible taunting sound.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are listening to a story being told by Danny and his sister.]
rows.Content: Danny: …so we finally get to the top of the mountain and airhead here (His sister) forgets the camera!ScenesJoey: Oh, y'know the same thing happened to me one time.ScenesChandler: When did that happen to you?!ScenesJoey: Don't you remember when we were jogging in the park and we saw that really pretty bird and wanted to take a picture—I didn't have my camera!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah. First off all, chasing the Churo guy isn't jogging.ScenesKrista: Oh, this is so good (A piece of cake.) you have got to try it. (She takes some on her finger and feeds it to Danny. Then takes a little more and does it again. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang stares on in shock. Then they pick up a part of it and some filling falls into his lap.)ScenesDanny: Oh, damn! I got it on my pants.ScenesKrista: Here, I'll get it. (She grabs a napkin and tries to wipe it up. The thing that gets the rest of the gang going is that she's whipping awfully close to his crotch. In fact, she is whipping his crotch. Chandler's about to come out of his chair.)ScenesKrista: We'd better take these pants off upstairs or that stain's gonna set.ScenesDanny: Yep. (To Rachel) I'm gonna wear these on our date tonight.ScenesRachel: Oh, great!ScenesChandler: Okay, bye! (To the gang.) Oh my God!!ScenesMonica: That was unbelievable!ScenesRachel: Okay, see? I told you!ScenesJoey: Yeah, wow, sorry Rach.ScenesChandler: I don't believe they're brother and sister.ScenesJoey: They're brother and sister!!!

rows.Scenes: In front of Macys, Phoebe has adorned her bucket with numerous signs. Like "We are not a urinal!" and "I have no Macys info." And other stuff like that. She also has a scowl on her face as she is ringing her bell. A little old lady walks up to make a donation but Phoebe stops her.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh whoa-whoa-whoa! Wait a minute, open up your hand; let me take a look. (The lady opens up her hand.) Quarter. Dime. Lint? Not interested in that. (She throws the lint away.) What's this? A Canadian coin? Get outta here! (The lady walks away.)Scenes(Another man walks up with a drink in his hand, Phoebe stops him too.)ScenesPhoebe: Whoa-whoa-whoa! No drinks near the bucket! Set it down over there and then you can make a contribution! (The guy starts to walk away with a hurt look on his face.) And you can leave the hurt bunny look over there too! (Her boss and a co-worker walk up.) Hi Bob! (The same old lady from before walks bye.) (To the old lady.) I thought I told you to get outta here!ScenesBob: Uh, Phoebe we've been getting complaints and uh, we're gonna move you to a less high-profile spot.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesBob: Umm, Ginger's gonna take over this corner.ScenesPhoebe: That chick can't handle my corner.ScenesBob: Look, either you leave, or we remove you.ScenesPhoebe: Fine. (She hands her bell to Ginger and starts to take down her signs.) (The same old lady walks by again.) All right, I'll give you one pointer. Look out for that bitch. (The old lady.)

rows.Scenes: Danny's apartment, there's a knock on the door and he answers it.]
rows.Content: Danny: Oh, hey Rach! I thought we said seven?ScenesRachel: Yeah uh, y'know what uh, let's skip it.ScenesDanny: What?! Why?!ScenesRachel: Umm, you-you and your sister seem to have umm, a very special bond, and…ScenesDanny: Oh great! That special bond again! Why do women have such a problem with the fact that I'm close with my sister?ScenesRachel: Well, okay, look. I don't know, listen, I don't know what's going on here but let's…ScenesDanny: Do-do you, do you have brothers?ScenesRachel: No, I have two sisters. But one of them has a very masculine energy.ScenesDanny: Are you close with them?ScenesRachel: No-no, they're not very nice people.ScenesDanny: Okay, listen, I really like you. Okay? I think this can go somewhere. So what if I'm close to my family, are you gonna let that stand in the way of us?ScenesRachel: Well, uh, I-I don't know. See when-when you put it that way y'know it does sort of…ScenesKrista: (calling from the bathroom) Danny! Hurry up! The bath is getting cold!ScenesDanny: (seeing Rachel's shocked look) What?ScenesRachel: Yeah, okay, I'll see you later. (Gets up and runs from the apartment.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Ross is there as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh hey! There's some kids playing in the street, you wanna go down there and give them a project, ruin their day?ScenesRoss: Hey, if they have a ball maybe you can stick razor blades in it and teach them a new game, Gonna Need Stitches Ball.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys! I was at the library all morning and I already finished my five pages for today!ScenesRoss: Yay!ScenesChandler: Great! Now, we can go to the Ranger game! (Pause) Last night!ScenesJoey: No dude, Ross tore up the tickets!ScenesRoss: I guess when you don't have so many distractions, it's easier for you to focus. Huh?ScenesChandler: Yeah or also when you don't have somebody breathing down your neck ALL THE LIVE LONG DAY!!ScenesJoey: Yeah, well, that's fine, but the important thing is that I finished it. And uh, I think it's really good, but y'know it'd really help me is if I could hear it. So would you guys read it for me?ScenesChandler: All right. (Takes a copy.)ScenesRoss: All right. (Takes another copy.)ScenesJoey: Okay. (Reading.) "It's a typical New York City apartment. Two guys are hanging out." Ross (Points to him.)Scenes(Ross and Chandler start to read Joey's script aloud.)ScenesRoss: Hey man.ScenesChandler: What is up?ScenesRoss: About yesterday, I was really wrong. I am sorry.ScenesChandler: No, it was me. I'm sorry. I over reacted.ScenesRoss: Maybe it was both of us, but we had our best friend's interest… (Pauses and looks at Joey.) But we had our best friend's interest at heart.ScenesChandler: Could I be more sorry. (Looks at Joey.)ScenesRoss: I don't know, I'm one sorry polentologist. (Stops reading.) All right Joey, we get it. (To Chandler) I'm sorry.ScenesChandler: (To Ross) I'm sorry too.ScenesJoey: Oh no! No-no, keep reading! The good part's coming up. Keep going.ScenesRoss: (reading from the script.) I am sorry, Chandler.ScenesChandler: I am sorry, Ross.ScenesJoey: A handsome man enters. (Playing the part of the handsome man.) Hey! How's it going guys? I don't know what you two were talking about, but I'd like to say thanks to both of you. You, (Ross) you wouldn't let me give up on myself, and you (Chandler) well you co-created Fireball. The end.ScenesChandler: This took you all day?!ScenesJoey: No-no, this only took five minutes. I spent the rest of the day coming up with new, Ultimate Fireball. (Takes out a bowling ball and a propane torch.) Ha-ha!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are about to read another one of Joey's efforts.]
rows.Content: Joey: (Reading the scene set up.) Okay, it's a typical New York City apartment. Two girls are just hanging out.Scenes(Monica and Rachel begin to read from the script.)ScenesMonica: Hi, how are you doing Kelly?ScenesRachel: I'm doing just fine! God, Tiffany, you smell so great!ScenesMonica: It's my new perfume. Why don't you come closer where you can really appreciate it?Scenes(They both start to read ahead.)ScenesRachel: Oh, y'know Joey, you are sick!ScenesMonica: This is disgusting!Scenes(They both throw the scripts in his face.)ScenesRachel: I'm not reading this!ScenesJoey: What?! Wait-wait-wait! The handsome man was about to enter!!ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With All The ResolutionsScenesTeleplay by: Suzie VillandryScenesStory by: Brian BoyleScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are hosting a New Year's party. So the place is crowded and in a shameless promotion for NBC they're watching Jay Leno's coverage of New Year's from Time Square.]
rows.Content: Jay Leno: (On TV to Dick Clark) Is there any entertainment there? What are people doing?ScenesJoey: All right! Here we go! 1999! The year of Joey!ScenesChandler: (deadpan, standing next to Monica) We're very happy for you.ScenesJoey: What's the matter?!ScenesChandler: We wanted to kiss at midnight, but nobody else is going to so y'know…ScenesJoey: All right, I'll take care of it.ScenesMonica: Oh no, wait! Joey!Scenes(They try to stop him, not sure of what he's planning. He ignores them and goes to talk to Ross.)ScenesRoss: (hopping) 73! 72! 71!ScenesJoey: Ross! Ross! Ross, listen! Who are you kissing at midnight, huh? Rachel or Phoebe?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: Well you gotta kiss someone, you can't kiss your sister.ScenesRoss: Well, who's gonna kiss my sister.ScenesJoey: Chandler.ScenesRoss: Awww, man! Really?ScenesJoey: Dude-dude, who would you rather have kiss your sister, me or Chandler?ScenesRoss: That's a good point.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Oh well, since I have that whole history with Rachel, I guess Phoebe.ScenesJoey: Okay, great!ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesJoey: Pheebs! Pheebs! Ross wants to kiss you at midnight!ScenesPhoebe: It's so obvious, why doesn't he just ask?ScenesJoey: Rach! Rach! Listen, I'm gonna kiss you at midnight.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: Well, everyone's gotta kiss someone. You can't kiss Ross you got the history.ScenesRachel: So?ScenesJoey: So? Who would you rather have kiss you, me or Chandler?ScenesRachel: Oh, good point.ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesAll: (watching the ball drop) 3! 2! 1! HAPPY NEW YEAR!!Scenes(And with that everyone starts playing tonsil hockey. Chandler with Monica, Ross with Phoebe, and Joey with Rachel.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Happy New Year!ScenesMonica: Happy New Year.ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe) Happy New Year, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: You too!ScenesRachel: (To Joey) Happy New Year, Joey!ScenesJoey: So did that do anything for ya?Scenes(Rachel slowly walks away.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, after the party. Everyone has left, except for the gang.]
rows.Content: Ross: Y'know what? I'm gonna go out on a limb and say no divorces in '99!ScenesRachel: But your divorce isn't even final yet.ScenesRoss: Just the one divorce in '99! Y'know what, I am gonna be happy this year. I am gonna make myself happy.ScenesChandler: Do you want us to leave the room, or?ScenesRoss: Everyday I am gonna do one thing that I haven't done before. That my friends is my New Year's resolution.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! That's a good one! Mine is to pilot a commercial jet.ScenesChandler: That's good one too, Pheebs. Now all you have to do is find a planeload of people who's resolution is to plummet to their deaths.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe your resolution is to not make fun of your friends, especially the ones who may soon be flying you to Europe for free on their own plane.ScenesMonica: She has a better chance of sprouting wings and flying up your nose than you do of not making fun of us.ScenesRoss: In fact, I'll bet you 50 bucks that you can't go the whole year without making fun of us. Eh, y'know what, better yet? A week.ScenesChandler: I'll take that bet my friend. And you know what, paying me the 50 bucks could be the "new thing you do that day!" (Ross looks at him.) And it starts right now!ScenesJoey: All right, my New Year's resolution is to learn how to play the guitar.ScenesRoss: Ohh.ScenesPhoebe: Really?! How come?ScenesJoey: Well, y'know those special skills I have listed on my resume? I would love it would be great if one of those was true.ScenesPhoebe: Do you want me to teach you? I'm a great teacher.ScenesJoey: Really? Who-who have you taught?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I taught me and I love me.ScenesJoey: Yeah that'd be great! Thanks Pheebs!ScenesRachel: Op, look! Claire forgot her glasses! And she's gonna be really needing these to keep an eye on that boyfriend, who, I hear, needs to keep his stapler in his desk drawer, if you know what I'm talking about.ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, maybe your resolution should be to umm, gossip less.ScenesRachel: I don't gossip!Scenes(They all laugh.)ScenesRachel: Well, maybe sometimes I find out things or I hear something and I pass that information on y'know kinda like a public service, it doesn't mean I'm a gossip. I mean, would you call Ted Kopel a gossip?ScenesMonica: Well if Ted Kopel talked about his coworkers botched boob jobs, I would.ScenesRachel: What? They were like this!Scenes(She puts her hands over her breasts and indicates that the coworkers boob job resulted in one pointing up and one pointing down with her hands by pointing up with one hand and down with the other.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is talking to a beautiful woman as Chandler and Joey enter.]
rows.Content: Woman: I'll see you tomorrow.ScenesRoss: Okay! (She leaves.) (To Chandler and Joey.) Hey!ScenesChandler and Joey: Hey!ScenesRoss: I just asked that girl out.ScenesChandler: Nice!ScenesJoey: Nice!! Yeah! Is that part of your resolution, your new thing for today?ScenesRoss: Yes it is. See. (Shows them the piece of paper she gave him with her name and phone number on it.)ScenesChandler: (reading it) Elizabeth Hornswoggle?ScenesRoss: That's right, uh, Elizabeth Hornswoggle.ScenesChandler: Horn-swoggle.ScenesJoey: You all right Chandler? Is there something funny about that name?ScenesChandler: No. No, I just think that maybe I-I'd heard it somewhere before. (Sits down rubbing his temple.)ScenesJoey: Oh really! Where? Somewhere funny I'd bet! (Chandler is straining to keep quiet as Phoebe enters.)ScenesRoss: Hi, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, guess what? I-I have a date with Elizabeth (Talking into Chandler's ear.) Hornswoggle.ScenesPhoebe: Hornswoggle? (To Chandler) Ooh, this must be killing you.ScenesRoss: All right, see you later.ScenesJoey: See ya! All right Pheebs, I am ready for my first lesson.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Joey tries to take the guitar.) Oh no-no-no, you don't touch the guitar! First you learn here, (Points to her head.) then you learn here. (Points to the guitar.)ScenesJoey: Umm, okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, lesson one: chords. Now, I don't know the actual names of the chords but umm, I-I-I made up names for the way my hand looks while I'm doing them. (She starts to show Joey the chords. Transcribers Note: For this one you'll have to use your imagination, 'cause it would take me 50 pages to describe each one. So if you want to see them, you'll have to wait for this episode to come to a TV near you.) (Holding up her hand and then reconfiguring her hand with each name.) So then, this is Bear Claw. Okay, umm, Turkey Leg and Old Lady. (Joey tries to imitate them.)ScenesChandler: What an interesting approach to guitar instruction. Y'know some might find it amusing, I myself find it regular.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering with Rachel.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey everybody, Rachel was so good today. She didn't gossip at all.ScenesRachel: I didn’t! Even when I found out…umm, all right, well let's just say I found something out something about someone and let's just say she's gonna keep it. (Goes into her room.)ScenesJoey: Hey, Pheebs! Check-check this out. (Holds up his hand in one of Phoebe's chords.)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, you nailed the Old Lady! (They both laugh at what she said.)ScenesJoey: Yeah listen so, I thought I was getting better, so on my way home today I stopped by this guitar store and…ScenesPhoebe: Did you, did you touch any of the guitars while you were there? Did you?!ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Give me your hands. (He does and she smells his left hand.) Strings. Gimme it! (He gives her his right hand and she smells it as well.) Pick. Do you want to learn to play guitar?ScenesJoey: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: Then don't touch one!!ScenesRoss: (entering, with Ben) Hi!ScenesBen: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi Ben!ScenesBen: Auntie Monica!! (He runs to hug her.)ScenesChandler: (notices something) Ross is wearing leather pants! Does nobody else see that Ross is wearing leather pants? (Pause, no one speaks.) Someone comment on the pants!ScenesRachel: I think they're very nice.ScenesMonica: I like 'em.ScenesJoey: Yeah! (Chandler bangs the table in frustration.)ScenesMonica: I like them a lot.ScenesChandler: That's not what I had in mind! See, people like Ross don't generally wear these types of pants. You see, they're very tight. (Motions to Ross's buttock.) Maybe there's something in that area.Scenes(They all speak at once in general approval of his pants selection; Joey asks where he got them. I can't pick out the rest of it.)ScenesRoss: Oh see, I-I needed a new thing for today and there's this leather store that always smells so good and I thought to myself, "Wow, (To Chandler) I never really owned a good smelling pair of pants before.Scenes(No one says anything.)ScenesChandler: Oh come on!! (Storms out.)ScenesRoss: (after he's left) Okay, seriously, what do you think?ScenesJoey: You look like a freak.ScenesRachel: Awful, absolutely awful. (Plus other negative comments from Phoebe and Monica.)Scenes(Monica starts taking pictures of Ross and Ben, with the flash.)ScenesRoss: What are you, what are you doing?ScenesMonica: It's my New Year's resolution!ScenesRoss: What, to blind my child?ScenesMonica: No! To take more pictures of all of us together. I mean I really think it's the best resolution because everyone will enjoy the pictures.ScenesJoey: Well, everyone will enjoy my music as well. (Does a chord and Monica starts taking pictures of him and Phoebe. They both start to strike a pose with the excessive amount of pictures that Monica takes.)

rows.Scenes: Elizabeth Hornswoggle's apartment; Ross is there on his date with her. They are sitting on the couch watching a movie. Ross is obviously hot.]
rows.Content: Ross: (talking to himself) My God! These pants are burning up! (He's still wearing the leather pants.) (She snuggles closer.) Oh come on, she wants to snuggle now! What is she trying to kill me? It's like a volcano in here! (Out loud.) Are you hot?ScenesElizabeth Hornswoggle: No.ScenesRoss: Okay, it must just be me then.Scenes(He shifts on the couch and a ripping sound emanates from his lower regions, the sound reminds one of a brief explosion of gas. In other words, it sounds like he farted. She has a look of horrific wonderment, wondering "Did he just fart?")ScenesRoss: That was just the pants on the couch. Umm, hey, do you, do you mind if I use your bathroom?ScenesElizabeth: No, go ahead.ScenesRoss: Thanks. (Gets up and as he does so, the sound returns. Without another word he heads into her bathroom.)Scenes[Cut to Elizabeth Hornswoggle's bathroom, Ross frantically pulls his shirt out and drops his pants. He exhales in sheer ecstasy as the coolness of the bathroom envelops his legs. He sits on the cast iron bathtub, again gasping in pleasure. He next grabs a magazine and starts to blow air on his exposed legs, but that doesn't work the way he wants it to. So he throws the magazine down, looks around for another idea, and finds one. He jumps up and hops to the sink. He turns on the water and starts to splash some on his legs, cooling them further.]ScenesRoss: (in ecstasy) Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh……….ScenesElizabeth: (yelling from outside) Hey, my favorite part is coming up!ScenesRoss: 'Kay!Scenes(He goes to pull up his pants, but can't seem to get them past his knees. He frantically tries to pull them up to no avail. Panic sets in.)ScenesRoss: Oh my God!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is drilling Joey on the chords as Monica looks on.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Tiger! (Joey moves his hand in an attempt to do the chord, in fact he does it with each name.) Dragon! Iceberg!! (He fails.) Joseph, did you even study at all last night?ScenesJoey: Yes! Yes, I did.ScenesPhoebe: Then do Iceberg!ScenesJoey: (thinks) (quietly) G-sharp.ScenesPhoebe: G-sharp? Have you been studying the real names of the chords? (Joey doesn't answer.) Have you? (He looks away in shame.) Oh my God!ScenesJoey: What?! I didn't touch a guitar!ScenesPhoebe: No, but you're questioning my method!ScenesJoey: No, I'm not questioning it, I'm saying it's stupid! (Notices Monica standing between them and smiling.) What?! (The camera clicks, taking another picture.)ScenesMonica: Thank you. (Leaves.)ScenesPhoebe: Y'know none of my other student thought I was stupid.ScenesJoey: Your other student, was you!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well, y'know maybe you just need to try a little harder!ScenesJoey: (looking in the Yellow Pages) Look, maybe I need to try a real teacher! Right here! Here! Andy Cooper, he teaches guitar and look ooh, there's a nice picture of him with a little kid and THE KID'S GOT A GUITAR!!!!!! (Storms out.)ScenesPhoebe: Fine! You go learn from your qualified instructor! But don't come crying to me when everyone's sick and tired of hearing you play Bad, Bad Leroy Brown!!ScenesRachel: (entering, singing) "Baddest man in the whole damn town.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, fine! Take his side! (Storms out.)Scenes(Rachel looks shocked, gets over it, notices she's alone, and picks up the phone. The last part of which is something she shouldn't have done, because the phone is already in use. By Monica, and now Rachel can hear every word.)ScenesMonica: (on phone) I can't wait to be with you! I'll sneak over as soon as Ross picks up Ben. I'll just tell Rachel I'm gonna be doing laundry for a couple of hours.ScenesChandler: (on phone) Laundry. Huh. Is that my new nickname? (Rachel is absolutely stunned, she opens her mouth in absolute amazement.)ScenesMonica: (on phone) Awww, y'know what your nickname is, Mr. Big…ScenesRachel: Arghh!! (She quickly hangs up the phone and starts to pace around wondering what to do.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, The phone rings and Joey answers it.]
rows.Content: Joey: (answering phone) Hello?ScenesRoss: (calling from Elizabeth's bathroom) Joey, it's Ross! I need some help!ScenesJoey: Uhh, Chandler's not here.ScenesRoss: Well, you can help me!ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRoss: Listen, I'm in Elizabeth's bathroom…ScenesJoey: Nice!ScenesRoss: No, I-I got really hot in my leather pants so I took them off but they must have shrunk from the-the sweat or-or-or my legs expanded from the heat. Look, I-I can't put them back on. I can't!ScenesJoey: Oh. That is quite a situation. Uh, do you see any like, powder?ScenesRoss: Powder! Yeah! Yeah, I have powder! (Grabs some of her shelf.)ScenesJoey: Good-good, okay, sprinkle some of that on your legs, it'll absorb some of the moisture and then you can get your pants back up.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay, hold on! (He puts the phone down and proceeds to spread a large amount of powder on his legs and makes another attempt at pulling up his pants. It doesn't work, and without picking up the phone leans down to it.) (Almost in tears.) They're not coming on man.ScenesJoey: Umm, do you see any—oh, Vaseline?ScenesRoss: Ohh, I-I see lotion, I have lotion! Will that work?ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure, spread some of that on there.ScenesRoss: Hold on.Scenes(Ross proceeds to apply copious amounts of the lotion on his legs. He literally starts spraying the back of his legs with the lotion, and as he applies some to his butt he makes a happy face like he enjoyed that sensation. After using about half the bottle he again tries to pull up his pants, but at the first sign of resistance, his hand slips off of the pants and hits him in the forehead.)ScenesJoey: Ross? You okay?ScenesRoss: They're still, they're still not coming on man and the lotion and the powder have made a paste!ScenesJoey: Really?! Uhh, what color is it?ScenesRoss: What difference does that make?!ScenesJoey: Well, I'm just—if the paste matches the pants, you can make yourself a pair of paste pants and she won't know the difference!ScenesRachel: (entering) Joey, do you have a minute?ScenesRoss: Dude, what am I gonna…ScenesJoey: (To Ross) Uh, Rachel's here, so good luck man, let me know how it works out. (He hangs up the phone and strands Ross in the bathroom.)ScenesRachel: Oh, Joey, I have such a problem!ScenesJoey: Oh well, you're timing couldn't be better. I am putting out fires all over the place.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay. Okay. Joey, I have got to tell you something!ScenesJoey: What-what is it, what is it?ScenesRachel: Oh my God, it's so huge, but you just have to promise me that you cannot tell anyone.ScenesJoey: Oh no, no-no-no-no! I don't want to know!ScenesRachel: Yes! Yes! Yes, you do want to know! This is unbelievable!ScenesJoey: I don't care, Rach! Look, I am tired of being the guy who knows all the secrets but can't tell anyone!ScenesRachel: What? What secrets? You know secrets? What are they?ScenesJoey: And you're not supposed to be gossiping!!ScenesRachel: I know, I know! I just can't keep this one in, so I pick up the phone… (Joey in a childish attempt to not hear what Rachel is about to say, puts his fingers in his ears and starts to scream loudly. Rachel turns and walks out upon seeing that Joey's not gonna listen, and as she exits Chandler walks in and sees Joey in his current state.)ScenesJoey: I'm not listening to you!Scenes(Chandler seeing that Joey has his eyes closed sneaks over and picks up the chicken. The chicken starts flapping it's wings in protest as Chandler holds the chicken inches from Joey's face. Joey stops yelling and upon opening his eyes sees the chicken, screams, and falls to the ground in horror.)

rows.Scenes: Elizabeth's apartment; Elizabeth is inquiring as to the delay in Ross's exit from her bathroom.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: Ross, umm, you've been in there for a long time. I'm starting to get kinda freaked out.ScenesRoss: All right, I'm coming out. Hey, can you turn the lights off.ScenesElizabeth: No, let's just leave the lights on.Scenes(Ross opens the door and steps into the living room. He has fully removed his pants and holds them wrapped into a ball in front of his crotch. His legs are covered in the powder and lotion paste. He looks terrible.)ScenesElizabeth: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: I had a problem.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is there to apologize to Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: No, I can't talk to you! I don't have a fancy ad in the Yellow Pages!ScenesJoey: Look, Pheebs, I just, I wanna apologize for, for saying that your method was stupid and-and maybe ask you to be my teacher again. And-and I promise, I won't touch a guitar until you say I'm ready. (After a short pause she hands him her guitar.) You really think I'm ready?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!ScenesJoey: Wow! Cool! (He takes the guitar, stands up, and goes to play a note. However, while strumming it, he knocks it out of his hands and it bounces off the table and lands on the floor. Phoebe just stares at the guitar.)ScenesJoey: (sitting back down) Was the chord at least right…ScenesPhoebe: No!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is returning from his horrible trek back home without pants on. The whole gang is there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: We heard about your pants, I'm so sorry.ScenesRoss: This year was supposed to be great! But, it's only the second day and I'm a loser with stupid leather pants that don't even fit!ScenesAll: No. No, you're not a loser.ScenesRoss: Look at me! (Chandler squeaks in an attempt not to make fun of him.)ScenesMonica: Hey, hey, look. Look Ross, Ben drew a picture of you! (Shows him Ben's picture.) Huh? You're-you're a cowboy!ScenesRoss: Oh, be-because of the leather pants.ScenesMonica: See? Ben doesn't think you're a loser, he thinks you're a cowboy! Now that's something.Scenes(All at once.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: That really is something; that's really cool.ScenesJoey: Howdy partner!ScenesRoss: Maybe I should get another pair! Ooh, y'know, they-they had some with fringe all down the sides. (Chandler starts rubbing his temple again.) I'm gonna go kiss Ben goodnight. (He starts to head for Monica's bedroom.) I can't believe he thinks I'm a cowboy. (Pause.) I would make a good cowboy. (He struts into Monica's room.)ScenesMonica: Okay, now that everything's wrapped up here, I think I'm, I'm gonna go do my laundry.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, me too. Y'know if this shirt is dirty. (Smells it.) Yep.Scenes(They both exit.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I'm gonna go too. I'm gonna go to the airport. I figure if I hang around there long enough, someone's bound to leave one of those planes unattended.ScenesRachel: Good luck, honey!ScenesPhoebe: Bye! (She exits, leaving Rachel and Joey alone.)ScenesRachel: Hey, uh, Joey?ScenesJoey: Umm?ScenesRachel: Remember that big thing I was gonna tell you about?ScenesJoey: Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)ScenesRachel: I'm not gonna tell you, but if you found out on your own, that would be okay and then we could talk about it. Right?ScenesJoey: Well, then it wouldn't be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!ScenesRachel: (quietly) Yeah. Well. (Pause.) Hey uh Joe, would mind going over to Chandler's bedroom and get that book back that he borrowed from me?ScenesJoey: Now? You want me to go over there now?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Do you know something?ScenesRachel: Do you know something?ScenesJoey: I might know something.ScenesRachel: I might know something too.ScenesJoey: What's the thing you know?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I can't tell you until you tell me what you know.ScenesJoey: I can't tell you what I know.ScenesRachel: Well then I can't tell you what I know.ScenesJoey: Okay, fine.Scenes(Silence ensues.)ScenesJoey: You don't know!ScenesRachel: All right, how about I go over there and I will walk into Chandler's bedroom and I will see that thing that I think that I know is actually the thing that I think that I know! (Note: Kudos to Ms. Aniston on the delivery of that line. She said it very quickly and didn't screw up a word. Try it yourself, it ain't that easy.)ScenesJoey: (gasps) YOU KNOW!!!!ScenesRachel: AND YOU KNOW!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I know!!!!ScenesRachel: Chandler and Monica?!! Oh, this is unbelievable!! How long have you known?ScenesJoey: Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I've been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can't say anything about this to anybody, they're so weird about that! Listen… (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)ScenesJoey and Rachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! It's raining. I don't want to fly in the rain. So…Scenes(Pause.)ScenesJoey: Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.ScenesRachel: Ohhh, yeah, me too.Scenes(They both exit.)ScenesPhoebe: That's weird. (Pause.) I bet they're doing it.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Oh good, okay, I can't take it anymore. I can't take it anymore. So you win, okay? Here! (Hands him the 50 bucks he's about to owe him.) Pheebs? Flying a jet? Better make it a spaceship so that you can get back to your home planet! And Ross, phone call for you today, Tom Jones, he wants his pants back! And Hornswoggle? What are you dating a character from Fraggile Rock?! (He sits down and sighs in relief.)ScenesEndScenescontrl08.gif (14783 bytes)ScenesThe One With Chandler's Work LaughScenesWritten by: Alicia Sky VarinaitisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to pry more information about Chandler and Monica from Joey who's sitting on the couch and busy downing a pizza.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Come on Joey!!!ScenesJoey: Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it's not that big of a deal, so Monica and Chandler are doing it.ScenesRachel: I can't believe you would say that!ScenesJoey: Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.ScenesRachel: No! I mean come on! This is a huge deal! (She sits next to him on the couch.) Fine I want—I need more details, who-who initiated the first kiss?ScenesJoey: (thinks) I don't know.ScenesRachel: Is he romantic with her?ScenesJoey: I don't know.ScenesRachel: Are they in love?ScenesJoey: (thinks) I don't know.ScenesRachel: You don't know anything.ScenesJoey: Ohh, I know one thing!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: They did it right there on the couch.Scenes(He points to where she's sitting and she jumps up quickly.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Ross!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: (disinterested) Hey-yeah. (He hurries up to the counter.) Hey Gunther, can I have a scone please? (To the gang.) Wanna hear some good news? Someone I know is getting married! Yeah! And weddings are happy occasions! Oh, by-the-by it's my ex-wife Emily!ScenesAll: What? Oh!ScenesChandler: Sorry man.ScenesGunther: Here's your scone.ScenesRoss: Oh, thanks Gunther. (He takes it, hands the plate it's on to Rachel, sets it down on the table, and proceeds to pound it into oblivion while saying.) STUPID BRITISH SNACK FOOD!!!!!!!ScenesChandler: Did they teach you that in your anger management class?ScenesPhoebe: Hey, you know what might help you deal with it? Think of it this way, you and Emily are in the past and you can't be mad about the past. So are you still mad about the Louisiana Purchase?ScenesRachel: Pheebs, I don’t think anyone's mad about that.ScenesPhoebe: Exactly! Because it's in the past!ScenesJoey: (eyeing the flattened scone) Anybody gonna eat that?

rows.Scenes: Chandler's office, Monica and him are at a party his office is throwing.]
rows.Content: Monica: Look at us all dressed up for the big office party! By the way, what are we celebrating?ScenesChandler: Oh, we had a lot of liquor left over from the Christmas party.ScenesMonica: I think this is so cool because none of our friends are here and we can be a real couple. We don't have to hide.ScenesChandler: I know, I can do this. (He takes her hand.)ScenesMonica: Ooh, and I can do this. (She kisses him on the cheek.)Scenes(They both stand real close together.)ScenesBoth: We can't do that. (They separate.)Scenes(Chandler's boss (Doug) walks up.)ScenesDoug: Hey Bing! (Slaps him on his ass.) (Sees Monica) Wo-ho-ho, who's the pretty lady and what the hell is she doing with you?ScenesChandler: I asked myself that very question, sir. Uh, (Points to Monica) this is Monica. (Points to his boss.) This is my boss, Doug. Doug this is Monica.ScenesMonica: Hi, nice to meet you!ScenesDoug: Hi! And this is my wife Kara.ScenesKara: Nice to meet you Monica. Bing! (Slaps Chandler on his butt.)ScenesDoug: Say uh, Bing, did you hear about the new law firm we got working for us?ScenesChandler: No, sir.ScenesDoug: Yeah, Dewey, Cheatum, and Howe.Scenes(Chandler does a fake laugh.)ScenesDoug: Come on honey, let's go drink our body weight. (They walk off leaving Chandler and Monica alone.)ScenesMonica: What was that?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: That noise you just made?ScenesChandler: Oh, that was my work laugh.ScenesMonica: Really?
